[His]116-mr. martin appearance was very neat , and [he]116-mr. martin looked like [a sensible young man]673-a sensible young man , but [[his]116-mr. martin person]674-his person had no other advantage ; and when [he]116-mr. martin came to be contrasted with [gentlemen]675-gentlemen , [she]123-emma thought [he]116-mr. martin must lose all the ground [he]116-mr. martin had gained in [Harriet]111-harriet 's inclination . [Harriet]111-harriet was not insensible of manner ; [she]111-harriet had voluntarily noticed [[her]111-harriet father]425-her father 's gentleness with admiration as well as wonder . [Mr. Martin]116-mr. martin looked as if [he]116-mr. martin did not know what manner was .

[They]670-they remained but a few minutes together , as [Miss Woodhouse]84-miss woodhouse must not be kept waiting ; and [Harriet]111-harriet then came running to [her]84-miss woodhouse with a smiling face , and in a flutter of spirits , which [Miss Woodhouse]84-miss woodhouse hoped very soon to compose .

“ Only think of [our]670-they happening to meet him!--How very odd ! It was quite a chance , [he]116-mr. martin said , that [he]116-mr. martin had not gone round by [Randalls]101-randalls . [He]116-mr. martin did not think [we]670-they ever walked [this road]2834-this road . [He]116-mr. martin thought [we]670-they walked towards [Randalls]101-randalls most days . [He]116-mr. martin has not been able to get the Romance of [the Forest]12-the forest yet . [He]116-mr. martin was so busy the last time [he]116-mr. martin was at [Kingston]13-kingston that [he]116-mr. martin quite forgot it , but [he]116-mr. martin goes again to - morrow . So very odd [we]670-they should happen to meet ! Well , [Miss Woodhouse]84-miss woodhouse , is [he]116-mr. martin like what [you]84-miss woodhouse expected ? What do [you]84-miss woodhouse think of [him]116-mr. martin ? Do [you]84-miss woodhouse think [him]116-mr. martin so very plain ? ”[111-harriet]

“ [He]116-mr. martin is very plain , undoubtedly -- remarkably plain:--but that is nothing compared with [his]116-mr. martin entire want of gentility . [I]84-miss woodhouse had no right to expect much , and [I]84-miss woodhouse did not expect much ; but [I]84-miss woodhouse had no idea that [he]116-mr. martin could be so very clownish , so totally without air . [I]84-miss woodhouse had imagined [him]116-mr. martin , [I]84-miss woodhouse confess , a degree or two nearer gentility . ”[84-miss woodhouse]

“ To be sure , ”[111-harriet] said [Harriet]111-harriet , in a mortified voice , “ [he]116-mr. martin is not so genteel as [real gentlemen]2835-real gentlemen . ”[111-harriet]

“ [I]84-miss woodhouse think , [Harriet]111-harriet , since [your]111-harriet acquaintance with [us]2836-us , [you]111-harriet have been repeatedly in the company of [some such very real gentlemen]2837-some such very real gentlemen , that [you]111-harriet must [yourself]111-harriet be struck with the difference in [Mr. Martin]116-mr. martin . [I]84-miss woodhouse should be surprized if , after seeing [them]2838-very good specimens of well educated , well bred men , [you]111-harriet could be in company with [Mr. Martin]116-mr. martin again without perceiving [him]116-mr. martin to be [a very inferior creature]2839-a very inferior creature -- and rather wondering at [yourself]111-harriet for having ever thought [him]116-mr. martin at all agreeable before . Do not [you]111-harriet begin to feel that now ? Were not [you]111-harriet struck ? [I]84-miss woodhouse am sure [you]111-harriet must have been struck by [his]116-mr. martin awkward look and abrupt manner , and the uncouthness of a voice which [I]84-miss woodhouse heard to be wholly unmodulated as [I]84-miss woodhouse stood here . ”[84-miss woodhouse]

“ Certainly , [he]116-mr. martin is not like [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley . [He]116-mr. martin has not such a fine air and way of walking as [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley . [I]111-harriet see the difference plain enough . But [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley is so very fine [a man]2840-a man ! ”[111-harriet]

“ [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley 's air is so remarkably good that it is not fair to compare [Mr. Martin]116-mr. martin with _ [him]92-mr. knightley _ . [You]111-harriet might not see [one in a hundred with _ gentleman]2841-one in a hundred with _ gentleman _ so plainly written as in [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley . But [he]116-mr. martin is not [the only gentleman [you]111-harriet have been lately used to]2842-the only gentleman you have been lately used to . What say [you]111-harriet to [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston and [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton ? Compare [Mr. Martin]116-mr. martin with either of _ [them]2843-them _ . Compare [their]2843-them manner of carrying [themselves]2843-them ; of walking ; of speaking ; of being silent . [You]111-harriet must see the difference . ”[84-miss woodhouse]

“ Oh yes!--there is a great difference . But [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston is almost [an old man]2844-an old man . [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston must be between forty and fifty . ”[111-harriet]

“ Which makes [his]86-mr. weston good manners the more valuable . The older [a person]2845-a person grows , [Harriet]111-harriet , the more important it is that [their]2845-a person manners should not be bad ; the more glaring and disgusting any loudness , or coarseness , or awkwardness becomes . What is passable in youth is detestable in later age . [Mr. Martin]116-mr. martin is now awkward and abrupt ; what will [he]116-mr. martin be at [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston 's time of life ? ”[84-miss woodhouse]

“ There is no saying , indeed , ”[111-harriet] replied [Harriet]111-harriet rather solemnly .

“ But there may be pretty good guessing . [He]116-mr. martin will be [a completely gross , vulgar farmer , totally inattentive to appearances , and thinking of nothing but profit and loss]2846-a completely gross , vulgar farmer , totally inattentive to appearances , and thinking of nothing but profit and loss . ”[84-miss woodhouse]

“ Will [he]116-mr. martin , indeed ? That will be very bad . ”[84-miss woodhouse]

“ How much [his]116-mr. martin business engrosses [him]116-mr. martin already is very plain from the circumstance of [his]116-mr. martin forgetting to inquire for the book [you]111-harriet recommended . [He]116-mr. martin was a great deal too full of the market to think of any thing else -- which is just as it should be , for [a thriving man]2847-a thriving man . What has [he]116-mr. martin to do with books ? And [I]84-miss woodhouse have no doubt that [he]116-mr. martin _ will _ thrive , and be [a very rich man]2848-a very rich man in time -- and [his]116-mr. martin being illiterate and coarse need not disturb _ [us]2849-us _ . ”[84-miss woodhouse]

“ [I]84-miss woodhouse wonder [he]116-mr. martin did not remember the book”--was[84-miss woodhouse] all [Harriet]111-harriet 's answer , and spoken with a degree of grave displeasure which [Emma]123-emma thought might be safely left to itself . [She]111-harriet , therefore , said no more for some time . [Her]111-harriet next beginning was ,

“ In one respect , perhaps , [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton 's manners are superior to [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley 's or [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston 's . [They]2850-they have more gentleness . They might be more safely held up as a pattern . There is an openness , a quickness , almost a bluntness in [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston , which [every body]2749-every body likes in _ [him]95-mr. elton _ , because there is so much good - humour with it -- but that would not do to be copied . Neither would [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley 's downright , decided , commanding sort of manner , though it suits _ [him]95-mr. elton _ very well ; [his]95-mr. elton figure , and look , and situation in life seem to allow it ; but if [any young man]2852-any young man were to set about copying [him]95-mr. elton , [he]95-mr. elton would not be sufferable . On the contrary , [I]111-harriet think [a young man]2853-a young man might be very safely recommended to take [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton as [a model]2854-a model . [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton is good - humoured , cheerful , obliging , and gentle . [He]95-mr. elton seems to [me]111-harriet to be grown particularly gentle of late . [I]111-harriet do not know whether [he]95-mr. elton has any design of ingratiating [himself]95-mr. elton with either of [us]2855-us , [Harriet]111-harriet , by additional softness , but it strikes [me]111-harriet that [his]95-mr. elton manners are softer than they used to be . If [he]95-mr. elton means any thing , it must be to please [you]111-harriet . Did not [I]111-harriet tell [you]111-harriet what [he]95-mr. elton said of [you]111-harriet the other day ? ”[111-harriet]

[She]677-she then repeated some warm personal praise which [she]677-she had drawn from [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton , and now did full justice to ; and [Harriet]111-harriet blushed and smiled , and said [she]111-harriet had always thought [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton very agreeable .

[Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton was the very person fixed on by [Emma]123-emma for driving [the young farmer]678-the young farmer out of [Harriet]111-harriet 's head . [She]123-emma thought it would be an excellent match ; and only too palpably desirable , natural , and probable , for [her]123-emma to have much merit in planning it . [She]123-emma feared it was what [every body else]679-every body else must think of and predict . It was not likely , however , that any body should have equalled [her]123-emma in the date of the plan , as it had entered [her]123-emma brain during the very first evening of [Harriet]111-harriet 's coming to [Hartfield]2-hartfield . The longer [she]123-emma considered it , the greater was [her]123-emma sense of its expediency . [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton 's situation was most suitable , quite [the gentleman]680-the gentleman [himself]95-mr. elton , and without low connexions ; at the same time , not of [any family that could fairly object to the doubtful birth of [Harriet]111-harriet]681-any family that could fairly object to the doubtful birth of harriet . [He]95-mr. elton had [a comfortable home for [her]111-harriet]682-a comfortable home for her , and [Emma]123-emma imagined a very sufficient income ; for though [the vicarage of Highbury]683-the vicarage of highbury was not large , [he]95-mr. elton was known to have [some independent property]684-some independent property ; and [she]123-emma thought very highly of [him]95-mr. elton as [a good - humoured , well - meaning , respectable young man]685-a good - humoured , well - meaning , respectable young man , without any deficiency of useful understanding or knowledge of [the world]403-the world .

[She]123-emma had already satisfied [herself]123-emma that [he]95-mr. elton thought [Harriet]111-harriet [a beautiful girl , which [she]123-emma trusted , with such frequent meetings at [Hartfield]2-hartfield]687-a beautiful girl , which she trusted , with such frequent meetings at hartfield , was foundation enough on [his]95-mr. elton side ; and on [Harriet]111-harriet 's there could be little doubt that the idea of being preferred by [him]95-mr. elton would have all the usual weight and efficacy . And [he]95-mr. elton was really [a very pleasing young man]688-a very pleasing young man , [a young man whom [any woman not fastidious]690-any woman not fastidious might like]689-a young man whom any woman not fastidious might like . [He]95-mr. elton was reckoned very handsome ; [[his]95-mr. elton person]674-his person much admired in general , though not by [her]123-emma , there being a want of elegance of feature which [she]123-emma could not dispense with:--but [the girl who could be gratified by [a Robert Martin]116-mr. martin 's riding about [the country]611-the country to get walnuts for [her]692-the girl who could be gratified by a robert martin 's riding about the country to get walnuts for her]692-the girl who could be gratified by a robert martin 's riding about the country to get walnuts for her might very well be conquered by [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton 's admiration .

CHAPTER V

“ [I]92-mr. knightley do not know what [your]123-emma opinion may be , [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , ”[92-mr. knightley] said [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley , “ of this great intimacy between [Emma]123-emma and [Harriet Smith]111-harriet , but [I]92-mr. knightley think it a bad thing . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ A bad thing ! Do [you]92-mr. knightley really think it a bad thing?--why so ? ”[88-mrs. weston]

“ [I]92-mr. knightley think [they]2856-they will neither of [them]2856-they do the other any good . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ [You]92-mr. knightley surprize [me]88-mrs. weston ! [Emma]123-emma must do [Harriet]111-harriet good : and by supplying [her]111-harriet with a new object of interest , [Harriet]111-harriet may be said to do [Emma]123-emma good . [I]88-mrs. weston have been seeing [their]2856-they intimacy with the greatest pleasure . How very differently [we]2857-we feel!--Not think [they]2856-they will do [each other]430-each other any good ! This will certainly be the beginning of one of [our]2857-we quarrels about [Emma]123-emma , [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley . ”[88-mrs. weston]

“ Perhaps [you]92-mr. knightley think [I]92-mr. knightley am come on purpose to quarrel with [you]92-mr. knightley , knowing [Weston]86-mr. weston to be out , and that [you]92-mr. knightley must still fight [your]92-mr. knightley own battle . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston would undoubtedly support [me]88-mrs. weston , if [he]86-mr. weston were [here]2707-here , for [he]86-mr. weston thinks exactly as [I]88-mrs. weston do on the subject . [We]2857-we were speaking of it only yesterday , and agreeing how fortunate it was for [Emma]123-emma , that there should be [such a girl in [Highbury]3-highbury for [her]123-emma to associate with]2860-such a girl in highbury for her to associate with . [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley , [I]88-mrs. weston shall not allow [you]92-mr. knightley to be [a fair judge in this case]2861-a fair judge in this case . [You]92-mr. knightley are so much used to live alone , that [you]92-mr. knightley do not know the value of [a companion]2862-a companion ; and , perhaps [no man]2863-no man can be a good judge of the comfort [a woman]2864-a woman feels in the society of one of [her]2864-a woman own sex , after being used to it all [her]2864-a woman life . [I]88-mrs. weston can imagine [your]92-mr. knightley objection to [Harriet Smith]111-harriet . [She]111-harriet is not [the superior young woman which [[Emma]123-emma 's friend]2866-emma 's friend ought to be]2865-the superior young woman which emma 's friend ought to be . [They]2867-they will read together . [She]123-emma means it , [I]88-mrs. weston know . ”[88-mrs. weston]

“ [Emma]123-emma has been meaning to read more ever since [she]123-emma was twelve years old . [I]92-mr. knightley have seen a great many lists of [her]123-emma drawing - up at various times of books that [she]123-emma meant to read regularly through -- and very good lists they were -- very well chosen , and very neatly arranged -- sometimes alphabetically , and sometimes by some other rule . But [I]92-mr. knightley have done with expecting any course of steady reading from [Emma]123-emma . [She]123-emma will never submit to any thing requiring industry and patience , and a subjection of the fancy to the understanding . Where [Miss Taylor]84-miss woodhouse failed to stimulate , [I]92-mr. knightley may safely affirm that [Harriet Smith]111-harriet will do nothing.--You never could persuade [her]123-emma to read half so much as [you]2868-you wished.--You know [you]2868-you could not . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ [I]88-mrs. weston dare say , ”[88-mrs. weston] replied [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , smiling , “ that [I]88-mrs. weston thought so _ then_;--but since [we]2869-we have parted , [I]88-mrs. weston can never remember [Emma]123-emma 's omitting to do any thing [I]88-mrs. weston wished . ”[88-mrs. weston]

“ There is hardly any desiring to refresh such a memory as _ that_,”--said[92-mr. knightley] [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley , feelingly ; and for a moment or two [he]92-mr. knightley had done . “ But [I]92-mr. knightley , ”[92-mr. knightley] [he]92-mr. knightley soon added , “ who have had no such charm thrown over [my]92-mr. knightley senses , must still see , hear , and remember . “ Not [I]694-i , indeed . [I]694-i only name possibilities . [I]694-i do not pretend to [Emma]123-emma 's genius for foretelling and guessing . “ Such an eye!--the true hazle eye -- and so brilliant ! regular features , open countenance , with a complexion ! oh ! what a bloom of full health , and such a pretty height and size ; such a firm and upright figure ! “ [Mrs. John Knightley]122-mrs. john knightley is easily alarmed , and might be made unhappy about [[her]122-mrs. john knightley sister]407-her sister . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ So do [I]88-mrs. weston , ”[88-mrs. weston] said [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston gently , “ very much . ”[88-mrs. weston]

“ [She]123-emma always declares [she]123-emma will never marry , which , of course , means just nothing at all . [CHAPTER VI

Emma]123-emma could not feel a doubt of having given [Harriet]111-harriet 's fancy a proper direction and raised the gratitude of [her]88-mrs. weston young vanity to a very good purpose , for [she]88-mrs. weston found [her]88-mrs. weston decidedly more sensible than before of [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton 's being [a remarkably handsome man , with most agreeable manners]698-a remarkably handsome man , with most agreeable manners ; and as [she]88-mrs. weston had no hesitation in following up the assurance of [his]95-mr. elton admiration by agreeable hints , [she]88-mrs. weston was soon pretty confident of creating as much liking on [Harriet]111-harriet 's side , as there could be any occasion for . [She]88-mrs. weston was quite convinced of [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton 's being in the fairest way of falling in love , if not in love already . [She]88-mrs. weston had no scruple with regard to [him]95-mr. elton . [He]95-mr. elton talked of [Harriet]111-harriet , and praised [her]111-harriet so warmly , that [she]88-mrs. weston could not suppose any thing wanting which a little time would not add . [His]95-mr. elton perception of the striking improvement of [Harriet]111-harriet 's manner , since [her]111-harriet introduction at [Hartfield]2-hartfield , was not one of the least agreeable proofs of [his]95-mr. elton growing attachment .

“ [You]88-mrs. weston have given [Miss Smith]111-harriet all that [she]111-harriet required , ”[95-mr. elton] said [he]95-mr. elton ; “ [you]88-mrs. weston have made [her]111-harriet graceful and easy . [She]111-harriet was a beautiful creature when [she]111-harriet came to [you]88-mrs. weston , but , in [my]95-mr. elton opinion , the attractions [you]88-mrs. weston have added are infinitely superior to what [she]111-harriet received from nature . ”[95-mr. elton]

“ [I]95-mr. elton am glad [you]88-mrs. weston think [I]95-mr. elton have been useful to [her]111-harriet ; but [Harriet]111-harriet only wanted drawing out , and receiving a few , very few hints . [She]111-harriet had all the natural grace of sweetness of temper and artlessness in [herself]111-harriet . [I]95-mr. elton have done very little . ”[95-mr. elton]

“ If it were admissible to contradict [a lady]2918-a lady , ”[124-the gallant mr. elton--] said [the gallant Mr. Elton--]124-the gallant mr. elton--

“ [I]95-mr. elton have perhaps given [her]111-harriet a little more decision of character , have taught [her]111-harriet to think on points which had not fallen in [her]111-harriet way before . ”[95-mr. elton]

“ Exactly so ; that is what principally strikes [me]95-mr. elton . So much superadded decision of character ! Skilful has been the hand ! ”[95-mr. elton]

“ Great has been the pleasure , [I]95-mr. elton am sure . [I]95-mr. elton never met with a disposition more truly amiable . ”[95-mr. elton]

“ [I]95-mr. elton have no doubt of it . ”[95-mr. elton] And it was spoken with a sort of sighing animation , which had a vast deal of [the lover]699-the lover . [She]700-she was not less pleased another day with the manner in which [he]699-the lover seconded a sudden wish of [hers]700-she , to have [Harriet]111-harriet 's picture .

“ Did [you]699-the lover ever have [your]699-the lover likeness taken , [Harriet]111-harriet ? ”[700-she] said [she]700-she : “ did [you]699-the lover ever sit for [your]699-the lover picture ? ”[700-she]

[Harriet]111-harriet was on the point of leaving [the room]701-the room , and only stopt to say , with a very interesting naivete ,

“ Oh ! dear , no , never . ”[111-harriet]

No sooner was [she]111-harriet out of sight , than [Emma]123-emma exclaimed ,

“ What an exquisite possession a good picture of [her]111-harriet would be ! [I]123-emma would give any money for it . [I]123-emma almost long to attempt [her]111-harriet likeness [myself]123-emma . [You]2919-you do not know it [I]123-emma dare say , but two or three years ago [I]123-emma had a great passion for taking likenesses , and attempted [several of [[my]123-emma friends]2921-my friends]2920-several of my friends , and was thought to have a tolerable eye in general . “ Let [me]95-mr. elton entreat [you]95-mr. elton , ”[95-mr. elton] cried [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton ; “ it would indeed be a delight ! Let [me]95-mr. elton entreat [you]95-mr. elton , [Miss Woodhouse]84-miss woodhouse , to exercise so charming a talent in favour of [[your]95-mr. elton friend]2922-your friend . [I]95-mr. elton know what [your]95-mr. elton drawings are . How could [you]95-mr. elton suppose [me]95-mr. elton ignorant ? Is not [this room]2923-this room rich in specimens of [your]95-mr. elton landscapes and flowers ; and has not [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston some inimitable figure - pieces in [[her]88-mrs. weston drawing - room]2924-her drawing - room , at [Randalls]101-randalls ? ”[95-mr. elton]

Yes , good man!--thought [Emma]123-emma -- but what has all that to do with taking likenesses ? [You]702-you know nothing of drawing . Do n't pretend to be in raptures about [mine]95-mr. elton . Keep [your]702-you raptures for [Harriet]111-harriet 's face . “ Well , if [you]702-you give [me]702-you such kind encouragement , [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton , [I]702-you believe [I]702-you shall try what [I]702-you can do . [Harriet]111-harriet 's features are very delicate , which makes a likeness difficult ; and yet there is a peculiarity in the shape of the eye and the lines about the mouth which one ought to catch . ”[702-you]

“ Exactly so -- The shape of the eye and the lines about the mouth -- [I]95-mr. elton have not a doubt of [your]702-you success . Pray , pray attempt it . As [you]702-you will do it , it will indeed , to use [your]702-you own words , be an exquisite possession . ”[95-mr. elton]

“ But [I]702-you am afraid , [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton , [Harriet]111-harriet will not like to sit . [She]111-harriet thinks so little of [her]111-harriet own beauty . Did not [you]702-you observe [her]111-harriet manner of answering [me]702-you ? How completely it meant , ' why should [my]702-you picture be drawn ? ' ”[702-you]

“ Oh ! yes , [I]95-mr. elton observed it , [I]95-mr. elton assure [you]702-you . It was not lost on [me]95-mr. elton . But still [I]95-mr. elton can not imagine [she]111-harriet would not be persuaded . ”[95-mr. elton]

[Harriet]111-harriet was soon back again , and the proposal almost immediately made ; and [she]111-harriet had no scruples which could stand many minutes against the earnest pressing of [both the others]703-both the others . [Emma]123-emma wished to go to work directly , and therefore produced the portfolio containing [her]123-emma various attempts at portraits , for not one of them had ever been finished , that [they]703-both the others might decide together on the best size for [Harriet]111-harriet . [Her]123-emma many beginnings were displayed . Miniatures , half - lengths , whole - lengths , pencil , crayon , and water - colours had been all tried in turn . [She]123-emma had always wanted to do every thing , and had made more progress both in drawing and music than many might have done with so little labour as [she]123-emma would ever submit to . [She]123-emma played and sang;--and drew in almost every style ; but steadiness had always been wanting ; and in nothing had [she]123-emma approached the degree of excellence which [she]123-emma would have been glad to command , and ought not to have failed of . [She]123-emma was not much deceived as to [her]123-emma own skill either as [an artist]704-an artist or [a musician]705-a musician , but [she]123-emma was not unwilling to have [others]2773-others deceived , or sorry to know [her]123-emma reputation for accomplishment often higher than it deserved .

There was merit in every drawing -- in the least finished , perhaps the most ; [her]123-emma style was spirited ; but had there been much less , or had there been ten times more , the delight and admiration of [[her]123-emma two companions]707-her two companions would have been the same . [They]707-her two companions were both in ecstasies . A likeness pleases every body ; and [Miss Woodhouse]84-miss woodhouse 's performances must be capital .

“ No great variety of faces for [you]2925-you , ”[123-emma] said [Emma]123-emma . “ [I]123-emma had only [[my]123-emma own family]2926-my own family to study from . There is [[my]123-emma father]2740-my father -- [another of [[my]123-emma father]2740-my father]2928-another of my father -- but the idea of sitting for [his]2740-my father picture made [him]2740-my father so nervous , that [I]123-emma could only take [him]2740-my father by stealth ; neither of [them]707-her two companions very like therefore . [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston again , and again , and again , [you]2925-you see . [Dear Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston ! always [[my]123-emma kindest friend]2930-my kindest friend on every occasion . [She]2930-my kindest friend would sit whenever [I]123-emma asked [her]2930-my kindest friend . There is [[my]123-emma sister]2910-my sister ; and really quite [her]2910-my sister own little elegant figure!--and the face not unlike . [I]123-emma should have made a good likeness of [her]2930-my kindest friend , if [she]2930-my kindest friend would have sat longer , but [she]2930-my kindest friend was in such a hurry to have [me]123-emma draw [[her]2930-my kindest friend four children]2932-her four children that [she]2930-my kindest friend would not be quiet . Then , here come all [my]123-emma attempts at three of those four children;--there [they]2932-her four children are , [Henry]125-henry and [John]92-mr. knightley and [Bella]87-isabella , from one end of the sheet to the other , and any one of [them]2932-her four children might do for [any one of the rest]2933-any one of the rest . [She]2930-my kindest friend was so eager to have [them]2932-her four children drawn that [I]123-emma could not refuse ; but there is no making [children of three or four years old]2934-children of three or four years old stand still [you]2935-you know ; nor can it be very easy to take any likeness of [them]2934-children of three or four years old , beyond the air and complexion , unless they are coarser featured than any of [[mama]2936-mama 's children]2937-mama 's children ever were . Here is [my]123-emma sketch of the fourth , who was [a baby]2938-a baby . [I]123-emma took [him]2822-a gentleman as [he]2822-a gentleman was sleeping on the sofa , and it is as strong a likeness of [his]2822-a gentleman cockade as [you]2935-you would wish to see . [He]2822-a gentleman had nestled down [his]2822-a gentleman head most conveniently . That 's very like . [I]123-emma am rather proud of little [George]126-george . The corner of the sofa is very good . Then here is [my]123-emma last,”--unclosing[123-emma] a pretty sketch of [a gentleman]2822-a gentleman in small size , whole - length--“my last and [my]123-emma best -- [[my]123-emma brother]2939-my brother , [Mr. John Knightley.--This]127-mr. john knightley.--this did not want much of being finished , when [I]123-emma put it away in a pet , and vowed [I]123-emma would never take another likeness . [I]123-emma could not help being provoked ; for after all [my]123-emma pains , and when [I]123-emma had really made a very good likeness of it--(Mrs . [Weston]88-mrs. weston and [I]123-emma were quite agreed in thinking it _ very _ like)--only too handsome -- too flattering -- but that was a fault on the right side”--after[123-emma] all this , came poor dear [Isabella]87-isabella 's cold approbation of--“Yes , it was a little like -- but to be sure it did not do [him]2822-a gentleman justice . [We]2940-we had had a great deal of trouble in persuading [him]2822-a gentleman to sit at all . It was made a great favour of ; and altogether it was more than [I]87-isabella could bear ; and so [I]87-isabella never would finish it , to have it apologised over as an unfavourable likeness , to [every morning visitor in [Brunswick Square;--and]14-brunswick square;--and]2941-every morning visitor in brunswick square;--and , as [I]87-isabella said , [I]87-isabella did then forswear ever drawing any body again . But for [Harriet]111-harriet 's sake , or rather for [my]87-isabella own , and as there are no [husbands]2942-husbands and [wives]2943-wives in the case _ at _ _ present _ , [I]87-isabella will break [my]87-isabella resolution now . ”[87-isabella]

[Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton seemed very properly struck and delighted by the idea , and was repeating , “ No [husbands]2942-husbands and [wives]2943-wives in the case at present indeed , as [you]123-emma observe . Exactly so . No [husbands]2942-husbands and [wives]2943-wives , ”[95-mr. elton] with so interesting a consciousness , that [Emma]123-emma began to consider whether [she]123-emma had not better leave [them]709-them together at once . But as [she]123-emma wanted to be drawing , the declaration must wait a little longer .

[She]123-emma had soon fixed on the size and sort of portrait . It was to be a whole - length in water - colours , like [Mr. John Knightley]92-mr. knightley 's , and was destined , if [she]123-emma could please [herself]123-emma , to hold a very honourable station over the mantelpiece .

The sitting began ; and [Harriet]111-harriet , smiling and blushing , and afraid of not keeping [her]111-harriet attitude and countenance , presented a very sweet mixture of youthful expression to the steady eyes of [the artist]710-the artist . But there was no doing any thing , with [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton fidgeting behind [her]111-harriet and watching every touch . [She]111-harriet gave [him]95-mr. elton credit for stationing [himself]95-mr. elton where [he]95-mr. elton might gaze and gaze again without offence ; but was really obliged to put an end to it , and request [him]95-mr. elton to place [himself]95-mr. elton elsewhere . It then occurred to [her]111-harriet to employ [him]95-mr. elton in reading .

“ If [he]95-mr. elton would be so good as to read to [them]2948-them , it would be a kindness indeed ! It would amuse away the difficulties of [her]111-harriet part , and lessen the irksomeness of [Miss Smith]111-harriet 's . ”[111-harriet]

[Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton was only too happy . [Harriet]111-harriet listened , and [Emma]123-emma drew in peace . [She]111-harriet must allow [him]95-mr. elton to be still frequently coming to look ; any thing less would certainly have been too little in [a lover]711-a lover ; and [he]95-mr. elton was ready at the smallest intermission of the pencil , to jump up and see the progress , and be charmed.--There was no being displeased with [such an encourager]712-such an encourager , for [his]95-mr. elton admiration made [him]95-mr. elton discern a likeness almost before it was possible . [She]111-harriet could not respect [his]95-mr. elton eye , but [his]95-mr. elton love and [his]95-mr. elton complaisance were unexceptionable .

The sitting was altogether very satisfactory ; [she]111-harriet was quite enough pleased with the first day 's sketch to wish to go on . There was no want of likeness , [she]111-harriet had been fortunate in the attitude , and as [she]111-harriet meant to throw in a little improvement to the figure , to give a little more height , and considerably more elegance , [she]111-harriet had great confidence of its being in every way a pretty drawing at last , and of its filling its destined place with credit to [them]713-them both -- a standing memorial of the beauty of one , the skill of the other , and the friendship of both ; with as many other agreeable associations as [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton 's very promising attachment was likely to add .

[Harriet]111-harriet was to sit again the next day ; and [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton , just as [he]95-mr. elton ought , entreated for the permission of attending and reading to [them]713-them again .

“ By all means . [We]713-them shall be most happy to consider [you]95-mr. elton as one of [the party]2949-the party . ”[95-mr. elton]

The same civilities and courtesies , the same success and satisfaction , took place on the morrow , and accompanied the whole progress of the picture , which was rapid and happy . [Every body who saw it]714-every body who saw it was pleased , but [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton was in continual raptures , and defended it through every criticism .

“ [Miss Woodhouse]84-miss woodhouse has given [[her]84-miss woodhouse friend]427-her friend the only beauty [she]84-miss woodhouse wanted,”--observed[88-mrs. weston] [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston to [him]95-mr. elton -- not in the least suspecting that [she]88-mrs. weston was addressing a lover.--“The expression of the eye is most correct , but [Miss Smith]111-harriet has not those eyebrows and eyelashes . It is the fault of [her]84-miss woodhouse face that [she]84-miss woodhouse has them not . ”[88-mrs. weston]

“ Do [you]95-mr. elton think so ? ”[95-mr. elton] replied [he]95-mr. elton . “ [I]95-mr. elton can not agree with [you]95-mr. elton . It appears to [me]95-mr. elton a most perfect resemblance in every feature . [I]95-mr. elton never saw such a likeness in [my]95-mr. elton life . [We]2951-we must allow for the effect of shade , [you]95-mr. elton know . ”[95-mr. elton]

“ [You]95-mr. elton have made [her]84-miss woodhouse too tall , [Emma]123-emma , ”[92-mr. knightley] said [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley .

[Emma]123-emma knew that [she]123-emma had , but would not own it ; and [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton warmly added ,

“ Oh no ! certainly not too tall ; not in the least too tall . Consider , [she]84-miss woodhouse is sitting down -- which naturally presents a different -- which in short gives exactly the idea -- and the proportions must be preserved , [you]95-mr. elton know . Proportions , fore - shortening.--Oh no ! it gives one exactly the idea of such a height as [Miss Smith]111-harriet 's . Exactly so indeed ! ”[95-mr. elton]

“ It is very pretty , ”[85-mr. woodhouse] said [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse . “ So prettily done ! Just as [your]95-mr. elton drawings always are , [[my]85-mr. woodhouse dear]2714-my dear . [I]85-mr. woodhouse do not know any body who draws so well as [you]95-mr. elton do . The only thing [I]85-mr. woodhouse do not thoroughly like is , that [she]84-miss woodhouse seems to be sitting out of doors , with only a little shawl over [her]84-miss woodhouse shoulders -- and it makes [one]2775-one think [she]84-miss woodhouse must catch cold . ”[85-mr. woodhouse]

“ But , [[my]95-mr. elton dear papa]2954-my dear papa , it is supposed to be summer ; a warm day in summer . Look at the tree . ”[95-mr. elton]

“ But it is never safe to sit out of doors , [[my]85-mr. woodhouse dear]2714-my dear . ”[85-mr. woodhouse]

“ [You]95-mr. elton , [sir]2734-sir , may say any thing , ”[95-mr. elton] cried [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton , “ but [I]95-mr. elton must confess that [I]95-mr. elton regard it as a most happy thought , the placing of [Miss Smith]111-harriet out of doors ; and the tree is touched with such inimitable spirit ! Any other situation would have been much less in character . The naivete of [Miss Smith]111-harriet 's manners -- and altogether -- Oh , it is most admirable ! [I]95-mr. elton can not keep [my]95-mr. elton eyes from it . [I]95-mr. elton never saw such a likeness . ”[95-mr. elton]

The next thing wanted was to get the picture framed ; and here were a few difficulties . It must be done directly ; it must be done in [London]1-london ; the order must go through the hands of [some intelligent person whose taste could be depended on]715-some intelligent person whose taste could be depended on ; and [Isabella]87-isabella , [the usual doer of all commissions]716-the usual doer of all commissions , must not be applied to , because it was December , and [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse could not bear the idea of [her]87-isabella stirring out of [[her]87-isabella house]717-her house in the fogs of December . But no sooner was the distress known to [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton , than it was removed . [His]95-mr. elton gallantry was always on the alert . “ Might [he]95-mr. elton be trusted with the commission , what infinite pleasure should [he]95-mr. elton have in executing it ! [he]95-mr. elton could ride to [London]1-london at any time . It was impossible to say how much [he]95-mr. elton should be gratified by being employed on such an errand . ”[95-mr. elton]

“ [He]95-mr. elton was too good!--she could not endure the thought!--she would not give [him]95-mr. elton such a troublesome office for the world,”--brought[95-mr. elton] on the desired repetition of entreaties and assurances,--and a very few minutes settled the business .

[Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton was to take the drawing to [London]1-london , chuse the frame , and give the directions ; and [Emma]123-emma thought [she]123-emma could so pack it as to ensure its safety without much incommoding [him]95-mr. elton , while [he]95-mr. elton seemed mostly fearful of not being incommoded enough .

“ What a precious deposit ! ”[95-mr. elton] said [he]95-mr. elton with a tender sigh , as [he]95-mr. elton received it .

“ [This man]2957-this man is almost too gallant to be in love , ”[123-emma] thought [Emma]123-emma . “ [I]123-emma should say so , but that [I]123-emma suppose there may be a hundred different ways of being in love . [He]2957-this man is [an excellent young man]2958-an excellent young man , and will suit [Harriet]111-harriet exactly ; it will be an ' Exactly so , ' as [he]2957-this man says [himself]2957-this man ; but [he]2957-this man does sigh and languish , and study for compliments rather more than [I]123-emma could endure as [a principal]2959-a principal . [I]123-emma come in for a pretty good share as a second . But it is [his]2957-this man gratitude on [Harriet]111-harriet 's account . ”[123-emma]

CHAPTER VII

The very day of [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton 's going to [London]1-london produced a fresh occasion for [Emma]123-emma 's services towards [[her]123-emma friend]427-her friend . [Harriet]111-harriet had been at [Hartfield]2-hartfield , as usual , soon after breakfast ; and , after a time , had gone [home]562-home to return again to dinner : [she]111-harriet returned , and sooner than had been talked of , and with an agitated , hurried look , announcing something extraordinary to have happened which [she]111-harriet was longing to tell . Half a minute brought it all out . [She]111-harriet had heard , as soon as [she]111-harriet got back to [[Mrs. Goddard]109-mrs. goddard 's]720-mrs. goddard 's , that [Mr. Martin]116-mr. martin had been [there]448-there an hour before , and finding [she]111-harriet was not at [home]562-home , nor particularly expected , had left a little parcel for [her]111-harriet from [one of [[his]116-mr. martin sisters]2820-his sisters]723-one of his sisters , and gone away ; and on opening this parcel , [she]111-harriet had actually found , besides the two songs which [she]111-harriet had lent [Elizabeth]120-elizabeth to copy , a letter to [herself]111-harriet ; and this letter was from [him]116-mr. martin , from [Mr. Martin]116-mr. martin , and contained a direct proposal of marriage . “ Who could have thought it ? [She]111-harriet was so surprized [she]111-harriet did not know what to do . Yes , quite a proposal of marriage ; and a very good letter , at least [she]111-harriet thought so . And [he]116-mr. martin wrote as if [he]116-mr. martin really loved [her]111-harriet very much -- but [she]111-harriet did not know -- and so , [she]111-harriet was come as fast as [she]111-harriet could to ask [Miss Woodhouse]84-miss woodhouse what [she]111-harriet should do.-- ”[123-emma] [Emma]123-emma was half - ashamed of [[her]123-emma friend]427-her friend for seeming so pleased and so doubtful .

“ Upon [my]123-emma word , ”[123-emma] [she]123-emma cried , “ [the young man]532-the young man is determined not to lose any thing for want of asking . [He]532-the young man will connect [himself]532-the young man well if [he]532-the young man can . ”[123-emma]

“ Will [you]111-harriet read the letter ? ”[111-harriet] cried [Harriet]111-harriet . “ Pray do . [I]111-harriet 'd rather [you]111-harriet would . ”[111-harriet]

[Emma]123-emma was not sorry to be pressed . [She]123-emma read , and was surprized . The style of the letter was much above [her]123-emma expectation . There were not merely no grammatical errors , but as a composition it would not have disgraced [a gentleman]2822-a gentleman ; the language , though plain , was strong and unaffected , and the sentiments it conveyed very much to the credit of [the writer]727-the writer . It was short , but expressed good sense , warm attachment , liberality , propriety , even delicacy of feeling . [She]123-emma paused over it , while [Harriet]111-harriet stood anxiously watching for [her]123-emma opinion , with a “ Well , well , ”[123-emma] and was at last forced to add , “ Is it a good letter ? or is it too short ? ”[123-emma]

“ Yes , indeed , a very good letter , ”[123-emma] replied [Emma]123-emma rather slowly--“so good a letter , [Harriet]111-harriet , that every thing considered , [I]123-emma think [one of [[his]532-the young man sisters]2820-his sisters]723-one of his sisters must have helped [him]532-the young man . [I]123-emma can hardly imagine [the young man whom [I]123-emma saw talking with [you]111-harriet the other day]2963-the young man whom i saw talking with you the other day could express [himself]532-the young man so well , if left quite to [his]532-the young man own powers , and yet it is not the style of [a woman]2864-a woman ; no , certainly , it is too strong and concise ; not diffuse enough for [a woman]2864-a woman . No doubt [he]532-the young man is [a sensible man]2966-a sensible man , and [I]123-emma suppose may have a natural talent for -- thinks strongly and clearly -- and when [he]532-the young man takes a pen in hand , [his]532-the young man thoughts naturally find proper words . It is so with [some men]2967-some men . Yes , [I]123-emma understand the sort of mind . Vigorous , decided , with sentiments to a certain point , not coarse . A better written letter , [Harriet]111-harriet ( returning it , ) than [I]123-emma had expected . ”[123-emma]

“ Well , ”[123-emma] said the still waiting [Harriet;--“well]128-harriet;--“well -- and -- and what shall [I]123-emma do ? ”[123-emma]

“ What shall [you]123-emma do ! In what respect ? Do [you]123-emma mean with regard to this letter ? ”[123-emma]

“ Yes . ”[123-emma]

“ But what are [you]123-emma in doubt of ? [You]123-emma must answer it of course -- and speedily . ”[123-emma]

“ Yes . But what shall [I]123-emma say ? [Dear Miss Woodhouse]84-miss woodhouse , do advise [me]123-emma . ”[123-emma]

“ Oh no , no ! the letter had much better be all [your]123-emma own . [You]123-emma will express [yourself]123-emma very properly , [I]123-emma am sure . There is no danger of [your]123-emma not being intelligible , which is the first thing . [Your]123-emma meaning must be unequivocal ; no doubts or demurs : and such expressions of gratitude and concern for the pain [you]123-emma are inflicting as propriety requires , will present themselves unbidden to _ [your]123-emma _ mind , [I]123-emma am persuaded . [You]123-emma need not be prompted to write with the appearance of sorrow for [his]2968-him disappointment . ”[123-emma]

“ [You]111-harriet think [I]111-harriet ought to refuse [him]2968-him then , ”[111-harriet] said [Harriet]111-harriet , looking down .

“ Ought to refuse [him]2968-him ! [[My]123-emma dear]2714-my dear [Harriet]111-harriet , what do [you]111-harriet mean ? Are [you]111-harriet in any doubt as to that ? [I]123-emma thought -- but [I]123-emma beg [your]111-harriet pardon , perhaps [I]123-emma have been under a mistake . [I]123-emma certainly have been misunderstanding [you]111-harriet , if [you]111-harriet feel in doubt as to the _ purport _ of [your]111-harriet answer . [I]123-emma had imagined [you]111-harriet were consulting [me]123-emma only as to the wording of it . ”[123-emma]

[Harriet]111-harriet was silent . With a little reserve of manner , [Emma]123-emma continued :

“ [You]111-harriet mean to return a favourable answer , [I]123-emma collect . ”[123-emma]

“ No , [I]123-emma do not ; that is , [I]123-emma do not mean -- What shall [I]123-emma do ? What would [you]123-emma advise [me]123-emma to do ? Pray , dear [Miss Woodhouse]84-miss woodhouse , tell [me]123-emma what [I]123-emma ought to do . ”[123-emma]

“ [I]123-emma shall not give [you]111-harriet any advice , [Harriet]111-harriet . [I]123-emma will have nothing to do with it . This is a point which [you]111-harriet must settle with [your]111-harriet feelings . ”[123-emma]

“ [I]111-harriet had no notion that [he]2970-he liked [me]111-harriet so very much , ”[111-harriet] said [Harriet]111-harriet , contemplating the letter . For a little while [Emma]123-emma persevered in [her]123-emma silence ; but beginning to apprehend the bewitching flattery of that letter might be too powerful , [she]123-emma thought it best to say ,

“ [I]123-emma lay it down as a general rule , [Harriet]111-harriet , that if [a woman]2864-a woman _ doubts _ as to whether [she]2864-a woman should accept [a man]2840-a man or not , [she]2864-a woman certainly ought to refuse [him]2840-a man . If [she]2864-a woman can hesitate as to ' Yes , ' [she]2864-a woman ought to say ' No ' directly . It is not a state to be safely entered into with doubtful feelings , with half a heart . [I]123-emma thought it [my]123-emma duty as [a friend]416-a friend , and older than [yourself]111-harriet , to say thus much to [you]111-harriet . But do not imagine that [I]123-emma want to influence [you]111-harriet . ”[123-emma]

“ Oh ! no , [I]123-emma am sure [you]111-harriet are a great deal too kind to -- but if [you]111-harriet would just advise [me]123-emma what [I]123-emma had best do -- No , no , [I]123-emma do not mean that -- As [you]111-harriet say , [one]2775-one 's mind ought to be quite made up -- [One]2775-one should not be hesitating -- It is a very serious thing.--It will be safer to say ' No , ' perhaps.--Do [you]111-harriet think [I]123-emma had better say ' No ? ' ”[123-emma]

“ Not for [the world]403-the world , ”[123-emma] said [Emma]123-emma , smiling graciously , “ would [I]123-emma advise [you]111-harriet either way . [You]111-harriet must be the best judge of [your]111-harriet own happiness . If [you]111-harriet prefer [Mr. Martin]116-mr. martin to [every other person]2977-every other person ; if [you]111-harriet think [him]116-mr. martin [the most agreeable man [you]111-harriet have ever been in company with]2978-the most agreeable man you have ever been in company with , why should [you]111-harriet hesitate ? [You]111-harriet blush , Harriet.--Does any body else occur to [you]111-harriet at this moment under such a definition ? [Harriet]111-harriet , [Harriet]111-harriet , do not deceive [yourself]111-harriet ; do not be run away with by gratitude and compassion . At this moment whom are [you]111-harriet thinking of ? ”[123-emma]

The symptoms were favourable.--Instead of answering , [Harriet]111-harriet turned away confused , and stood thoughtfully by the fire ; and though the letter was still in [her]111-harriet hand , it was now mechanically twisted about without regard . [Emma]123-emma waited the result with impatience , but not without strong hopes . At last , with some hesitation , [Harriet]111-harriet said--

“ [Miss Woodhouse]84-miss woodhouse , as [you]84-miss woodhouse will not give [me]111-harriet [your]84-miss woodhouse opinion , [I]111-harriet must do as well as [I]111-harriet can by [myself]111-harriet ; and [I]111-harriet have now quite determined , and really almost made up [my]111-harriet mind -- to refuse [Mr. Martin]116-mr. martin . Do [you]84-miss woodhouse think [I]111-harriet am right ? ”[111-harriet]

“ Perfectly , perfectly right , [[my]111-harriet dearest]2979-my dearest [Harriet]111-harriet ; [you]111-harriet are doing just what [you]111-harriet ought . While [you]111-harriet were at all in suspense [I]111-harriet kept [my]111-harriet feelings to [myself]111-harriet , but now that [you]111-harriet are so completely decided [I]111-harriet have no hesitation in approving . [Dear Harriet]111-harriet , [I]111-harriet give [myself]111-harriet joy of this . It would have grieved [me]111-harriet to lose [your]111-harriet acquaintance , which must have been the consequence of [your]111-harriet marrying [Mr. Martin]116-mr. martin . While [you]111-harriet were in the smallest degree wavering , [I]111-harriet said nothing about it , because [I]111-harriet would not influence ; but it would have been the loss of [a friend to [me]111-harriet]2980-a friend to me . [I]111-harriet could not have visited [Mrs. Robert Martin]114-mrs. martin , of [Abbey]8-donwell abbey - [Mill Farm]2981-mill farm . Now [I]111-harriet am secure of [you]111-harriet for ever . ”[111-harriet]

[Harriet]111-harriet had not surmised [her]111-harriet own danger , but the idea of it struck [her]111-harriet forcibly .

“ [You]111-harriet could not have visited [me]111-harriet ! ”[111-harriet] [she]111-harriet cried , looking aghast . “ No , to be sure [you]111-harriet could not ; but [I]111-harriet never thought of that before . That would have been too dreadful!--What an [escape!--Dear Miss Woodhouse]84-miss woodhouse , [I]111-harriet would not give up the pleasure and honour of being intimate with [you]111-harriet for any thing in [the world]403-the world . ”[111-harriet]

“ Indeed , [Harriet]111-harriet , it would have been a severe pang to lose [you]111-harriet ; but it must have been . [You]111-harriet would have thrown [yourself]111-harriet out of all good society . [I]111-harriet must have given [you]111-harriet up . ”[111-harriet]

“ Dear me!--How should [I]111-harriet ever have borne it ! It would have killed [me]111-harriet never to come to [Hartfield]2-hartfield any more ! ”[111-harriet]

“ Dear affectionate creature!--_You _ banished to [Abbey]8-donwell abbey - Mill Farm!--_You _ confined to the society of [the illiterate and vulgar]2983-the illiterate and vulgar all [your]111-harriet life ! [I]111-harriet wonder how [the young man]532-the young man could have the assurance to ask it . [He]532-the young man must have a pretty good opinion of [himself]532-the young man . ”[111-harriet]

“ [I]111-harriet do not think [he]532-the young man is conceited either , in general , ”[111-harriet] said [Harriet]111-harriet , [her]111-harriet conscience opposing such censure ; “ at least , [he]532-the young man is very good natured , and [I]111-harriet shall always feel much obliged to [him]532-the young man , and have a great regard for -- but that is quite a different thing from -- and [you]111-harriet know , though [he]532-the young man may like [me]111-harriet , it does not follow that [I]111-harriet should -- and certainly [I]111-harriet must confess that since [my]111-harriet visiting [here]2707-here [I]111-harriet have seen [people]2986-people -- and if one comes to compare [them]2986-people , person and manners , there is no comparison at all , _ one _ is so very handsome and agreeable . However , [I]111-harriet do really think [Mr. Martin]116-mr. martin [a very amiable young man]2987-a very amiable young man , and have a great opinion of [him]532-the young man ; and [his]532-the young man being so much attached to [me]111-harriet -- and [his]532-the young man writing such a letter -- but as to leaving [you]111-harriet , it is what [I]111-harriet would not do upon any consideration . ”[111-harriet]

“ Thank [you]111-harriet , thank [you]111-harriet , [[my]123-emma own sweet little friend]2988-my own sweet little friend . [We]2989-we will not be parted . [A woman]2864-a woman is not to marry [a man]2840-a man merely because [she]2864-a woman is asked , or because [he]2840-a man is attached to [her]2864-a woman , and can write a tolerable letter . ”[123-emma]

“ Oh no;--and it is but a short letter too . ”[111-harriet]

[Emma]123-emma felt the bad taste of [[her]123-emma friend]427-her friend , but let it pass with a “ very true ; and it would be a small consolation to [her]2864-a woman , for the clownish manner which might be offending [her]2864-a woman every hour of the day , to know that [[her]2864-a woman husband]441-her husband could write a good letter . ”[123-emma]

“ Oh ! yes , very . [Nobody]2718-nobody cares for a letter ; the thing is , to be always happy with [pleasant companions]2994-pleasant companions . [I]123-emma am quite determined to refuse [him]427-her friend . But how shall [I]123-emma do ? What shall [I]123-emma say ? ”[123-emma]

[Emma]123-emma assured [her]427-her friend there would be no difficulty in the answer , and advised its being written directly , which was agreed to , in the hope of [her]123-emma assistance ; and though [Emma]123-emma continued to protest against any assistance being wanted , it was in fact given in the formation of every sentence . The looking over [his]427-her friend letter again , in replying to it , had such a softening tendency , that it was particularly necessary to brace [her]123-emma up with a few decisive expressions ; and [she]123-emma was so very much concerned at the idea of making [him]427-her friend unhappy , and thought so much of what [[his]427-her friend mother]500-his mother and sisters would think and say , and was so anxious that [they]730-they should not fancy [her]123-emma ungrateful , that [Emma]123-emma believed if [the young man]532-the young man had come in [her]123-emma way at that moment , [he]532-the young man would have been accepted after all .

This letter , however , was written , and sealed , and sent . The business was finished , and [Harriet]111-harriet safe . [She]111-harriet was rather low all the evening , but [Emma]123-emma could allow for [her]123-emma amiable regrets , and sometimes relieved [them]732-them by speaking of [her]123-emma own affection , sometimes by bringing forward the idea of [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton .

“ [I]111-harriet shall never be invited to [Abbey - Mill]16-abbey - mill again , ”[111-harriet] was said in rather a sorrowful tone .

“ Nor , if [you]111-harriet were , could [I]111-harriet ever bear to part with [you]111-harriet , [[my]111-harriet Harriet]2995-my harriet . [You]111-harriet are a great deal too necessary at [Hartfield]2-hartfield to be spared to [Abbey - Mill]16-abbey - mill . ”[111-harriet]

“ And [I]111-harriet am sure [I]111-harriet should never want to go [there]448-there ; for [I]111-harriet am never happy but at [Hartfield]2-hartfield . ”[111-harriet]

Some time afterwards it was , “ [I]111-harriet think [Mrs. Goddard]109-mrs. goddard would be very much surprized if [she]109-mrs. goddard knew what had happened . [I]111-harriet am sure [Miss Nash]117-miss nash would -- for [Miss Nash]117-miss nash thinks [[her]117-miss nash own sister]2997-her own sister very well married , and it is only [a linen - draper]2998-a linen - draper . ”[111-harriet]

“ [One]2775-one should be sorry to see greater pride or refinement in [the teacher of [a school]582-a school]3000-the teacher of a school , [Harriet]111-harriet . [I]111-harriet dare say [Miss Nash]117-miss nash would envy [you]111-harriet such an opportunity as this of being married . Even this conquest would appear valuable in [her]117-miss nash eyes . As to any thing superior for [you]111-harriet , [I]111-harriet suppose [she]117-miss nash is quite in the dark . The attentions of [a certain person]3002-a certain person can hardly be among the tittle - tattle of [Highbury]3-highbury yet . Hitherto [I]111-harriet fancy [you]111-harriet and [I]111-harriet are the only people to whom [his]95-mr. elton looks and manners have explained [themselves]2986-people . ”[111-harriet]

[Harriet]111-harriet blushed and smiled , and said something about wondering that [people]2986-people should like [her]111-harriet so much . The idea of [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton was certainly cheering ; but still , after a time , [she]111-harriet was tender - hearted again towards [the rejected Mr. Martin]116-mr. martin .

“ Now [he]95-mr. elton has got [my]111-harriet letter , ”[111-harriet] said [she]111-harriet softly . “ [I]111-harriet wonder what [they]3003-they are all doing -- whether [[his]95-mr. elton sisters]2820-his sisters know -- if [he]95-mr. elton is unhappy , [they]3003-they will be unhappy too . [I]111-harriet hope [he]95-mr. elton will not mind it so very much . ”[111-harriet]

“ Let [us]3005-us think of [those among [[our]3005-us absent friends]3007-our absent friends who are more cheerfully employed]3006-those among our absent friends who are more cheerfully employed , ”[123-emma] cried [Emma]123-emma . “ At this moment , perhaps , [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton is shewing [your]111-harriet picture to [[his]95-mr. elton mother]500-his mother and [sisters]418-sisters , telling how much more beautiful is the original , and after being asked for it five or six times , allowing [them]3003-they to hear [your]111-harriet name , [your]111-harriet own dear name . ”[123-emma]

“ [My]111-harriet picture!--But [he]95-mr. elton has left [my]111-harriet picture in [Bond - street]3010-bond - street . ”[111-harriet]

“ Has [he]95-mr. elton so!--Then [I]123-emma know nothing of [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton . No , [[my]123-emma dear]2714-my dear little modest [Harriet]111-harriet , depend upon it the picture will not be in [Bond - street]3010-bond - street till just before [he]95-mr. elton mounts [his]95-mr. elton horse to - morrow . It is [[his]95-mr. elton companion]3013-his companion all this evening , [his]95-mr. elton solace , [his]95-mr. elton delight . It opens [his]95-mr. elton designs to [[his]95-mr. elton family]3014-his family , it introduces [you]111-harriet among [them]3014-his family , it diffuses through the party those pleasantest feelings of [our]3015-our nature , eager curiosity and warm prepossession . How cheerful , how animated , how suspicious , how busy [their]3014-his family imaginations all are ! ”[123-emma]

[Harriet]111-harriet smiled again , and [her]111-harriet smiles grew stronger .

CHAPTER VIII

[Harriet]111-harriet slept at [Hartfield]2-hartfield that night . For some weeks past [she]111-harriet had been spending more than half [her]111-harriet time [there]448-there , and gradually getting to have [a bed - room]735-a bed - room appropriated to [herself]111-harriet ; and [Emma]123-emma judged it best in every respect , safest and kindest , to keep [her]111-harriet with [them]736-them as much as possible just at present . [She]111-harriet was obliged to go the next morning for an hour or two to [[Mrs. Goddard]109-mrs. goddard 's]720-mrs. goddard 's , but it was then to be settled that [she]111-harriet should return to [Hartfield]2-hartfield , to make a regular visit of some days .

While [she]111-harriet was gone , [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley called , and sat some time with [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse and [Emma]123-emma , till [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse , who had previously made up [his]85-mr. woodhouse mind to walk out , was persuaded by [[his]85-mr. woodhouse daughter]2723-his daughter not to defer it , and was induced by the entreaties of both , though against the scruples of [his]85-mr. woodhouse own civility , to leave [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley for that purpose . [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley , who had nothing of ceremony about [him]92-mr. knightley , was offering by [his]92-mr. knightley short , decided answers , an amusing contrast to the protracted apologies and civil hesitations of [the other]739-the other .

“ Well , [I]92-mr. knightley believe , if [you]92-mr. knightley will excuse [me]92-mr. knightley , [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley , if [you]92-mr. knightley will not consider [me]92-mr. knightley as doing a very rude thing , [I]92-mr. knightley shall take [Emma]123-emma 's advice and go out for a quarter of an hour . As the sun is out , [I]92-mr. knightley believe [I]92-mr. knightley had better take [my]92-mr. knightley three turns while [I]92-mr. knightley can . [I]92-mr. knightley treat [you]92-mr. knightley without ceremony , [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley . [[We]3016-we invalids]3017-we invalids think [we]3016-we are [privileged people]3018-privileged people . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ [[My]92-mr. knightley dear sir]3019-my dear sir , do not make [a stranger of [me]92-mr. knightley]3020-a stranger of me . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ [I]92-mr. knightley leave an excellent substitute in [[my]92-mr. knightley daughter]3021-my daughter . [Emma]123-emma will be happy to entertain [you]92-mr. knightley . And therefore [I]92-mr. knightley think [I]92-mr. knightley will beg [your]92-mr. knightley excuse and take [my]92-mr. knightley three turns -- [my]92-mr. knightley winter walk . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ [You]92-mr. knightley can not do better , [sir]2734-sir . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ [I]92-mr. knightley would ask for the pleasure of [your]92-mr. knightley company , [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley , but [I]92-mr. knightley am [a very slow walker]3023-a very slow walker , and [my]92-mr. knightley pace would be tedious to [you]92-mr. knightley ; and , besides , [you]92-mr. knightley have another long walk before [you]92-mr. knightley , to [Donwell Abbey]8-donwell abbey . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ Thank [you]92-mr. knightley , [sir]2734-sir , thank [you]92-mr. knightley ; [I]92-mr. knightley am going this moment [myself]92-mr. knightley ; and [I]92-mr. knightley think the sooner _ [you]92-mr. knightley _ go the better . [I]92-mr. knightley will fetch [your]92-mr. knightley greatcoat and open the garden door for [you]92-mr. knightley . ”[92-mr. knightley]

[Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse at last was off ; but [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley , instead of being immediately off likewise , sat down again , seemingly inclined for more chat . [He]92-mr. knightley began speaking of [Harriet]111-harriet , and speaking of [her]111-harriet with more voluntary praise than [Emma]123-emma had ever heard before .

“ [I]92-mr. knightley can not rate [her]111-harriet beauty as [you]92-mr. knightley do , ”[92-mr. knightley] said [he]92-mr. knightley ; “ but [she]111-harriet is a pretty little creature , and [I]92-mr. knightley am inclined to think very well of [her]111-harriet disposition . [Her]111-harriet character depends upon those [she]111-harriet is with ; but in good hands [she]111-harriet will turn out [a valuable woman]3025-a valuable woman . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ [I]92-mr. knightley am glad [you]92-mr. knightley think so ; and the good hands , [I]92-mr. knightley hope , may not be wanting . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ Come , ”[92-mr. knightley] said [he]92-mr. knightley , “ [you]92-mr. knightley are anxious for a compliment , so [I]92-mr. knightley will tell [you]92-mr. knightley that [you]92-mr. knightley have improved [her]111-harriet . [You]92-mr. knightley have cured [her]111-harriet of [[her]111-harriet school - girl]3026-her school - girl 's giggle ; [she]111-harriet really does [you]92-mr. knightley credit . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ Thank [you]92-mr. knightley . [I]92-mr. knightley should be mortified indeed if [I]92-mr. knightley did not believe [I]92-mr. knightley had been of some use ; but it is not every body who will bestow praise where [they]3027-they may . _ [You]92-mr. knightley _ do not often overpower [me]92-mr. knightley with it . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ [You]92-mr. knightley are expecting [her]111-harriet again , [you]92-mr. knightley say , this morning ? ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ Almost every moment . [She]111-harriet has been gone longer already than [she]111-harriet intended . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ Something has happened to delay [her]111-harriet ; [some visitors]3028-some visitors perhaps . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ [Highbury gossips!--Tiresome wretches]3029-highbury gossips!--tiresome wretches ! ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ [Harriet]111-harriet may not consider every body tiresome that [you]92-mr. knightley would . ”[92-mr. knightley]

[Emma]123-emma knew this was too true for contradiction , and therefore said nothing . [He]740-i presently added , with a smile ,

“ [I]740-i do not pretend to fix on times or places , but [I]740-i must tell [you]123-emma that [I]740-i have good reason to believe [[your]123-emma little friend]3030-your little friend will soon hear of something to [her]111-harriet advantage . ”[740-i]

“ Indeed ! how so ? of what sort ? ”[740-i]

“ A very serious sort , [I]740-i assure [you]123-emma ; ”[740-i] still smiling .

“ Very serious ! [I]740-i can think of but one thing -- Who is in love with [her]111-harriet ? Who makes [you]123-emma [[their]3031-their confidant]3032-their confidant ? ”[740-i]

[Emma]123-emma was more than half in hopes of [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton 's having dropt a hint . [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley was [a sort of general friend and adviser]741-a sort of general friend and adviser , and [she]123-emma knew [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton looked up to [him]92-mr. knightley .

“ [I]92-mr. knightley have reason to think , ”[92-mr. knightley] [he]92-mr. knightley replied , “ that [Harriet Smith]111-harriet will soon have an offer of marriage , and from a most unexceptionable quarter:--Robert [Martin]116-mr. martin is [the man]3033-the man . [Her]111-harriet visit to [Abbey]8-donwell abbey - [Mill]129-mill , this summer , seems to have done [his]116-mr. martin business . [He]116-mr. martin is desperately in love and means to marry [her]111-harriet . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ [He]116-mr. martin is very obliging , ”[123-emma] said [Emma]123-emma ; “ but is [he]116-mr. martin sure that [Harriet]111-harriet means to marry [him]116-mr. martin ? ”[123-emma]

“ Well , well , means to make [her]111-harriet an offer then . Will that do ? [He]116-mr. martin came to [the Abbey]2802-the abbey two evenings ago , on purpose to consult [me]92-mr. knightley about it . [He]116-mr. martin knows [I]92-mr. knightley have a thorough regard for [him]116-mr. martin and [all [his]116-mr. martin family]3035-all his family , and , [I]92-mr. knightley believe , considers [me]92-mr. knightley as [one of [[his]116-mr. martin best friends]3037-his best friends]3036-one of his best friends . [He]116-mr. martin came to ask [me]92-mr. knightley whether [I]92-mr. knightley thought it would be imprudent in [him]116-mr. martin to settle so early ; whether [I]92-mr. knightley thought [her]111-harriet too young : in short , whether [I]92-mr. knightley approved [his]116-mr. martin choice altogether ; having some apprehension perhaps of [her]111-harriet being considered ( especially since _ [your]3038-your _ making so much of [her]111-harriet ) as in a line of society above [him]116-mr. martin . [I]92-mr. knightley was very much pleased with all that [he]116-mr. martin said . [I]92-mr. knightley never hear better sense from any one than [Robert Martin]116-mr. martin . [He]116-mr. martin always speaks to the purpose ; open , straightforward , and very well judging . [He]116-mr. martin told [me]92-mr. knightley every thing ; [his]116-mr. martin circumstances and plans , and what [they]3039-they all proposed doing in the event of [his]116-mr. martin marriage . [He]116-mr. martin is [an excellent young man]2958-an excellent young man , both as [son]651-son and [brother]3042-brother . [I]92-mr. knightley had no hesitation in advising [him]116-mr. martin to marry . [He]116-mr. martin proved to [me]92-mr. knightley that [he]116-mr. martin could afford it ; and that being the case , [I]92-mr. knightley was convinced [he]116-mr. martin could not do better . [I]92-mr. knightley praised [the fair lady]3043-the fair lady too , and altogether sent [him]116-mr. martin away very happy . If [he]116-mr. martin had never esteemed [my]92-mr. knightley opinion before , [he]116-mr. martin would have thought highly of [me]92-mr. knightley then ; and , [I]92-mr. knightley dare say , left [the house]435-the house thinking [me]92-mr. knightley [the best friend and [counsellor man]3046-counsellor man ever had]3045-the best friend and counsellor man ever had . This happened the night before last . Now , as [we]3047-we may fairly suppose , [he]116-mr. martin would not allow much time to pass before [he]116-mr. martin spoke to [the lady]3048-the lady , and as [he]116-mr. martin does not appear to have spoken yesterday , it is not unlikely that [he]116-mr. martin should be at [Mrs. Goddard]109-mrs. goddard 's to - day ; and [she]3048-the lady may be detained by [a visitor]459-a visitor , without thinking [him]116-mr. martin at all [a tiresome wretch]3050-a tiresome wretch . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ Pray , [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley , ”[123-emma] said [Emma]123-emma , who had been smiling to [herself]123-emma through a great part of this speech , “ how do [you]92-mr. knightley know that [Mr. Martin]116-mr. martin did not speak yesterday ? ”[123-emma]

“ Certainly , ”[742-he] replied [he]742-he , surprized , “ [I]742-he do not absolutely know it ; but it may be inferred . Was not [she]3048-the lady the whole day with [you]92-mr. knightley ? ”[742-he]

“ Come , ”[123-emma] said [she]123-emma , “ [I]123-emma will tell [you]92-mr. knightley something , in return for what [you]92-mr. knightley have told [me]123-emma . [He]116-mr. martin did speak yesterday -- that is , [he]116-mr. martin wrote , and was refused . ”[123-emma]

This was obliged to be repeated before it could be believed ; and [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley actually looked red with surprize and displeasure , as [he]92-mr. knightley stood up , in tall indignation , and said ,

“ Then [she]3048-the lady is [a greater simpleton]3051-a greater simpleton than [I]92-mr. knightley ever believed [her]3048-the lady . What is [the foolish girl]3052-the foolish girl about ? ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ Oh ! to be sure , ”[123-emma] cried [Emma]123-emma , “ it is always incomprehensible to [a man]2840-a man that [a woman]2864-a woman should ever refuse an offer of marriage . [A man]2840-a man always imagines [a woman]2864-a woman to be ready for any body who asks [her]2864-a woman . ”[123-emma]

“ Nonsense ! [a man]2840-a man does not imagine any such thing . But what is the meaning of this ? [Harriet Smith]111-harriet refuse [Robert Martin]116-mr. martin ? madness , if it is so ; but [I]92-mr. knightley hope [you]92-mr. knightley are mistaken . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ [I]123-emma saw [her]3048-the lady answer!--nothing could be clearer . ”[123-emma]

“ [You]92-mr. knightley saw [her]3048-the lady answer!--you wrote [her]3048-the lady answer too . [Emma]123-emma , this is [your]92-mr. knightley doing . [You]92-mr. knightley persuaded [her]3048-the lady to refuse [him]116-mr. martin . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ And if [I]123-emma did , ( which , however , [I]123-emma am far from allowing ) [I]123-emma should not feel that [I]123-emma had done wrong . [Mr. Martin]116-mr. martin is [a very respectable young man]2808-a very respectable young man , but [I]123-emma can not admit [him]116-mr. martin to be [Harriet]111-harriet 's equal ; and am rather surprized indeed that [he]116-mr. martin should have ventured to address [her]111-harriet . By [your]92-mr. knightley account , [he]116-mr. martin does seem to have had some scruples . It is a pity that [they]3059-they were ever got over . ”[123-emma]

“ Not [Harriet]111-harriet 's equal ! ”[92-mr. knightley] exclaimed [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley loudly and warmly ; and with calmer asperity , added , a few moments afterwards , “ No , [he]116-mr. martin is not [her]111-harriet equal indeed , for [he]116-mr. martin is as much [her]111-harriet superior in sense as in situation . [Emma]123-emma , [your]92-mr. knightley infatuation about [that girl]3060-that girl blinds [you]92-mr. knightley . What are [Harriet Smith]111-harriet 's claims , either of birth , nature or education , to any connexion higher than [Robert Martin]116-mr. martin ? [She]111-harriet is [the natural daughter of [nobody]2718-nobody knows whom]3061-the natural daughter of nobody knows whom , with probably no settled provision at all , and certainly no respectable relations . [She]111-harriet is known only as [parlour - boarder at [a common school]3064-a common school]3063-parlour - boarder at a common school . [She]111-harriet is not [a sensible girl]3065-a sensible girl , nor [a girl of any information]3066-a girl of any information . [She]111-harriet has been taught nothing useful , and is too young and too simple to have acquired any thing [herself]111-harriet . At [her]111-harriet age [she]111-harriet can have no experience , and with [her]111-harriet little wit , is not very likely ever to have any that can avail [her]111-harriet . [She]111-harriet is pretty , and [she]111-harriet is good tempered , and that is all . [My]123-emma only scruple in advising the match was on [his]116-mr. martin account , as being beneath [his]116-mr. martin deserts , and a bad connexion for [him]116-mr. martin . [I]123-emma felt that , as to fortune , in all probability [he]116-mr. martin might do much better ; and that as to [a rational companion]3067-a rational companion or [useful helpmate]3068-useful helpmate , [he]116-mr. martin could not do worse . But [I]123-emma could not reason so to [a man in love]3069-a man in love , and was willing to trust to there being no harm in [her]111-harriet , to [her]111-harriet having that sort of disposition , which , in good hands , like [his]116-mr. martin , might be easily led aright and turn out very well . The advantage of the match [I]123-emma felt to be all on [her]111-harriet side ; and had not the smallest doubt ( nor have [I]123-emma now ) that there would be a general cry - out upon [her]111-harriet extreme good luck . Even _ [your]3070-your _ satisfaction [I]123-emma made sure of . It crossed [my]123-emma mind immediately that [you]3070-your would not regret [[your]3070-your friend]2922-your friend 's leaving [Highbury]3-highbury , for the sake of [her]111-harriet being settled so well . [I]123-emma remember saying to [myself]123-emma , ' Even [Emma]123-emma , with all [her]123-emma partiality for [Harriet]111-harriet , will think this a good match . ' ”[123-emma]

“ [I]123-emma can not help wondering at [your]3070-your knowing so little of [Emma]123-emma as to say any such thing . What ! think [a farmer]2807-a farmer , ( and with all [his]2807-a farmer sense and all [his]2807-a farmer merit [Mr. Martin]116-mr. martin is nothing more , ) a good match for [[my]123-emma intimate friend]3073-my intimate friend ! Not regret [her]111-harriet leaving [Highbury]3-highbury for the sake of marrying [a man whom [I]123-emma could never admit as [an acquaintance of [my]123-emma own]3075-an acquaintance of my own]3074-a man whom i could never admit as an acquaintance of my own ! [I]123-emma wonder [you]3070-your should think it possible for [me]123-emma to have such feelings . [I]123-emma assure [you]3070-your [mine]123-emma are very different . [I]123-emma must think [your]3070-your statement by no means fair . [You]3070-your are not just to [Harriet]111-harriet 's claims . They would be estimated very differently by [others]2773-others as well as [myself]123-emma ; [Mr. Martin]116-mr. martin may be [the richest of [the two]3078-the two]3077-the richest of the two , but [he]116-mr. martin is undoubtedly [her]111-harriet inferior as to rank in society.--The sphere in which [she]111-harriet moves is much above his.--It would be a degradation . ”[123-emma]

“ [A degradation to illegitimacy and ignorance]3079-a degradation to illegitimacy and ignorance , to be married to [a respectable , intelligent gentleman - farmer]3080-a respectable , intelligent gentleman - farmer ! ”[123-emma]

“ As to the circumstances of [her]111-harriet birth , though in a legal sense [she]111-harriet may be called [Nobody]2718-nobody , it will not hold in common sense . [She]111-harriet is not to pay for the offence of [others]2773-others , by being held below the level of those with whom [she]111-harriet is brought up.--There can scarcely be a doubt that [[her]111-harriet father]425-her father is [a gentleman]2822-a gentleman -- and [a gentleman of fortune.--Her allowance]3085-a gentleman of fortune.--her allowance is very liberal ; nothing has ever been grudged for [her]111-harriet improvement or comfort.--That [she]111-harriet is [[a gentleman]2822-a gentleman 's daughter]2823-a gentleman 's daughter , is indubitable to [me]123-emma ; that [she]111-harriet associates with [[gentlemen]675-gentlemen 's daughters]3089-gentlemen 's daughters , [no one]3090-no one , [I]123-emma apprehend , will deny.--She is superior to [Mr. Robert Martin]116-mr. martin . ”[123-emma]

“ Whoever might be [[her]111-harriet parents]3091-her parents , ”[92-mr. knightley] said [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley , “ whoever may have had the charge of [her]111-harriet , it does not appear to have been any part of [their]3091-her parents plan to introduce [her]111-harriet into what [you]3092-you would call good society . After receiving a very indifferent education [she]111-harriet is left in [Mrs. Goddard]109-mrs. goddard 's hands to shift as [she]111-harriet can;--to move , in short , in [Mrs. Goddard]109-mrs. goddard 's line , to have [Mrs. Goddard]109-mrs. goddard 's acquaintance . [[Her]111-harriet friends]3093-her friends evidently thought this good enough for [her]111-harriet ; and it _ was _ good enough . [She]111-harriet desired nothing better [herself]111-harriet . Till [you]3092-you chose to turn [her]111-harriet into [a friend]416-a friend , [her]111-harriet mind had no distaste for [her]111-harriet own set , nor any ambition beyond it . [She]111-harriet was as happy as possible with [the Martins]113-the martins in the summer . [She]111-harriet had no sense of superiority then . If [she]111-harriet has it now , [you]3092-you have given it . [You]3092-you have been [no friend to [Harriet Smith]111-harriet]3095-no friend to harriet smith , [Emma]123-emma . [Robert Martin]116-mr. martin would never have proceeded so far , if [he]116-mr. martin had not felt persuaded of [her]111-harriet not being disinclined to [him]116-mr. martin . [I]92-mr. knightley know [him]116-mr. martin well . [He]116-mr. martin has too much real feeling to address [any woman]3096-any woman on the haphazard of selfish passion . And as to conceit , [he]116-mr. martin is the farthest from it of [any man [I]92-mr. knightley know]3097-any man i know . Depend upon it [he]116-mr. martin had encouragement . ”[92-mr. knightley]

It was most convenient to [Emma]123-emma not to make a direct reply to this assertion ; [she]123-emma chose rather to take up [her]123-emma own line of the subject again .
