“ [You]3092-you are [a very warm friend to [Mr. Martin]116-mr. martin]3098-a very warm friend to mr. martin ; but , as [I]123-emma said before , are unjust to [Harriet]111-harriet . [Harriet]111-harriet 's claims to marry well are not so contemptible as [you]3092-you represent [them]3099-them . [She]111-harriet is not [a clever girl]3100-a clever girl , but [she]111-harriet has better sense than [you]3092-you are aware of , and does not deserve to have [her]111-harriet understanding spoken of so slightingly . Waiving that point , however , and supposing [her]111-harriet to be , as [you]3092-you describe [her]111-harriet , only pretty and good - natured , let [me]123-emma tell [you]3092-you , that in the degree [she]111-harriet possesses [them]3099-them , they are not trivial recommendations to [the world]403-the world in general , for [she]111-harriet is , in fact , [a beautiful girl]3102-a beautiful girl , and must be thought so by [ninety - nine people out of an hundred]3103-ninety - nine people out of an hundred ; and till it appears that [men]3104-men are much more philosophic on the subject of beauty than [they]3104-men are generally supposed ; till [they]3104-men do fall in love with [well - informed minds instead of handsome faces]3105-well - informed minds instead of handsome faces , [a girl]2892-a girl , with such loveliness as [Harriet]111-harriet , has a certainty of being admired and sought after , of having the power of chusing from among [many]545-many , consequently a claim to be nice . [Her]111-harriet good - nature , too , is not so very slight a claim , comprehending , as it does , real , thorough sweetness of temper and manner , a very humble opinion of [herself]111-harriet , and a great readiness to be pleased with [other people]456-other people . [I]123-emma am very much mistaken if [your]3092-you sex in general would not think such beauty , and such temper , the highest claims [a woman]2864-a woman could possess . ”[123-emma]

“ Upon [my]123-emma word , [Emma]123-emma , to hear [you]123-emma abusing the reason [you]123-emma have , is almost enough to make [me]123-emma think so too . Better be without sense , than misapply it as [you]123-emma do . ”[123-emma]

“ To be sure ! ”[743-i] cried [she]743-i playfully . “ [I]743-i know _ that _ is the feeling of [you]3092-you all . [I]743-i know that [such a girl]3110-such a girl as [Harriet]111-harriet is exactly what [every man]3111-every man delights in -- what at once bewitches [his]3111-every man senses and satisfies [his]3111-every man judgment . Oh ! [Harriet]111-harriet may pick and chuse . Were [you]3092-you , [yourself]3092-you , ever to marry , [she]111-harriet is [the very woman for [you]3092-you]3112-the very woman for you . And is [she]111-harriet , at seventeen , just entering into life , just beginning to be known , to be wondered at because [she]111-harriet does not accept the first offer [she]111-harriet receives ? No -- pray let [her]111-harriet have time to look about [her]111-harriet . ”[743-i]

“ [I]92-mr. knightley have always thought it a very foolish intimacy , ”[92-mr. knightley] said [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley presently , “ though [I]92-mr. knightley have kept [my]92-mr. knightley thoughts to [myself]92-mr. knightley ; but [I]92-mr. knightley now perceive that it will be a very unfortunate one for [Harriet]111-harriet . [You]3092-you will puff [her]111-harriet up with such ideas of [her]111-harriet own beauty , and of what [she]111-harriet has a claim to , that , in a little while , [nobody]2718-nobody within [her]111-harriet reach will be good enough for [her]111-harriet . [Vanity]130-vanity working on a weak head , produces every sort of mischief . Nothing so easy as for [a young lady]2768-a young lady to raise [her]2768-a young lady expectations too high . [Miss Harriet Smith]111-harriet may not find offers of marriage flow in so fast , though [she]111-harriet is [a very pretty girl]615-a very pretty girl . [Men of sense]3116-men of sense , whatever [you]3092-you may chuse to say , do not want [silly wives]3117-silly wives . [Men of family]3118-men of family would not be very fond of connecting [themselves]3118-men of family with [a girl of such obscurity]3119-a girl of such obscurity -- and [most prudent men]3120-most prudent men would be afraid of the inconvenience and disgrace [they]3120-most prudent men might be involved in , when the mystery of [her]111-harriet parentage came to be revealed . Let [her]111-harriet marry [Robert Martin]116-mr. martin , and [she]111-harriet is safe , respectable , and happy for ever ; but if [you]3092-you encourage [her]111-harriet to expect to marry greatly , and teach [her]111-harriet to be satisfied with nothing less than [a man of consequence and large fortune]3121-a man of consequence and large fortune , [she]111-harriet may be a parlour - boarder at [Mrs. Goddard]109-mrs. goddard 's all the rest of [her]111-harriet life -- or , at least , ( for [Harriet Smith]111-harriet is [a girl who will marry [somebody or other]3123-somebody or other , ) till [she]111-harriet grow desperate , and is glad to catch at [[the old writing - master]3124-the old writing - master 's son]3125-the old writing - master 's son]3122-a girl who will marry somebody or other , ) till she grow desperate , and is glad to catch at the old writing - master 's son . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ [We]3126-we think so very differently on this point , [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley , that there can be no use in canvassing it . [We]3126-we shall only be making [each other]430-each other more angry . But as to [my]92-mr. knightley _ letting _ [her]111-harriet marry [Robert Martin]116-mr. martin , it is impossible ; [she]111-harriet has refused [him]116-mr. martin , and so decidedly , [I]92-mr. knightley think , as must prevent any second application . [She]111-harriet must abide by the evil of having refused [him]116-mr. martin , whatever it may be ; and as to the refusal itself , [I]92-mr. knightley will not pretend to say that [I]92-mr. knightley might not influence [her]111-harriet a little ; but [I]92-mr. knightley assure [you]3128-you there was very little for [me]92-mr. knightley or for any body to do . [His]116-mr. martin appearance is so much against [him]116-mr. martin , and [his]116-mr. martin manner so bad , that if [she]111-harriet ever were disposed to favour [him]116-mr. martin , [she]111-harriet is not now . [I]92-mr. knightley can imagine , that before [she]111-harriet had seen [any body superior]3129-any body superior , [she]111-harriet might tolerate [him]116-mr. martin . [He]116-mr. martin was [the brother of [[her]111-harriet friends]3093-her friends]3130-the brother of her friends , and [he]116-mr. martin took pains to please [her]111-harriet ; and altogether , having seen [nobody]2718-nobody better ( that must have been [[his]116-mr. martin great assistant]3133-his great assistant ) [she]111-harriet might not , while [she]111-harriet was at [Abbey - Mill]16-abbey - mill , find [him]116-mr. martin disagreeable . But the case is altered now . [She]111-harriet knows now what [gentlemen]675-gentlemen are ; and nothing but [a gentleman in education and manner]3135-a gentleman in education and manner has any chance with [Harriet]111-harriet . ”[131-mr. knightley.--“robert martin]

“ Nonsense , errant nonsense , as ever was talked ! ”[131-mr. knightley.--“robert martin] cried [Mr. Knightley.--“Robert Martin]131-mr. knightley.--“robert martin 's manners have sense , sincerity , and good - humour to recommend them ; and [his]744-he mind has more true gentility than [Harriet Smith]111-harriet could understand . ”[131-mr. knightley.--“robert martin]

[Emma]123-emma made no answer , and tried to look cheerfully unconcerned , but was really feeling uncomfortable and wanting [him]744-he very much to be gone . [She]123-emma did not repent what [she]123-emma had done ; [she]123-emma still thought [herself]123-emma a better judge of such a point of female right and refinement than [he]744-he could be ; but yet [she]123-emma had a sort of habitual respect for [his]744-he judgment in general , which made [her]123-emma dislike having it so loudly against [her]123-emma ; and to have [him]744-he sitting just opposite to [her]123-emma in angry state , was very disagreeable . Some minutes passed in this unpleasant silence , with only one attempt on [Emma]123-emma 's side to talk of the weather , but [he]744-he made no answer . [He]744-he was thinking . The result of [his]744-he thoughts appeared at last in these words .

“ [Robert Martin]116-mr. martin has no great loss -- if [he]744-he can but think so ; and [I]744-he hope it will not be long before [he]744-he does . [Your]744-he views for [Harriet]111-harriet are best known to [yourself]744-he ; but as [you]744-he make no secret of [your]744-he love of match - making , it is fair to suppose that views , and plans , and projects [you]744-he have;--and as [a friend]416-a friend [I]744-he shall just hint to [you]744-he that if [Elton]95-mr. elton is [the man]3033-the man , [I]744-he think it will be all labour in vain . ”[744-he]

[Emma]123-emma laughed and disclaimed . [He]744-he continued ,

“ Depend upon it , [Elton]95-mr. elton will not do . [Elton]95-mr. elton is [a very good sort of man]3138-a very good sort of man , and [a very respectable vicar of [Highbury]3-highbury]3139-a very respectable vicar of highbury , but not at all likely to make an imprudent match . [He]95-mr. elton knows the value of a good income as well as any body . [Elton]95-mr. elton may talk sentimentally , but [he]95-mr. elton will act rationally . [He]95-mr. elton is as well acquainted with [his]95-mr. elton own claims , as [you]744-he can be with [Harriet]111-harriet 's . [He]95-mr. elton knows that [he]95-mr. elton is [a very handsome young man]3140-a very handsome young man , and a great favourite wherever [he]95-mr. elton goes ; and from [his]95-mr. elton general way of talking in unreserved moments , when there are only [men present]3141-men present , [I]744-he am convinced that [he]95-mr. elton does not mean to throw [himself]95-mr. elton away . [I]744-he have heard [him]95-mr. elton speak with great animation of [a large family of young ladies that [[his]95-mr. elton sisters]2820-his sisters are intimate with , who have all twenty thousand pounds apiece]3142-a large family of young ladies that his sisters are intimate with , who have all twenty thousand pounds apiece . ”[744-he]

“ [I]123-emma am very much obliged to [you]95-mr. elton , ”[123-emma] said [Emma]123-emma , laughing again . “ If [I]123-emma had set [my]123-emma heart on [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton 's marrying [Harriet]111-harriet , it would have been very kind to open [my]123-emma eyes ; but at present [I]123-emma only want to keep [Harriet]111-harriet to [myself]123-emma . [I]123-emma have done with match - making indeed . [I]123-emma could never hope to equal [my]123-emma own doings at [Randalls]101-randalls . [I]123-emma shall leave off while [I]123-emma am well . ”[123-emma]

“ Good morning to you,”--said[745-he] [he]745-he , rising and walking off abruptly . [He]745-he was very much vexed . [He]745-he felt the disappointment of [the young man]532-the young man , and was mortified to have been the means of promoting it , by the sanction [he]745-he had given ; and the part which [he]745-he was persuaded [Emma]123-emma had taken in the affair , was provoking [him]745-he exceedingly .

[Emma]123-emma remained in a state of vexation too ; but there was more indistinctness in the causes of [her]123-emma 's , than in [his]745-he . [She]123-emma did not always feel so absolutely satisfied with [herself]123-emma , so entirely convinced that [her]123-emma opinions were right and [[her]123-emma adversary]747-her adversary 's wrong , as [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley . [He]745-he walked off in more complete self - approbation than [he]745-he left for [her]123-emma . [She]123-emma was not so materially cast down , however , but that a little time and the return of [Harriet]111-harriet were very adequate restoratives . [Harriet]111-harriet 's staying away so long was beginning to make [her]123-emma uneasy . The possibility of [the young man]532-the young man 's coming to [Mrs. Goddard]109-mrs. goddard 's that morning , and meeting with [Harriet]111-harriet and pleading [his]745-he own cause , gave alarming ideas . The dread of such a failure after all became the prominent uneasiness ; and when [Harriet]111-harriet appeared , and in very good spirits , and without having any such reason to give for [her]111-harriet long absence , [she]111-harriet felt a satisfaction which settled [her]111-harriet with [her]111-harriet own mind , and convinced [her]111-harriet , that let [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley think or say what [he]92-mr. knightley would , [she]111-harriet had done nothing which [woman]749-woman 's friendship and [woman]749-woman 's feelings would not justify .

[He]92-mr. knightley had frightened [her]111-harriet a little about [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton ; but when [she]111-harriet considered that [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley could not have observed [him]92-mr. knightley as [she]111-harriet had done , neither with the interest , nor ( [she]111-harriet must be allowed to tell [herself]111-harriet , in spite of [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley 's pretensions ) with the skill of such [an observer]751-an observer on such a question as [herself]111-harriet , that [he]92-mr. knightley had spoken it hastily and in anger , [she]111-harriet was able to believe , that [he]92-mr. knightley had rather said what [he]92-mr. knightley wished resentfully to be true , than what [he]92-mr. knightley knew any thing about . [He]92-mr. knightley certainly might have heard [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton speak with more unreserve than [she]111-harriet had ever done , and [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton might not be of an imprudent , inconsiderate disposition as to money matters ; [he]95-mr. elton might naturally be rather attentive than otherwise to [them]752-them ; but then , [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley did not make due allowance for the influence of a strong passion at war with all interested motives . [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley saw no such passion , and of course thought nothing of its effects ; but [she]111-harriet saw too much of it to feel a doubt of its overcoming any hesitations that a reasonable prudence might originally suggest ; and more than a reasonable , becoming degree of prudence , [she]111-harriet was very sure did not belong to [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton .

[Harriet]111-harriet 's cheerful look and manner established [hers]111-harriet : [she]111-harriet came back , not to think of [Mr. Martin]116-mr. martin , but to talk of [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton . [Miss Nash]117-miss nash had been telling [her]111-harriet something , which [she]111-harriet repeated immediately with great delight . [Mr. Perry]106-mr. perry had been to [Mrs. Goddard]109-mrs. goddard 's to attend [a sick child]753-a sick child , and [Miss Nash]117-miss nash had seen [him]106-mr. perry , and [he]106-mr. perry had told [Miss Nash]117-miss nash , that as [he]106-mr. perry was coming back yesterday from [Clayton Park]18-clayton park , [he]106-mr. perry had met [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton , and found to [his]106-mr. perry great surprize , that [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton was actually on [his]95-mr. elton road to [London]1-london , and not meaning to return till the morrow , though it was the whist - club night , which [he]95-mr. elton had been never known to miss before ; and [Mr. Perry]106-mr. perry had remonstrated with [him]95-mr. elton about it , and told [him]95-mr. elton how shabby it was in [him]95-mr. elton , [[their]754-their best player]755-their best player , to absent [himself]95-mr. elton , and tried very much to persuade [him]95-mr. elton to put off [his]95-mr. elton journey only one day ; but it would not do ; [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton had been determined to go on , and had said in a _ very _ _ particular _ way indeed , that [he]95-mr. elton was going on business which [he]95-mr. elton would not put off for any inducement in [the world]403-the world ; and something about a very enviable commission , and being [the bearer of something exceedingly precious]757-the bearer of something exceedingly precious . [Mr. Perry]106-mr. perry could not quite understand [him]95-mr. elton , but [he]106-mr. perry was very sure there must be [a _ lady _ in the case]758-a _ lady _ in the case , and [he]106-mr. perry told [him]95-mr. elton so ; and [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton only looked very conscious and smiling , and rode off in great spirits . [Miss Nash]117-miss nash had told [her]117-miss nash all this , and had talked a great deal more about [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton ; and said , looking so very significantly at [her]117-miss nash , “ that [she]117-miss nash did not pretend to understand what [his]95-mr. elton business might be , but [she]117-miss nash only knew that [any woman whom [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton]3144-any woman whom mr. elton could prefer , [she]117-miss nash should think [the luckiest woman in [the world]403-the world]3145-the luckiest woman in the world ; for , beyond a doubt , [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton had not [his]95-mr. elton equal for beauty or agreeableness . ”[95-mr. elton]

[CHAPTER IX

Mr. Knightley]132-mr. knightley might quarrel with [her]117-miss nash , but [Emma]123-emma could not quarrel with [herself]123-emma . [He]95-mr. elton was so much displeased , that it was longer than usual before [he]95-mr. elton came to [Hartfield]2-hartfield again ; and when [they]759-they did meet , [his]95-mr. elton grave looks shewed that [she]117-miss nash was not forgiven . [She]117-miss nash was sorry , but could not repent . On the contrary , [her]117-miss nash plans and proceedings were more and more justified and endeared to [her]117-miss nash by the general appearances of the next few days .

The Picture , elegantly framed , came safely to hand soon after [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton 's return , and being hung over the mantelpiece of [the common sitting - room]760-the common sitting - room , [he]95-mr. elton got up to look at it , and sighed out [his]95-mr. elton half sentences of admiration just as [he]95-mr. elton ought ; and as for [Harriet]111-harriet 's feelings , they were visibly forming themselves into as strong and steady an attachment as [her]111-harriet youth and sort of mind admitted . [Emma]123-emma was soon perfectly satisfied of [Mr. Martin]116-mr. martin 's being no otherwise remembered , than as [he]95-mr. elton furnished a contrast with [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton , of the utmost advantage to the latter .

[Her]117-miss nash views of improving [[her]117-miss nash little friend]761-her little friend 's mind , by a great deal of useful reading and conversation , had never yet led to more than a few first chapters , and the intention of going on to - morrow . It was much easier to chat than to study ; much pleasanter to let [her]117-miss nash imagination range and work at [Harriet]111-harriet 's fortune , than to be labouring to enlarge [her]117-miss nash comprehension or exercise it on sober facts ; and the only literary pursuit which engaged [Harriet]111-harriet at present , the only mental provision [she]111-harriet was making for the evening of life , was the collecting and transcribing all the riddles of every sort that [she]111-harriet could meet with , into a thin quarto of hot - pressed paper , made up by [[her]111-harriet friend]427-her friend , and ornamented with ciphers and trophies .

In this age of literature , such collections on a very grand scale are not uncommon . [Miss Nash]117-miss nash , [head - teacher at [Mrs. Goddard]109-mrs. goddard 's]763-head - teacher at mrs. goddard 's , had written out at least three hundred ; and [Harriet]111-harriet , who had taken the first hint of it from [her]117-miss nash , hoped , with [Miss Woodhouse]84-miss woodhouse 's help , to get a great many more . [Emma]123-emma assisted with [her]123-emma invention , memory and taste ; and as [Harriet]111-harriet wrote a very pretty hand , it was likely to be an arrangement of the first order , in form as well as quantity .

[Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse was almost as much interested in the business as [the girls]642-the girls , and tried very often to recollect something worth [their]642-the girls putting in . “ So many clever riddles as there used to be when [he]85-mr. woodhouse was young -- [he]85-mr. woodhouse wondered [he]85-mr. woodhouse could not remember them ! but [he]85-mr. woodhouse hoped [he]85-mr. woodhouse should in time . ”[85-mr. woodhouse] And it always ended in “ [Kitty]133-kitty , [a fair but frozen maid]3147-a fair but frozen maid . ”[85-mr. woodhouse]

[[His]85-mr. woodhouse good friend]765-his good friend [Perry]106-mr. perry , too , whom [he]85-mr. woodhouse had spoken to on the subject , did not at present recollect any thing of the riddle kind ; but [he]85-mr. woodhouse had desired [Perry]106-mr. perry to be upon the watch , and as [he]85-mr. woodhouse went about so much , something , [he]85-mr. woodhouse thought , might come from that quarter .

It was by no means [[his]85-mr. woodhouse daughter]2723-his daughter 's wish that the intellects of [Highbury]3-highbury in general should be put under requisition . [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton was the only one whose assistance [she]2723-his daughter asked . [He]95-mr. elton was invited to contribute any really good enigmas , charades , or conundrums that [he]95-mr. elton might recollect ; and [she]2723-his daughter had the pleasure of seeing [him]95-mr. elton most intently at work with [his]95-mr. elton recollections ; and at the same time , as [she]2723-his daughter could perceive , most earnestly careful that nothing ungallant , nothing that did not breathe a compliment to the sex should pass [his]95-mr. elton lips . [They]767-they owed to [him]95-mr. elton [their]767-they two or three politest puzzles ; and the joy and exultation with which at last [he]95-mr. elton recalled , and rather sentimentally recited , that well - known charade ,

[My]0-my first doth affliction denote , Which [my]0-my second is destin'd to feel And [my]0-my whole is the best antidote That affliction to soften and heal.--

made [her]2723-his daughter quite sorry to acknowledge that [they]767-they had transcribed it some pages ago already .

“ Why will not [you]95-mr. elton write one [yourself]95-mr. elton for [us]767-they , [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton ? ”[2723-his daughter] said [she]2723-his daughter ; “ that is the only security for its freshness ; and nothing could be easier to [you]95-mr. elton . ”[2723-his daughter]

“ Oh no ! [he]95-mr. elton had never written , hardly ever , any thing of the kind in [his]95-mr. elton life . [The stupidest fellow]3148-the stupidest fellow ! [He]95-mr. elton was afraid not even [Miss Woodhouse”--he]134-miss woodhouse”--he[95-mr. elton] stopt a moment--“or [Miss Smith]111-harriet could inspire [him]95-mr. elton . ”[95-mr. elton]

The very next day however produced some proof of inspiration . [He]95-mr. elton called for a few moments , just to leave a piece of paper on the table containing , as [he]95-mr. elton said , a charade , which [a friend of [his]95-mr. elton]768-a friend of his had addressed to [a young lady]2768-a young lady , the object of [his]95-mr. elton admiration , but which , from [his]95-mr. elton manner , [Emma]123-emma was immediately convinced must be [his]95-mr. elton own .

“ [I]95-mr. elton do not offer it for [Miss Smith]111-harriet 's collection , ”[95-mr. elton] said [he]95-mr. elton . “ Being [[my]95-mr. elton friend]3149-my friend 's , [I]95-mr. elton have no right to expose it in any degree to the public eye , but perhaps [you]111-harriet may not dislike looking at it . ”[95-mr. elton]

The speech was more to [Emma]123-emma than to [Harriet]111-harriet , which [Emma]123-emma could understand . There was deep consciousness about [him]95-mr. elton , and [he]95-mr. elton found it easier to meet [her]123-emma eye than [[her]123-emma friend]427-her friend 's . [He]95-mr. elton was gone the next moment:--after another moment 's pause ,

“ Take it , ”[123-emma] said [Emma]123-emma , smiling , and pushing the paper towards [Harriet--“it]135-harriet--“it is for [you]111-harriet . Take [your]111-harriet own . ”[123-emma]

But [Harriet]111-harriet was in a tremor , and could not touch it ; and [Emma]123-emma , never loth to be first , was obliged to examine it [herself]123-emma .

To [Miss--

CHARADE]136-miss-- charade .

[My]0-my first displays the wealth and pomp of [kings]771-kings , [Lords of [the earth]773-the earth]772-lords of the earth ! [their]772-lords of the earth luxury and ease . [Thy]784-thy ready wit the word will soon supply , May its approval beam in that soft eye !

[She]785-she cast [her]785-she eye over it , pondered , caught the meaning , read it through again to be quite certain , and quite mistress of the lines , and then passing it to [Harriet]111-harriet , sat happily smiling , and saying to [herself]785-she , while [Harriet]111-harriet was puzzling over the paper in all the confusion of hope and dulness , “ Very well , [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton , very well indeed . [I]111-harriet have read worse charades . _ Courtship_--a very good hint . [I]111-harriet give [you]111-harriet credit for it . This is feeling [your]111-harriet way . May its approval beam in that soft eye !

[Harriet]111-harriet exactly . [Soft]137-soft is the very word for [her]111-harriet eye -- of all epithets , the justest that could be given .

[Thy]784-thy ready wit the word will soon supply .

Humph -- [Harriet]111-harriet 's ready wit ! All the better . [A man]2840-a man must be very much in love , indeed , to describe [her]111-harriet so . Ah ! [Mr. Knightley]132-mr. knightley , [I]0-my wish [you]132-mr. knightley had the benefit of this ; [I]0-my think this would convince [you]132-mr. knightley . Things must come to a crisis soon now . ”[111-harriet]

[She]111-harriet was obliged to break off from these very pleasant observations , which were otherwise of a sort to run into great length , by the eagerness of [Harriet]111-harriet 's wondering questions .

“ What can it be , [Miss Woodhouse?--what]138-miss woodhouse?--what can it be ? [I]111-harriet have not an idea -- [I]111-harriet can not guess it in the least . What can it possibly be ? Do try to find it out , [Miss Woodhouse]84-miss woodhouse . Do help [me]111-harriet . [I]111-harriet never saw any thing so hard . Is [it kingdom]3150-it kingdom ? Can it be [woman]749-woman ?[111-harriet]

And [woman]749-woman , [lovely woman]783-lovely woman , reigns alone .

For [Miss]794-miss ------ , read [Miss Smith]111-harriet .

[My]0-my first displays the wealth and pomp of [kings]771-kings , [Lords of [the earth]773-the earth]772-lords of the earth ! [their]772-lords of the earth luxury and ease .

That is _ court _ .

Another view of [man]774-man , [my]0-my second brings ; Behold [him]799-him there , [the monarch of [the seas]776-the seas]775-the monarch of the seas !

That is _ ship_;--plain as it can be.--Now for the cream .

But ah ! united , ( _ courtship _ , [you]802-you know , ) what reverse [we]803-we have ! [Man]774-man 's boasted power and freedom , all are flown . [Lord of [the earth and sea]806-the earth and sea]805-lord of the earth and sea , [he]774-man bends [a slave]781-a slave , And [woman]749-woman , [lovely woman]783-lovely woman , reigns alone .

A very proper compliment!--and then follows the application , which [I]0-my think , [[my]0-my dear]2714-my dear [Harriet]111-harriet , [you]111-harriet can not find much difficulty in comprehending . [Harriet]111-harriet could not long resist so delightful a persuasion . [She]111-harriet read the concluding lines , and was all flutter and happiness . [She]111-harriet could not speak . But [she]111-harriet was not wanted to speak . It was enough for [her]111-harriet to feel . [Emma]123-emma spoke for [her]111-harriet .

“ There is so pointed , and so particular a meaning in this compliment , ”[123-emma] said [she]123-emma , “ that [I]123-emma can not have a doubt as to [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton 's intentions . [You]111-harriet are [his]95-mr. elton object -- and [you]111-harriet will soon receive the completest proof of it . [I]123-emma thought it must be so . [I]123-emma thought [I]123-emma could not be so deceived ; but now , it is clear ; the state of [his]95-mr. elton mind is as clear and decided , as [my]123-emma wishes on the subject have been ever since [I]123-emma knew [you]111-harriet . [I]123-emma could never tell whether an attachment between [you]111-harriet and [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton were most desirable or most natural . [I]123-emma congratulate [you]111-harriet , [[my]123-emma dear]2714-my dear [Harriet]111-harriet , with all [my]123-emma heart . It will give [you]111-harriet every thing that [you]111-harriet want -- consideration , independence , a proper home -- it will fix [you]111-harriet in the centre of all [[your]111-harriet real friends]3159-your real friends , close to [Hartfield]93-miss woodhouse and to [me]123-emma , and confirm [our]811-our intimacy for ever . “ [Dear Miss Woodhouse!”--and]140-dear miss woodhouse!”--and[95-mr. elton] “ [Dear Miss Woodhouse]141-miss woodhouse , ”[123-emma] was all that [Harriet]111-harriet , with many tender embraces could articulate at first ; but when [they]811-our did arrive at something more like conversation , it was sufficiently clear to [[her]111-harriet friend]427-her friend that [she]111-harriet saw , felt , anticipated , and remembered just as [she]111-harriet ought . “ Whatever [you]95-mr. elton say is always right , ”[111-harriet] cried [Harriet]111-harriet , “ and therefore [I]111-harriet suppose , and believe , and hope it must be so ; but otherwise [I]111-harriet could not have imagined it . “ [I]95-mr. elton can not make a question , or listen to a question about that . It is a certainty . Receive it on [my]95-mr. elton judgment . It is a sort of prologue to the play , a motto to the chapter ; and will be soon followed by matter - of - fact prose . ”[95-mr. elton]

“ It is a sort of thing which [nobody]2718-nobody could have expected . [I]111-harriet am sure , a month ago , [I]111-harriet had no more idea myself!--The strangest things do take place ! ”[111-harriet]

“ When [Miss Smiths]142-miss smiths and [Mr. Eltons]143-the eltons get acquainted -- [they]3161-they do indeed -- and really it is strange ; it is out of the common course that what is so evidently , so palpably desirable -- what courts the pre - arrangement of [other people]456-other people , should so immediately shape itself into the proper form . [You]3163-you and [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton are by situation called together ; [you]3163-you belong to [one another]2744-one another by every circumstance of [[your]3163-you respective homes]3165-your respective homes . [Your]3163-you marrying will be equal to the match at [Randalls]101-randalls . There does seem to be a something in the air of [Hartfield]2-hartfield which gives love exactly the right direction , and sends it into [the very channel]3166-the very channel where it ought to flow .[95-mr. elton]

The course of true love never did run smooth--

A Hartfield edition of [Shakespeare]144-shakespeare would have a long note on that passage . ”[144-shakespeare]

“ That [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton should really be in love with [me,--me]111-harriet , of all people , who did not know [him]95-mr. elton , to speak to [him]95-mr. elton , at [Michaelmas]19-michaelmas ! “ This is an alliance which , whoever -- whatever [[your]3173-you friends]3174-your friends may be , must be agreeable to [them]3174-your friends , provided at least [they]3174-your friends have common sense ; and [we]3171-two abbots are not to be addressing [our]3171-two abbots conduct to [fools]3175-fools . “ Yes , very true . How nicely [you]3173-you talk ; [I]111-harriet love to hear [you]3173-you . [You]3173-you understand every thing . “ [I]144-shakespeare thought [he]95-mr. elton meant to try [his]95-mr. elton skill , by [his]95-mr. elton manner of declining it yesterday . ”[144-shakespeare]

“ [I]111-harriet do think it is , without exception , the best charade [I]111-harriet ever read . ”[111-harriet]

“ [I]144-shakespeare never read one more to the purpose , certainly . ”[144-shakespeare]

“ It is as long again as almost all [we]3180-we have had before . ”[111-harriet]

“ [I]144-shakespeare do not consider its length as particularly in its favour . Such things in general can not be too short . ”[144-shakespeare]

[Harriet]111-harriet was too intent on the lines to hear . The most satisfactory comparisons were rising in [her]111-harriet mind .

“ It is one thing , ”[111-harriet] said [she]111-harriet , presently -- [her]111-harriet cheeks in a glow--“to have very good sense in a common way , like every body else , and if there is any thing to say , to sit down and write a letter , and say just what [you]3173-you must , in a short way ; and another , to write verses and charades like this . ”[111-harriet]

[Emma]123-emma could not have desired a more spirited rejection of [Mr. Martin]116-mr. martin 's prose .

“ Such sweet lines ! ”[111-harriet] continued [Harriet--“these]146-harriet--“these two last!--But how shall [I]144-shakespeare ever be able to return the paper , or say [I]144-shakespeare have found it out?--Oh ! [Miss Woodhouse]141-miss woodhouse , what can [we]3180-we do about that ? ”[144-shakespeare]

“ Leave it to [me]111-harriet . [You]141-miss woodhouse do nothing . “ Oh ! [Miss Woodhouse]141-miss woodhouse , what a pity that [I]144-shakespeare must not write this beautiful charade into [my]144-shakespeare book ! [I]144-shakespeare am sure [I]144-shakespeare have not got one half so good . ”[144-shakespeare]

“ Leave out the two last lines , and there is no reason why [you]141-miss woodhouse should not write it into [your]141-miss woodhouse book . ”[111-harriet]

“ Oh ! but those two lines are”--[144-shakespeare]

--“The best of all . Granted;--for private enjoyment ; and for private enjoyment keep them . They are not at all the less written [you]141-miss woodhouse know , because [you]141-miss woodhouse divide them . The couplet does not cease to be , nor does its meaning change . But take it away , and all _ appropriation _ ceases , and a very pretty gallant charade remains , fit for any collection . Depend upon it , [he]95-mr. elton would not like to have [his]95-mr. elton charade slighted , much better than [his]95-mr. elton passion . [A poet in love]3182-a poet in love must be encouraged in both capacities , or neither . Give [me]111-harriet the book , [I]111-harriet will write it down , and then there can be no possible reflection on [you]141-miss woodhouse . ”[111-harriet]

[Harriet]111-harriet submitted , though [her]111-harriet mind could hardly separate the parts , so as to feel quite sure that [[her]111-harriet friend]427-her friend were not writing down a declaration of love . It seemed too precious an offering for any degree of publicity .

“ [I]111-harriet shall never let that book go out of [my]111-harriet own hands , ”[111-harriet] said [she]111-harriet .

“ Very well , ”[123-emma] replied [Emma]123-emma ; “ a most natural feeling ; and the longer it lasts , the better [I]123-emma shall be pleased . But here is [[my]123-emma father]2740-my father coming : [you]141-miss woodhouse will not object to [my]123-emma reading the charade to [him]2740-my father . It will be giving [him]2740-my father so much pleasure ! [He]2740-my father loves any thing of the sort , and especially any thing that pays [woman]749-woman a compliment . [He]2740-my father has the tenderest spirit of gallantry towards [us]3185-we all!--You must let [me]123-emma read it to [him]2740-my father . ”[123-emma]

[Harriet]111-harriet looked grave .

“ [[My]111-harriet dear]2714-my dear [Harriet]111-harriet , [you]111-harriet must not refine too much upon this charade.--You will betray [your]111-harriet feelings improperly , if [you]111-harriet are too conscious and too quick , and appear to affix more meaning , or even quite all the meaning which may be affixed to it . Do not be overpowered by such a little tribute of admiration . If [he]2740-my father had been anxious for secrecy , [he]2740-my father would not have left the paper while [I]111-harriet was by ; but [he]2740-my father rather pushed it towards [me]111-harriet than towards [you]111-harriet . “ Oh ! no -- [I]111-harriet hope [I]111-harriet shall not be ridiculous about it . Do as [you]111-harriet please . ”[111-harriet]

[Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse came in , and very soon led to the subject again , by the recurrence of [his]85-mr. woodhouse very frequent inquiry of “ Well , [[my]111-harriet dears]3187-my dears , how does [your]111-harriet book go on?--Have [you]111-harriet got any thing fresh ? ”[111-harriet]

“ Yes , [papa]2708-papa ; [we]3185-we have something to read [you]111-harriet , something quite fresh . A piece of paper was found on the table this morning--(dropt , [we]3185-we suppose , by a fairy)--containing a very pretty charade , and [we]3185-we have just copied it in . ”[814-she]

[She]814-she read it to [him]85-mr. woodhouse , just as [he]85-mr. woodhouse liked to have any thing read , slowly and distinctly , and two or three times over , with explanations of every part as [she]814-she proceeded -- and [he]85-mr. woodhouse was very much pleased , and , as [she]814-she had foreseen , especially struck with the complimentary conclusion .

“ Aye , that 's very just , indeed , that 's very properly said . Very true . ' [Woman]749-woman , [lovely woman]783-lovely woman . ' It is such a pretty charade , [[my]85-mr. woodhouse dear]2714-my dear , that [I]85-mr. woodhouse can easily guess what fairy brought it.--Nobody could have written so prettily , but [you]111-harriet , [Emma]123-emma . ”[85-mr. woodhouse]

[Emma]123-emma only nodded , and smiled.--After a little thinking , and a very tender sigh , [he]85-mr. woodhouse added ,

“ Ah ! it is no difficulty to see who [you]111-harriet take after ! [[Your]111-harriet dear mother]3192-your dear mother was so clever at all those things ! But [I]85-mr. woodhouse can remember nothing;--not even that particular riddle which [you]111-harriet have heard [me]85-mr. woodhouse mention ; [I]85-mr. woodhouse can only recollect the first stanza ; and there are several .[85-mr. woodhouse]

[Kitty]133-kitty , [a fair but frozen maid]3147-a fair but frozen maid , Kindled a flame [I]0-my yet deplore , [The hood - wink'd boy [I]0-my called to aid]816-the hood - wink'd boy i called to aid , Though of [his]816-the hood - wink'd boy i called to aid near approach afraid , So fatal to [my]0-my suit before .

“ Aye , very true.--I wish [I]133-kitty could recollect more of it .[133-kitty]

“ Oh ! yes -- [she]87-isabella will have [[her]87-isabella own room]3195-her own room , of course ; [the room [she]87-isabella always has;--and]3196-the room she always has;--and there is the nursery for the children,--just as usual , [you]2714-my dear know .
