[Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse agreed to it all , but added ,

“ [[Our]3437-them little friend]3439-our little friend [Harriet Smith]111-harriet , however , is just such [another pretty kind of young person]3440-another pretty kind of young person . [You]123-emma will like [Harriet]111-harriet . [Emma]123-emma could not have [a better companion]3441-a better companion than [Harriet]111-harriet . ”[163-mrs. john knightley.--“it]

“ [I]163-mrs. john knightley.--“it am most happy to hear it -- but only [Jane Fairfax one]152-miss fairfax knows to be so very accomplished and superior!--and exactly [Emma]123-emma 's age . ”[163-mrs. john knightley.--“it]

This topic was discussed very happily , and others succeeded of similar moment , and passed away with similar harmony ; but the evening did not close without a little return of agitation . The gruel came and supplied a great deal to be said -- much praise and many comments -- undoubting decision of its wholesomeness for every constitution , and pretty severe Philippics upon [the many houses where it was never met with tolerably;--but]970-the many houses where it was never met with tolerably;--but , unfortunately , among the failures which [the daughter]971-the daughter had to instance , the most recent , and therefore most prominent , was in [[her]971-the daughter own cook]972-her own cook at [South End]25-south end , [a young woman hired for the time]973-a young woman hired for the time , who never had been able to understand what [she]973-a young woman hired for the time meant by a basin of nice smooth gruel , thin , but not too thin . Often as [she]973-a young woman hired for the time had wished for and ordered it , [she]973-a young woman hired for the time had never been able to get any thing tolerable . Here was a dangerous opening .

“ Ah ! ”[85-mr. woodhouse] said [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse , shaking [his]85-mr. woodhouse head and fixing [his]85-mr. woodhouse eyes on [her]971-the daughter with tender concern.--The ejaculation in [Emma]123-emma 's ear expressed , “ Ah ! there is no end of the sad consequences of [your]971-the daughter going to [South End]25-south end . It does not bear talking of . ”[85-mr. woodhouse] And for a little while [she]971-the daughter hoped [he]85-mr. woodhouse would not talk of it , and that a silent rumination might suffice to restore [him]85-mr. woodhouse to the relish of [his]85-mr. woodhouse own smooth gruel . After an interval of some minutes , however , [he]85-mr. woodhouse began with ,

“ [I]85-mr. woodhouse shall always be very sorry that [you]971-the daughter went to [the sea]3383-the sea this autumn , instead of coming here . ”[85-mr. woodhouse]

“ But why should [you]971-the daughter be sorry , sir?--I assure [you]971-the daughter , it did [the children]591-the children a great deal of good . ”[85-mr. woodhouse]

“ And , moreover , if [you]971-the daughter must go to [the sea]3383-the sea , it had better not have been to [South End]25-south end . [South End]25-south end is [an unhealthy place]3445-an unhealthy place . [Perry]106-mr. perry was surprized to hear [you]971-the daughter had fixed upon [South End]25-south end . ”[85-mr. woodhouse]

“ [I]85-mr. woodhouse know there is such an idea with [many people]3446-many people , but indeed it is quite a mistake , sir.--We all had [our]3447-our health perfectly well there , never found the least inconvenience from the mud ; and [Mr. Wingfield]159-mr. wingfield says it is entirely a mistake to suppose [the place]450-the place unhealthy ; and [I]85-mr. woodhouse am sure [he]159-mr. wingfield may be depended on , for [he]159-mr. wingfield thoroughly understands the nature of the air , and [[his]159-mr. wingfield own brother]3449-his own brother and [family]3450-family have been [there]448-there repeatedly . ”[85-mr. woodhouse]

“ [You]971-the daughter should have gone to [Cromer]27-cromer , [[my]85-mr. woodhouse dear]2714-my dear , if [you]971-the daughter went anywhere.--Perry was a week at [Cromer]27-cromer once , and [he]159-mr. wingfield holds it to be the best of [all the sea - bathing places]3453-all the sea - bathing places . [A fine open sea]3454-a fine open sea , [he]159-mr. wingfield says , and very pure air . And , by what [I]85-mr. woodhouse understand , [you]971-the daughter might have had [lodgings]3455-lodgings [there]448-there quite away from [the sea]3383-the sea -- a quarter of a mile off -- very comfortable . [You]971-the daughter should have consulted [Perry]106-mr. perry . ”[85-mr. woodhouse]

“ But , [[my]85-mr. woodhouse dear sir]3019-my dear sir , the difference of the journey;--only consider how great it would have been.--An hundred miles , perhaps , instead of forty . ”[85-mr. woodhouse]

“ Ah ! [[my]85-mr. woodhouse dear]2714-my dear , as [Perry]106-mr. perry says , where health is at stake , nothing else should be considered ; and if one is to travel , there is not much to chuse between forty miles and an hundred.--Better not move at all , better stay in [London]1-london altogether than travel forty miles to get into a worse air . This is just what [Perry]106-mr. perry said . It seemed to [him]106-mr. perry a very ill - judged measure . ”[85-mr. woodhouse]

[Emma]123-emma 's attempts to stop [[her]123-emma father]425-her father had been vain ; and when [he]425-her father had reached such a point as this , [she]123-emma could not wonder at [[her]123-emma brother - in - law]975-her brother - in - law 's breaking out .

“ [Mr. Perry]106-mr. perry , ”[425-her father] said [he]425-her father , in a voice of very strong displeasure , “ would do as well to keep [his]106-mr. perry opinion till it is asked for . Why does [he]106-mr. perry make it any business of [his]106-mr. perry , to wonder at what [I]425-her father do?--at [my]425-her father taking [[my]425-her father family]3460-my family to [one part of [the coast]3462-the coast]3461-one part of the coast or another?--I may be allowed , [I]425-her father hope , the use of [my]425-her father judgment as well as [Mr. Perry.--I]165-mr. perry.--i want [his]106-mr. perry directions no more than [his]106-mr. perry drugs . ”[425-her father] [He]425-her father paused -- and growing cooler in a moment , added , with only sarcastic dryness , “ If [Mr. Perry]106-mr. perry can tell [me]425-her father how to convey [a wife]2759-a wife and [five children]3464-five children a distance of an hundred and thirty miles with no greater expense or inconvenience than a distance of forty , [I]425-her father should be as willing to prefer [Cromer]27-cromer to [South End]25-south end as [he]106-mr. perry could [himself]106-mr. perry . ”[425-her father]

“ True , true , ”[92-mr. knightley] cried [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley , with most ready interposition--“very true . That 's a consideration indeed.--But [John]92-mr. knightley , as to what [I]92-mr. knightley was telling [you]92-mr. knightley of [my]92-mr. knightley idea of moving [the path]3465-the path to [Langham]28-langham , of turning it more to the right that it may not cut through [the home meadows]3466-the home meadows , [I]92-mr. knightley can not conceive any difficulty . [I]92-mr. knightley should not attempt it , if it were to be the means of inconvenience to [the Highbury people]3467-the highbury people , but if [you]92-mr. knightley call to mind exactly the present line of the path .... The only way of proving it , however , will be to turn to [our]3468-our maps . [I]92-mr. knightley shall see [you]92-mr. knightley at [the Abbey]2802-the abbey to - morrow morning [I]92-mr. knightley hope , and then [we]3468-our will look them over , and [you]92-mr. knightley shall give [me]92-mr. knightley [your]92-mr. knightley opinion . ”[92-mr. knightley]

[Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse was rather agitated by such harsh reflections on [[his]85-mr. woodhouse friend]830-his friend [Perry]106-mr. perry , to whom [he]85-mr. woodhouse had , in fact , though unconsciously , been attributing many of [his]85-mr. woodhouse own feelings and expressions;--but the soothing attentions of [[his]85-mr. woodhouse daughters]977-his daughters gradually removed the present evil , and the immediate alertness of [one brother]978-one brother , and better recollections of the other , prevented any renewal of it .

CHAPTER XIII

There could hardly be a happier creature in [the world]403-the world than [Mrs. John Knightley]122-mrs. john knightley , in this short visit to [Hartfield]2-hartfield , going about every morning among [her]122-mrs. john knightley old acquaintance with [[her]122-mrs. john knightley five children]980-her five children , and talking over what [she]122-mrs. john knightley had done every evening with [[her]122-mrs. john knightley father]425-her father and [sister]3216-sister . [She]122-mrs. john knightley had nothing to wish otherwise , but that the days did not pass so swiftly . It was a delightful visit;--perfect , in being much too short .

In general [their]983-their evenings were less engaged with [friends]579-friends than [their]983-their mornings ; but one complete dinner engagement , and out of [the house]435-the house too , there was no avoiding , though at Christmas . [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston would take no denial ; [they]983-their must all dine at [Randalls]101-randalls one day;--even [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse was persuaded to think it a possible thing in preference to a division of [the party]2949-the party .

How [they]983-their were all to be conveyed , [he]85-mr. woodhouse would have made a difficulty if [he]85-mr. woodhouse could , but as [[his]85-mr. woodhouse son]523-his son and [daughter]649-daughter 's carriage and horses were actually at [Hartfield]2-hartfield , [he]85-mr. woodhouse was not able to make more than a simple question on that head ; it hardly amounted to a doubt ; nor did it occupy [Emma]123-emma long to convince [him]85-mr. woodhouse that [they]983-their might in one of [the carriages]989-the carriages find room for [Harriet]111-harriet also .

[Harriet]111-harriet , [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton , and [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley , [[their]983-their own especial set]990-their own especial set , were [the only persons invited to meet]991-the only persons invited to meet [them;--the]992-them;--the hours were to be early , as well as the numbers few ; [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse 's habits and inclination being consulted in every thing .

The evening before this great event ( for it was a very great event that [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse should dine out , on the 24th of December ) had been spent by [Harriet]111-harriet at [Hartfield]2-hartfield , and [she]111-harriet had gone [home]562-home so much indisposed with a cold , that , but for [her]111-harriet own earnest wish of being nursed by [Mrs. Goddard]109-mrs. goddard , [Emma]123-emma could not have allowed [her]111-harriet to leave [the house]435-the house . [Emma]123-emma called on [her]111-harriet the next day , and found [her]111-harriet doom already signed with regard to [Randalls]101-randalls . [She]111-harriet was very feverish and had a bad sore throat : [Mrs. Goddard]109-mrs. goddard was full of care and affection , [Mr. Perry]106-mr. perry was talked of , and [Harriet]111-harriet [herself]111-harriet was too ill and low to resist the authority which excluded [her]111-harriet from this delightful engagement , though [she]111-harriet could not speak of [her]111-harriet loss without many tears .

[Emma]123-emma sat with [her]111-harriet as long as [she]123-emma could , to attend [her]111-harriet in [Mrs. Goddard]109-mrs. goddard 's unavoidable absences , and raise [her]111-harriet spirits by representing how much [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton 's would be depressed when [he]95-mr. elton knew [her]111-harriet state ; and left [her]111-harriet at last tolerably comfortable , in the sweet dependence of [his]95-mr. elton having a most comfortless visit , and of [their]995-they all missing [her]111-harriet very much . [She]111-harriet had not advanced many yards from [Mrs. Goddard]109-mrs. goddard 's door , when [she]111-harriet was met by [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton [himself]95-mr. elton , evidently coming towards [it]996-it , and as [they]995-they walked on slowly together in conversation about [the invalid]997-the invalid -- of whom [he]95-mr. elton , on the rumour of considerable illness , had been going to inquire , that [he]95-mr. elton might carry some report of [her]111-harriet to [Hartfield]2-hartfield -- [they]995-they were overtaken by [Mr. John Knightley]92-mr. knightley returning from the daily visit to [Donwell]24-donwell , with [[his]92-mr. knightley two eldest boys]998-his two eldest boys , whose [healthy , glowing faces shewed all the benefit of a country run]999-healthy , glowing faces shewed all the benefit of a country run , and seemed to ensure a quick despatch of the roast mutton and rice pudding [they]995-they were hastening [home]562-home for . [They]995-they joined [company]1001-company and proceeded together . [Emma]123-emma was just describing the nature of [[her]123-emma friend]427-her friend 's complaint;--“a throat very much inflamed , with a great deal of heat about [her]111-harriet , a quick , low pulse , & c. and [she]123-emma was sorry to find from [Mrs. Goddard]109-mrs. goddard that [Harriet]111-harriet was liable to very bad sore - throats , and had often alarmed [her]123-emma with them . ”[95-mr. elton] [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton looked all alarm on the occasion , as [he]95-mr. elton exclaimed ,

“ A sore - throat!--I hope not infectious . [I]95-mr. elton hope not of a putrid infectious sort . Has [Perry]106-mr. perry seen [her]111-harriet ? Indeed [you]123-emma should take care of [yourself]123-emma as well as of [[your]123-emma friend]2922-your friend . Let [me]95-mr. elton entreat [you]123-emma to run no risks . Why does not [Perry]106-mr. perry see [her]111-harriet ? ”[95-mr. elton]

[Emma]123-emma , who was not really at all frightened [herself]123-emma , tranquillised this excess of apprehension by assurances of [Mrs. Goddard]109-mrs. goddard 's experience and care ; but as there must still remain a degree of uneasiness which [she]123-emma could not wish to reason away , which [she]123-emma would rather feed and assist than not , [she]123-emma added soon afterwards -- as if quite another subject ,

“ It is so cold , so very cold -- and looks and feels so very much like snow , that if it were to any other place or with [any other party]3471-any other party , [I]123-emma should really try not to go out to - day -- and dissuade [[my]123-emma father]2740-my father from venturing ; but as [he]2740-my father has made up [his]2740-my father mind , and does not seem to feel the cold [himself]2740-my father , [I]123-emma do not like to interfere , as [I]123-emma know it would be so great a disappointment to [Mr.]3473-mr. and [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston . But , upon [my]123-emma word , [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton , in [your]95-mr. elton case , [I]123-emma should certainly excuse [myself]123-emma . [You]95-mr. elton appear to [me]123-emma a little hoarse already , and when [you]95-mr. elton consider what demand of voice and what fatigues to - morrow will bring , [I]123-emma think it would be no more than common prudence to stay at [home]562-home and take care of [yourself]95-mr. elton to - night . ”[123-emma]

[Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton looked as if [he]95-mr. elton did not very well know what answer to make ; which was exactly the case ; for though very much gratified by the kind care of [such a fair lady]1003-such a fair lady , and not liking to resist any advice of [her]1003-such a fair lady 's , [he]95-mr. elton had not really the least inclination to give up the visit;--but [Emma]123-emma , too eager and busy in [her]123-emma own previous conceptions and views to hear [him]95-mr. elton impartially , or see [him]95-mr. elton with clear vision , was very well satisfied with [his]95-mr. elton muttering acknowledgment of its being “ very cold , certainly very cold , ”[123-emma] and walked on , rejoicing in having extricated [him]95-mr. elton from [Randalls]101-randalls , and secured [him]95-mr. elton the power of sending to inquire after [Harriet]111-harriet every hour of the evening .

“ [You]95-mr. elton do quite right , ”[123-emma] said [she;--“we]123-emma will make [your]95-mr. elton apologies to [Mr.]3475-mr. and [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston . ”[123-emma]

But hardly had [she]123-emma so spoken , when [she]123-emma found [[her]123-emma brother]482-her brother was civilly offering a seat in [[his]95-mr. elton carriage]1005-his carriage , if the weather were [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton 's only objection , and [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton actually accepting the offer with much prompt satisfaction . It was a done thing ; [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton was to go , and never had [his]95-mr. elton broad handsome face expressed more pleasure than at this moment ; never had [his]95-mr. elton smile been stronger , nor [his]95-mr. elton eyes more exulting than when [he]95-mr. elton next looked at [her]123-emma .

“ Well , ”[123-emma] said [she]123-emma to [herself]123-emma , “ this is most strange!--After [I]123-emma had got [him]95-mr. elton off so well , to chuse to go into company , and leave [Harriet]111-harriet ill behind!--Most strange indeed!--But there is , [I]123-emma believe , in [many men]3476-many men , especially [single men]3477-single men , such an inclination -- such a passion for dining out -- a dinner engagement is so high in the class of [their]3476-many men pleasures , [their]3476-many men employments , [their]3476-many men dignities , almost [their]3476-many men duties , that any thing gives way to it -- and this must be the case with [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton ; [a most valuable , amiable , pleasing young man]3478-a most valuable , amiable , pleasing young man undoubtedly , and very much in love with [Harriet]111-harriet ; but still , [he]95-mr. elton can not refuse an invitation , [he]95-mr. elton must dine out wherever [he]95-mr. elton is asked . What a strange thing love is ! [he]95-mr. elton can see ready wit in [Harriet]111-harriet , but will not dine alone for [her]111-harriet . ”[123-emma]

Soon afterwards [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton quitted [them]1006-them , and [she]1007-her could not but do [him]95-mr. elton the justice of feeling that there was a great deal of sentiment in [his]95-mr. elton manner of naming [Harriet]111-harriet at parting ; in the tone of [his]95-mr. elton voice while assuring [her]1007-her that [he]95-mr. elton should call at [Mrs. Goddard]109-mrs. goddard 's for news of [[her]1007-her fair friend]1008-her fair friend , the last thing before [he]95-mr. elton prepared for the happiness of meeting [her]1007-her again , when [he]95-mr. elton hoped to be able to give a better report ; and [he]95-mr. elton sighed and smiled [himself]95-mr. elton off in a way that left the balance of approbation much in [his]95-mr. elton favour .

After a few minutes of entire silence between [them]1006-them , [John Knightley]92-mr. knightley began with--

“ [I]92-mr. knightley never in [my]92-mr. knightley life saw [a man]2840-a man more intent on being agreeable than [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton . It is downright labour to [him]95-mr. elton where [ladies]3480-ladies are concerned . With [men]3104-men [he]95-mr. elton can be rational and unaffected , but when [he]95-mr. elton has [ladies]3480-ladies to please , every feature works . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton 's manners are not perfect , ”[123-emma] replied [Emma]123-emma ; “ but where there is a wish to please , [one]2775-one ought to overlook , and [one]2775-one does overlook a great deal . Where [a man]2840-a man does [his]95-mr. elton best with only moderate powers , [he]95-mr. elton will have the advantage over negligent superiority . There is such perfect good - temper and good - will in [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton as [one]2775-one can not but value . ”[123-emma]

“ Yes , ”[92-mr. knightley] said [Mr. John Knightley]92-mr. knightley presently , with some slyness , “ [he]95-mr. elton seems to have a great deal of good - will towards [you]123-emma . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ [Me]123-emma ! ”[123-emma] [she]123-emma replied with a smile of astonishment , “ are [you]95-mr. elton imagining [me]123-emma to be [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton 's object ? ”[123-emma]

“ Such an imagination has crossed [me]92-mr. knightley , [I]92-mr. knightley own , [Emma]123-emma ; and if it never occurred to [you]123-emma before , [you]123-emma may as well take it into consideration now . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton in love with me!--What an idea ! ”[123-emma]

“ [I]92-mr. knightley do not say it is so ; but [you]123-emma will do well to consider whether it is so or not , and to regulate [your]123-emma behaviour accordingly . [I]92-mr. knightley think [your]123-emma manners to [him]95-mr. elton encouraging . [I]92-mr. knightley speak as [a friend]416-a friend , [Emma]123-emma . [You]123-emma had better look about [you]123-emma , and ascertain what [you]123-emma do , and what [you]123-emma mean to do . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ [I]1009-i thank [you]123-emma ; but [I]1009-i assure [you]123-emma [you]123-emma are quite mistaken . [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton and [I]1009-i are [very good friends]3488-very good friends , and nothing more ; ”[1009-i] and [she]1009-i walked on , amusing [herself]1009-i in the consideration of the blunders which often arise from a partial knowledge of circumstances , of the mistakes which [people of high pretensions to judgment]1010-people of high pretensions to judgment are for ever falling into ; and not very well pleased with [[her]1009-i brother]482-her brother for imagining [her]1009-i blind and ignorant , and in want of counsel . [He]482-her brother said no more .

[Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse had so completely made up [his]85-mr. woodhouse mind to the visit , that in spite of the increasing coldness , [he]85-mr. woodhouse seemed to have no idea of shrinking from it , and set forward at last most punctually with [[his]85-mr. woodhouse eldest daughter]1012-his eldest daughter in [[his]85-mr. woodhouse own carriage]1013-his own carriage , with less apparent consciousness of the weather than either of the others ; too full of the wonder of [his]85-mr. woodhouse own going , and the pleasure it was to afford at [Randalls]101-randalls to see that it was cold , and too well wrapt up to feel it . The cold , however , was severe ; and by the time [the second carriage]1014-the second carriage was in motion , a few flakes of snow were finding their way down , and the sky had the appearance of being so overcharged as to want only a milder air to produce a very white world in a very short time .

[Emma]123-emma soon saw that [[her]123-emma companion]672-her companion was not in the happiest humour . The preparing and the going abroad in such weather , with the sacrifice of [[his]85-mr. woodhouse children]1016-his children after dinner , were evils , were disagreeables at least , which [Mr. John Knightley]92-mr. knightley did not by any means like ; [he]85-mr. woodhouse anticipated nothing in the visit that could be at all worth the purchase ; and the whole of [their]1017-their drive to [the vicarage]844-the vicarage was spent by [him]85-mr. woodhouse in expressing [his]85-mr. woodhouse discontent .

“ [A man]2840-a man , ”[85-mr. woodhouse] said [he]85-mr. woodhouse , “ must have a very good opinion of [himself]2840-a man when [he]2840-a man asks [people]2986-people to leave [[their]2986-people own fireside]3491-their own fireside , and encounter such a day as this , for the sake of coming to see [him]2840-a man . [He]2840-a man must think [himself]2840-a man [a most agreeable fellow]3492-a most agreeable fellow ; [I]85-mr. woodhouse could not do such a thing . It is the greatest absurdity -- Actually snowing at this moment!--The folly of not allowing [people]2986-people to be comfortable at [home]562-home -- and the folly of [people]2986-people 's not staying comfortably at [home]562-home when [they]2986-people can ! If [we]3497-we were obliged to go out such an evening as this , by any call of duty or business , what a hardship [we]3497-we should deem it;--and here are [we]3497-we , probably with rather thinner clothing than usual , setting forward voluntarily , without excuse , in defiance of the voice of nature , which tells [man]774-man , in every thing given to [his]774-man view or [his]774-man feelings , to stay at [home]562-home [himself]774-man , and keep all under shelter that [he]774-man can;--here are [we]3497-we setting forward to spend five dull hours in [[another man]3500-another man 's house]3501-another man 's house , with nothing to say or to hear that was not said and heard yesterday , and may not be said and heard again to - morrow . Going in dismal weather , to return probably in worse;--four horses and [four servants]3502-four servants taken out for nothing but to convey five idle , shivering creatures into colder rooms and worse company than [they]3502-four servants might have had at [home]562-home . ”[85-mr. woodhouse]

[Emma]123-emma did not find [herself]123-emma equal to give the pleased assent , which no doubt [he]1019-he was in the habit of receiving , to emulate the “ Very true , [my]123-emma love , ”[123-emma] which must have been usually administered by [[his]1019-he travelling companion]1020-his travelling companion ; but [she]123-emma had resolution enough to refrain from making any answer at all . [She]123-emma could not be complying , [she]123-emma dreaded being quarrelsome ; [her]123-emma heroism reached only to silence . [She]123-emma allowed [him]1019-he to talk , and arranged the glasses , and wrapped [herself]123-emma up , without opening [her]123-emma lips .

[They]1021-they arrived , [the carriage]2719-the carriage turned , the step was let down , and [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton , spruce , black , and smiling , was with [them]1021-they instantly . [Emma]123-emma thought with pleasure of some change of subject . [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton was all obligation and cheerfulness ; [he]95-mr. elton was so very cheerful in [his]95-mr. elton civilities indeed , that [she]123-emma began to think [he]95-mr. elton must have received a different account of [Harriet]111-harriet from what had reached [her]123-emma . [She]123-emma had sent while dressing , and the answer had been , “ Much the same -- not better . ”[123-emma]

“ _ [My]123-emma _ report from [Mrs. Goddard]109-mrs. goddard 's , ”[123-emma] said [she]123-emma presently , “ was not so pleasant as [I]123-emma had hoped--'Not better ' was _ [my]123-emma _ answer . ”[123-emma]

[His]95-mr. elton face lengthened immediately ; and [his]95-mr. elton voice was the voice of sentiment as [he]95-mr. elton answered .

“ Oh ! no -- [I]95-mr. elton am grieved to find -- [I]95-mr. elton was on the point of telling [you]3504-you that when [I]95-mr. elton called at [Mrs. Goddard]109-mrs. goddard 's door , which [I]95-mr. elton did the very last thing before [I]95-mr. elton returned to dress , [I]95-mr. elton was told that [Miss Smith]111-harriet was not better , by no means better , rather worse . Very much grieved and concerned -- [I]95-mr. elton had flattered [myself]95-mr. elton that [she]111-harriet must be better after such a cordial as [I]95-mr. elton knew had been given [her]111-harriet in the morning . ”[95-mr. elton]

[Emma]123-emma smiled and answered--“My visit was of use to the nervous part of [her]111-harriet complaint , [I]123-emma hope ; but not even [I]123-emma can charm away a sore throat ; it is a most severe cold indeed . [Mr. Perry]106-mr. perry has been with [her]111-harriet , as [you]123-emma probably heard . ”[123-emma]

“ Yes -- [I]95-mr. elton imagined -- that is -- [I]95-mr. elton did not-- ”[95-mr. elton]

“ [He]1023-he has been used to [her]111-harriet in these complaints , and [I]123-emma hope to - morrow morning will bring [us]3505-we both a more comfortable report . But it is impossible not to feel uneasiness . Such a sad loss to [our]3505-we party to - day ! ”[123-emma]

“ Dreadful!--Exactly so , indeed.--She will be missed every moment . ”[95-mr. elton]

This was very proper ; the sigh which accompanied it was really estimable ; but it should have lasted longer . [Emma]123-emma was rather in dismay when only half a minute afterwards [he]1023-he began to speak of other things , and in a voice of the greatest alacrity and enjoyment .

“ What an excellent device , ”[1023-he] said [he]1023-he , “ the use of a sheepskin for [carriages]3506-carriages . How very comfortable [they]3506-carriages make it;--impossible to feel cold with such precautions . The contrivances of modern days indeed have rendered [a gentleman]2822-a gentleman 's carriage perfectly complete . One is so fenced and guarded from the weather , that not a breath of air can find its way unpermitted . Weather becomes absolutely of no consequence . It is a very cold afternoon -- but in [this carriage]3508-this carriage [we]3505-we know nothing of the matter.--Ha ! snows a little [I]1023-he see . ”[1023-he]

“ Yes , ”[92-mr. knightley] said [John Knightley]92-mr. knightley , “ and [I]92-mr. knightley think [we]3505-we shall have a good deal of it . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ Christmas weather , ”[95-mr. elton] observed [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton . “ Quite seasonable ; and extremely fortunate [we]3505-we may think [ourselves]3505-we that it did not begin yesterday , and prevent this day 's party , which it might very possibly have done , for [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse would hardly have ventured had there been much snow on the ground ; but now it is of no consequence . This is quite the season indeed for friendly meetings . At Christmas [every body]2749-every body invites [[their]2749-every body friends]3510-their friends about [them]2749-every body , and [people]2986-people think little of even the worst weather . [I]95-mr. elton was snowed up at [[a friend]416-a friend 's house]3513-a friend 's house once for a week . Nothing could be pleasanter . [I]95-mr. elton went for only one night , and could not get away till that very day se'nnight . ”[95-mr. elton]

[Mr. John Knightley]92-mr. knightley looked as if [he]92-mr. knightley did not comprehend the pleasure , but said only , coolly ,

“ [I]92-mr. knightley can not wish to be snowed up a week at [Randalls]101-randalls . ”[92-mr. knightley]

At another time [Emma]123-emma might have been amused , but [she]123-emma was too much astonished now at [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton 's spirits for other feelings . [Harriet]111-harriet seemed quite forgotten in the expectation of a pleasant party .

“ [We]3505-we are sure of excellent fires , ”[92-mr. knightley] continued [he]92-mr. knightley , “ and every thing in the greatest comfort . [Charming people]3514-charming people , [Mr.]3515-mr. and [Mrs. Weston;--Mrs]166-mrs. weston;--mrs . [Weston]86-mr. weston indeed is much beyond praise , and [he]86-mr. weston is exactly what one values , so hospitable , and so fond of society;--it will be a small party , but where [small parties]3516-small parties are select , [they]3516-small parties are perhaps the most agreeable of any . [[Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston 's dining - room]3517-mr. weston 's dining - room does not accommodate more than ten comfortably ; and for [my]92-mr. knightley part , [I]92-mr. knightley would rather , under such circumstances , fall short by two than exceed by two . [I]92-mr. knightley think [you]123-emma will agree with [me]92-mr. knightley , ( turning with a soft air to [Emma]123-emma , ) [I]92-mr. knightley think [I]92-mr. knightley shall certainly have [your]123-emma approbation , though [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley perhaps , from being used to [the large parties of [London]1-london]3518-the large parties of london , may not quite enter into [our]3519-our feelings . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ [I]92-mr. knightley know nothing of [the large parties of [London]1-london]3518-the large parties of london , [sir]2734-sir -- [I]92-mr. knightley never dine with [any body]665-any body . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ Indeed ! ( in a tone of wonder and pity , ) [I]92-mr. knightley had no idea that the law had been so great a slavery . Well , [sir]2734-sir , the time must come when [you]2734-sir will be paid for all this , when [you]2734-sir will have little labour and great enjoyment . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ [My]92-mr. knightley first enjoyment , ”[92-mr. knightley] replied [John Knightley]92-mr. knightley , as [they]1024-they passed through the sweep - gate , “ will be to find [myself]92-mr. knightley safe at [Hartfield]2-hartfield again . ”[92-mr. knightley]

CHAPTER XIV

Some change of countenance was necessary for [each gentleman]1025-each gentleman as [they]1024-they walked into [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston 's drawing - room;--Mr . [Elton]95-mr. elton must compose [his]95-mr. elton joyous looks , and [Mr. John Knightley]92-mr. knightley disperse [his]95-mr. elton ill - humour . [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton must smile less , and [Mr. John Knightley]92-mr. knightley more , to fit [them]1024-they for the place.--Emma only might be as nature prompted , and [shew]1026-she [herself]1026-she just as happy as [she]1026-she was . To [her]1026-she it was real enjoyment to be with [the Westons]108-the westons . [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston was a great favourite , and there was not a creature in [the world]403-the world to whom [she]1026-she spoke with such unreserve , as to [[his]86-mr. weston wife]2763-his wife ; not [any one , to whom [she]1026-she related with such conviction of being listened to and understood , of being always interesting and always intelligible , the little affairs , arrangements , perplexities , and pleasures of [[her]1026-she father]425-her father and [herself]1026-she]1029-any one , to whom she related with such conviction of being listened to and understood , of being always interesting and always intelligible , the little affairs , arrangements , perplexities , and pleasures of her father and herself . [She]1026-she could tell nothing of [Hartfield]2-hartfield , in which [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston had not a lively concern ; and half an hour 's uninterrupted communication of all those little matters on which the daily happiness of private life depends , was one of the first gratifications of each .

This was a pleasure which perhaps the whole day 's visit might not afford , which certainly did not belong to the present half - hour ; but the very sight of [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , [her]88-mrs. weston smile , [her]88-mrs. weston touch , [her]88-mrs. weston voice was grateful to [Emma]123-emma , and [she]123-emma determined to think as little as possible of [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton 's oddities , or of any thing else unpleasant , and enjoy all that was enjoyable to the utmost .

The misfortune of [Harriet]111-harriet 's cold had been pretty well gone through before [her]111-harriet arrival . [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse had been safely seated long enough to give the history of it , besides all the history of [his]85-mr. woodhouse own and [Isabella]87-isabella 's coming , and of [Emma]123-emma 's being to follow , and had indeed just got to the end of [his]85-mr. woodhouse satisfaction that [James]90-james should come and see [[his]85-mr. woodhouse daughter]2723-his daughter , when [the others]870-the others appeared , and [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , who had been almost wholly engrossed by [her]88-mrs. weston attentions to [him]85-mr. woodhouse , was able to turn away and welcome [her]88-mrs. weston dear [Emma]123-emma .

[Emma]123-emma 's project of forgetting [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton for a while made [her]123-emma rather sorry to find , when [they]870-the others had all taken [their]870-the others places , that [he]95-mr. elton was close to [her]123-emma . The difficulty was great of driving [his]95-mr. elton strange insensibility towards [Harriet]111-harriet , from [her]111-harriet mind , while [he]95-mr. elton not only sat at [her]111-harriet elbow , but was continually obtruding [his]95-mr. elton happy countenance on [her]111-harriet notice , and solicitously addressing [her]111-harriet upon every occasion . Instead of forgetting [him]95-mr. elton , [his]95-mr. elton behaviour was such that [she]111-harriet could not avoid the internal suggestion of “ Can it really be as [[my]95-mr. elton brother]2939-my brother imagined ? can it be possible for [this man]2957-this man to be beginning to transfer [his]95-mr. elton affections from [Harriet]111-harriet to me?--Absurd and insufferable!”--Yet[95-mr. elton] [he]95-mr. elton would be so anxious for [her]111-harriet being perfectly warm , would be so interested about [[her]111-harriet father]425-her father , and so delighted with [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston ; and at last would begin admiring [her]111-harriet drawings with so much zeal and so little knowledge as seemed terribly like [a would - be lover]1034-a would - be lover , and made it some effort with [her]111-harriet to preserve [her]111-harriet good manners . For [her]111-harriet own sake [she]111-harriet could not be rude ; and for [Harriet]111-harriet 's , in the hope that all would yet turn out right , [she]111-harriet was even positively civil ; but it was an effort ; especially as something was going on amongst the others , in the most overpowering period of [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton 's nonsense , which [she]111-harriet particularly wished to listen to . [She]111-harriet heard enough to know that [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston was giving some information about [[his]86-mr. weston son]523-his son ; [she]111-harriet heard the words “ [[my]86-mr. weston son]3526-my son , ”[86-mr. weston] and “ [Frank]102-frank churchill , ”[86-mr. weston] and “ [[my]86-mr. weston son]3526-my son , ”[86-mr. weston] repeated several times over ; and , from a few other half - syllables very much suspected that [he]86-mr. weston was announcing an early visit from [[his]86-mr. weston son]523-his son ; but before [she]111-harriet could quiet [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton , the subject was so completely past that any reviving question from [her]111-harriet would have been awkward .

Now , it so happened that in spite of [Emma]123-emma 's resolution of never marrying , there was something in the name , in the idea of [Mr. Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill , which always interested [her]111-harriet . [She]111-harriet had frequently thought -- especially since [[his]102-frank churchill father]518-his father 's marriage with [Miss Taylor]84-miss woodhouse -- that if [she]111-harriet _ were _ to marry , [he]102-frank churchill was the very person to suit [her]111-harriet in age , character and condition . [He]102-frank churchill seemed by this connexion between [the families]1038-the families , quite to belong to [her]111-harriet . [She]111-harriet could not but suppose it to be a match that [every body who knew [them]1040-we]1039-every body who knew them must think of . That [Mr.]1041-mr. and [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston did think of it , [she]111-harriet was very strongly persuaded ; and though not meaning to be induced by [him]102-frank churchill , or by [any body else]1042-any body else , to give up a situation which [she]111-harriet believed more replete with good than any [she]111-harriet could change it for , [she]111-harriet had a great curiosity to see [him]102-frank churchill , a decided intention of finding [him]102-frank churchill pleasant , of being liked by [him]102-frank churchill to a certain degree , and a sort of pleasure in the idea of [their]1040-we being coupled in [[their]1040-we friends]3510-their friends ' imaginations .

With such sensations , [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton 's civilities were dreadfully ill - timed ; but [she]111-harriet had the comfort of appearing very polite , while feeling very cross -- and of thinking that the rest of the visit could not possibly pass without bringing forward the same information again , or the substance of it , from [the open - hearted Mr. Weston.--So]167-the open - hearted mr. weston.--so it proved;--for when happily released from [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton , and seated by [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston , at dinner , [he]102-frank churchill made use of the very first interval in the cares of hospitality , the very first leisure from the saddle of mutton , to say to [her]111-harriet ,

“ [We]1040-we want only two more to be just the right number . [I]102-frank churchill should like to see two more [here,--your pretty little friend]3528-here,--your pretty little friend , [Miss Smith]111-harriet , and [[my]102-frank churchill son]3526-my son -- and then [I]102-frank churchill should say [we]1040-we were quite complete . [I]102-frank churchill believe [you]111-harriet did not hear [me]102-frank churchill telling [the others in [the drawing - room]3531-the drawing - room]3530-the others in the drawing - room that [we]1040-we are expecting [Frank]102-frank churchill . [I]102-frank churchill had a letter from [him]102-frank churchill this morning , and [he]102-frank churchill will be with [us]1040-we within a fortnight . ”[102-frank churchill]

[Emma]123-emma spoke with a very proper degree of pleasure ; and fully assented to [his]1044-his proposition of [Mr. Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill and [Miss Smith]111-harriet making [their]1045-their party quite complete .

“ [He]102-frank churchill has been wanting to come to [us]1040-we , ”[86-mr. weston] continued [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston , “ ever since September : every letter has been full of it ; but [he]102-frank churchill can not command [his]102-frank churchill own time . [He]102-frank churchill has those to please who must be pleased , and who ( between [ourselves]1040-we ) are sometimes to be pleased only by a good many sacrifices . But now [I]86-mr. weston have no doubt of seeing [him]102-frank churchill here about the second week in January . ”[86-mr. weston]

“ What a very great pleasure it will be to [you]123-emma ! and [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston is so anxious to be acquainted with [him]102-frank churchill , that [she]88-mrs. weston must be almost as happy as [yourself]123-emma . ”[1044-his]

“ Yes , [she]88-mrs. weston would be , but that [she]88-mrs. weston thinks there will be another put - off . [She]88-mrs. weston does not depend upon [his]102-frank churchill coming so much as [I]86-mr. weston do : but [she]88-mrs. weston does not know the parties so well as [I]86-mr. weston do . The case , [you]123-emma see , is--(but this is quite between [ourselves]1040-we : [I]86-mr. weston did not mention a syllable of it in [the other room]3532-the other room . But [I]86-mr. weston know [they]3534-a party of friends will , because it is [a family that [a certain lady , of some consequence]3537-a certain lady , of some consequence , at [Enscombe]7-enscombe]3536-a family that a certain lady , of some consequence , at enscombe , has a particular dislike to : and though it is thought necessary to invite [them]3534-a party of friends once in two or three years , [they]3534-a party of friends always are put off when it comes to the point . [I]86-mr. weston have not the smallest doubt of the issue . [I]86-mr. weston am as confident of seeing [Frank]102-frank churchill here before the middle of January , as [I]86-mr. weston am of being here [myself]86-mr. weston : but [[your]3538-you good friend]3539-your good friend there ( nodding towards the upper end of the table ) has so few vagaries [herself]3539-your good friend , and has been so little used to them at [Hartfield]2-hartfield , that [she]3539-your good friend can not calculate on their effects , as [I]86-mr. weston have been long in the practice of doing . ”[86-mr. weston]

“ [I]123-emma am sorry there should be any thing like doubt in the case , ”[123-emma] replied [Emma]123-emma ; “ but am disposed to side with [you]3538-you , [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston . “ Yes -- [I]123-emma have some right to that knowledge ; though [I]123-emma have never been at the place in [[my]123-emma life.--She]3540-my life.--she is an odd woman!--But [I]123-emma never allow [myself]123-emma to speak ill of [her]3539-your good friend , on [Frank]102-frank churchill 's account ; for [I]123-emma do believe [her]3539-your good friend to be very fond of [him]102-frank churchill . [I]123-emma used to think [she]3539-your good friend was not capable of being fond of any body , except [herself]3539-your good friend : but [she]3539-your good friend has always been kind to [him]102-frank churchill ( in [her]3539-your good friend way -- allowing for little whims and caprices , and expecting every thing to be as [she]3539-your good friend likes ) . And it is no small credit , in [my]123-emma opinion , to [him]102-frank churchill , that [he]102-frank churchill should excite such an affection ; for , though [I]123-emma would not say it to [any body else]1042-any body else , [she]3539-your good friend has no more heart than a stone to [people in general]3542-people in general ; and the devil of a temper . ”[123-emma]

[Emma]123-emma liked the subject so well , that [she]123-emma began upon it , to [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , very soon after [their]1046-their moving into [the drawing - room]3531-the drawing - room : wishing [her]123-emma joy -- yet observing , that [she]123-emma knew the first meeting must be rather alarming.-- [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston agreed to it ; but added , that [she]123-emma should be very glad to be secure of undergoing the anxiety of a first meeting at the time talked of : “ for [I]123-emma can not depend upon [his]102-frank churchill coming . [I]123-emma can not be so sanguine as [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston . [I]123-emma am very much afraid that it will all end in nothing . [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston , [I]123-emma dare say , has been telling [you]123-emma exactly how the matter stands ? ”[123-emma]

“ Yes -- it seems to depend upon nothing but the ill - humour of [Mrs. Churchill]98-mrs. churchill , which [I]87-isabella imagine to be the most certain thing in [the world]403-the world . ”[87-isabella]

“ [[My]88-mrs. weston Emma]3544-my emma ! ”[88-mrs. weston] replied [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , smiling , “ what is the certainty of caprice ? ”[88-mrs. weston] Then turning to [Isabella]87-isabella , who had not been attending before--“You must know , [[my]87-isabella dear]2714-my dear [Mrs. Knightley]122-mrs. john knightley , that [we]3546-we are by no means so sure of seeing [Mr. Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill , in [my]87-isabella opinion , as [[his]102-frank churchill father]518-his father thinks . It depends entirely upon [[his]102-frank churchill aunt]3548-his aunt 's spirits and pleasure ; in short , upon [her]3548-his aunt temper . To [you]2714-my dear -- to [[my]87-isabella two daughters]3549-my two daughters -- [I]87-isabella may venture on the truth . [Mrs. Churchill]98-mrs. churchill rules at [Enscombe]7-enscombe , and is [a very odd - tempered woman]3550-a very odd - tempered woman ; and [his]102-frank churchill coming now , depends upon [her]3548-his aunt being willing to spare [him]102-frank churchill . ”[87-isabella]

“ Oh , [Mrs. Churchill]98-mrs. churchill ; [every body]2749-every body knows [Mrs. Churchill]98-mrs. churchill , ”[87-isabella] replied [Isabella]87-isabella : “ and [I]87-isabella am sure [I]87-isabella never think of [that poor young man]3552-that poor young man without the greatest compassion . To be constantly living with [an ill - tempered person]3553-an ill - tempered person , must be dreadful . It is what [we]3554-we happily have never known any thing of ; but it must be a life of misery . What a blessing , that [she]3548-his aunt never had [any children]3555-any children ! [Poor little creatures]3556-poor little creatures , how unhappy [she]3548-his aunt would have made [them]3556-poor little creatures ! ”[87-isabella]

[Emma]123-emma wished [she]123-emma had been alone with [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston . [She]123-emma should then have heard more : [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston would speak to [her]123-emma , with a degree of unreserve which [she]88-mrs. weston would not hazard with [Isabella]87-isabella ; and , [she]123-emma really believed , would scarcely try to conceal any thing relative to [the Churchills]100-the churchills from [her]123-emma , excepting those views on [the young man]532-the young man , of which [her]123-emma own imagination had already given [her]123-emma such instinctive knowledge . But at present there was nothing more to be said . [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse very soon followed [them]1049-them into [the drawing - room]3531-the drawing - room . To be sitting long after dinner , was a confinement that [he]85-mr. woodhouse could not endure . Neither wine nor conversation was any thing to [him]85-mr. woodhouse ; and gladly did [he]85-mr. woodhouse move to those with whom [he]85-mr. woodhouse was always comfortable .

While [he]85-mr. woodhouse talked to [Isabella]87-isabella , however , [Emma]123-emma found an opportunity of saying ,

“ And so [you]87-isabella do not consider this visit from [[your]87-isabella son]3557-your son as by any means certain . [I]123-emma am sorry for it . The introduction must be unpleasant , whenever it takes place ; and the sooner it could be over , the better . ”[123-emma]

“ Yes ; and every delay makes one more apprehensive of other delays . Even if [this family]3558-this family , [the Braithwaites]168-the braithwaites , are put off , [I]123-emma am still afraid that some excuse may be found for disappointing [us]1049-them . [I]123-emma can not bear to imagine any reluctance on [his]85-mr. woodhouse side ; but [I]123-emma am sure there is a great wish on [the Churchills]100-the churchills ' to keep [him]85-mr. woodhouse to [themselves]100-the churchills . There is jealousy . [They]3558-this family are jealous even of [his]85-mr. woodhouse regard for [[his]85-mr. woodhouse father]518-his father . In short , [I]123-emma can feel no dependence on [his]85-mr. woodhouse coming , and [I]123-emma wish [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston were less sanguine . ”[123-emma]

“ [He]85-mr. woodhouse ought to come , ”[123-emma] said [Emma]123-emma . “ If [he]85-mr. woodhouse could stay only a couple of days , [he]85-mr. woodhouse ought to come ; and [one]2775-one can hardly conceive [a young man]2853-a young man 's not having it in [his]2853-a young man power to do as much as that . [A young _ woman]3562-a young _ woman _ , if [she]3562-a young _ woman fall into bad hands , may be teased , and kept at a distance from those [she]3562-a young _ woman wants to be with ; but [one]2775-one can not comprehend [a young _ man _]3564-a young _ man _ 's being under such restraint , as not to be able to spend a week with [[his]85-mr. woodhouse father]518-his father , if [he]85-mr. woodhouse likes it . ”[123-emma]

“ [One]2775-one ought to be at [Enscombe]7-enscombe , and know the ways of [the family]433-the family , before [one]2775-one decides upon what [he]2775-one can do , ”[88-mrs. weston] replied [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston . “ [One]2775-one ought to use the same caution , perhaps , in judging of the conduct of [any one individual of any one family]3570-any one individual of any one family ; but [Enscombe]7-enscombe , [I]88-mrs. weston believe , certainly must not be judged by general rules : _ [she]3562-a young _ woman _ is so very unreasonable ; and every thing gives way to [her]3562-a young _ woman . ”[88-mrs. weston]

“ But [she]3562-a young _ woman is so fond of [the nephew]3571-the nephew : [he]3571-the nephew is so very great a favourite . Now , according to [my]123-emma idea of [Mrs. Churchill]98-mrs. churchill , it would be most natural , that while [she]3562-a young _ woman makes no sacrifice for the comfort of [the husband]3572-the husband , to whom [she]3562-a young _ woman owes every thing , while [she]3562-a young _ woman exercises incessant caprice towards _ [him]3572-the husband _ , [she]3562-a young _ woman should frequently be governed by [the nephew]3571-the nephew , to whom [she]3562-a young _ woman owes nothing at all . ”[123-emma]

“ [[My]88-mrs. weston dearest]2979-my dearest [Emma]123-emma , do not pretend , with [your]123-emma sweet temper , to understand a bad one , or to lay down rules for it : [you]123-emma must let it go its own way . [I]88-mrs. weston have no doubt of [his]3571-the nephew having , at times , considerable influence ; but it may be perfectly impossible for [him]3571-the nephew to know beforehand _ when _ it will be . ”[88-mrs. weston]

[Emma]123-emma listened , and then coolly said , “ [I]123-emma shall not be satisfied , unless [he]3571-the nephew comes . ”[123-emma]

“ [He]3571-the nephew may have a great deal of influence on some points , ”[88-mrs. weston] continued [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , “ and on others , very little : and among those , on which [she]3562-a young _ woman is beyond [his]3571-the nephew reach , it is but too likely , may be this very circumstance of [his]3571-the nephew coming away from [them]3575-them to visit [us]3576-us . ”[88-mrs. weston]

CHAPTER XV

[Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse was soon ready for [his]85-mr. woodhouse tea ; and when [he]85-mr. woodhouse had drank [his]85-mr. woodhouse tea [he]85-mr. woodhouse was quite ready to go [home]562-home ; and it was as much as [[his]85-mr. woodhouse three companions]1052-his three companions could do , to entertain away [his]85-mr. woodhouse notice of the lateness of the hour , before [the other gentlemen]1053-the other gentlemen appeared . [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston was chatty and convivial , and [no friend to early separations of any sort]1054-no friend to early separations of any sort ; but at last [the drawing - room party]1055-the drawing - room party did receive an augmentation . [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton , in very good spirits , was one of the first to walk in . [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston and [Emma]123-emma were sitting together on a sofa . [He]95-mr. elton joined [them]1056-them immediately , and , with scarcely an invitation , seated [himself]95-mr. elton between [them]1056-them .

[Emma]123-emma , in good spirits too , from the amusement afforded [her]123-emma mind by the expectation of [Mr. Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill , was willing to forget [his]95-mr. elton late improprieties , and be as well satisfied with [him]95-mr. elton as before , and on [his]95-mr. elton making [Harriet]111-harriet [his]95-mr. elton very first subject , was ready to listen with most friendly smiles .

[He]95-mr. elton professed [himself]95-mr. elton extremely anxious about [[her]111-harriet fair friend]1008-her fair friend -- [[her]111-harriet fair , lovely , amiable friend]1058-her fair , lovely , amiable friend . “ Did [she]111-harriet know?--had [she]111-harriet heard any thing about [her]111-harriet , since [their]3577-their being at [Randalls?--he]29-randalls?--he felt much anxiety -- [he]95-mr. elton must confess that the nature of [her]111-harriet complaint alarmed [him]95-mr. elton considerably . ”[95-mr. elton] And in this style [he]95-mr. elton talked on for some time very properly , not much attending to any answer , but altogether sufficiently awake to the terror of a bad sore throat ; and [Emma]123-emma was quite in charity with [him]95-mr. elton .

But at last there seemed a perverse turn ; it seemed all at once as if [he]95-mr. elton were more afraid of its being a bad sore throat on [her]123-emma account , than on [Harriet's]169-harriet's -- more anxious that [she]123-emma should escape the infection , than that there should be no infection in the complaint . [He]95-mr. elton began with great earnestness to entreat [her]123-emma to refrain from visiting [the sick - chamber]1059-the sick - chamber again , for the present -- to entreat [her]123-emma to _ promise _ _ [him]95-mr. elton _ not to venture into such hazard till [he]95-mr. elton had seen [Mr. Perry]106-mr. perry and learnt [his]95-mr. elton opinion ; and though [she]123-emma tried to laugh it off and bring the subject back into its proper course , there was no putting an end to [his]95-mr. elton extreme solicitude about [her]123-emma . [She]123-emma was vexed . It did appear -- there was no concealing it -- exactly like the pretence of being in love with [her]123-emma , instead of [Harriet]111-harriet ; an inconstancy , if real , the most contemptible and abominable ! and [she]123-emma had difficulty in behaving with temper . [He]95-mr. elton turned to [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston to implore [her]88-mrs. weston assistance , “ Would not [she]123-emma give [him]95-mr. elton [her]123-emma support?--would not [she]123-emma add [her]123-emma persuasions to [his]95-mr. elton , to induce [Miss Woodhouse]84-miss woodhouse not to go to [Mrs. Goddard]109-mrs. goddard 's till it were certain that [Miss Smith]111-harriet 's disorder had no infection ? [He]95-mr. elton could not be satisfied without a promise -- would not [she]123-emma give [him]95-mr. elton [her]123-emma influence in procuring it ? ”[95-mr. elton]

“ So scrupulous for [others]2773-others , ”[95-mr. elton] [he]95-mr. elton continued , “ and yet so careless for [herself]123-emma ! [She]123-emma wanted [me]95-mr. elton to nurse [my]95-mr. elton cold by staying at [home]562-home to - day , and yet will not promise to avoid the danger of catching an ulcerated sore throat [herself]123-emma . Is this fair , [Mrs. Weston?--Judge]170-mrs. weston?--judge between [us]3580-us . Have not [I]95-mr. elton some right to complain ? [I]95-mr. elton am sure of [your]88-mrs. weston kind support and aid . ”[95-mr. elton]

[Emma]123-emma saw [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston 's surprize , and felt that it must be great , at an address which , in words and manner , was assuming to [himself]95-mr. elton the right of first interest in [her]88-mrs. weston ; and as for [herself]123-emma , [she]123-emma was too much provoked and offended to have the power of directly saying any thing to the purpose . [She]123-emma could only give [him]95-mr. elton a look ; but it was such a look as [she]123-emma thought must restore [him]95-mr. elton to [his]95-mr. elton senses , and then left the sofa , removing to a seat by [[her]123-emma sister]407-her sister , and giving [her]123-emma all [her]123-emma attention .

[She]123-emma had not time to know how [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton took the reproof , so rapidly did another subject succeed ; for [Mr. John Knightley]92-mr. knightley now came into [the room]701-the room from examining the weather , and opened on [them]1062-them all with the information of the ground being covered with snow , and of its still snowing fast , with a strong drifting wind ; concluding with these words to [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse :

“ This will prove a spirited beginning of [your]85-mr. woodhouse winter engagements , [sir]2734-sir . Something new for [[your]85-mr. woodhouse coachman]3582-your coachman and horses to be making [their]1062-them way through a storm of snow . ”[85-mr. woodhouse]

[Poor Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse was silent from consternation ; but [every body else]679-every body else had something to say ; [every body]2749-every body was either surprized or not surprized , and had some question to ask , or some comfort to offer . [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston and [Emma]123-emma tried earnestly to cheer [him]85-mr. woodhouse and turn [his]85-mr. woodhouse attention from [[his]85-mr. woodhouse son - in - law]1065-his son - in - law , who was pursuing [his]85-mr. woodhouse triumph rather unfeelingly .

“ [I]85-mr. woodhouse admired [your]85-mr. woodhouse resolution very much , [sir]2734-sir , ”[85-mr. woodhouse] said [he]85-mr. woodhouse , “ in venturing out in such weather , for of course [you]85-mr. woodhouse saw there would be snow very soon . [Every body]2749-every body must have seen the snow coming on . [I]85-mr. woodhouse admired [your]85-mr. woodhouse spirit ; and [I]85-mr. woodhouse dare say [we]3585-we shall get [home]562-home very well . Another hour or two 's snow can hardly make [the road]846-the road impassable ; and [we]3585-we are [two carriages]3588-two carriages ; if one is blown over in the bleak part of [the common field]3589-the common field there will be the other at hand . [I]85-mr. woodhouse dare say [we]3585-we shall be all safe at [Hartfield]2-hartfield before midnight . ”[85-mr. woodhouse]

[Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston , with triumph of a different sort , was confessing that [he]86-mr. weston had known it to be snowing some time , but had not said a word , lest it should make [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse uncomfortable , and be an excuse for [his]85-mr. woodhouse hurrying away . As to there being any quantity of snow fallen or likely to fall to impede [their]1066-their return , that was a mere joke ; [he]85-mr. woodhouse was afraid [they]1066-their would find no difficulty . [He]85-mr. woodhouse wished [the road]846-the road might be impassable , that [he]85-mr. woodhouse might be able to keep [them]1066-their all at [Randalls]101-randalls ; and with the utmost good - will was sure that accommodation might be found for every body , calling on [[his]85-mr. woodhouse wife]2763-his wife to agree with [him]85-mr. woodhouse , that with a little contrivance , every body might be lodged , which [she]2763-his wife hardly knew how to do , from the consciousness of there being but [two spare rooms in [the house]435-the house]1069-two spare rooms in the house .

“ What is to be done , [[my]85-mr. woodhouse dear]2714-my dear [Emma?--what]171-emma?--what is to be done ? ”[85-mr. woodhouse] was [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse 's first exclamation , and all that [he]85-mr. woodhouse could say for some time . To [her]2763-his wife [he]85-mr. woodhouse looked for comfort ; and [her]2763-his wife assurances of safety , [her]2763-his wife representation of the excellence of the horses , and of [James]90-james , and of [their]1071-we having so many friends about [them]1071-we , revived [him]85-mr. woodhouse a little .

[[His]85-mr. woodhouse eldest daughter]1012-his eldest daughter 's alarm was equal to [his]85-mr. woodhouse own . The horror of being blocked up at [Randalls]101-randalls , while [[her]2763-his wife children]467-her children were at [Hartfield]2-hartfield , was full in [her]2763-his wife imagination ; and fancying [the road]846-the road to be now just passable for [adventurous people]1075-adventurous people , but in a state that admitted no delay , [she]2763-his wife was eager to have it settled , that [[her]2763-his wife father]425-her father and [Emma]123-emma should remain at [Randalls]101-randalls , while [she]2763-his wife and [[her]2763-his wife husband]441-her husband set forward instantly through all the possible accumulations of drifted snow that might impede [them]1071-we .

“ [You]441-her husband had better order [the carriage]2719-the carriage directly , [[my]2763-his wife love]3321-my love , ”[2763-his wife] said [she]2763-his wife ; “ [I]2763-his wife dare say [we]1071-we shall be able to get along , if [we]1071-we set off directly ; and if [we]1071-we do come to any thing very bad , [I]2763-his wife can get out and walk . [I]2763-his wife am not at all afraid . [I]2763-his wife should not mind walking half the way . [I]2763-his wife could change [my]2763-his wife shoes , [you]441-her husband know , the moment [I]2763-his wife got [home]562-home ; and it is not the sort of thing that gives [me]2763-his wife cold . ”[2763-his wife]

“ Indeed ! ”[441-her husband] replied [he]441-her husband . “ Then , [[my]441-her husband dear]2714-my dear [Isabella]87-isabella , it is the most extraordinary sort of thing in [the world]403-the world , for in general every thing does give [you]87-isabella cold . Walk home!--you are prettily shod for walking [home]562-home , [I]441-her husband dare say . It will be bad enough for the horses . ”[441-her husband]

[Isabella]87-isabella turned to [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston for [her]88-mrs. weston approbation of the plan . [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston could only approve . [Isabella]87-isabella then went to [Emma]123-emma ; but [Emma]123-emma could not so entirely give up the hope of [their]1078-their being all able to get away ; and [they]1078-their were still discussing the point , when [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley , who had left [the room]701-the room immediately after [[his]92-mr. knightley brother]824-his brother 's first report of the snow , came back again , and told [them]1078-their that [he]92-mr. knightley had been out of doors to examine , and could answer for there not being the smallest difficulty in [their]1078-their getting [home]562-home , whenever [they]1078-their liked it , either now or an hour hence . [He]92-mr. knightley had gone beyond the sweep -- some way along [the Highbury road]1082-the highbury road -- the snow was nowhere above half an inch deep -- in many places hardly enough to whiten the ground ; a very few flakes were falling at present , but the clouds were parting , and there was every appearance of its being soon over . [He]92-mr. knightley had seen [the coachmen]1083-the coachmen , and [they]1083-the coachmen both agreed with [him]92-mr. knightley in there being nothing to apprehend .

To [Isabella]87-isabella , the relief of such tidings was very great , and they were scarcely less acceptable to [Emma]123-emma on [[her]123-emma father]425-her father 's account , who was immediately set as much at ease on the subject as [his]92-mr. knightley nervous constitution allowed ; but the alarm that had been raised could not be appeased so as to admit of any comfort for [him]92-mr. knightley while [he]92-mr. knightley continued at [Randalls]101-randalls . [He]92-mr. knightley was satisfied of there being no present danger in returning [home]562-home , but no assurances could convince [him]92-mr. knightley that it was safe to stay ; and while [the others]870-the others were variously urging and recommending , [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley and [Emma]123-emma settled it in a few brief sentences : thus--

“ [[Your]123-emma father]3597-your father will not be easy ; why do not [you]123-emma go ? ”[870-the others]

“ [I]870-the others am ready , if [the others]870-the others are . ”[870-the others]

“ Shall [I]870-the others ring the bell ? ”[870-the others]

“ Yes , do . ”[870-the others]

And the bell was rung , and [the carriages]989-the carriages spoken for . A few minutes more , and [Emma]123-emma hoped to see [one troublesome companion]1088-one troublesome companion deposited in [[his]1088-one troublesome companion own house]1089-his own house , to get sober and cool , and the other recover [his]1088-one troublesome companion temper and happiness when this visit of hardship were over .

[The carriage]2719-the carriage came : and [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse , always [the first object on such occasions]1091-the first object on such occasions , was carefully attended to [his]85-mr. woodhouse own by [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley and [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston ; but not all that [either]1092-either could say could prevent some renewal of alarm at the sight of the snow which had actually fallen , and the discovery of a much darker night than [he]85-mr. woodhouse had been prepared for . “ [He]3597-your father was afraid [they]3599-they should have a very bad drive . [He]3597-your father was afraid poor [Isabella]87-isabella would not like it . And there would be [poor Emma]123-emma in [the carriage]2719-the carriage behind . [He]3597-your father did not know what [they]3599-they had best do . [They]3599-they must keep as much together as [they]3599-they could ; ”[90-james] and [James]90-james was talked to , and given a charge to go very slow and wait for [the other carriage]1093-the other carriage .

[Isabella]87-isabella stept in after [[her]87-isabella father]425-her father ; [John Knightley]92-mr. knightley , forgetting that [he]92-mr. knightley did not belong to [[their]1095-they party]1096-their party , stept in after [[his]92-mr. knightley wife]2763-his wife very naturally ; so that [Emma]123-emma found , on being escorted and followed into [the second carriage]1014-the second carriage by [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton , that the door was to be lawfully shut on [them]1095-they , and that [they]1095-they were to have a tete - a - tete drive . It would not have been the awkwardness of a moment , it would have been rather a pleasure , previous to the suspicions of this very day ; [she]123-emma could have talked to [him]92-mr. knightley of [Harriet]111-harriet , and the three - quarters of a mile would have seemed but one . But now , [she]123-emma would rather it had not happened . [She]123-emma believed [he]92-mr. knightley had been drinking too much of [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston 's good wine , and felt sure that [he]92-mr. knightley would want to be talking nonsense .

To restrain [him]92-mr. knightley as much as might be , by [her]123-emma own manners , [she]123-emma was immediately preparing to speak with exquisite calmness and gravity of the weather and the night ; but scarcely had [she]123-emma begun , scarcely had [they]1095-they passed the sweep - gate and joined [the other carriage]1093-the other carriage , than [she]123-emma found [her]123-emma subject cut up -- [her]123-emma hand seized -- [her]123-emma attention demanded , and [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton actually making violent love to [her]111-harriet : availing [himself]95-mr. elton of the precious opportunity , declaring sentiments which must be already well known , hoping -- fearing -- adoring -- ready to die if [she]111-harriet refused [him]92-mr. knightley ; but flattering [himself]95-mr. elton that [his]95-mr. elton ardent attachment and unequalled love and unexampled passion could not fail of having some effect , and in short , very much resolved on being seriously accepted as soon as possible . It really was so . Without scruple -- without apology -- without much apparent diffidence , [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton , [the lover of [Harriet]111-harriet]1100-the lover of harriet , was professing [himself]95-mr. elton _ [[her]111-harriet _ lover]1101-her _ lover . [She]123-emma tried to stop [him]95-mr. elton ; but vainly ; [he]95-mr. elton would go on , and say it all . Angry as [she]123-emma was , the thought of the moment made [her]123-emma resolve to restrain [herself]123-emma when [she]123-emma did speak . [She]123-emma felt that half this folly must be drunkenness , and therefore could hope that it might belong only to the passing hour . Accordingly , with a mixture of the serious and the playful , which [she]123-emma hoped would best suit [his]95-mr. elton half and half state , [she]123-emma replied ,

“ [I]123-emma am very much astonished , [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton . This to _ [me]123-emma _ ! [you]95-mr. elton forget [yourself]95-mr. elton -- [you]95-mr. elton take [me]123-emma for [[my]123-emma friend]3149-my friend -- any message to [Miss Smith]111-harriet [I]123-emma shall be happy to deliver ; but no more of this to _ [me]123-emma _ , if [you]95-mr. elton please . ”[123-emma]

“ [Miss Smith!--message]172-miss smith!--message to [Miss Smith!--What]3602-miss smith!--what could [she]111-harriet possibly mean!”--And[95-mr. elton] [he]95-mr. elton repeated [her]123-emma words with such assurance of accent , such boastful pretence of amazement , that [she]123-emma could not help replying with quickness ,

“ [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton , this is the most extraordinary conduct ! and [I]123-emma can account for it only in one way ; [you]95-mr. elton are not [yourself]95-mr. elton , or [you]95-mr. elton could not speak either to [me]123-emma , or of [Harriet]111-harriet , in such a manner . Command [yourself]95-mr. elton enough to say no more , and [I]123-emma will endeavour to forget it . ”[123-emma]

But [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton had only drunk wine enough to elevate [his]95-mr. elton spirits , not at all to confuse [his]95-mr. elton intellects . [He]95-mr. elton perfectly knew [his]95-mr. elton own meaning ; and having warmly protested against [her]123-emma suspicion as most injurious , and slightly touched upon [his]95-mr. elton respect for [Miss Smith]111-harriet as [[her]123-emma friend,--but]1102-her friend,--but acknowledging [his]95-mr. elton wonder that [Miss Smith]111-harriet should be mentioned at all,--he resumed the subject of [his]95-mr. elton own passion , and was very urgent for a favourable answer .

As [she]123-emma thought less of [his]95-mr. elton inebriety , [she]123-emma thought more of [his]95-mr. elton inconstancy and presumption ; and with fewer struggles for politeness , replied ,

“ It is impossible for [me]123-emma to doubt any longer . [You]95-mr. elton have made [yourself]95-mr. elton too clear . [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton , [my]123-emma astonishment is much beyond any thing [I]123-emma can express . After such behaviour , as [I]123-emma have witnessed during the last month , to [Miss Smith]111-harriet -- such attentions as [I]123-emma have been in the daily habit of observing -- to be addressing [me]123-emma in this manner -- this is an unsteadiness of character , indeed , which [I]123-emma had not supposed possible ! Believe [me]123-emma , [sir]2734-sir , [I]123-emma am far , very far , from gratified in being the object of such professions . ”[123-emma]

“ [Good Heaven]173-good heaven ! ”[95-mr. elton] cried [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton , “ what can be the meaning of this?--Miss [Smith!--I]174-smith!--i never thought of [Miss Smith]111-harriet in the whole course of [my]95-mr. elton existence -- never paid [her]111-harriet any attentions , but as [[your]95-mr. elton friend]2922-your friend : never cared whether [she]111-harriet were dead or alive , but as [[your]95-mr. elton friend]2922-your friend . If [she]111-harriet has fancied otherwise , [her]111-harriet own wishes have misled [her]111-harriet , and [I]95-mr. elton am very sorry -- extremely sorry -- But , [Miss Smith]111-harriet , indeed!--Oh ! [Miss Woodhouse]84-miss woodhouse ! who can think of [Miss Smith]111-harriet , when [Miss Woodhouse]84-miss woodhouse is near ! No , upon [my]95-mr. elton honour , there is no unsteadiness of character . [I]95-mr. elton have thought only of [you]111-harriet . [I]95-mr. elton protest against having paid the smallest attention to [any one else]3606-any one else . Every thing that [I]95-mr. elton have said or done , for many weeks past , has been with the sole view of marking [my]95-mr. elton adoration of [yourself]111-harriet . [You]111-harriet can not really , seriously , doubt it . No!--(in an accent meant to be insinuating)--I am sure [you]111-harriet have seen and understood [me]95-mr. elton . ”[95-mr. elton]

It would be impossible to say what [Emma]123-emma felt , on hearing this -- which of all [her]123-emma unpleasant sensations was uppermost . [She]123-emma was too completely overpowered to be immediately able to reply : and two moments of silence being ample encouragement for [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton 's sanguine state of mind , [he]95-mr. elton tried to take [her]123-emma hand again , as [he]95-mr. elton joyously exclaimed--

“ [Charming Miss Woodhouse]175-charming miss woodhouse ! allow [me]95-mr. elton to interpret this interesting silence . [It]3607-it confesses that [you]111-harriet have long understood [me]95-mr. elton . ”[95-mr. elton]

“ No , [sir]2734-sir , ”[123-emma] cried [Emma]123-emma , “ it confesses no such thing . So far from having long understood [you]2734-sir , [I]123-emma have been in a most complete error with respect to [your]2734-sir views , till this moment . As to [myself]123-emma , [I]123-emma am very sorry that [you]2734-sir should have been giving way to any feelings -- Nothing could be farther from [my]123-emma wishes -- [your]2734-sir attachment to [[my]123-emma friend]3149-my friend [Harriet]111-harriet -- [your]2734-sir pursuit of [her]111-harriet , ( pursuit , it appeared , ) gave [me]123-emma great pleasure , and [I]123-emma have been very earnestly wishing [you]2734-sir success : but had [I]123-emma supposed that [she]111-harriet were not [your]2734-sir attraction to [Hartfield]93-miss woodhouse , [I]123-emma should certainly have thought [you]2734-sir judged ill in making [your]2734-sir visits so frequent . Am [I]123-emma to believe that [you]2734-sir have never sought to recommend [yourself]2734-sir particularly to [Miss Smith?--that]176-miss smith?--that [you]2734-sir have never thought seriously of [her]111-harriet ? ”[123-emma]

“ Never , [madam]3610-madam , ”[1103-i] cried [he]1103-i , affronted in [his]1103-i turn : “ never , [I]1103-i assure [you]3610-madam . _ [I]1103-i _ think seriously of [Miss Smith!--Miss Smith]111-harriet is [a very good sort of girl]3611-a very good sort of girl ; and [I]1103-i should be happy to see [her]111-harriet respectably settled . [I]1103-i wish [her]111-harriet extremely well : and , no doubt , there are [men who might not object to]3612-men who might not object to -- Every body has [their]3612-men who might not object to level : but as for [myself]1103-i , [I]1103-i am not , [I]1103-i think , quite so much at a loss . [I]1103-i need not so totally despair of an equal alliance , as to be addressing [myself]1103-i to [Miss Smith!--No]177-miss smith!--no , [madam]3610-madam , [my]1103-i visits to [Hartfield]2-hartfield have been for [yourself]3610-madam only ; and the encouragement [I]1103-i received-- ”[1103-i]

“ Encouragement!--I give [you]3610-madam encouragement!--Sir , [you]3610-madam have been entirely mistaken in supposing it . [I]1105-she have seen [you]3610-madam only as [the admirer of [[my]1105-she friend]3149-my friend]3614-the admirer of my friend . In no other light could [you]3610-madam have been more to [me]1105-she than [a common acquaintance]3616-a common acquaintance . [I]1105-she am exceedingly sorry : but it is well that the mistake ends where it does . Had the same behaviour continued , [Miss Smith]111-harriet might have been led into a misconception of [your]3610-madam views ; not being aware , probably , any more than [myself]1105-she , of the very great inequality which [you]3610-madam are so sensible of . But , as it is , the disappointment is single , and , [I]1105-she trust , will not be lasting . [I]1105-she have no thoughts of matrimony at present . ”[1105-she]

[He]1104-he was too angry to say another word ; [her]1105-she manner too decided to invite supplication ; and in this state of swelling resentment , and mutually deep mortification , [they]1106-they had to continue together a few minutes longer , for the fears of [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse had confined [them]1106-they to a foot - pace . If there had not been so much anger , there would have been desperate awkwardness ; but [their]1106-they straightforward emotions left no room for the little zigzags of embarrassment . Without knowing when [the carriage]2719-the carriage turned into [Vicarage Lane]21-vicarage lane , or when it stopped , [they]1106-they found [themselves]1106-they , all at once , at the door of [[his]1104-he house]409-his house ; and [he]1104-he was out before another syllable passed.--Emma then felt it indispensable to wish [him]1104-he a good night . The compliment was just returned , coldly and proudly ; and , under indescribable irritation of spirits , [she]1105-she was then conveyed to [Hartfield]93-miss woodhouse .
