“ Nay , [she]152-miss fairfax has always been a first favourite with [him]92-mr. knightley , as [you]88-mrs. weston very well know . ”[88-mrs. weston]

“ But the imprudence of such a match ! ”[123-emma]

“ [I]88-mrs. weston am not speaking of its prudence ; merely its probability . ”[88-mrs. weston]

“ [I]123-emma see no probability in it , unless [you]88-mrs. weston have any better foundation than what [you]88-mrs. weston mention . [His]92-mr. knightley good - nature , [his]92-mr. knightley humanity , as [I]123-emma tell [you]88-mrs. weston , would be quite enough to account for the horses . [He]92-mr. knightley has a great regard for [the Bateses]161-the bateses , [you]88-mrs. weston know , independent of [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax -- and is always glad to shew [them]161-the bateses attention . [[My]123-emma dear]2714-my dear [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , do not take to match - making . [You]88-mrs. weston do it very ill . [[Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax mistress of [the Abbey!--Oh]4124-the abbey!--oh]4123-jane fairfax mistress of the abbey!--oh ! no , no;--every feeling revolts . For [his]92-mr. knightley own sake , [I]123-emma would not have [him]92-mr. knightley do so mad a thing . ”[123-emma]

“ Imprudent , if [you]88-mrs. weston please -- but not mad . Excepting inequality of fortune , and perhaps a little disparity of age , [I]88-mrs. weston can see nothing unsuitable . ”[88-mrs. weston]

“ But [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley does not want to marry . [I]123-emma am sure [he]92-mr. knightley has not the least idea of it . Do not put it into [his]92-mr. knightley head . Why should [he]92-mr. knightley marry?--He is as happy as possible by [himself]92-mr. knightley ; with [[his]92-mr. knightley farm]4125-his farm , and [his]92-mr. knightley sheep , and [[his]92-mr. knightley library]4126-his library , and all the parish to manage ; and [he]92-mr. knightley is extremely fond of [[[his]92-mr. knightley brother]824-his brother 's children]4128-his brother 's children . [He]92-mr. knightley has no occasion to marry , either to fill up [his]92-mr. knightley time or [his]92-mr. knightley heart . ”[123-emma]

“ [[My]88-mrs. weston dear]2714-my dear [Emma]123-emma , as long as [he]92-mr. knightley thinks so , it is so ; but if [he]92-mr. knightley really loves [Jane Fairfax--]221-jane fairfax-- ”[88-mrs. weston]

“ Nonsense ! [He]92-mr. knightley does not care about [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax . In the way of love , [I]123-emma am sure [he]92-mr. knightley does not . [He]92-mr. knightley would do any good to [her]152-miss fairfax , or [[her]152-miss fairfax family]2871-her family ; but-- ”[123-emma]

“ Well , ”[88-mrs. weston] said [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , laughing , “ perhaps the greatest good [he]92-mr. knightley could do [them]4128-his brother 's children , would be to give [Jane]152-miss fairfax such [a respectable home]4131-a respectable home . ”[88-mrs. weston]

“ If it would be good to [her]152-miss fairfax , [I]123-emma am sure it would be evil to [himself]92-mr. knightley ; a very shameful and degrading connexion . How would [he]92-mr. knightley bear to have [Miss Bates]105-miss bates belonging to him?--To have [her]152-miss fairfax haunting [the Abbey]2802-the abbey , and thanking [him]92-mr. knightley all day long for [his]92-mr. knightley great kindness in marrying [Jane?--'So]222-jane?--'so very kind and obliging!--But [he]92-mr. knightley always had been such [a very kind neighbour]4133-a very kind neighbour ! ' And then fly off , through half a sentence , to [[her]152-miss fairfax mother]410-her mother 's old petticoat . ' Not that it was such a very old petticoat either -- for still it would last a great while -- and , indeed , [she]152-miss fairfax must thankfully say that [their]4128-his brother 's children petticoats were all very strong . ' ”[123-emma]

“ For shame , [Emma]123-emma ! Do not mimic [her]152-miss fairfax . [You]123-emma divert [me]88-mrs. weston against [my]88-mrs. weston conscience . And , upon [my]88-mrs. weston word , [I]88-mrs. weston do not think [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley would be much disturbed by [Miss Bates]105-miss bates . Little things do not irritate [him]92-mr. knightley . [She]152-miss fairfax might talk on ; and if [he]92-mr. knightley wanted to say any thing [himself]92-mr. knightley , [he]92-mr. knightley would only talk louder , and drown [her]152-miss fairfax voice . But the question is not , whether it would be a bad connexion for [him]92-mr. knightley , but whether [he]92-mr. knightley wishes it ; and [I]88-mrs. weston think [he]92-mr. knightley does . [I]88-mrs. weston have heard [him]92-mr. knightley speak , and so must [you]123-emma , so very highly of [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax ! The interest [he]92-mr. knightley takes in [her]152-miss fairfax -- [his]92-mr. knightley anxiety about [her]152-miss fairfax health -- [his]92-mr. knightley concern that [she]152-miss fairfax should have no happier prospect ! [I]88-mrs. weston have heard [him]92-mr. knightley express [himself]92-mr. knightley so warmly on those points!--Such an admirer of [her]152-miss fairfax performance on the pianoforte , and of [her]152-miss fairfax voice ! [I]88-mrs. weston have heard [him]92-mr. knightley say that [he]92-mr. knightley could listen to [her]152-miss fairfax for ever . Oh ! and [I]88-mrs. weston had almost forgotten one idea that occurred to [me]88-mrs. weston -- this pianoforte that has been sent [here]2707-here by [somebody]604-somebody -- though [we]4137-we have all been so well satisfied to consider it a present from [the Campbells]190-the campbells , may it not be from [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley ? [I]88-mrs. weston can not help suspecting [him]92-mr. knightley . [I]88-mrs. weston think [he]92-mr. knightley is just [the person to do it]4138-the person to do it , even without being in love . ”[88-mrs. weston]

“ Then it can be no argument to prove that [he]92-mr. knightley is in love . But [I]123-emma do not think it is at all a likely thing for [him]92-mr. knightley to do . [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley does nothing mysteriously . ”[123-emma]

“ [I]88-mrs. weston have heard [him]92-mr. knightley lamenting [her]152-miss fairfax having no instrument repeatedly ; oftener than [I]88-mrs. weston should suppose such a circumstance would , in the common course of things , occur to [him]92-mr. knightley . ”[88-mrs. weston]

“ Very well ; and if [he]92-mr. knightley had intended to give [her]152-miss fairfax one , [he]92-mr. knightley would have told [her]152-miss fairfax so . ”[123-emma]

“ There might be scruples of delicacy , [my]88-mrs. weston dear [Emma]123-emma . [I]88-mrs. weston have a very strong notion that it comes from [him]92-mr. knightley . [I]88-mrs. weston am sure [he]92-mr. knightley was particularly silent when [Mrs. Cole]185-mrs. cole told [us]1612-them of it at dinner . ”[88-mrs. weston]

“ [You]123-emma take up an idea , [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , and run away with it ; as [you]123-emma have many a time reproached [me]123-emma with doing . [I]123-emma see no sign of attachment -- [I]123-emma believe nothing of the pianoforte -- and proof only shall convince [me]123-emma that [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley has any thought of marrying [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax . ”[123-emma]

[They]1612-them combated the point some time longer in the same way ; [Emma]123-emma rather gaining ground over the mind of [[her]123-emma friend]427-her friend ; for [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston was the most used of [the two]3078-the two to yield ; till a little bustle in [the room]701-the room shewed [them]1612-them that tea was over , and the instrument in preparation;--and at the same moment [Mr. Cole]145-mr. cole approaching to entreat [Miss Woodhouse]84-miss woodhouse would do [them]1612-them the honour of trying it . [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill , of whom , in the eagerness of [her]123-emma conversation with [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , [she]123-emma had been seeing nothing , except that [he]102-frank churchill had found a seat by [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax , followed [Mr. Cole]145-mr. cole , to add [his]102-frank churchill very pressing entreaties ; and as , in every respect , it suited [Emma]123-emma best to lead , [she]123-emma gave a very proper compliance .

[She]123-emma knew the limitations of [her]123-emma own powers too well to attempt more than [she]123-emma could perform with credit ; [she]123-emma wanted neither taste nor spirit in the little things which are generally acceptable , and could accompany [her]123-emma own voice well . One accompaniment to [her]123-emma song took [her]123-emma agreeably by surprize -- a second , slightly but correctly taken by [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill . [Her]123-emma pardon was duly begged at the close of the song , and every thing usual followed . [He]102-frank churchill was accused of having a delightful voice , and a perfect knowledge of music ; which was properly denied ; and that [he]102-frank churchill knew nothing of the matter , and had no voice at all , roundly asserted . [They]1616-they sang together once more ; and [Emma]123-emma would then resign [her]123-emma place to [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax , whose performance , both vocal and instrumental , [she]152-miss fairfax never could attempt to conceal from [herself]152-miss fairfax , was infinitely superior to [her]152-miss fairfax own .

With mixed feelings , [she]152-miss fairfax seated [herself]152-miss fairfax at a little distance from the numbers round the instrument , to listen . [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill sang again . [They]1616-they had sung together once or twice , it appeared , at [Weymouth]23-weymouth . But the sight of [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley among the most attentive , soon drew away half [Emma]123-emma 's mind ; and [she]123-emma fell into a train of thinking on the subject of [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston 's suspicions , to which the sweet sounds of the united voices gave only momentary interruptions . [Her]123-emma objections to [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley 's marrying did not in the least subside . [She]123-emma could see nothing but evil in it . It would be a great disappointment to [Mr. John Knightley]92-mr. knightley ; consequently to [Isabella]87-isabella . A real injury to [the children]591-the children -- a most mortifying change , and material loss to [them]591-the children all;--a very great deduction from [[her]123-emma father]425-her father 's daily comfort -- and , as to [herself]123-emma , [she]123-emma could not at all endure the idea of [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax at [Donwell Abbey]8-donwell abbey . [A Mrs. Knightley]122-mrs. john knightley for [them]591-the children all to give way to!--No -- [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley must never marry . [Little Henry]125-henry must remain [the heir of [Donwell]24-donwell]1619-the heir of donwell .

Presently [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley looked back , and came and sat down by [her]123-emma . [They]1620-they talked at first only of the performance . [His]92-mr. knightley admiration was certainly very warm ; yet [she]123-emma thought , but for [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , it would not have struck [her]123-emma . As a sort of touchstone , however , [she]123-emma began to speak of [his]92-mr. knightley kindness in conveying [the aunt and niece]1621-the aunt and niece ; and though [his]92-mr. knightley answer was in the spirit of cutting the matter short , [she]123-emma believed it to indicate only [his]92-mr. knightley disinclination to dwell on any kindness of [his]92-mr. knightley own .

“ [I]123-emma often feel concern , ”[123-emma] said [she]123-emma , “ that [I]123-emma dare not make [our]1620-they carriage more useful on such occasions . It is not that [I]123-emma am without the wish ; but [you]92-mr. knightley know how impossible [[my]123-emma father]2740-my father would deem it that [James]90-james should put - to for such a purpose . ”[123-emma]

“ Quite out of the question , quite out of the question , ”[92-mr. knightley] [he]92-mr. knightley replied;--“but [you]123-emma must often wish it , [I]92-mr. knightley am sure . ”[92-mr. knightley] And [he]92-mr. knightley smiled with such seeming pleasure at the conviction , that [she]123-emma must proceed another step .

“ This present from [the Campbells]190-the campbells , ”[92-mr. knightley] said she--“this pianoforte is very kindly given . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ Yes , ”[92-mr. knightley] [he]92-mr. knightley replied , and without the smallest apparent embarrassment.--“But [they]190-the campbells would have done better had [they]190-the campbells given [her]152-miss fairfax notice of it . Surprizes are foolish things . The pleasure is not enhanced , and the inconvenience is often considerable . [I]92-mr. knightley should have expected better judgment in [Colonel Campbell]164-colonel campbell . ”[92-mr. knightley]

From that moment , [Emma]123-emma could have taken [her]123-emma oath that [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley had had no concern in giving the instrument . But whether [he]92-mr. knightley were entirely free from peculiar attachment -- whether there were no actual preference -- remained a little longer doubtful . Towards the end of [Jane]152-miss fairfax 's second song , [her]152-miss fairfax voice grew thick .

“ That will do , ”[92-mr. knightley] said [he]92-mr. knightley , when it was finished , thinking aloud--“you have sung quite enough for one evening -- now be quiet . ”[92-mr. knightley]

Another song , however , was soon begged for . “ One more;--they would not fatigue [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax on any account , and would only ask for one more . ”[102-frank churchill] And [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill was heard to say , “ [I]102-frank churchill think [you]123-emma could manage this without effort ; the first part is so very trifling . The strength of the song falls on the second . ”[102-frank churchill]

[Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley grew angry .

“ [That fellow]4140-that fellow , ”[92-mr. knightley] said [he]92-mr. knightley , indignantly , “ thinks of nothing but [shewing]4141-shewing off [his]4140-that fellow own voice . This must not be . ”[92-mr. knightley] And touching [Miss Bates]105-miss bates , who at that moment passed [near--“Miss Bates]105-miss bates , are [you]105-miss bates mad , to let [[your]105-miss bates niece]4142-your niece sing [herself]4142-your niece hoarse in this manner ? Go , and interfere . [They]4143-they have no mercy on [her]4142-your niece . ”[92-mr. knightley]

[Miss Bates]105-miss bates , in [her]105-miss bates real anxiety for [Jane]105-miss bates , could hardly stay even to be grateful , before [she]105-miss bates stept forward and put an end to all farther singing . Here ceased the concert part of the evening , for [Miss Woodhouse]84-miss woodhouse and [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax were [the only young lady performers]1622-the only young lady performers ; but soon ( within five minutes ) the proposal of dancing -- originating [nobody]2718-nobody exactly knew where -- was so effectually promoted by [Mr.]1624-mr. and [Mrs. Cole]185-mrs. cole , that every thing was rapidly clearing away , to give proper space . [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , capital in [her]88-mrs. weston country - dances , was seated , and beginning an irresistible waltz ; and [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill , coming up with most becoming gallantry to [Emma]123-emma , had secured [her]123-emma hand , and led [her]123-emma up to the top .

While waiting till [the other young people]1625-the other young people could pair [themselves]1625-the other young people off , [Emma]123-emma found time , in spite of the compliments [she]123-emma was receiving on [her]123-emma voice and [her]123-emma taste , to look about , and see what became of [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley . This would be a trial . [He]92-mr. knightley was [no dancer in general]1626-no dancer in general . If [he]92-mr. knightley were to be very alert in engaging [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax now , it might augur something . There was no immediate appearance . No ; [he]92-mr. knightley was talking to [Mrs. Cole]185-mrs. cole -- [he]92-mr. knightley was looking on unconcerned ; [Jane]152-miss fairfax was asked by [somebody else]1627-somebody else , and [he]92-mr. knightley was still talking to [Mrs. Cole]185-mrs. cole .

[Emma]123-emma had no longer an alarm for [Henry]125-henry ; [his]92-mr. knightley interest was yet safe ; and [she]123-emma led off the dance with genuine spirit and enjoyment . Not more than five couple could be mustered ; but the rarity and the suddenness of it made it very delightful , and [she]123-emma found [herself]123-emma well matched in [a partner]1628-a partner . [They]1629-they were [a couple worth looking at]1630-a couple worth looking at .

Two dances , unfortunately , were all that could be allowed . It was growing late , and [Miss Bates]105-miss bates became anxious to get [home]562-home , on [[her]105-miss bates mother]410-her mother 's account . After some attempts , therefore , to be permitted to begin again , [they]1629-they were obliged to thank [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , look sorrowful , and have done .

“ Perhaps it is as well , ”[102-frank churchill] said [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill , as [he]102-frank churchill attended [Emma]123-emma to [[her]123-emma carriage]1633-her carriage . “ [I]102-frank churchill must have asked [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax , and [her]152-miss fairfax languid dancing would not have agreed with [me]102-frank churchill , after [yours]4144-yours . ”[102-frank churchill]

[CHAPTER IX

Emma]123-emma did not repent [her]123-emma condescension in going to [the Coles]184-the coles . The visit afforded [her]123-emma many pleasant recollections the next day ; and all that [she]123-emma might be supposed to have lost on the side of dignified seclusion , must be amply repaid in the splendour of popularity . [She]123-emma must have delighted [the Coles]184-the coles -- worthy people , who deserved to be made happy!--And left a name behind [her]123-emma that would not soon die away .

Perfect happiness , even in memory , is not common ; and there were two points on which [she]123-emma was not quite easy . [She]123-emma doubted whether [she]123-emma had not transgressed the duty of [woman]749-woman by [woman]749-woman , in betraying [her]123-emma suspicions of [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax 's feelings to [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill . It was hardly right ; but it had been so strong an idea , that it would escape [her]123-emma , and [his]102-frank churchill submission to all that [she]123-emma told , was a compliment to [her]123-emma penetration , which made it difficult for [her]123-emma to be quite certain that [she]123-emma ought to have held [her]123-emma tongue .

The other circumstance of regret related also to [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax ; and there [she]123-emma had no doubt . [She]123-emma did unfeignedly and unequivocally regret the inferiority of [her]123-emma own playing and singing . [She]123-emma did most heartily grieve over the idleness of [her]123-emma childhood -- and sat down and practised vigorously an hour and a half .

[She]123-emma was then interrupted by [Harriet]111-harriet 's coming in ; and if [Harriet]111-harriet 's praise could have satisfied [her]123-emma , [she]123-emma might soon have been comforted .

“ Oh ! if [I]111-harriet could but play as well as [you]111-harriet and [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax ! ”[111-harriet]

“ Do n't class [us]4145-us together , [Harriet]111-harriet . [My]1636-they playing is no more like [her]152-miss fairfax 's , than a lamp is like sunshine . ”[1636-they]

“ Oh ! dear -- [I]111-harriet think [you]111-harriet play the best of [the two]3078-the two . [I]111-harriet think [you]111-harriet play quite as well as [she]152-miss fairfax does . [I]111-harriet am sure [I]111-harriet had much rather hear [you]111-harriet . [Every body last night]4147-every body last night said how well [you]111-harriet played . ”[111-harriet]

“ [Those who knew any thing about it]4148-those who knew any thing about it , must have felt the difference . The truth is , [Harriet]111-harriet , that [my]1636-they playing is just good enough to be praised , but [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax 's is much beyond it . ”[1636-they]

“ Well , [I]111-harriet always shall think that [you]111-harriet play quite as well as [she]152-miss fairfax does , or that if there is any difference [nobody]2718-nobody would ever find it out . [Mr. Cole]145-mr. cole said how much taste [you]111-harriet had ; and [Mr. Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill talked a great deal about [your]111-harriet taste , and that [he]102-frank churchill valued taste much more than execution . ”[111-harriet]

“ Ah ! but [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax has [them]4150-them both , [Harriet]111-harriet . ”[1636-they]

“ Are [you]111-harriet sure ? [I]111-harriet saw [she]152-miss fairfax had execution , but [I]111-harriet did not know [she]152-miss fairfax had any taste . [Nobody]2718-nobody talked about it . And [I]111-harriet hate Italian singing.--There is no understanding a word of it . Besides , if [she]152-miss fairfax does play so very well , [you]111-harriet know , it is no more than [she]152-miss fairfax is obliged to do , because [she]152-miss fairfax will have to teach . [The Coxes]224-the coxes were wondering last night whether [she]152-miss fairfax would get into [any great family]4152-any great family . How did [you]111-harriet think [the Coxes]224-the coxes looked ? ”[111-harriet]

“ Just as [they]224-the coxes always do -- very vulgar . ”[1636-they]

“ [They]1636-they told [me]111-harriet something , ”[111-harriet] said [Harriet]111-harriet rather hesitatingly ; “ but it is nothing of any consequence . ”[111-harriet]

[Emma]123-emma was obliged to ask what [they]1636-they had told [her]123-emma , though fearful of its producing [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton .

“ [They]1636-they told [me]1636-they -- that [Mr. Martin]116-mr. martin dined with [them]1636-they last Saturday . ”[1636-they]

“ Oh ! ”[1636-they]

“ [He]116-mr. martin came to [[their]1636-they father]3233-their father upon some business , and [he]116-mr. martin asked [him]116-mr. martin to stay to dinner . ”[1636-they]

“ Oh ! ”[1636-they]

“ [They]1636-they talked a great deal about [him]116-mr. martin , especially [Anne Cox]225-anne cox . [I]1636-they do not know what [she]225-anne cox meant , but [she]225-anne cox asked [me]1636-they if [I]1636-they thought [I]1636-they should go and stay [there]448-there again next summer . ”[1636-they]

“ [She]225-anne cox meant to be impertinently curious , just as such an [Anne Cox]225-anne cox should be . ”[1636-they]

“ [She]225-anne cox said [he]116-mr. martin was very agreeable the day [he]116-mr. martin dined [there]448-there . [He]116-mr. martin sat by [her]225-anne cox at dinner . [Miss Nash]117-miss nash thinks [either of [the Coxes]4157-the coxes]4156-either of the coxes would be very glad to marry [him]116-mr. martin . ”[1636-they]

“ Very likely.--I think [they]4157-the coxes are , without exception , [the most vulgar girls in [Highbury]3-highbury]4158-the most vulgar girls in highbury . ”[1636-they]

[Harriet]111-harriet had business at [Ford's.--Emma]226-ford's.--emma thought it most prudent to go with [her]111-harriet . Another accidental meeting with [the Martins]113-the martins was possible , and in [her]111-harriet present state , would be dangerous .

[Harriet]111-harriet , tempted by every thing and swayed by half a word , was always very long at a purchase ; and while [she]111-harriet was still hanging over muslins and changing [her]111-harriet mind , [Emma]123-emma went to the door for amusement.--Much could not be hoped from the traffic of even [the busiest part of [Highbury;--Mr]49-highbury;--mr]1637-the busiest part of highbury;--mr . [Perry]104-mrs. perry walking hastily by , [Mr. William Cox]216-mr. cox letting [himself]216-mr. cox in at [the office]1638-the office - door , [Mr. Cole]145-mr. cole 's carriage - horses returning from exercise , or [a stray letter - boy on an obstinate mule]1639-a stray letter - boy on an obstinate mule , were the liveliest objects [she]123-emma could presume to expect ; and when [her]123-emma eyes fell only on [the butcher]1351-the butcher with [his]1351-the butcher tray , [a tidy old woman travelling homewards from [shop]1642-shop with [her]1641-a tidy old woman travelling homewards from shop with her full basket full basket]1641-a tidy old woman travelling homewards from shop with her full basket , [two curs]1643-two curs quarrelling over a dirty bone , and [a string of dawdling children]1644-a string of dawdling children round [the baker]1645-the baker 's little bow - window eyeing the gingerbread , [she]123-emma knew [she]123-emma had no reason to complain , and was amused enough ; quite enough still to stand at the door . A mind lively and at ease , can do with seeing nothing , and can see nothing that does not answer .

[She]123-emma looked down [the Randalls road]1646-the randalls road . The scene enlarged ; [two persons]1647-two persons appeared ; [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston and [[her]88-mrs. weston son - in - law]1648-her son - in - law ; [they]1647-two persons were walking into [Highbury;--to Hartfield]50-highbury;--to hartfield of course . [They]1647-two persons were stopping , however , in the first place at [[Mrs. Bates]110-mrs. bates 's ; whose house was a little nearer [Randalls]101-randalls than [Ford 's]212-ford 's]1649-mrs. bates 's ; whose house was a little nearer randalls than ford 's ; and had all but knocked , when [Emma]123-emma caught [their]1647-two persons eye.--Immediately [they]1647-two persons crossed [the road]846-the road and came forward to [her]123-emma ; and the agreeableness of yesterday 's engagement seemed to give fresh pleasure to the present meeting . [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston informed [her]123-emma that [she]88-mrs. weston was going to call on [the Bateses]161-the bateses , in order to hear the new instrument .

“ For [[my]88-mrs. weston companion]4159-my companion tells [me]88-mrs. weston , ”[88-mrs. weston] said [she]88-mrs. weston , “ that [I]88-mrs. weston absolutely promised [Miss Bates]105-miss bates last night , that [I]88-mrs. weston would come this morning . [I]88-mrs. weston was not aware of it [myself]88-mrs. weston . [I]88-mrs. weston did not know that [I]88-mrs. weston had fixed a day , but as [he]4159-my companion says [I]88-mrs. weston did , [I]88-mrs. weston am going now . ”[88-mrs. weston]

“ And while [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston pays [her]105-miss bates visit , [I]102-frank churchill may be allowed , [I]102-frank churchill hope , ”[102-frank churchill] said [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill , “ to join [your]88-mrs. weston party and wait for [her]105-miss bates at [Hartfield]2-hartfield -- if [you]88-mrs. weston are going [home]562-home . ”[102-frank churchill]

[Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston was disappointed .

“ [I]88-mrs. weston thought [you]88-mrs. weston meant to go with [me]88-mrs. weston . [They]4161-they would be very much pleased . ”[88-mrs. weston]

“ [Me]88-mrs. weston ! [I]88-mrs. weston should be quite in the way . But , perhaps -- [I]88-mrs. weston may be equally in the way here . [Miss Woodhouse]84-miss woodhouse looks as if [she]84-miss woodhouse did not want [me]88-mrs. weston . [[My]88-mrs. weston aunt]4162-my aunt always sends [me]88-mrs. weston off when [she]84-miss woodhouse is shopping . [She]84-miss woodhouse says [I]88-mrs. weston fidget [her]84-miss woodhouse to death ; and [Miss Woodhouse]84-miss woodhouse looks as if [she]84-miss woodhouse could almost say the same . What am [I]88-mrs. weston to do ? ”[88-mrs. weston]

“ [I]123-emma am here on no business of [my]123-emma own , ”[123-emma] said [Emma]123-emma ; “ [I]123-emma am only waiting for [[my]123-emma friend]3149-my friend . [She]3149-my friend will probably have soon done , and then [we]4164-we shall go [home]562-home . But [you]123-emma had better go with [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston and hear the instrument . ”[123-emma]

“ Well -- if [you]123-emma advise it.--But ( with a smile ) if [Colonel Campbell]164-colonel campbell should have employed [a careless friend]4166-a careless friend , and if it should prove to have an indifferent tone -- what shall [I]88-mrs. weston say ? [I]88-mrs. weston shall be no support to [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston . [She]88-mrs. weston might do very well by [herself]88-mrs. weston . A disagreeable truth would be palatable through [her]88-mrs. weston lips , but [I]88-mrs. weston am the wretchedest being in [the world]403-the world at a civil falsehood . ”[88-mrs. weston]

“ [I]123-emma do not believe any such thing , ”[123-emma] replied [Emma.--“I]227-emma.--“i am persuaded that [you]123-emma can be as insincere as [[your]123-emma neighbours]4036-your neighbours , when it is necessary ; but there is no reason to suppose the instrument is indifferent . Quite otherwise indeed , if [I]88-mrs. weston understood [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax 's opinion last night . ”[88-mrs. weston]

“ Do come with [me]88-mrs. weston , ”[88-mrs. weston] said [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , “ if it be not very disagreeable to [you]123-emma . [It]4169-it need not detain [us]4170-we long . [We]4170-we will go to [Hartfield]2-hartfield afterwards . [We]4170-we will follow [them]4036-your neighbours to [Hartfield]2-hartfield . [I]88-mrs. weston really wish [you]123-emma to call with [me]88-mrs. weston . It will be felt so great an attention ! and [I]88-mrs. weston always thought [you]123-emma meant it . ”[88-mrs. weston]

[He]1651-he could say no more ; and with the hope of [Hartfield]93-miss woodhouse to reward [him]1651-he , returned with [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston to [Mrs. Bates]110-mrs. bates 's door . [Emma]123-emma watched [them]1652-them in , and then joined [Harriet]111-harriet at the interesting counter,--trying , with all the force of [her]111-harriet own mind , to convince [her]111-harriet that if [she]111-harriet wanted plain muslin it was of no use to look at figured ; and that a blue ribbon , be it ever so beautiful , would still never match [her]111-harriet yellow pattern . At last it was all settled , even to the destination of the parcel .

“ Should [I]123-emma send it to [Mrs. Goddard]109-mrs. goddard 's , [ma'am]4171-ma'am ? ”[4172-mrs. ford.--“yes] asked [Mrs. Ford.--“Yes]4172-mrs. ford.--“yes -- no -- yes , to [Mrs. Goddard]109-mrs. goddard 's . Only [my]4172-mrs. ford.--“yes pattern gown is at [Hartfield]2-hartfield . No , [you]123-emma shall send it to [Hartfield]2-hartfield , if [you]123-emma please . But then , [Mrs. Goddard]109-mrs. goddard will want to see it.--And [I]4172-mrs. ford.--“yes could take the pattern gown [home]562-home any day . But [I]4172-mrs. ford.--“yes shall want the ribbon directly -- so it had better go to [Hartfield]2-hartfield -- at least the ribbon . [You]123-emma could make it into two parcels , [Mrs. Ford]212-ford 's , could not [you]123-emma ? ”[4172-mrs. ford.--“yes]

“ It is not worth while , [Harriet]111-harriet , to give [Mrs. Ford]212-ford 's the trouble of two parcels . ”[4172-mrs. ford.--“yes]

“ No more it is . ”[4172-mrs. ford.--“yes]

“ No trouble in [the world]403-the world , [ma'am]4171-ma'am , ”[212-ford 's] said [the obliging Mrs. Ford]212-ford 's .

“ Oh ! but indeed [I]4172-mrs. ford.--“yes would much rather have it only in one . Then , if [you]123-emma please , [you]123-emma shall send it all to [Mrs. Goddard's]228-mrs. goddard's -- [I]4172-mrs. ford.--“yes do not know -- No , [I]4172-mrs. ford.--“yes think , [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse , [I]4172-mrs. ford.--“yes may just as well have it sent to [Hartfield]2-hartfield , and take it [home]562-home with [me]4172-mrs. ford.--“yes at night . What do [you]123-emma advise ? ”[4172-mrs. ford.--“yes]

“ That [you]123-emma do not give another half - second to the subject . To [Hartfield]2-hartfield , if [you]123-emma please , [Mrs. Ford]212-ford 's . ”[229-voices]

“ Aye , that will be much best , ”[111-harriet] said [Harriet]111-harriet , quite satisfied , “ [I]111-harriet should not at all like to have it sent to [Mrs. Goddard]109-mrs. goddard 's . ”[111-harriet]

[Voices]229-voices approached [the shop]3873-the shop -- or rather one voice and [two ladies]1654-two ladies : [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston and [Miss Bates]105-miss bates met [them]229-voices at the door .

“ [[My]1655-the latter dear]2714-my dear [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse , ”[1655-the latter] said [the latter]1655-the latter , “ [I]1655-the latter am just run across to entreat the favour of [you]93-miss woodhouse to come and sit down with [us]4178-us a little while , and give [us]4178-us [your]93-miss woodhouse opinion of [our]4178-us new instrument ; [you]93-miss woodhouse and [Miss Smith]111-harriet . “ [I]229-voices hope [Mrs. Bates]110-mrs. bates and [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax are-- ”[229-voices]

“ Very well , [I]1655-the latter am much obliged to [you]93-miss woodhouse . [[My]1655-the latter mother]3715-my mother is delightfully well ; and [Jane]152-miss fairfax caught no cold last night . How is [Mr. Woodhouse?--I]231-mr. woodhouse?--i am so glad to hear such a good account . [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston told [me]1655-the latter [you]93-miss woodhouse were here.--Oh ! then , said [I]1655-the latter , [I]1655-the latter must run across , [I]1655-the latter am sure [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse will allow [me]1655-the latter just to run across and entreat [her]88-mrs. weston to come in ; [[my]1655-the latter mother]3715-my mother will be so very happy to see [her]88-mrs. weston -- and now [we]4181-we are such a nice party , [she]88-mrs. weston can not refuse.--'Aye , pray do , ' said [Mr. Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill , ' [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse 's opinion of the instrument will be worth having . '--But , said [I]1655-the latter , [I]1655-the latter shall be more sure of succeeding if one of [you]93-miss woodhouse will go with me.--'Oh , ' said [he]1655-the latter , ' wait half a minute , till [I]1655-the latter have finished [my]1655-the latter job;'--For , would [you]93-miss woodhouse believe it , [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse , there [he]1655-the latter is , in the most obliging manner in [the world]403-the world , fastening in the rivet of [[my]1655-the latter mother]3715-my mother 's spectacles.--The rivet came out , [you]93-miss woodhouse know , this morning.--So very obliging!--For [[my]1655-the latter mother]3715-my mother had no use of [her]3715-my mother spectacles -- could not put them on . And , by the bye , [every body]2749-every body ought to have two pair of spectacles ; they should indeed . [Jane]152-miss fairfax said so . [I]1655-the latter meant to take [them]4186-them over to [John Saunders]232-john saunders the first thing [I]1655-the latter did , but something or other hindered [me]1655-the latter all the morning ; first one thing , then another , there is no saying what , [you]93-miss woodhouse know . At one time [Patty]196-patty came to say [she]196-patty thought the kitchen chimney wanted sweeping . Oh , said [I]1655-the latter , [Patty]196-patty do not come with [your]93-miss woodhouse bad news to [me]1655-the latter . Here is the rivet of [[your]93-miss woodhouse mistress]4187-your mistress 's spectacles out . Then the baked apples came [home]562-home , [Mrs. Wallis]233-mrs. wallis sent [them]4186-them by [[her]233-mrs. wallis boy]4189-her boy ; [they]4186-them are extremely civil and obliging to [us]4190-our , [the Wallises]4191-the wallises , always -- [I]1655-the latter have heard [some people]2762-some people say that [Mrs. Wallis]233-mrs. wallis can be uncivil and give a very rude answer , but [we]4190-our have never known any thing but the greatest attention from [them]2762-some people . And it can not be for the value of [our]4190-our custom now , for what is [our]4190-our consumption of bread , [you]93-miss woodhouse know ? Only three of [us.--besides]4193-us.--besides dear [Jane]152-miss fairfax at present -- and [she]233-mrs. wallis really eats nothing -- makes such a shocking breakfast , [you]93-miss woodhouse would be quite frightened if [you]93-miss woodhouse saw it . [I]1655-the latter dare not let [[my]1655-the latter mother]3715-my mother know how little [she]233-mrs. wallis eats -- so [I]1655-the latter say one thing and then [I]1655-the latter say another , and it passes off . But about the middle of the day [she]233-mrs. wallis gets hungry , and there is nothing [she]233-mrs. wallis likes so well as these baked apples , and they are extremely wholesome , for [I]1655-the latter took the opportunity the other day of asking [Mr. Perry]106-mr. perry ; [I]1655-the latter happened to meet [him]106-mr. perry in [the street]1208-the street . Not that [I]1655-the latter had any doubt before -- [I]1655-the latter have so often heard [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse recommend a baked apple . [I]1655-the latter believe it is the only way that [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse thinks the fruit thoroughly wholesome . [We]1656-they have apple - dumplings , however , very often . [Patty]196-patty makes an excellent apple - dumpling . Well , [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , [you]88-mrs. weston have prevailed , [I]1655-the latter hope , and [these ladies]4196-these ladies will oblige [us]1656-they . ”[1655-the latter]

[Emma]123-emma would be “ very happy to wait on [Mrs. Bates]110-mrs. bates , & c. , ”[123-emma] and [they]1656-they did at last move out of [the shop]3873-the shop , with no farther delay from [Miss Bates]105-miss bates than ,

“ How do [you]88-mrs. weston do , [Mrs. Ford]212-ford 's ? [I]229-voices beg [your]88-mrs. weston pardon . [I]229-voices did not see [you]88-mrs. weston before . [I]229-voices hear [you]88-mrs. weston have a charming collection of new ribbons from [town]2760-town . [Jane]105-miss bates came back delighted yesterday . Thank [ye]88-mrs. weston , the gloves do very well -- only a little too large about the wrist ; but [Jane]105-miss bates is taking them in . ”[229-voices]

“ What was [I]105-miss bates talking of ? ”[105-miss bates] said [she]105-miss bates , beginning again when [they]1656-they were all in [the street]1208-the street .

[Emma]123-emma wondered on what , of all the medley , [she]123-emma would fix .

“ [I]123-emma declare [I]123-emma can not recollect what [I]123-emma was talking of.--Oh ! [[my]123-emma mother]3715-my mother 's spectacles . So very obliging of [Mr. Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill ! ' Oh ! ' said [he]102-frank churchill , ' [I]123-emma do think [I]123-emma can fasten the rivet ; [I]123-emma like a job of this kind excessively . '--Which [you]123-emma know [shewed]4199-shewed [him]102-frank churchill to be so very .... Indeed [I]123-emma must say that , much as [I]123-emma had heard of [him]102-frank churchill before and much as [I]123-emma had expected , [he]102-frank churchill very far exceeds any thing .... [I]123-emma do congratulate [you]123-emma , [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , most warmly . [He]102-frank churchill seems every thing [the fondest parent]4200-the fondest parent could .... ' Oh ! ' said [he]102-frank churchill , ' [I]123-emma can fasten the rivet . [I]123-emma like a job of that sort excessively . ' [I]123-emma never shall forget [his]102-frank churchill manner . And when [I]123-emma brought out the baked apples from [the closet]4201-the closet , and hoped [[our]4202-we friends]3819-our friends would be so very obliging as to take some , ' Oh ! ' said [he]102-frank churchill directly , ' there is nothing in the way of fruit half so good , and these are the finest - looking home - baked apples [I]123-emma ever saw in [my]123-emma life . ' That , [you]123-emma know , was so very .... And [I]123-emma am sure , by [his]102-frank churchill manner , it was no compliment . Indeed they are very delightful apples , and [Mrs. Wallis]233-mrs. wallis does [them]4204-them full justice -- only [we]4202-we do not have them baked more than twice , and [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse made [us]4202-we promise to have them done three times -- but [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse will be so good as not to mention it . The apples themselves are the very finest sort for baking , beyond a doubt ; all from [Donwell]24-donwell -- some of [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley 's most liberal supply . [He]102-frank churchill sends [us]4202-we a sack every year ; and certainly there never was such a keeping apple anywhere as one of [[his]102-frank churchill trees]4205-his trees -- [I]123-emma believe there is two of them . [[My]123-emma mother]3715-my mother says [the orchard]4207-the orchard was always famous in [her]3715-my mother younger days . But [I]123-emma was really quite shocked the other day -- for [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley called one morning , and [Jane]105-miss bates was eating these apples , and [we]4202-we talked about them and said how much [she]105-miss bates enjoyed them , and [he]102-frank churchill asked whether [we]4202-we were not got to the end of [our]4202-we stock . ' [I]123-emma am sure [you]105-miss bates must be , ' said [he]102-frank churchill , ' and [I]123-emma will send [you]105-miss bates another supply ; for [I]123-emma have a great many more than [I]123-emma can ever use . [William Larkins]234-william larkins let [me]123-emma keep a larger quantity than usual this year . [I]123-emma will send [you]105-miss bates some more , before [they]4208-they get good for nothing . ' So [I]123-emma begged [he]102-frank churchill would not -- for really as to [ours]4202-we being gone , [I]123-emma could not absolutely say that [we]4202-we had a great many left -- it was but half a dozen indeed ; but they should be all kept for [Jane]105-miss bates ; and [I]123-emma could not at all bear that [he]102-frank churchill should be sending [us]4202-we more , so liberal as [he]102-frank churchill had been already ; and [Jane]105-miss bates said the same . And when [he]102-frank churchill was gone , [she]105-miss bates almost quarrelled with [me]123-emma -- No , [I]123-emma should not say quarrelled , for [we]4202-we never had a quarrel in [our]4202-we lives ; but [she]105-miss bates was quite distressed that [I]123-emma had owned the apples were so nearly gone ; [she]105-miss bates wished [I]123-emma had made [him]102-frank churchill believe [we]4202-we had a great many left . Oh , said [I]123-emma , [[my]123-emma dear]2714-my dear , [I]123-emma did say as much as [I]123-emma could . However , the very same evening [William Larkins]234-william larkins came over with a large basket of apples , the same sort of apples , a bushel at least , and [I]123-emma was very much obliged , and went down and spoke to [William Larkins]234-william larkins and said every thing , as [you]4210-you may suppose . [William Larkins]234-william larkins is such [an old acquaintance]4211-an old acquaintance ! [I]123-emma am always glad to see [him]234-william larkins . But , however , [I]123-emma found afterwards from [Patty]196-patty , that [William]234-william larkins said it was all the apples of _ that _ sort [[his]234-william larkins master]4212-his master had ; [he]234-william larkins had brought them all -- and now [[his]234-william larkins master]4212-his master had not one left to bake or boil . [William]234-william larkins did not seem to mind it [himself]234-william larkins , [he]234-william larkins was so pleased to think [[his]234-william larkins master]4212-his master had sold so many ; for [William]234-william larkins , [you]4210-you know , thinks more of [[his]234-william larkins master]4212-his master 's profit than any thing ; but [Mrs. Hodges]235-mrs. hodges , [he]234-william larkins said , was quite displeased at [their]4216-their being all sent away . [She]235-mrs. hodges could not bear that [[her]235-mrs. hodges master]4217-her master should not be able to have another apple - tart this spring . [He]234-william larkins told [Patty]196-patty this , but bid [her]196-patty not mind it , and be sure not to say any thing to [us]4218-us about it , for [Mrs. Hodges]235-mrs. hodges _ would _ be cross sometimes , and as long as so many sacks were sold , it did not signify who ate the remainder . And so [Patty]196-patty told [me]123-emma , and [I]123-emma was excessively shocked indeed ! [I]123-emma would not have [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley know any thing about it for [the world]403-the world ! [He]92-mr. knightley would be so very .... [I]123-emma wanted to keep it from [Jane]105-miss bates 's knowledge ; but , unluckily , [I]123-emma had mentioned it before [I]123-emma was aware . ”[123-emma]

[Miss Bates]105-miss bates had just done as [Patty]196-patty opened the door ; and [[her]105-miss bates visitors]629-her visitors walked [upstairs]1660-upstairs without having any regular narration to attend to , pursued only by the sounds of [her]105-miss bates desultory good - will .

“ Pray take care , [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , there is a step at the turning . Pray take care , [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse , ours is rather [a dark staircase]4220-a dark staircase -- rather darker and narrower than [one]2775-one could wish . [Miss Smith]111-harriet , pray take care . [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse , [I]105-miss bates am quite concerned , [I]105-miss bates am sure [you]93-miss woodhouse hit [your]93-miss woodhouse foot . [Miss Smith]111-harriet , the step at the turning . ”[105-miss bates]

CHAPTER X

The appearance of [the little sitting - room]1661-the little sitting - room as [they]1662-they entered , was tranquillity itself ; [Mrs. Bates]110-mrs. bates , deprived of [her]110-mrs. bates usual employment , slumbering on one side of the fire , [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill , at a table near [her]110-mrs. bates , most deedily occupied about [her]110-mrs. bates spectacles , and [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax , standing with [her]152-miss fairfax back to [them]1662-they , intent on [her]152-miss fairfax pianoforte .

Busy as [he]1663-i was , however , [the young man]532-the young man was yet able to shew a most happy countenance on seeing [Emma]123-emma again .

“ This is a pleasure , ”[1663-i] said [he]1663-i , in rather a low voice , “ coming at least ten minutes earlier than [I]1663-i had calculated . [You]123-emma find [me]1663-i trying to be useful ; tell [me]1663-i if [you]123-emma think [I]1663-i shall succeed . ”[1663-i]

“ What ! ”[88-mrs. weston] said [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , “ have not [you]1663-i finished it yet ? [you]1663-i would not earn a very good livelihood as [a working silversmith]4222-a working silversmith at this rate . ”[88-mrs. weston]

“ [I]1663-i have not been working uninterruptedly , ”[1663-i] [he]1663-i replied , “ [I]1663-i have been assisting [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax in trying to make [her]152-miss fairfax instrument stand steadily , it was not quite firm ; an unevenness in the floor , [I]1663-i believe . [You]123-emma see [we]4223-we have been wedging one leg with paper . This was very kind of [you]123-emma to be persuaded to come . [I]1663-i was almost afraid [you]123-emma would be hurrying [home]562-home . ”[1663-i]

[He]1663-i contrived that [she]88-mrs. weston should be seated by [him]1663-i ; and was sufficiently employed in looking out the best baked apple for [her]88-mrs. weston , and trying to make [her]88-mrs. weston help or advise [him]1663-i in [his]1663-i work , till [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax was quite ready to sit down to the pianoforte again . That [she]152-miss fairfax was not immediately ready , [Emma]123-emma did suspect to arise from the state of [her]123-emma nerves ; [she]123-emma had not yet possessed the instrument long enough to touch it without emotion ; [she]123-emma must reason [herself]123-emma into the power of performance ; and [Emma]123-emma could not but pity such feelings , whatever [their]1665-their origin , and could not but resolve never to expose [them]1665-their to [[her]123-emma neighbour]1557-her neighbour again .

At last [Jane]152-miss fairfax began , and though the first bars were feebly given , the powers of the instrument were gradually done full justice to . [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston had been delighted before , and was delighted again ; [Emma]123-emma joined [her]88-mrs. weston in all [her]88-mrs. weston praise ; and the pianoforte , with every proper discrimination , was pronounced to be altogether of the highest promise .

“ Whoever [Colonel Campbell]164-colonel campbell might employ , ”[102-frank churchill] said [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill , with a smile at [Emma]123-emma , “ [the person]4067-the person has not chosen ill . [I]102-frank churchill heard a good deal of [Colonel Campbell]164-colonel campbell 's taste at [Weymouth]23-weymouth ; and the softness of the upper notes [I]102-frank churchill am sure is exactly what [he]164-colonel campbell and _ all _ _ that _ _ party _ would particularly prize . [I]102-frank churchill dare say , [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax , that [he]164-colonel campbell either gave [[his]164-colonel campbell friend]830-his friend very minute directions , or wrote to [Broadwood]46-broadwood [himself]164-colonel campbell . Do not [you]152-miss fairfax think so ? ”[102-frank churchill]

[Jane]152-miss fairfax did not look round . [She]152-miss fairfax was not obliged to hear . [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston had been speaking to [her]152-miss fairfax at the same moment .

“ It is not fair , ”[123-emma] said [Emma]123-emma , in a whisper ; “ [mine]123-emma was a random guess . Do not distress [her]830-his friend . ”[123-emma]

[He]1667-he shook [his]1667-he head with a smile , and looked as if [he]1667-he had very little doubt and very little mercy . Soon afterwards [he]1667-he began again ,

“ How much [[your]152-miss fairfax friends in [Ireland]32-ireland]4227-your friends in ireland must be enjoying [your]152-miss fairfax pleasure on this occasion , [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax . [I]1667-he dare say [they]4227-your friends in ireland often think of [you]152-miss fairfax , and wonder which will be the day , the precise day of the instrument 's coming to hand . Do [you]152-miss fairfax imagine [Colonel Campbell]164-colonel campbell knows the business to be going forward just at this time?--Do [you]152-miss fairfax imagine it to be the consequence of an immediate commission from [him]164-colonel campbell , or that [he]164-colonel campbell may have sent only a general direction , an order indefinite as to time , to depend upon contingencies and conveniences ? ”[1667-he]

[He]1667-he paused . [She]1668-i could not but hear ; [she]1668-i could not avoid answering ,

“ Till [I]1668-i have a letter from [Colonel Campbell]164-colonel campbell , ”[1668-i] said [she]1668-i , in a voice of forced calmness , “ [I]1668-i can imagine nothing with any confidence . It must be all conjecture . ”[1668-i]

“ Conjecture -- aye , sometimes one conjectures right , and sometimes one conjectures wrong . [I]1668-i wish [I]1668-i could conjecture how soon [I]1668-i shall make this rivet quite firm . What nonsense [one]2775-one talks , [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse , when hard at work , if [one]2775-one talks at all;--your [real workmen]4230-real workmen , [I]1668-i suppose , hold [their]4230-real workmen tongues ; but [we]4231-we [gentlemen]675-gentlemen labourers if [we]4231-we get hold of a word -- [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax said something about conjecturing . There , it is done . [I]1668-i have the pleasure , [madam]3610-madam , ( to [Mrs. Bates]110-mrs. bates , ) of restoring [your]3610-madam spectacles , healed for the present . ”[1668-i]

[He]1669-i was very warmly thanked both by [mother]3738-mother and [daughter]649-daughter ; to escape a little from the latter , [he]1669-i went to the pianoforte , and begged [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax , who was still sitting at it , to play something more .

“ If [you]3610-madam are very kind , ”[1669-i] said [he]1669-i , “ it will be one of the waltzes [we]4231-we danced last night;--let [me]1669-i live them over again . [You]3610-madam did not enjoy them as [I]1669-i did ; [you]3610-madam appeared tired the whole time . [I]1669-i believe [you]3610-madam were glad [we]4231-we danced no longer ; but [I]1669-i would have given worlds -- all the worlds one ever has to give -- for another half - hour . ”[1669-i]

[She]152-miss fairfax played .

“ What felicity it is to hear a tune again which _ has _ made one happy!--If [I]1669-i mistake not that was danced at [Weymouth]23-weymouth . ”[1669-i]

[She]152-miss fairfax looked up at [him]1669-i for a moment , coloured deeply , and played something else . [He]1669-i took some music from a chair near the pianoforte , and turning to [Emma]123-emma , said ,

“ Here is something quite new to [me]1669-i . Do [you]123-emma know it?--Cramer.--And here are a new set of Irish melodies . That , from such a quarter , [one]2775-one might expect . This was all sent with the instrument . Very thoughtful of [Colonel Campbell]164-colonel campbell , was not it?--He knew [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax could have no music here . [I]1669-i honour that part of the attention particularly ; it [shews]4235-shews it to have been so thoroughly from the heart . Nothing hastily done ; nothing incomplete . True affection only could have prompted it . ”[1669-i]

[Emma]123-emma wished [he]1669-i would be less pointed , yet could not help being amused ; and when on glancing [her]123-emma eye towards [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax [she]123-emma caught the remains of a smile , when [she]123-emma saw that with all the deep blush of consciousness , there had been a smile of secret delight , [she]123-emma had less scruple in the amusement , and much less compunction with respect to [her.--This amiable , upright , perfect Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax was apparently cherishing very reprehensible feelings .

[He]1669-i brought all the music to [her]123-emma , and [they]1672-they looked it over together.--Emma took the opportunity of whispering ,

“ [You]123-emma speak too plain . [She]152-miss fairfax must understand [you]123-emma . ”[1669-i]

“ [I]1669-i hope [she]152-miss fairfax does . [I]1669-i would have [her]152-miss fairfax understand [me]1669-i . [I]1669-i am not in the least ashamed of [my]1669-i meaning . ”[1669-i]

“ But really , [I]1669-i am half ashamed , and wish [I]1669-i had never taken up the idea . ”[1669-i]

“ [I]1669-i am very glad [you]1669-i did , and that [you]1669-i communicated it to [me]1669-i . [I]1669-i have now a key to all [her]152-miss fairfax odd looks and ways . Leave shame to [her]152-miss fairfax . If [she]152-miss fairfax does wrong , [she]152-miss fairfax ought to feel it . ”[1669-i]

“ [She]152-miss fairfax is not entirely without it , [I]1669-i think . ”[1669-i]

“ [I]1669-i do not see much sign of it . [She]152-miss fairfax is playing _ [Robin _ _ Adair]237-robin _ _ adair _ at this moment--_his _ favourite . ”[1669-i]

Shortly afterwards [Miss Bates]105-miss bates , passing near the window , descried [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley on horse - back not far off .

“ [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley [I]105-miss bates declare!--I must speak to [him]92-mr. knightley if possible , just to thank [him]92-mr. knightley . [She]105-miss bates was in [the adjoining chamber]1673-the adjoining chamber while [she]105-miss bates still spoke , and opening the casement there , immediately called [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley 's attention , and every syllable of [their]1674-their conversation was as distinctly heard by [the others]870-the others , as if it had passed within [the same apartment]1676-the same apartment .

“ How d ' [ye]4237-you do?--how [d'ye]4242-d'ye do?--Very well , [I]92-mr. knightley thank [you]4237-you . So obliged to [you]4237-you for [the carriage]2719-the carriage last night . And [Miss Bates]105-miss bates was obliged to give a direct answer before [he]92-mr. knightley would hear [her]105-miss bates in any thing else . But [Emma]123-emma still shook [her]123-emma head in steady scepticism .

“ So obliged to you!--so very much obliged to [you]123-emma for [the carriage]2719-the carriage , ”[105-miss bates] resumed [Miss Bates]105-miss bates .

[He]92-mr. knightley cut [her]105-miss bates short with ,

“ Well , [I]92-mr. knightley am so sorry!--Oh ! “ Oh ! very delightful indeed ; [I]92-mr. knightley can say nothing less , for [I]92-mr. knightley suppose [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse and [Mr. Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill are hearing every thing that passes . And ( raising [his]102-frank churchill voice still more ) [I]92-mr. knightley do not see why [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax should not be mentioned too . [I]92-mr. knightley think [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax dances very well ; and [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston is the very best country - dance player , without exception , in [England]36-england . Now , if [[your]92-mr. knightley friends]3174-your friends have any gratitude , [they]3174-your friends will say something pretty loud about [you]92-mr. knightley and [me]92-mr. knightley in return ; but [I]92-mr. knightley can not stay to hear it . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ Oh ! [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley , one moment more ; something of consequence -- so shocked!--Jane and [I]92-mr. knightley are both so shocked about the apples ! ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ What is the matter now ? ”[92-mr. knightley]

[Mrs. Hodges]235-mrs. hodges may well be angry . [William Larkins]234-william larkins mentioned it here . [You]92-mr. knightley should not have done it , indeed [you]92-mr. knightley should not . Ah ! [he]234-william larkins is off . [He]234-william larkins never can bear to be thanked . “ Yes , ”[152-miss fairfax] said [Jane]152-miss fairfax , “ [we]4255-we heard [his]234-william larkins kind offers , [we]4255-we heard every thing . ”[152-miss fairfax]

“ Oh ! yes , [[my]92-mr. knightley dear]2714-my dear , [I]92-mr. knightley dare say [you]2714-my dear might , because [you]2714-my dear know , the door was open , and the window was open , and [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley spoke loud .
