“ [[My]207-mrs. elton father]2740-my father tried it more than once , formerly ; but without receiving any benefit ; and [Mr. Perry]106-mr. perry , whose name , [I]207-mrs. elton dare say , is not unknown to [you]1214-this girl , does not conceive it would be at all more likely to be useful now . ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ Ah ! that 's a great pity ; for [I]207-mrs. elton assure [you]1214-this girl , [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse , where the waters do agree , it is quite wonderful the relief they give . In [my]207-mrs. elton Bath life , [I]207-mrs. elton have seen such instances of it ! And it is so cheerful a place , that it could not fail of being of use to [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse 's spirits , which , [I]207-mrs. elton understand , are sometimes much depressed . And as to its recommendations to _ [you]1214-this girl _ , [I]207-mrs. elton fancy [I]207-mrs. elton need not take much pains to dwell on them . The advantages of [Bath]30-bath to [the young]4466-the young are pretty generally understood . It would be a charming introduction for [you]1214-this girl , who have lived so secluded a life ; and [I]207-mrs. elton could immediately secure [you]1214-this girl some of the best society in [the place]450-the place . A line from [me]207-mrs. elton would bring [you]1214-this girl a little host of acquaintance ; and [[my]207-mrs. elton particular friend]4468-my particular friend , [Mrs. Partridge]253-mrs. partridge , [the lady [I]207-mrs. elton have always resided with when in [Bath]30-bath]4469-the lady i have always resided with when in bath , would be most happy to shew [you]1214-this girl any attentions , and would be the very person for [you]1214-this girl to go into public with . ”[207-mrs. elton]

It was as much as [Emma]123-emma could bear , without being impolite . The idea of [her]123-emma being indebted to [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton for what was called an _ introduction_--of [her]123-emma going into public under the auspices of [a friend of [Mrs. Elton's]254-mrs. elton's]1822-a friend of mrs. elton's -- probably [some vulgar , dashing widow]1823-some vulgar , dashing widow , who , with the help of [a boarder]1824-a boarder , just made a shift to live!--The dignity of [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse , of [Hartfield]2-hartfield , was sunk indeed !

[She]123-emma restrained [herself]123-emma , however , from any of the reproofs [she]123-emma could have given , and only thanked [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton coolly ; “ but [their]4470-their going to [Bath]30-bath was quite out of the question ; and [she]207-mrs. elton was not perfectly convinced that [the place]450-the place might suit [her]207-mrs. elton better than [[her]207-mrs. elton father]425-her father . ”[207-mrs. elton] And then , to prevent farther outrage and indignation , changed the subject directly .

“ [I]207-mrs. elton do not ask whether [you]123-emma are musical , [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton . Upon these occasions , [a lady]2918-a lady 's character generally precedes [her]2918-a lady ; and [Highbury]3-highbury has long known that [you]123-emma are [a superior performer]4474-a superior performer . ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ Oh ! no , indeed ; [I]207-mrs. elton must protest against any such idea . [A superior performer!--very]4475-a superior performer!--very far from it , [I]207-mrs. elton assure [you]123-emma . Consider from how partial a quarter [your]123-emma information came . [I]207-mrs. elton am doatingly fond of music -- passionately fond;--and [[my]207-mrs. elton friends]2921-my friends say [I]207-mrs. elton am not entirely devoid of taste ; but as to any thing else , upon [my]207-mrs. elton honour [my]207-mrs. elton performance is _ mediocre _ to the last degree . [You]123-emma , [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse , [I]207-mrs. elton well know , play delightfully . [I]207-mrs. elton assure [you]123-emma it has been the greatest satisfaction , comfort , and delight to [me]207-mrs. elton , to hear what a musical society [I]207-mrs. elton am got into . [I]207-mrs. elton absolutely can not do without music . It is a necessary of life to [me]207-mrs. elton ; and having always been used to a very musical society , both at [Maple Grove]51-maple grove and in [Bath]30-bath , it would have been a most serious sacrifice . [I]207-mrs. elton honestly said as much to [Mr. E.]255-mr. e. when [he]255-mr. e. was speaking of [[my]207-mrs. elton future home]4477-my future home , and expressing [his]255-mr. e. fears lest the retirement of [it]4477-my future home should be disagreeable ; and the inferiority of [the house]435-the house too -- knowing what [I]207-mrs. elton had been accustomed to -- of course [he]255-mr. e. was not wholly without apprehension . When [he]255-mr. e. was speaking of it in that way , [I]207-mrs. elton honestly said that _ [the _ _ world]4479-the _ _ world _ [I]207-mrs. elton could give up -- parties , balls , plays -- for [I]207-mrs. elton had no fear of retirement . Blessed with so many resources within [myself]207-mrs. elton , [the world]403-the world was not necessary to _ [me]207-mrs. elton _ . [I]207-mrs. elton could do very well without it . To [those who had no resources]4481-those who had no resources it was a different thing ; but [my]207-mrs. elton resources made [me]207-mrs. elton quite independent . And as to [smaller - sized rooms than [I]207-mrs. elton had been used to]4482-smaller - sized rooms than i had been used to , [I]207-mrs. elton really could not give it a thought . [I]207-mrs. elton hoped [I]207-mrs. elton was perfectly equal to any sacrifice of that description . Certainly [I]207-mrs. elton had been accustomed to every luxury at [Maple Grove]51-maple grove ; but [I]207-mrs. elton did assure [him]255-mr. e. that [two carriages]3588-two carriages were not necessary to [my]207-mrs. elton happiness , nor were [spacious apartments]4484-spacious apartments . ' But , ' said [I]207-mrs. elton , ' to be quite honest , [I]207-mrs. elton do not think [I]207-mrs. elton can live without something of [a musical society]3906-a musical society . [I]207-mrs. elton condition for nothing else ; but without music , life would be a blank to [me]207-mrs. elton . ' ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ [We]4486-we can not suppose , ”[123-emma] said [Emma]123-emma , smiling , “ that [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton would hesitate to assure [you]207-mrs. elton of there being [a _ very _ musical society in [Highbury]3-highbury]4487-a _ very _ musical society in highbury ; and [I]123-emma hope [you]207-mrs. elton will not find [he]95-mr. elton has outstepped the truth more than may be pardoned , in consideration of the motive . ”[123-emma]

“ No , indeed , [I]207-mrs. elton have no doubts at all on that head . [I]207-mrs. elton am delighted to find [myself]207-mrs. elton in such a circle . [I]207-mrs. elton hope [we]4486-we shall have many sweet little concerts together . [I]207-mrs. elton think , [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse , [you]93-miss woodhouse and [I]207-mrs. elton must establish a musical club , and have regular weekly meetings at [[your]93-miss woodhouse house]3305-your house , or [ours]4486-we . Will not it be a good plan ? If _ [we]4486-we _ exert [ourselves]4486-we , [I]207-mrs. elton think [we]4486-we shall not be long in want of [allies]4489-allies . Something of that nature would be particularly desirable for _ [me]207-mrs. elton _ , as an inducement to keep [me]207-mrs. elton in practice ; for [married women]4490-married women , [you]93-miss woodhouse know -- there is a sad story against [them]4490-married women , in general . [They]4490-married women are but too apt to give up music . ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ But [you]93-miss woodhouse , who are so extremely fond of it -- there can be no danger , surely ? ”[123-emma]

“ [I]207-mrs. elton should hope not ; but really when [I]207-mrs. elton look around among [[my]207-mrs. elton acquaintance]4491-my acquaintance , [I]207-mrs. elton tremble . [Selina]252-selina has entirely given up music -- never touches the instrument -- though [she]252-selina played sweetly . And the same may be said of [Mrs. Jeffereys]256-mrs. jeffereys -- [Clara Partridge]257-clara partridge , that was -- and of the two [Milmans]258-milmans , now [Mrs. Bird]259-mrs. bird and [Mrs. James Cooper]90-james ; and of more than [I]207-mrs. elton can enumerate . Upon [my]207-mrs. elton word it is enough to put [one]2775-one in a fright . [I]207-mrs. elton used to be quite angry with [Selina]252-selina ; but really [I]207-mrs. elton begin now to comprehend that [a married woman]4493-a married woman has many things to call [her]4493-a married woman attention . [I]207-mrs. elton believe [I]207-mrs. elton was half an hour this morning shut up with [[my]207-mrs. elton housekeeper]4494-my housekeeper . ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ But every thing of that kind , ”[123-emma] said [Emma]123-emma , “ will soon be in so regular a train-- ”[123-emma]

“ Well , ”[207-mrs. elton] said [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton , laughing , “ [we]4495-we shall see . ”[207-mrs. elton]

[Emma]123-emma , finding [her]207-mrs. elton so determined upon neglecting [her]207-mrs. elton music , had nothing more to say ; and , after a moment 's pause , [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton chose another subject .

“ [We]4495-we have been calling at [Randalls]101-randalls , ”[207-mrs. elton] said [she]207-mrs. elton , “ and found [them]101-randalls both at [home]562-home ; and [very pleasant people]4497-very pleasant people [they]101-randalls seem to be . [I]207-mrs. elton like [them]101-randalls extremely . [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston seems [an excellent creature]2898-an excellent creature -- quite a first - rate favourite with [me]207-mrs. elton already , [I]207-mrs. elton assure [you]123-emma . And _ [she]207-mrs. elton _ appears so truly good -- there is something so motherly and kind - hearted about [her]207-mrs. elton , that it wins upon one directly . [She]207-mrs. elton was [[your]123-emma governess]4499-your governess , [I]207-mrs. elton think ? ”[207-mrs. elton]

[Emma]123-emma was almost too much astonished to answer ; but [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton hardly waited for the affirmative before [she]207-mrs. elton went on .

“ Having understood as much , [I]207-mrs. elton was rather astonished to find [her]207-mrs. elton so very lady - like ! But [she]207-mrs. elton is really quite [the gentlewoman]4500-the gentlewoman . ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston 's manners , ”[123-emma] said [Emma]123-emma , “ were always particularly good . [Their]4501-their propriety , simplicity , and elegance , would make [them]4501-their the safest model for [any young woman]4502-any young woman . ”[123-emma]

“ And who do [you]123-emma think came in while [we]4503-we were [there]448-there ? ”[207-mrs. elton]

[Emma]123-emma was quite at a loss . The tone implied [some old acquaintance]1825-some old acquaintance -- and how could [she]123-emma possibly guess ?

“ [Knightley]92-mr. knightley ! ”[207-mrs. elton] continued [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton ; “ [Knightley]92-mr. knightley himself!--Was not it lucky?--for , not being within when [he]92-mr. knightley called the other day , [I]207-mrs. elton had never seen [him]92-mr. knightley before ; and of course , as so particular [a friend of [Mr. E.]255-mr. e. 's]4505-a friend of mr. e. 's , [I]207-mrs. elton had a great curiosity . ' [[My]207-mrs. elton friend]3149-my friend [Knightley]92-mr. knightley ' had been so often mentioned , that [I]207-mrs. elton was really impatient to see [him]92-mr. knightley ; and [I]207-mrs. elton must do [my]207-mrs. elton caro sposo the justice to say that [he]92-mr. knightley need not be ashamed of [[his]92-mr. knightley friend]830-his friend . [Knightley]92-mr. knightley is quite [the gentleman]680-the gentleman . [I]207-mrs. elton like [him]92-mr. knightley very much . Decidedly , [I]207-mrs. elton think , [a very gentleman - like man]4509-a very gentleman - like man . ”[207-mrs. elton]

Happily , it was now time to be gone . [They]1826-they were off ; and [Emma]123-emma could breathe .

“ [Insufferable woman]4510-insufferable woman ! ”[123-emma] was [her]123-emma immediate exclamation . “ Worse than [I]123-emma had supposed . Absolutely insufferable ! [Knightley!--I]260-knightley!--i could not have believed it . [Knightley!--never]261-knightley!--never seen [him]92-mr. knightley in [her]207-mrs. elton life before , and call [him]92-mr. knightley [Knightley!--and]262-knightley!--and discover that [he]92-mr. knightley is [a gentleman]2822-a gentleman ! [A little upstart , vulgar being]4512-a little upstart , vulgar being , with [her]207-mrs. elton Mr. E. , and [her]207-mrs. elton _ caro _ _ sposo _ , and [her]207-mrs. elton resources , and all [her]207-mrs. elton airs of pert pretension and underbred finery . Actually to discover that [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley is [a gentleman]2822-a gentleman ! [I]123-emma doubt whether [he]92-mr. knightley will return the compliment , and discover [her]207-mrs. elton to be [a lady]2918-a lady . [I]123-emma could not have believed it ! And to propose that [she]207-mrs. elton and [I]123-emma should unite to form [a musical club]4515-a musical club ! [One]2775-one would fancy [we]4517-we were [bosom friends]4518-bosom friends ! And [Mrs. Weston!--Astonished]4519-mrs. weston!--astonished that [the person who had brought [me]123-emma up]4520-the person who had brought me up should be [a gentlewoman]4521-a gentlewoman ! Worse and worse . [I]123-emma never met with [[her]207-mrs. elton equal]4522-her equal . Much beyond [my]123-emma hopes . [Harriet]111-harriet is disgraced by any comparison . Oh ! what would [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill say to [her]111-harriet , if [he]102-frank churchill were [here]2707-here ? How angry and how diverted [he]102-frank churchill would be ! Ah ! there [I]123-emma am -- thinking of [him]102-frank churchill directly . Always [the first person to be thought of]4524-the first person to be thought of ! How [I]123-emma catch [myself]123-emma out ! [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill comes as regularly into [my]123-emma mind!”--[123-emma]

All this ran so glibly through [her]1827-she thoughts , that by the time [[her]1827-she father]425-her father had arranged [himself]425-her father , after the bustle of [the Eltons]143-the eltons ' departure , and was ready to speak , [she]1827-she was very tolerably capable of attending .

“ Well , [[my]425-her father dear]2714-my dear , ”[425-her father] [he]425-her father deliberately began , “ considering [we]4526-we never saw [her]1827-she before , [she]1827-she seems [a very pretty sort of young lady]3797-a very pretty sort of young lady ; and [I]425-her father dare say [she]1827-she was very much pleased with [you]2714-my dear . [She]1827-she speaks a little too quick . A little quickness of voice there is which rather hurts the ear . But [I]425-her father believe [I]425-her father am nice ; [I]425-her father do not like strange voices ; and [nobody]2718-nobody speaks like [you]2714-my dear and poor [Miss Taylor]84-miss woodhouse . However , [she]1827-she seems [a very obliging , pretty - behaved young lady]4529-a very obliging , pretty - behaved young lady , and no doubt will make [him]425-her father [a very good wife]4530-a very good wife . Though [I]425-her father think [he]425-her father had better not have married . [I]425-her father made the best excuses [I]425-her father could for not having been able to wait on [him]425-her father and [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton on this happy occasion ; [I]425-her father said that [I]425-her father hoped [I]425-her father _ should _ in the course of the summer . But [I]425-her father ought to have gone before . Not to wait upon [a bride]1796-a bride is very remiss . Ah ! it [shews]4532-shews what [a sad invalid]4533-a sad invalid [I]425-her father am ! But [I]425-her father do not like the corner into [Vicarage Lane]21-vicarage lane . ”[425-her father]

“ [I]1827-she dare say [your]425-her father apologies were accepted , [sir]2734-sir . [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton knows [you]425-her father . ”[1827-she]

“ Yes : but [a young lady]2768-a young lady -- [a bride]1796-a bride -- [I]425-her father ought to have paid [my]425-her father respects to [her]2768-a young lady if possible . It was being very deficient . ”[425-her father]

“ But , [[my]1827-she dear [papa]2708-papa]2954-my dear papa , [you]2708-papa are [no friend to matrimony]4539-no friend to matrimony ; and therefore why should [you]2708-papa be so anxious to pay [your]2708-papa respects to [a _ bride _]4540-a _ bride _ ? It ought to be no recommendation to _ [you]2708-papa _ . [It]4541-it is encouraging [people]2986-people to marry if [you]2708-papa make so much of [them]2986-people . ”[1827-she]

“ No , [[my]425-her father dear]2714-my dear , [I]425-her father never encouraged [any body]665-any body to marry , but [I]425-her father would always wish to pay every proper attention to [a lady]2918-a lady -- and [a bride]1796-a bride , especially , is never to be neglected . More is avowedly due to _ [her]1796-a bride _ . [A bride]1796-a bride , [you]2708-papa know , [[my]425-her father dear]2714-my dear , is always [the first in company]4549-the first in company , let [the others]870-the others be who [they]870-the others may . ”[425-her father]

“ Well , [papa]2708-papa , if this is not encouragement to marry , [I]1827-she do not know what is . And [I]1827-she should never have expected [you]2708-papa to be lending [your]2708-papa sanction to such vanity - baits for [poor young ladies]4552-poor young ladies . ”[1827-she]

“ [[My]123-emma dear]2714-my dear , [you]2714-my dear do not understand [me]123-emma . This is a matter of mere common politeness and good - breeding , and has nothing to do with any encouragement to [people to marry]4554-people to marry . ”[123-emma]

[Emma]123-emma had done . [[Her]123-emma father]425-her father was growing nervous , and could not understand _ [her]123-emma _ . [Her]123-emma mind returned to [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton 's offences , and long , very long , did [they]1830-they occupy [her]123-emma .

CHAPTER XV

[Emma]123-emma was not required , by any subsequent discovery , to retract [her]123-emma ill opinion of [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton . [Her]123-emma observation had been pretty correct . Such as [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton appeared to [her]123-emma on this second interview , such [she]207-mrs. elton appeared whenever [they]1831-they met again,--self - important , presuming , familiar , ignorant , and ill - bred . [She]207-mrs. elton had a little beauty and a little accomplishment , but so little judgment that [she]207-mrs. elton thought [herself]207-mrs. elton coming with superior knowledge of [the world]403-the world , to enliven and improve [a country neighbourhood]1833-a country neighbourhood ; and conceived [Miss Hawkins]197-miss hawkins to have held such a place in society as [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton 's consequence only could surpass .

There was no reason to suppose [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton thought at all differently from [[his]95-mr. elton wife]2763-his wife . [He]95-mr. elton seemed not merely happy with [her]2763-his wife , but proud . [He]95-mr. elton had the air of congratulating [himself]95-mr. elton on having brought [such a woman]1835-such a woman to [Highbury]3-highbury , as not even [Miss Woodhouse]84-miss woodhouse could equal ; and [the greater part of [her]2763-his wife new acquaintance]1836-the greater part of her new acquaintance , disposed to commend , or not in the habit of judging , following the lead of [Miss Bates]105-miss bates 's good - will , or taking it for granted that [the bride]1837-the bride must be as clever and as agreeable as [she]207-mrs. elton professed [herself]207-mrs. elton , were very well satisfied ; so that [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton 's praise passed from one mouth to another as it ought to do , unimpeded by [Miss Woodhouse]84-miss woodhouse , who readily continued [her]84-miss woodhouse first contribution and talked with a good grace of [her]84-miss woodhouse being “ very pleasant and very elegantly dressed . ”[84-miss woodhouse]

In one respect [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton grew even worse than [she]207-mrs. elton had appeared at first . [Her]207-mrs. elton feelings altered towards [Emma.--Offended]263-emma.--offended , probably , by the little encouragement which [her]207-mrs. elton proposals of intimacy met with , [she]207-mrs. elton drew back in [her]207-mrs. elton turn and gradually became much more cold and distant ; and though the effect was agreeable , the ill - will which produced it was necessarily increasing [Emma]123-emma 's dislike . [Her]207-mrs. elton manners , too -- and [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton 's , were unpleasant towards [Harriet]111-harriet . [They]1838-they were sneering and negligent . [Emma]123-emma hoped it must rapidly work [Harriet]111-harriet 's cure ; but the sensations which could prompt such behaviour sunk [them]1838-they both very much.--It was not to be doubted that poor [Harriet]111-harriet 's attachment had been an offering to conjugal unreserve , and [her]111-harriet own share in the story , under a colouring the least favourable to [her]111-harriet and the most soothing to [him]95-mr. elton , had in all likelihood been given also . [She]111-harriet was , of course , the object of [their]1838-they joint dislike.--When [they]1838-they had nothing else to say , it must be always easy to begin abusing [Miss Woodhouse]84-miss woodhouse ; and the enmity which [they]1838-they dared not shew in open disrespect to [her]84-miss woodhouse , found a broader vent in contemptuous treatment of [Harriet]111-harriet .

[Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton took a great fancy to [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax ; and from the first . Not merely when a state of warfare with [one young lady]1839-one young lady might be supposed to recommend [the other]739-the other , but from the very first ; and [she]111-harriet was not satisfied with expressing a natural and reasonable admiration -- but without solicitation , or plea , or privilege , [she]111-harriet must be wanting to assist and befriend her.--Before [Emma]123-emma had forfeited [her]123-emma confidence , and about the third time of [their]1838-they meeting , [she]123-emma heard all [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton 's knight - errantry on the subject.--

“ [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax is absolutely charming , [Miss Woodhouse.--I]264-miss woodhouse.--i quite rave about [Jane Fairfax.--A]265-jane fairfax.--a [sweet , interesting creature]4555-sweet , interesting creature . So mild and ladylike -- and with such talents!--I assure [you]4556-you [I]207-mrs. elton think [she]152-miss fairfax has very extraordinary talents . [I]207-mrs. elton do not scruple to say that [she]152-miss fairfax plays extremely well . [I]207-mrs. elton know enough of music to speak decidedly on that point . Oh ! [she]152-miss fairfax is absolutely charming ! [You]4556-you will laugh at [my]207-mrs. elton warmth -- but , upon [my]207-mrs. elton word , [I]207-mrs. elton talk of nothing but [Jane Fairfax.--And]265-jane fairfax.--a [her]152-miss fairfax situation is so calculated to affect [one!--Miss Woodhouse]84-miss woodhouse , [we]1841-we must exert [ourselves]1841-we and endeavour to do something for [her]152-miss fairfax . [We]1841-we must bring [her]152-miss fairfax forward . Such talent as [hers]152-miss fairfax must not be suffered to remain unknown.--I dare say [you]4556-you have heard those charming lines of [the poet]4557-the poet ,[207-mrs. elton]

' Full many a flower is born to blush unseen , ' And waste its fragrance on the desert air . '

[We]1841-we must not allow [them]1842-them to be verified in [sweet Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax . ”[152-miss fairfax]

“ [I]123-emma can not think there is any danger of it , ”[123-emma] was [Emma]123-emma 's calm answer--“and when [you]4556-you are better acquainted with [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax 's situation and understand what [[her]152-miss fairfax home]638-her home has been , with [Colonel]164-colonel campbell and [Mrs. Campbell]164-colonel campbell , [I]123-emma have no idea that [you]4556-you will suppose [her]152-miss fairfax talents can be unknown . ”[123-emma]

“ Oh ! but dear [Miss Woodhouse]84-miss woodhouse , [she]152-miss fairfax is now in such retirement , such obscurity , so thrown away.--Whatever advantages [she]152-miss fairfax may have enjoyed with [the Campbells]190-the campbells are so palpably at an end ! And [I]152-miss fairfax think [she]152-miss fairfax feels it . [I]152-miss fairfax am sure [she]152-miss fairfax does . [She]152-miss fairfax is very timid and silent . [One]2775-one can see that [she]152-miss fairfax feels the want of encouragement . [I]152-miss fairfax like [her]152-miss fairfax the better for it . [I]152-miss fairfax must confess it is a recommendation to [me]152-miss fairfax . [I]152-miss fairfax am a great advocate for timidity -- and [I]152-miss fairfax am sure [one]2775-one does not often meet with it.--But in [those who are at all inferior]4561-those who are at all inferior , it is extremely prepossessing . Oh ! [I]152-miss fairfax assure [you]84-miss woodhouse , [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax is a very delightful character , and interests [me]152-miss fairfax more than [I]152-miss fairfax can express . ”[152-miss fairfax]

“ [You]84-miss woodhouse appear to feel a great deal -- but [I]123-emma am not aware how [you]84-miss woodhouse or any of [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax 's acquaintance here , [any of those who have known [her]152-miss fairfax longer than [yourself]84-miss woodhouse]4562-any of those who have known her longer than yourself , can shew [her]152-miss fairfax any other attention than”--[123-emma]

“ [[My]152-miss fairfax dear]2714-my dear [Miss Woodhouse]84-miss woodhouse , a vast deal may be done by [those who dare to act]4564-those who dare to act . [You]84-miss woodhouse and [I]152-miss fairfax need not be afraid . If _ [we]4565-we _ set the example , [many]545-many will follow it as far as [they]545-many can ; though all have not [our]4565-we situations . _ [We]4565-we _ have [carriages]3506-carriages to fetch and convey [her]152-miss fairfax [home]562-home , and _ [we]4565-we _ live in a style which could not make the addition of [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax , at any time , the least inconvenient.--I should be extremely displeased if [Wright]266-wright were to send [us]4565-we up such a dinner , as could make [me]152-miss fairfax regret having asked _ more _ than [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax to partake of it . [I]152-miss fairfax have no idea of that sort of thing . It is not likely that [I]152-miss fairfax _ should _ , considering what [I]152-miss fairfax have been used to . [My]152-miss fairfax greatest danger , perhaps , in housekeeping , may be quite the other way , in doing too much , and being too careless of expense . [Maple Grove]51-maple grove will probably be [my]152-miss fairfax model more than it ought to be -- for [we]4565-we do not at all affect to equal [[my]152-miss fairfax brother]2939-my brother , [Mr. Suckling]251-mr. suckling , in income.--However , [my]152-miss fairfax resolution is taken as to noticing [Jane Fairfax.--I]267-jane fairfax.--i shall certainly have [her]152-miss fairfax very often at [[my]152-miss fairfax house]4570-my house , shall introduce [her]152-miss fairfax wherever [I]152-miss fairfax can , shall have musical parties to draw out [her]152-miss fairfax talents , and shall be constantly on the watch for an eligible situation . [My]152-miss fairfax acquaintance is so very extensive , that [I]152-miss fairfax have little doubt of hearing of something to suit [her]152-miss fairfax shortly.--I shall introduce [her]152-miss fairfax , of course , very particularly to [[my]152-miss fairfax brother]2939-my brother and [sister]3216-sister when [they]4573-they come to [us]4565-we . [I]152-miss fairfax am sure [they]4573-they will like [her]152-miss fairfax extremely ; and when [she]152-miss fairfax gets a little acquainted with [them]4573-they , [her]152-miss fairfax fears will completely wear off , for there really is nothing in the manners of either but what is highly conciliating.--I shall have [her]152-miss fairfax very often indeed while [they]4573-they are with [me]152-miss fairfax , and [I]152-miss fairfax dare say [we]4565-we shall sometimes find a seat for [her]152-miss fairfax in the barouche - landau in some of [our]4565-we exploring parties . ”[152-miss fairfax]

“ [Poor Jane Fairfax!”--thought]268-poor jane fairfax!”--thought[123-emma] [Emma.--“You]268-poor jane fairfax!”--thought have not deserved this . [You]268-poor jane fairfax!”--thought may have done wrong with regard to [Mr. Dixon]192-mr. dixon , but this is a punishment beyond what [you]268-poor jane fairfax!”--thought can have merited!--The kindness and protection of [Mrs. Elton!--'Jane Fairfax]269-mrs. elton!--'jane fairfax and [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax . ' Heavens ! Let [me]152-miss fairfax not suppose that [she]152-miss fairfax dares go about , [Emma Woodhouse]123-emma - ing me!--But upon [my]152-miss fairfax honour , there seems no limits to the licentiousness of [that woman]4574-that woman 's tongue ! ”[152-miss fairfax]

[Emma]123-emma had not to listen to such paradings again -- to any so exclusively addressed to [herself]123-emma -- so disgustingly decorated with a “ dear [Miss Woodhouse]84-miss woodhouse . ”[152-miss fairfax] The change on [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton 's side soon afterwards appeared , and [she]123-emma was left in peace -- neither forced to be [the very particular friend of [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton]1843-the very particular friend of mrs. elton , nor , under [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton 's guidance , [the very active patroness of [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax]1844-the very active patroness of jane fairfax , and only sharing with [others]2773-others in a general way , in knowing what was felt , what was meditated , what was done .

[She]123-emma looked on with some amusement.--Miss [Bates]105-miss bates 's gratitude for [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton 's attentions to [Jane]105-miss bates was in the first style of guileless simplicity and warmth . [She]123-emma was quite one of [[her]207-mrs. elton worthies]1846-her worthies -- [the most amiable , affable , delightful woman]1847-the most amiable , affable , delightful woman -- just as accomplished and condescending as [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton meant to be considered . [Emma]123-emma 's only surprize was that [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax should accept those attentions and tolerate [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton as [she]207-mrs. elton seemed to do . [She]123-emma heard of [her]152-miss fairfax walking with [the Eltons]143-the eltons , sitting with [the Eltons]143-the eltons , spending a day with [the Eltons]143-the eltons ! This was astonishing!--She could not have believed it possible that the taste or the pride of [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax could endure such society and friendship as [the Vicarage]844-the vicarage had to offer .

“ [She]152-miss fairfax is a riddle , quite a riddle ! ”[844-the vicarage] said she.--“To chuse to remain [here]2707-here month after month , under privations of every sort ! And now to chuse the mortification of [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton 's notice and the penury of [her]152-miss fairfax conversation , rather than return to [the superior companions who have always loved [her]152-miss fairfax]4576-the superior companions who have always loved her with such real , generous affection . ”[844-the vicarage]

[Jane]152-miss fairfax had come to [Highbury]3-highbury professedly for three months ; [the Campbells]190-the campbells were gone to [Ireland]32-ireland for three months ; but now [the Campbells]190-the campbells had promised [[their]190-the campbells daughter]3438-their daughter to stay at least till Midsummer , and fresh invitations had arrived for [her]152-miss fairfax to join [them]190-the campbells [there]448-there . According to [Miss Bates]105-miss bates -- it all came from [her]152-miss fairfax -- [Mrs. Dixon]191-mrs. dixon had written most pressingly . Would [Jane]105-miss bates but go , means were to be found , [servants]1339-servants sent , [friends]579-friends contrived -- no travelling difficulty allowed to exist ; but still [she]105-miss bates had declined it !

“ [She]105-miss bates must have some motive , more powerful than appears , for refusing this invitation , ”[123-emma] was [Emma]123-emma 's conclusion . “ [She]105-miss bates must be under some sort of penance , inflicted either by [the Campbells]190-the campbells or [herself]105-miss bates . There is great fear , great caution , great resolution somewhere.--She is _ not _ to be with [the _ Dixons]195-the dixons _ . The decree is issued by [somebody]604-somebody . But why must [she]105-miss bates consent to be with [the Eltons?--Here]270-the eltons?--here is quite a separate puzzle . ”[123-emma]

Upon [her]123-emma speaking [her]123-emma wonder aloud on that part of the subject , before [the few who knew [her]123-emma opinion of [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton]1853-the few who knew her opinion of mrs. elton , [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston ventured this apology for [Jane]105-miss bates .

“ [We]4578-we can not suppose that [she]105-miss bates has any great enjoyment at [the Vicarage]844-the vicarage , [[my]123-emma dear]2714-my dear [Emma]123-emma -- but it is better than being always at [home]562-home . [[Her]105-miss bates aunt]3293-her aunt is a good creature , but , as [a constant companion]4583-a constant companion , must be very tiresome . [We]4578-we must consider what [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax quits , before [we]4578-we condemn [her]105-miss bates taste for what [she]105-miss bates goes to . ”[123-emma]

“ [You]88-mrs. weston are right , [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , ”[92-mr. knightley] said [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley warmly , “ [[Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax]4584-miss fairfax is as capable as any of [us]4578-we of forming a just opinion of [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton . Could [she]207-mrs. elton have chosen with whom to associate , [she]207-mrs. elton would not have chosen [her]105-miss bates . But ( with a reproachful smile at [Emma]123-emma ) [she]105-miss bates receives attentions from [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton , which [nobody else]3698-nobody else pays [her]105-miss bates . ”[92-mr. knightley]

[Emma]123-emma felt that [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston was giving [her]123-emma a momentary glance ; and [she]123-emma was [herself]123-emma struck by [his]92-mr. knightley warmth . With a faint blush , [she]123-emma presently replied ,

“ Such attentions as [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton 's , [I]123-emma should have imagined , would rather disgust than gratify [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax . [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton 's invitations [I]123-emma should have imagined any thing but inviting . ”[123-emma]

“ [I]88-mrs. weston should not wonder , ”[88-mrs. weston] said [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , “ if [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax were to have been drawn on beyond [her]152-miss fairfax own inclination , by [[her]152-miss fairfax aunt]3293-her aunt 's eagerness in accepting [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton 's civilities for [her]152-miss fairfax . [Poor Miss Bates]105-miss bates may very likely have committed [[her]105-miss bates niece]1204-her niece and hurried [her]1204-her niece into a greater appearance of intimacy than [her]1204-her niece own good sense would have dictated , in spite of the very natural wish of a little change . ”[88-mrs. weston]

[Both]271-both felt rather anxious to hear [him]1854-him speak again ; and after a few minutes silence , [he]1854-him said ,

“ Another thing must be taken into consideration too -- [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton does not talk _ to _ [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax as [she]207-mrs. elton speaks _ of _ [her]152-miss fairfax . [We]4588-we all know the difference between the pronouns [he]4589-he or [she]4590-she and [thou]4591-thou , the plainest spoken amongst [us]4588-we ; [we]4588-we all feel the influence of a something beyond common civility in [our]4588-we personal intercourse with [each other]430-each other -- a something more early implanted . [We]4588-we can not give [any body]665-any body the disagreeable hints that [we]4588-we may have been very full of the hour before . [We]4588-we feel things differently . And besides the operation of this , as a general principle , [you]4594-you may be sure that [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax awes [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton by [her]152-miss fairfax superiority both of mind and manner ; and that , face to face , [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton treats [her]152-miss fairfax with all the respect which [she]152-miss fairfax has a claim to . [Such a woman]1835-such a woman as [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax probably never fell in [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton 's way before -- and no degree of vanity can prevent [her]152-miss fairfax acknowledging [her]152-miss fairfax own comparative littleness in action , if not in consciousness . ”[1854-him]

“ [I]123-emma know how highly [you]125-henry think of [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax , ”[123-emma] said [Emma]123-emma . [Little Henry]125-henry was in [her]123-emma thoughts , and a mixture of alarm and delicacy made [her]123-emma irresolute what else to say .

“ Yes , ”[125-henry] [he]125-henry replied , “ [any body]665-any body may know how highly [I]125-henry think of [her]152-miss fairfax . ”[125-henry]

“ And yet , ”[123-emma] said [Emma]123-emma , beginning hastily and with an arch look , but soon stopping -- it was better , however , to know the worst at once -- [she]123-emma hurried on--“And yet , perhaps , [you]125-henry may hardly be aware [yourself]125-henry how highly it is . The extent of [your]125-henry admiration may take [you]125-henry by surprize some day or other . ”[123-emma]

[Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley was hard at work upon the lower buttons of [his]92-mr. knightley thick leather gaiters , and either the exertion of getting them together , or some other cause , brought the colour into [his]92-mr. knightley face , as [he]92-mr. knightley answered ,

“ Oh ! are [you]123-emma there?--But [you]123-emma are miserably behindhand . [Mr. Cole]145-mr. cole gave [me]92-mr. knightley a hint of it six weeks ago . ”[92-mr. knightley]

[He]92-mr. knightley stopped.--Emma felt [her]123-emma foot pressed by [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , and did not [herself]123-emma know what to think . In a moment [he]92-mr. knightley went on--

“ That will never be , however , [I]92-mr. knightley can assure [you]123-emma . [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax , [I]92-mr. knightley dare say , would not have [me]92-mr. knightley if [I]92-mr. knightley were to ask [her]152-miss fairfax -- and [I]92-mr. knightley am very sure [I]92-mr. knightley shall never ask [her]152-miss fairfax . ”[92-mr. knightley]

[Emma]123-emma returned [[her]123-emma friend]427-her friend 's pressure with interest ; and was pleased enough to exclaim ,

“ [You]92-mr. knightley are not vain , [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley . [I]123-emma will say that for [you]92-mr. knightley . ”[123-emma]

[He]92-mr. knightley seemed hardly to hear [her]123-emma ; [he]92-mr. knightley was thoughtful -- and in a manner which shewed [him]92-mr. knightley not pleased , soon afterwards said ,

“ So [you]92-mr. knightley have been settling that [I]92-mr. knightley should marry [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax ? ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ No indeed [I]92-mr. knightley have not . [You]92-mr. knightley have scolded [me]92-mr. knightley too much for match - making , for [me]92-mr. knightley to presume to take such a liberty with [you]92-mr. knightley . What [I]92-mr. knightley said just now , meant nothing . [One]272-one says those sort of things , of course , without any idea of a serious meaning . Oh ! no , upon [my]92-mr. knightley word [I]92-mr. knightley have not the smallest wish for [your]92-mr. knightley marrying [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax or [Jane]152-miss fairfax any body . [You]92-mr. knightley would not come in and sit with [us]4597-us in this comfortable way , if [you]92-mr. knightley were married . ”[92-mr. knightley]

[Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley was thoughtful again . The result of [his]92-mr. knightley reverie was , “ No , [Emma]123-emma , [I]92-mr. knightley do not think the extent of [my]92-mr. knightley admiration for [her]152-miss fairfax will ever take [me]92-mr. knightley by surprize.--I never had a thought of [her]152-miss fairfax in that way , [I]92-mr. knightley assure [you]123-emma . ”[92-mr. knightley] And soon afterwards , “ [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax is [a very charming young woman]4598-a very charming young woman -- but not even [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax is perfect . [She]152-miss fairfax has a fault . [She]152-miss fairfax has not the open temper which [a man]2840-a man would wish for in [a wife]2759-a wife . ”[92-mr. knightley]

[Emma]123-emma could not but rejoice to hear that [she]123-emma had a fault . “ Well , ”[123-emma] said [she]123-emma , “ and [you]92-mr. knightley soon silenced [Mr. Cole]145-mr. cole , [I]123-emma suppose ? ”[123-emma]

“ Yes , very soon . [He]145-mr. cole gave [me]92-mr. knightley a quiet hint ; [I]92-mr. knightley told [him]145-mr. cole [he]145-mr. cole was mistaken ; [he]145-mr. cole asked [my]92-mr. knightley pardon and said no more . [Cole]145-mr. cole does not want to be wiser or wittier than [[his]145-mr. cole neighbours]541-his neighbours . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ In that respect how unlike dear [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton , who wants to be wiser and wittier than [all the world]4602-all the world ! [I]123-emma wonder how [she]207-mrs. elton speaks of [the Coles]184-the coles -- what [she]207-mrs. elton calls [them]184-the coles ! How can [she]207-mrs. elton find any appellation for [them]184-the coles , deep enough in familiar vulgarity ? [She]207-mrs. elton calls [you]4603-you , [Knightley]92-mr. knightley -- what can [she]207-mrs. elton do for [Mr. Cole]145-mr. cole ? And so [I]123-emma am not to be surprized that [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax accepts [her]152-miss fairfax civilities and consents to be with [her]152-miss fairfax . [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , [your]88-mrs. weston argument weighs most with [me]123-emma . [I]123-emma can much more readily enter into the temptation of getting away from [Miss Bates]105-miss bates , than [I]123-emma can believe in the triumph of [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax 's mind over [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton . [I]123-emma have no faith in [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton 's acknowledging [herself]207-mrs. elton [the inferior]4604-the inferior in thought , word , or deed ; or in [her]207-mrs. elton being under any restraint beyond [her]207-mrs. elton own scanty rule of good - breeding . [I]123-emma can not imagine that [she]207-mrs. elton will not be continually insulting [[her]207-mrs. elton visitor]1760-her visitor with praise , encouragement , and offers of service ; that [she]207-mrs. elton will not be continually detailing [her]207-mrs. elton magnificent intentions , from the procuring [her]207-mrs. elton a permanent situation to the including [her]207-mrs. elton in those delightful exploring parties which are to take place in [the barouche - landau]4445-the barouche - landau . ”[123-emma]

“ [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax has feeling , ”[273-mr. knightley--“i] said [Mr. Knightley--“I]273-mr. knightley--“i do not accuse [her]152-miss fairfax of want of feeling . [Her]152-miss fairfax sensibilities , [I]123-emma suspect , are strong -- and [her]152-miss fairfax temper excellent in its power of forbearance , patience , self - control ; but it wants openness . [She]152-miss fairfax is reserved , more reserved , [I]123-emma think , than [she]152-miss fairfax used to be -- And [I]123-emma love an open temper . “ Well , [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , ”[123-emma] said [Emma]123-emma triumphantly when [he]1856-he left [them]1857-them , “ what do [you]88-mrs. weston say now to [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley 's marrying [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax ? ”[123-emma]

“ Why , really , [dear Emma]123-emma , [I]123-emma say that [he]95-mr. elton is so very much occupied by the idea of _ not _ being in love with [her]152-miss fairfax , that [I]123-emma should not wonder if it were to end in [his]95-mr. elton being so at last . Do not beat [me]123-emma . ”[123-emma]

CHAPTER XVI

Every body in and about [Highbury]3-highbury who had ever visited [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton , was disposed to pay [him]95-mr. elton attention on [his]95-mr. elton marriage . Dinner - parties and evening - parties were made for [him]95-mr. elton and [[his]95-mr. elton lady]1858-his lady ; and invitations flowed in so fast that [she]1858-his lady had soon the pleasure of apprehending [they]1857-them were never to have a disengaged day .

“ [I]1858-his lady see how it is , ”[1858-his lady] said [she]1858-his lady . “ [I]1858-his lady see what a life [I]1858-his lady am to lead among [you]4607-you . Upon [my]1858-his lady word [we]4608-we shall be absolutely dissipated . [We]4608-we really seem quite the fashion . If this is living in [the country]611-the country , it is nothing very formidable . From Monday next to Saturday , [I]1858-his lady assure [you]4607-you [we]4608-we have [not a disengaged day!--A woman with fewer resources than [I]1858-his lady have]4610-not a disengaged day!--a woman with fewer resources than i have , need not have been at a loss . ”[1858-his lady]

No invitation came amiss to [her]1858-his lady . [Her]1858-his lady Bath habits made evening - parties perfectly natural to [her]1858-his lady , and [Maple Grove]51-maple grove had given [her]1858-his lady a taste for dinners . [She]1858-his lady was a little shocked at the want of [two drawing rooms]1859-two drawing rooms , at the poor attempt at rout - cakes , and there being no ice in the Highbury card - parties . [Mrs. Bates]110-mrs. bates , [Mrs. Perry]104-mrs. perry , [Mrs. Goddard]109-mrs. goddard and [others]2773-others , were a good deal behind - hand in knowledge of [the world]403-the world , but [she]1858-his lady would soon shew [them]1862-their how every thing ought to be arranged . In the course of the spring [she]1858-his lady must return [their]1862-their civilities by one very superior party -- in which [her]1858-his lady card - tables should be set out with [their]1862-their separate candles and unbroken packs in the true style -- and more waiters engaged for the evening than [[their]1862-their own establishment]1863-their own establishment could furnish , to carry round the refreshments at exactly the proper hour , and in the proper order .

[Emma]123-emma , in the meanwhile , could not be satisfied without a dinner at [Hartfield]2-hartfield for [the Eltons]143-the eltons . [They]1862-their must not do less than [others]2773-others , or [she]123-emma should be exposed to odious suspicions , and imagined capable of pitiful resentment . A dinner there must be . After [Emma]123-emma had talked about it for ten minutes , [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse felt no unwillingness , and only made the usual stipulation of not sitting at the bottom of the table [himself]85-mr. woodhouse , with the usual regular difficulty of deciding who should do it for [him]85-mr. woodhouse .

[The persons to be invited]1865-the persons to be invited , required little thought . Besides [the Eltons]143-the eltons , it must be [the Westons]108-the westons and [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley ; so far it was all of course -- and it was hardly less inevitable that [poor little Harriet]111-harriet must be asked to make the eighth:--but this invitation was not given with equal satisfaction , and on many accounts [Emma]123-emma was particularly pleased by [Harriet]111-harriet 's begging to be allowed to decline it . “ [She]111-harriet would rather not be in [his]85-mr. woodhouse company more than [she]111-harriet could help . [She]111-harriet was not yet quite able to see [him]85-mr. woodhouse and [[his]85-mr. woodhouse charming happy wife]4611-his charming happy wife together , without feeling uncomfortable . If [Miss Woodhouse]84-miss woodhouse would not be displeased , [she]111-harriet would rather stay at [home]562-home . ”[123-emma] It was precisely what [Emma]123-emma would have wished , had [she]123-emma deemed it possible enough for wishing . [She]123-emma was delighted with the fortitude of [[her]123-emma little friend]761-her little friend -- for fortitude [she]123-emma knew it was in [her]123-emma to give up being in company and stay at [home]562-home ; and [she]123-emma could now invite [the very person whom [she]123-emma really wanted to make the eighth , [Jane Fairfax.--]275-jane fairfax.-- Since [her]123-emma last conversation with [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston and [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley]1868-the very person whom she really wanted to make the eighth , jane fairfax.-- since her last conversation with mrs. weston and mr. knightley , [she]123-emma was more conscience - stricken about [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax than [she]123-emma had often been.--Mr . [Knightley]92-mr. knightley 's words dwelt with [her]123-emma . [He]92-mr. knightley had said that [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax received attentions from [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton which [nobody else]3698-nobody else paid [her]123-emma .

“ This is very true , ”[123-emma] said [she]123-emma , “ at least as far as relates to [me]123-emma , which was all that was meant -- and it is very shameful.--Of the same age -- and always knowing [her]152-miss fairfax -- [I]123-emma ought to have been more [her]152-miss fairfax friend.--She will never like [me]123-emma now . [I]123-emma have neglected [her]152-miss fairfax too long . But [I]123-emma will shew [her]152-miss fairfax greater attention than [I]123-emma have done . ”[123-emma]

Every invitation was successful . [They]1870-they were all disengaged and all happy.--The preparatory interest of this dinner , however , was not yet over . A circumstance rather unlucky occurred . [The two eldest little Knightleys]1871-the two eldest little knightleys were engaged to pay [[their]1871-the two eldest little knightleys grandpapa]1872-their grandpapa and [aunt]3628-aunt a visit of some weeks in the spring , and [[their]1871-the two eldest little knightleys papa]1874-their papa now proposed bringing [them]1871-the two eldest little knightleys , and staying one whole day at [Hartfield]2-hartfield -- which one day would be the very day of this party.--His professional engagements did not allow of [his]1874-their papa being put off , but both [father]3777-father and [daughter]649-daughter were disturbed by its happening so . [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse considered [eight persons at dinner]1877-eight persons at dinner together as the utmost that [his]85-mr. woodhouse nerves could bear -- and here would be a ninth -- and [Emma]123-emma apprehended that it would be a ninth very much out of humour at not being able to come even to [Hartfield]2-hartfield for forty - eight hours without falling in with a dinner - party .

[She]123-emma comforted [[her]123-emma father]425-her father better than [she]123-emma could comfort [herself]123-emma , by representing that though [he]425-her father certainly would make [them]1877-eight persons at dinner nine , yet [he]425-her father always said so little , that the increase of noise would be very immaterial . [She]123-emma thought it in reality a sad exchange for [herself]123-emma , to have [him]425-her father with [his]425-her father grave looks and reluctant conversation opposed to [her]123-emma instead of [[his]425-her father brother]824-his brother .

The event was more favourable to [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse than to [Emma]123-emma . [John Knightley]92-mr. knightley came ; but [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston was unexpectedly summoned to [town]2760-town and must be absent on the very day . [He]425-her father might be able to join [them]1877-eight persons at dinner in the evening , but certainly not to dinner . [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse was quite at ease ; and the seeing [him]425-her father so , with the arrival of [the little boys]1881-the little boys and the philosophic composure of [[her]123-emma brother]482-her brother on hearing [his]425-her father fate , removed [the chief]1883-the chief of even [Emma]123-emma 's vexation .

The day came , [the party]2949-the party were punctually assembled , and [Mr. John Knightley]92-mr. knightley seemed early to devote [himself]92-mr. knightley to the business of being agreeable . Instead of drawing [[his]92-mr. knightley brother]824-his brother off to a window while [they]1877-eight persons at dinner waited for dinner , [he]92-mr. knightley was talking to [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax . [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton , as elegant as lace and pearls could make [her]207-mrs. elton , [he]92-mr. knightley looked at in silence -- wanting only to observe enough for [Isabella]87-isabella 's information -- but [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax was [an old acquaintance]4211-an old acquaintance and [a quiet girl]1887-a quiet girl , and [he]92-mr. knightley could talk to [her]152-miss fairfax . [He]92-mr. knightley had met [her]152-miss fairfax before breakfast as [he]92-mr. knightley was returning from a walk with [[his]92-mr. knightley little boys]1888-his little boys , when it had been just beginning to rain . It was natural to have some civil hopes on the subject , and [he]92-mr. knightley said ,

“ [I]92-mr. knightley hope [you]152-miss fairfax did not venture far , [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax , this morning , or [I]92-mr. knightley am sure [you]152-miss fairfax must have been wet.--We scarcely got [home]562-home in time . [I]92-mr. knightley hope [you]152-miss fairfax turned directly . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ [I]152-miss fairfax went only to [the post - office]4614-the post - office , ”[152-miss fairfax] said [she]152-miss fairfax , “ and reached [home]562-home before the rain was much . It is [my]152-miss fairfax daily errand . [I]152-miss fairfax always fetch the letters when [I]152-miss fairfax am [here]2707-here . It saves trouble , and is a something to get [me]152-miss fairfax out . A walk before breakfast does [me]152-miss fairfax good . ”[152-miss fairfax]

“ Not a walk in the rain , [I]92-mr. knightley should imagine . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ No , but it did not absolutely rain when [I]152-miss fairfax set out . ”[152-miss fairfax]

[Mr. John Knightley]92-mr. knightley smiled , and replied ,

“ That is to say , [you]152-miss fairfax chose to have [your]152-miss fairfax walk , for [you]152-miss fairfax were not six yards from [your]152-miss fairfax own door when [I]92-mr. knightley had the pleasure of meeting [you]152-miss fairfax ; and [Henry]125-henry and [John]92-mr. knightley had seen more drops than [they]4617-they could count long before . [The post - office]4614-the post - office has a great charm at one period of [our]4619-our lives . When [you]152-miss fairfax have lived to [my]92-mr. knightley age , [you]152-miss fairfax will begin to think letters are never worth going through the rain for . ”[92-mr. knightley]

There was a little blush , and then this answer ,

“ [I]92-mr. knightley must not hope to be ever situated as [you]152-miss fairfax are , in the midst of every dearest connexion , and therefore [I]92-mr. knightley can not expect that simply growing older should make [me]92-mr. knightley indifferent about letters . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ Indifferent ! Oh ! no -- [I]92-mr. knightley never conceived [you]152-miss fairfax could become indifferent . Letters are no matter of indifference ; they are generally a very positive curse . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ [You]92-mr. knightley are speaking of letters of business ; mine are letters of friendship . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ [I]1889-i have often thought them the worst of the two , ”[1889-i] replied [he]1889-i coolly . “ Business , [you]92-mr. knightley know , may bring money , but friendship hardly ever does . ”[1889-i]

“ Ah ! [you]92-mr. knightley are not serious now . [I]92-mr. knightley know [Mr. John Knightley]92-mr. knightley too well -- [I]92-mr. knightley am very sure [he]92-mr. knightley understands the value of friendship as well as any body . [I]92-mr. knightley can easily believe that letters are very little to [you]152-miss fairfax , much less than to [me]92-mr. knightley , but it is not [your]152-miss fairfax being ten years older than [myself]92-mr. knightley which makes the difference , it is not age , but situation . [You]152-miss fairfax have every body dearest to [you]152-miss fairfax always at hand , [I]92-mr. knightley , probably , never shall again ; and therefore till [I]92-mr. knightley have outlived all [my]92-mr. knightley affections , a post - office , [I]92-mr. knightley think , must always have power to draw [me]92-mr. knightley out , in worse weather than to - day . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ When [I]92-mr. knightley talked of [your]152-miss fairfax being altered by time , by the progress of years , ”[92-mr. knightley] said [John Knightley]92-mr. knightley , “ [I]92-mr. knightley meant to imply the change of situation which time usually brings . [I]92-mr. knightley consider one as including the other . Time will generally lessen the interest of every attachment not within the daily circle -- but that is not the change [I]92-mr. knightley had in view for [you]152-miss fairfax . As [an old friend]4620-an old friend , [you]152-miss fairfax will allow [me]92-mr. knightley to hope , [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax , that ten years hence [you]152-miss fairfax may have as many concentrated objects as [I]92-mr. knightley have . ”[92-mr. knightley]

It was kindly said , and very far from giving offence . A pleasant “ thank [you]152-miss fairfax ”[92-mr. knightley] seemed meant to laugh it off , but a blush , a quivering lip , a tear in the eye , shewed that it was felt beyond a laugh . [Her]1890-her attention was now claimed by [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse , who being , according to [his]85-mr. woodhouse custom on such occasions , making the circle of [[his]85-mr. woodhouse guests]1891-his guests , and paying [his]85-mr. woodhouse particular compliments to [the ladies]627-the ladies , was ending with [her]1890-her -- and with all [his]85-mr. woodhouse mildest urbanity , said ,

“ [I]85-mr. woodhouse am very sorry to hear , [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax , of [your]152-miss fairfax being out this morning in the rain . [Young ladies]4621-young ladies should take care of [themselves.--Young ladies]4622-themselves.--young ladies are [delicate plants]4623-delicate plants . [They]4621-young ladies should take care of [their]4621-young ladies health and [their]4621-young ladies complexion . [[My]85-mr. woodhouse dear]2714-my dear , did [you]152-miss fairfax change [your]152-miss fairfax stockings ? ”[85-mr. woodhouse]

“ Yes , [sir]2734-sir , [I]85-mr. woodhouse did indeed ; and [I]85-mr. woodhouse am very much obliged by [your]2734-sir kind solicitude about [me]85-mr. woodhouse . ”[85-mr. woodhouse]

“ [[My]85-mr. woodhouse dear]2714-my dear [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax , [young ladies]4621-young ladies are very sure to be cared for.--I hope [[your]152-miss fairfax good grand - mama]4628-your good grand - mama and [aunt]3628-aunt are well . [They]4621-young ladies are [some of [[my]85-mr. woodhouse very old friends]4631-my very old friends]4630-some of my very old friends . [I]85-mr. woodhouse wish [my]85-mr. woodhouse health allowed [me]85-mr. woodhouse to be [a better neighbour]4632-a better neighbour . [You]152-miss fairfax do [us]4633-us a great deal of honour to - day , [I]85-mr. woodhouse am sure . [[My]85-mr. woodhouse daughter]3021-my daughter and [I]85-mr. woodhouse are both highly sensible of [your]152-miss fairfax goodness , and have the greatest satisfaction in seeing [you]152-miss fairfax at [Hartfield]2-hartfield . ”[85-mr. woodhouse]

[The kind - hearted , polite old man]1893-the kind - hearted , polite old man might then sit down and feel that [he]1893-the kind - hearted , polite old man had done [his]1893-the kind - hearted , polite old man duty , and made [every fair lady]1894-every fair lady welcome and easy .

By this time , the walk in the rain had reached [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton , and [her]207-mrs. elton remonstrances now opened upon [Jane]152-miss fairfax .

“ [[My]207-mrs. elton dear]2714-my dear [Jane]152-miss fairfax , what is this [I]207-mrs. elton hear?--Going to [the post - office]4614-the post - office in the rain!--This must not be , [I]207-mrs. elton assure [you.--You sad girl]4637-you.--you sad girl , how could [you]152-miss fairfax do such a thing?--It is a sign [I]207-mrs. elton was not there to take care of [you]152-miss fairfax . ”[207-mrs. elton]

[Jane]152-miss fairfax very patiently assured [her]152-miss fairfax that [she]152-miss fairfax had not caught any cold .

“ Oh ! do not tell _ [me]207-mrs. elton _ . [You]152-miss fairfax really are [a very sad girl]4638-a very sad girl , and do not know how to take care of yourself.--To [the post - office]4614-the post - office indeed ! [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , did [you]152-miss fairfax ever hear the like ? [You]152-miss fairfax and [I]207-mrs. elton must positively exert [our]4640-our authority . ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ [My]88-mrs. weston advice , ”[88-mrs. weston] said [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston kindly and persuasively , “ [I]88-mrs. weston certainly do feel tempted to give . [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax , [you]152-miss fairfax must not run such risks.--Liable as [you]152-miss fairfax have been to severe colds , indeed [you]152-miss fairfax ought to be particularly careful , especially at this time of year . The spring [I]88-mrs. weston always think requires more than common care . Better wait an hour or two , or even half a day for [your]152-miss fairfax letters , than run the risk of bringing on [your]152-miss fairfax cough again . Now do not [you]152-miss fairfax feel that [you]152-miss fairfax had ? Yes , [I]88-mrs. weston am sure [you]152-miss fairfax are much too reasonable . [You]152-miss fairfax look as if [you]152-miss fairfax would not do such a thing again . ”[88-mrs. weston]

“ Oh ! [she]207-mrs. elton _ shall _ _ not _ do such a thing again , ”[207-mrs. elton] eagerly rejoined [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton . “ [We]4640-our will not allow [her]207-mrs. elton to do such a thing again:”--and[207-mrs. elton] nodding significantly--“there must be some arrangement made , there must indeed . [I]88-mrs. weston shall speak to [Mr.]4641-mr. E. [The man who fetches [our]4640-our letters every morning ( one of [[our]4640-our men]4643-our men , [I]88-mrs. weston forget [his]4642-the man who fetches our letters every morning ( one of our men , i forget his name name]4642-the man who fetches our letters every morning ( one of our men , i forget his name ) shall inquire for [yours]152-miss fairfax too and bring them to [you]152-miss fairfax . “ [You]88-mrs. weston are extremely kind , ”[152-miss fairfax] said [Jane]152-miss fairfax ; “ but [I]152-miss fairfax can not give up [my]152-miss fairfax early walk . [I]152-miss fairfax am advised to be out of doors as much as [I]152-miss fairfax can , [I]152-miss fairfax must walk somewhere , and [the post - office]4614-the post - office is an object ; and upon [my]152-miss fairfax word , [I]152-miss fairfax have scarcely ever had a bad morning before . ”[152-miss fairfax]

“ [[My]88-mrs. weston dear]2714-my dear [Jane]152-miss fairfax , say no more about it . “ Excuse [me]152-miss fairfax , ”[152-miss fairfax] said [Jane]152-miss fairfax earnestly , “ [I]152-miss fairfax can not by any means consent to such an arrangement , so needlessly troublesome to [[your]152-miss fairfax servant]4651-your servant . “ Oh ! [[my]88-mrs. weston dear]2714-my dear ; but so much as [Patty]196-patty has to do!--And it is a kindness to employ [[our]4654-our men]4643-our men . ”[88-mrs. weston]

[Jane]152-miss fairfax looked as if [she]152-miss fairfax did not mean to be conquered ; but instead of answering , [she]152-miss fairfax began speaking again to [Mr. John Knightley]92-mr. knightley .

“ [The post - office]4614-the post - office is [a wonderful establishment]4657-a wonderful establishment ! ”[152-miss fairfax] said she.--“The regularity and despatch of [it]4614-the post - office ! If [one]2775-one thinks of all that it has to do , and all that it does so well , it is really astonishing ! ”[152-miss fairfax]

“ It is certainly very well regulated . ”[152-miss fairfax]

“ So seldom that any negligence or blunder appears ! So seldom that a letter , among the thousands that are constantly passing about [the kingdom]3644-the kingdom , is even carried wrong -- and not one in a million , [I]152-miss fairfax suppose , actually lost ! And when one considers the variety of hands , and of bad hands too , that are to be deciphered , it increases the wonder . ”[152-miss fairfax]

“ [The clerks]4660-the clerks grow expert from habit.--They must begin with some quickness of sight and hand , and exercise improves [them]4660-the clerks . If [you]2714-my dear want any farther explanation , ”[92-mr. knightley] continued [he]92-mr. knightley , smiling , “ [they]4660-the clerks are paid for it . That is the key to a great deal of capacity . [The public]4661-the public pays and must be served well . ”[92-mr. knightley]

The varieties of handwriting were farther talked of , and the usual observations made .

“ [I]92-mr. knightley have heard it asserted , ”[92-mr. knightley] said [John Knightley]92-mr. knightley , “ that the same sort of handwriting often prevails in [a family]3649-a family ; and where [the same master]4663-the same master teaches , it is natural enough . But for that reason , [I]92-mr. knightley should imagine the likeness must be chiefly confined to [the females]4664-the females , for [boys]3273-boys have very little teaching after an early age , and scramble into any hand [they]3273-boys can get . [Isabella]87-isabella and [Emma]123-emma , [I]92-mr. knightley think , do write very much alike . [I]92-mr. knightley have not always known [their]4666-their writing apart . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ Yes , ”[824-his brother] said [[his]92-mr. knightley brother]824-his brother hesitatingly , “ there is a likeness . [I]824-his brother know what [you]92-mr. knightley mean -- but [Emma]123-emma 's hand is the strongest . ”[824-his brother]

“ [Isabella]87-isabella and [Emma]123-emma both write beautifully , ”[85-mr. woodhouse] said [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse ; “ and always did . And so does [poor Mrs. Weston”--with]4667-poor mrs. weston”--with[85-mr. woodhouse] half a sigh and half a smile at [her]1896-her .

“ [I]88-mrs. weston never saw [any gentleman]4668-any gentleman 's handwriting”--Emma[88-mrs. weston] began , looking also at [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston ; but stopped , on perceiving that [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston was attending to [some one else]1897-some one else -- and the pause gave [her]88-mrs. weston time to reflect , “ Now , how am [I]88-mrs. weston going to introduce him?--Am [I]88-mrs. weston unequal to speaking [his]824-his brother name at once before [all these people]4669-all these people ? Is it necessary for [me]88-mrs. weston to use any roundabout phrase?--Your Yorkshire friend -- [[your]92-mr. knightley correspondent]4670-your correspondent in [Yorkshire;--that]53-yorkshire;--that would be the way , [I]88-mrs. weston suppose , if [I]88-mrs. weston were very bad.--No , [I]88-mrs. weston can pronounce [his]824-his brother name without the smallest distress . [I]88-mrs. weston certainly get better and better.--Now for it . ”[88-mrs. weston]

[Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston was disengaged and [Emma]123-emma began again--“Mr . [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill writes one of the best gentleman 's hands [I]123-emma ever saw . ”[123-emma]

“ [I]92-mr. knightley do not admire it , ”[92-mr. knightley] said [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley . “ It is too small -- wants strength . It is like [a woman]2864-a woman 's writing . ”[92-mr. knightley]

This was not submitted to by [either lady]1898-either lady . [They]1899-they vindicated [him]92-mr. knightley against the base aspersion . “ No , it by no means wanted strength -- it was not a large hand , but very clear and certainly strong . Had not [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston any letter about [her]88-mrs. weston to produce ? ”[1899-they] No , [she]123-emma had heard from [him]92-mr. knightley very lately , but having answered the letter , had put it away .

“ If [we]4672-we were in [the other room]3532-the other room , ”[123-emma] said [Emma]123-emma , “ if [I]123-emma had [my]123-emma writing - desk , [I]123-emma am sure [I]123-emma could produce a specimen . [I]123-emma have a note of his.--Do not [you]88-mrs. weston remember , [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , employing [him]92-mr. knightley to write for [you]88-mrs. weston one day ? ”[123-emma]

“ [He]92-mr. knightley chose to say [he]92-mr. knightley was employed”--[1899-they]

“ Well , well , [I]123-emma have that note ; and can shew it after dinner to convince [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley . ”[123-emma]

“ Oh ! when [a gallant young man]4674-a gallant young man , like [Mr. Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill , ”[92-mr. knightley] said [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley dryly , “ writes to [a fair lady]4675-a fair lady like [Miss Woodhouse]84-miss woodhouse , [he]92-mr. knightley will , of course , put forth [his]92-mr. knightley best . ”[92-mr. knightley]

Dinner was on table.--Mrs . [Elton]207-mrs. elton , before [she]207-mrs. elton could be spoken to , was ready ; and before [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse had reached [her]207-mrs. elton with [his]85-mr. woodhouse request to be allowed to hand [her]207-mrs. elton into [the dining - parlour]1900-the dining - parlour , was saying--

“ Must [I]85-mr. woodhouse go first ? [I]85-mr. woodhouse really am ashamed of always leading the way . ”[85-mr. woodhouse]

[Jane]152-miss fairfax 's solicitude about fetching [her]152-miss fairfax own letters had not escaped [Emma]123-emma . [She]152-miss fairfax had heard and seen it all ; and felt some curiosity to know whether the wet walk of this morning had produced any . [She]152-miss fairfax suspected that it _ had _ ; that it would not have been so resolutely encountered but in full expectation of hearing from [some one very dear]1901-some one very dear , and that it had not been in vain . [She]152-miss fairfax thought there was an air of greater happiness than usual -- a glow both of complexion and spirits .

[She]152-miss fairfax could have made an inquiry or two , as to the expedition and the expense of the Irish mails;--it was at [her]152-miss fairfax tongue 's end -- but [she]152-miss fairfax abstained . [She]152-miss fairfax was quite determined not to utter a word that should hurt [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax 's feelings ; and [they]1902-they followed [the other ladies]1573-the other ladies out of [the room]701-the room , arm in arm , with an appearance of good - will highly becoming to the beauty and grace of each .

CHAPTER XVII

When [the ladies]627-the ladies returned to [the drawing - room]3531-the drawing - room after dinner , [Emma]123-emma found it hardly possible to prevent [their]627-the ladies making two distinct parties;--with so much perseverance in judging and behaving ill did [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton engross [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax and slight [herself]152-miss fairfax . [She]152-miss fairfax and [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston were obliged to be almost always either talking together or silent together . [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton left [them]627-the ladies no choice . If [Jane]152-miss fairfax repressed [her]152-miss fairfax for a little time , [she]152-miss fairfax soon began again ; and though much that passed between [them]627-the ladies was in a half - whisper , especially on [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton 's side , there was no avoiding a knowledge of [[their]627-the ladies principal subjects]1907-their principal subjects : The post - office -- catching cold -- fetching letters -- and friendship , were long under discussion ; and to [them]627-the ladies succeeded one , which must be at least equally unpleasant to [Jane]152-miss fairfax -- inquiries whether [she]152-miss fairfax had yet heard of any situation likely to suit [her]152-miss fairfax , and professions of [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton 's meditated activity .

“ Here is April come ! ”[152-miss fairfax] said [she]152-miss fairfax , “ [I]152-miss fairfax get quite anxious about [you]207-mrs. elton . [June]276-june will soon be here . ”[152-miss fairfax]

“ But [I]627-the ladies have never fixed on [June]276-june or any other month -- merely looked forward to the summer in general . ”[627-the ladies]

“ But have [you]207-mrs. elton really heard of nothing ? ”[152-miss fairfax]

“ [I]627-the ladies have not even made any inquiry ; [I]627-the ladies do not wish to make any yet . ”[627-the ladies]

“ Oh ! [my]152-miss fairfax dear , [we]627-the ladies can not begin too early ; [you]207-mrs. elton are not aware of the difficulty of procuring exactly the desirable thing . ”[152-miss fairfax]

“ [I]152-miss fairfax not aware ! ”[152-miss fairfax] said [Jane]152-miss fairfax , shaking [her]152-miss fairfax head ; “ dear [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton , who can have thought of it as [I]152-miss fairfax have done ? ”[152-miss fairfax]

“ But [you]207-mrs. elton have not seen so much of [the world]403-the world as [I]152-miss fairfax have . [You]207-mrs. elton do not know how many candidates there always are for the _ first _ situations . [I]152-miss fairfax saw a vast deal of that in [the neighbourhood round [Maple Grove]51-maple grove]4677-the neighbourhood round maple grove . [A cousin of [Mr. Suckling]251-mr. suckling]4678-a cousin of mr. suckling , [Mrs. Bragge]277-mrs. bragge , had such an infinity of applications ; [every body]2749-every body was anxious to be in [[her]277-mrs. bragge family]2871-her family , for [she]277-mrs. bragge moves in the first circle . Wax - candles in [the schoolroom]4681-the schoolroom ! [You]207-mrs. elton may imagine how desirable ! Of [all houses in [the kingdom]3644-the kingdom [Mrs. Bragge]277-mrs. bragge 's]4682-all houses in the kingdom mrs. bragge 's is the one [I]152-miss fairfax would most wish to see [you]207-mrs. elton in . ”[152-miss fairfax]

“ [Colonel]164-colonel campbell and [Mrs. Campbell]164-colonel campbell are to be in [town]2760-town again by midsummer , ”[152-miss fairfax] said [Jane]152-miss fairfax . “ [I]152-miss fairfax must spend some time with [them]4685-them ; [I]152-miss fairfax am sure [they]4685-them will want it;--afterwards [I]152-miss fairfax may probably be glad to dispose of [myself]152-miss fairfax . But [I]152-miss fairfax would not wish [you]207-mrs. elton to take the trouble of making any inquiries at present . ”[152-miss fairfax]

“ Trouble ! aye , [I]152-miss fairfax know [your]207-mrs. elton scruples . [You]207-mrs. elton are afraid of giving [me]152-miss fairfax trouble ; but [I]152-miss fairfax assure [you]207-mrs. elton , [[my]152-miss fairfax dear]2714-my dear [Jane]152-miss fairfax , [the Campbells]190-the campbells can hardly be more interested about [you]207-mrs. elton than [I]152-miss fairfax am . [I]152-miss fairfax shall write to [Mrs. Partridge]253-mrs. partridge in a day or two , and shall give [her]253-mrs. partridge a strict charge to be on the look - out for any thing eligible . ”[152-miss fairfax]

“ Thank [you]207-mrs. elton , but [I]152-miss fairfax would rather [you]207-mrs. elton did not mention the subject to [her]253-mrs. partridge ; till the time draws nearer , [I]152-miss fairfax do not wish to be giving any body trouble . ”[152-miss fairfax]

“ But , [[my]152-miss fairfax dear child]4687-my dear child , the time is drawing near ; here is April , and June , or say even July , is very near , with such business to accomplish before [us]4688-us . [Your]207-mrs. elton inexperience really amuses [me]152-miss fairfax !
