“ Excuse [me]152-miss fairfax , [ma'am]4171-ma'am , but this is by no means [my]152-miss fairfax intention ; [I]152-miss fairfax make no inquiry [myself]152-miss fairfax , and should be sorry to have any made by [[my]152-miss fairfax friends]2921-my friends . When [I]152-miss fairfax am quite determined as to the time , [I]152-miss fairfax am not at all afraid of being long unemployed . There are places in [town]2760-town , [offices]4693-offices , where inquiry would soon produce something -- [Offices]4693-offices for the sale -- not quite of [human flesh]4695-human flesh -- but of human intellect . ”[152-miss fairfax]

“ Oh ! [my]152-miss fairfax dear , [human flesh]4695-human flesh ! [You]207-mrs. elton quite shock [me]152-miss fairfax ; if [you]207-mrs. elton mean a fling at the slave - trade , [I]152-miss fairfax assure [you]207-mrs. elton [Mr. Suckling]251-mr. suckling was always rather [a friend to the abolition]4697-a friend to the abolition . ”[152-miss fairfax]

“ [I]152-miss fairfax did not mean , [I]152-miss fairfax was not thinking of the slave - trade , ”[152-miss fairfax] replied [Jane]152-miss fairfax ; “ [governess - trade]4698-governess - trade , [I]152-miss fairfax assure [you]207-mrs. elton , was all that [I]152-miss fairfax had in view ; widely different certainly as to the guilt of [those who carry it on]4699-those who carry it on ; but as to the greater misery of [the victims]4700-the victims , [I]152-miss fairfax do not know where it lies . But [I]152-miss fairfax only mean to say that there are advertising [offices]4693-offices , and that by applying to [them]4693-offices [I]152-miss fairfax should have no doubt of very soon meeting with something that would do . ”[152-miss fairfax]

“ Something that would do ! ”[207-mrs. elton] repeated [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton . “ Aye , _ that _ may suit [your]207-mrs. elton humble ideas of yourself;--I know what [a modest creature]4702-a modest creature [you]207-mrs. elton are ; but it will not satisfy [[your]207-mrs. elton friends]3174-your friends to have [you]207-mrs. elton taking up with any thing that may offer , any inferior , commonplace situation , in [a family not moving in a certain circle , or able to command the elegancies of life]4704-a family not moving in a certain circle , or able to command the elegancies of life . ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ [You]207-mrs. elton are very obliging ; but as to all that , [I]152-miss fairfax am very indifferent ; it would be no object to [me]152-miss fairfax to be with [the rich]4705-the rich ; [my]152-miss fairfax mortifications , [I]152-miss fairfax think , would only be the greater ; [I]152-miss fairfax should suffer more from comparison . [[A gentleman]2822-a gentleman 's family]4707-a gentleman 's family is all that [I]152-miss fairfax should condition for . ”[152-miss fairfax]

“ [I]207-mrs. elton know [you]207-mrs. elton , [I]207-mrs. elton know [you]207-mrs. elton ; [you]207-mrs. elton would take up with any thing ; but [I]207-mrs. elton shall be a little more nice , and [I]207-mrs. elton am sure [the good Campbells]4708-the good campbells will be quite on [my]207-mrs. elton side ; with [your]207-mrs. elton superior talents , [you]207-mrs. elton have a right to move in the first circle . [Your]207-mrs. elton musical knowledge alone would entitle [you]207-mrs. elton to name [your]207-mrs. elton own terms , have as many rooms as [you]207-mrs. elton like , and mix in [the family]433-the family as much as [you]207-mrs. elton chose;--that is -- [I]207-mrs. elton do not know -- if [you]207-mrs. elton knew the harp , [you]207-mrs. elton might do all that , [I]207-mrs. elton am very sure ; but [you]207-mrs. elton sing as well as play;--yes , [I]207-mrs. elton really believe [you]207-mrs. elton might , even without the harp , stipulate for what [you]207-mrs. elton chose;--and [you]207-mrs. elton must and shall be delightfully , honourably and comfortably settled before [the Campbells]190-the campbells or [I]207-mrs. elton have any rest . ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ [You]207-mrs. elton may well class the delight , the honour , and the comfort of such a situation together , ”[152-miss fairfax] said [Jane]152-miss fairfax , “ [they]4710-they are pretty sure to be equal ; however , [I]152-miss fairfax am very serious in not wishing any thing to be attempted at present for [me]152-miss fairfax . [I]152-miss fairfax am exceedingly obliged to [you]207-mrs. elton , [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton , [I]152-miss fairfax am obliged to [any body who feels for [me]152-miss fairfax]4711-any body who feels for me , but [I]152-miss fairfax am quite serious in wishing nothing to be done till the summer . For two or three months longer [I]152-miss fairfax shall remain where [I]152-miss fairfax am , and as [I]152-miss fairfax am . ”[152-miss fairfax]

“ And [I]207-mrs. elton am quite serious too , [I]207-mrs. elton assure [you]207-mrs. elton , ”[207-mrs. elton] replied [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton gaily , “ in resolving to be always on the watch , and employing [[my]207-mrs. elton friends]2921-my friends to watch also , that nothing really unexceptionable may pass [us]4713-us . ”[207-mrs. elton]

In this style [she]207-mrs. elton ran on ; never thoroughly stopped by any thing till [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse came into [the room]701-the room ; [her]207-mrs. elton vanity had then a change of object , and [Emma]123-emma heard [her]207-mrs. elton saying in the same half - whisper to [Jane]152-miss fairfax ,

“ Here comes [this dear old beau of [mine]207-mrs. elton]4714-this dear old beau of mine , [I]207-mrs. elton protest!--Only think of [his]4714-this dear old beau of mine gallantry in coming away before the other men!--what a dear creature [he]4714-this dear old beau of mine is;--I assure [you]207-mrs. elton [I]207-mrs. elton like [him]4714-this dear old beau of mine excessively . [I]207-mrs. elton admire all that quaint , old - fashioned politeness ; it is much more to [my]207-mrs. elton taste than modern ease ; modern ease often disgusts [me]207-mrs. elton . But this good old [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse , [I]207-mrs. elton wish [you]207-mrs. elton had heard [his]4714-this dear old beau of mine gallant speeches to [me]207-mrs. elton at dinner . Oh ! [I]207-mrs. elton assure [you]207-mrs. elton [I]207-mrs. elton began to think [my]207-mrs. elton caro sposo would be absolutely jealous . [I]207-mrs. elton fancy [I]207-mrs. elton am rather a favourite ; [he]4714-this dear old beau of mine took notice of [my]207-mrs. elton gown . How do [you]207-mrs. elton like it?--Selina 's choice -- handsome , [I]207-mrs. elton think , but [I]207-mrs. elton do not know whether it is not over - trimmed ; [I]207-mrs. elton have the greatest dislike to the idea of being over - trimmed -- quite a horror of finery . [I]207-mrs. elton must put on a few ornaments now , because it is expected of [me]207-mrs. elton . [A bride]1796-a bride , [you]207-mrs. elton know , must appear like [a bride]1796-a bride , but [my]207-mrs. elton natural taste is all for simplicity ; a simple style of dress is so infinitely preferable to finery . But [I]207-mrs. elton am quite in the minority , [I]207-mrs. elton believe ; [few people]4717-few people seem to value simplicity of dress,--show and finery are every thing . [I]207-mrs. elton have some notion of putting such a trimming as this to [my]207-mrs. elton white and silver poplin . Do [you]207-mrs. elton think it will look well ? ”[207-mrs. elton]

[The whole party]1152-the whole party were but just reassembled in [the drawing - room]3531-the drawing - room when [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston made [his]86-mr. weston appearance among [them]1152-the whole party . [He]86-mr. weston had returned to a late dinner , and walked to [Hartfield]2-hartfield as soon as it was over . [He]86-mr. weston had been too much expected by [the best judges]1911-the best judges , for surprize -- but there was great joy . [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse was almost as glad to see [him]86-mr. weston now , as [he]85-mr. woodhouse would have been sorry to see [him]86-mr. weston before . [John Knightley]92-mr. knightley only was in mute astonishment.--That [a man who might have spent [his]92-mr. knightley evening quietly at [home]562-home after a day of business in [London]1-london]1912-a man who might have spent his evening quietly at home after a day of business in london , should set off again , and walk half a mile to [[another man]3500-another man 's house]3501-another man 's house , for the sake of being in mixed company till bed - time , of finishing [his]92-mr. knightley day in the efforts of civility and the noise of numbers , was a circumstance to strike [him]92-mr. knightley deeply . [A man who had been in motion since eight o'clock in the morning , and might now have been still , who had been long talking , and might have been silent , who had been in more than one crowd]1916-a man who had been in motion since eight o'clock in the morning , and might now have been still , who had been long talking , and might have been silent , who had been in more than one crowd , and might have been alone!--Such [a man]2840-a man , to quit the tranquillity and independence of [his]92-mr. knightley own fireside , and on the evening of a cold sleety April day rush out again into the world!--Could [he]92-mr. knightley by a touch of [his]92-mr. knightley finger have instantly taken back [[his]92-mr. knightley wife]2763-his wife , there would have been a motive ; but [his]92-mr. knightley coming would probably prolong rather than break up the party . [John Knightley]92-mr. knightley looked at [him]92-mr. knightley with amazement , then shrugged [his]92-mr. knightley shoulders , and said , “ [I]92-mr. knightley could not have believed it even of _ [him]92-mr. knightley _ . ”[92-mr. knightley]

[Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston meanwhile , perfectly unsuspicious of the indignation [he]86-mr. weston was exciting , happy and cheerful as usual , and with all the right of being [principal talker]1919-principal talker , which a day spent anywhere from [home]562-home confers , was making [himself]86-mr. weston agreeable among [the rest]1921-the rest ; and having satisfied the inquiries of [[his]86-mr. weston wife]2763-his wife as to [his]86-mr. weston dinner , convincing [her]2763-his wife that none of all [her]2763-his wife careful directions to [the servants]1923-the servants had been forgotten , and spread abroad what public news [he]86-mr. weston had heard , was proceeding to a family communication , which , though principally addressed to [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , [he]86-mr. weston had not the smallest doubt of being highly interesting to [every body in [the room]701-the room]1924-every body in the room . [He]86-mr. weston gave [her]2763-his wife a letter , it was from [Frank]102-frank churchill , and to [herself]2763-his wife ; [he]86-mr. weston had met with it in [his]86-mr. weston way , and had taken the liberty of opening it .

“ Read it , read it , ”[86-mr. weston] said [he]86-mr. weston , “ it will give [you]1542-the two ladies pleasure ; only a few lines -- will not take [you]1542-the two ladies long ; read it to [Emma]123-emma . ”[86-mr. weston]

[The two ladies]1542-the two ladies looked over it together ; and [he]86-mr. weston sat smiling and talking to [them]1542-the two ladies the whole time , in a voice a little subdued , but very audible to [every body]2749-every body .

“ Well , [he]86-mr. weston is coming , [you]1542-the two ladies see ; good news , [I]86-mr. weston think . Well , what do [you]1542-the two ladies say to it?--I always told [you]1542-the two ladies [he]86-mr. weston would be [here]2707-here again soon , did not [I?--Anne]86-mr. weston , [[my]86-mr. weston dear]2714-my dear , did not [I]86-mr. weston always tell [you]1542-the two ladies so , and [you]1542-the two ladies would not believe me?--In [town]2760-town next week , [you]1542-the two ladies see -- at the latest , [I]86-mr. weston dare say ; for _ [she]4721-she _ is as impatient as [the black gentleman]4722-the black gentleman when any thing is to be done ; most likely [they]1542-the two ladies will be there to - morrow or Saturday . As to [her]4721-she illness , all nothing of course . But it is an excellent thing to have [Frank]102-frank churchill among [us]4723-us again , so near as [town]2760-town . [They]1542-the two ladies will stay a good while when [they]1542-the two ladies do come , and [he]102-frank churchill will be half [his]102-frank churchill time with [us]4723-us . This is precisely what [I]86-mr. weston wanted . Well , pretty good news , is not it ? Have [you]4725-you finished it ? Has [Emma]123-emma read it all ? Put it up , put it up ; [we]4723-us will have a good talk about it some other time , but it will not do now . [I]86-mr. weston shall only just mention the circumstance to [the others]870-the others in a common way . ”[86-mr. weston]

[Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston was most comfortably pleased on the occasion . [Her]88-mrs. weston looks and words had nothing to restrain them . [She]88-mrs. weston was happy , [she]88-mrs. weston knew [she]88-mrs. weston was happy , and knew [she]88-mrs. weston ought to be happy . [Her]88-mrs. weston congratulations were warm and open ; but [Emma]123-emma could not speak so fluently . _ [She]123-emma _ was a little occupied in weighing [her]123-emma own feelings , and trying to understand the degree of [her]123-emma agitation , which [she]123-emma rather thought was considerable .

[Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston , however , too eager to be very observant , too communicative to want [others]2773-others to talk , was very well satisfied with what [she]123-emma did say , and soon moved away to make [the rest of [[his]86-mr. weston friends]2761-his friends]1929-the rest of his friends happy by a partial communication of what [the whole room]1931-the whole room must have overheard already .

It was well that [he]86-mr. weston took [every body]2749-every body 's joy for granted , or [he]86-mr. weston might not have thought either [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse or [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley particularly delighted . [They]1933-they were the first entitled , after [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston and [Emma]123-emma , to be made happy;--from [them]1933-they [he]86-mr. weston would have proceeded to [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax , but [she]152-miss fairfax was so deep in conversation with [John Knightley]92-mr. knightley , that it would have been too positive an interruption ; and finding [himself]86-mr. weston close to [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton , and [her]207-mrs. elton attention disengaged , [he]86-mr. weston necessarily began on the subject with [her]207-mrs. elton .

CHAPTER XVIII

“ [I]86-mr. weston hope [I]86-mr. weston shall soon have the pleasure of introducing [[my]86-mr. weston son]3526-my son to [you]207-mrs. elton , ”[86-mr. weston] said [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston .

[Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton , very willing to suppose a particular compliment intended [her]207-mrs. elton by such a hope , smiled most graciously .

“ [You]207-mrs. elton have heard of a certain [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill , [I]86-mr. weston presume , ”[86-mr. weston] [he]86-mr. weston continued--“and know [him]102-frank churchill to be [[my]207-mrs. elton son]3526-my son , though [he]102-frank churchill does not bear [my]207-mrs. elton name . ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ Oh ! yes , and [I]86-mr. weston shall be very happy in [his]102-frank churchill acquaintance . [I]86-mr. weston am sure [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton will lose no time in calling on [him]102-frank churchill ; and [we]4729-we shall both have great pleasure in seeing [him]102-frank churchill at [the Vicarage]844-the vicarage . ”[86-mr. weston]

“ [You]207-mrs. elton are very obliging.--Frank will be extremely happy , [I]207-mrs. elton am sure.-- [He]102-frank churchill is to be in [town]2760-town next week , if not sooner . [We]4729-we have notice of it in a letter to - day . [I]207-mrs. elton met the letters in [my]207-mrs. elton way this morning , and seeing [[my]207-mrs. elton son]3526-my son 's hand , presumed to open it -- though it was not directed to [me]207-mrs. elton -- it was to [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston . [She]88-mrs. weston is [[his]102-frank churchill principal correspondent]4733-his principal correspondent , [I]207-mrs. elton assure [you]207-mrs. elton . [I]207-mrs. elton hardly ever get a letter . ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ And so [you]207-mrs. elton absolutely opened what was directed to [her]88-mrs. weston ! Oh ! [Mr. Weston--(laughing]278-mr. weston--(laughing affectedly ) [I]86-mr. weston must protest against that.--A most dangerous precedent indeed!--I beg [you]207-mrs. elton will not let [[your]207-mrs. elton neighbours]4036-your neighbours follow [your]207-mrs. elton example.--Upon [my]86-mr. weston word , if this is what [I]86-mr. weston am to expect , [we]4735-us [married women]4490-married women must begin to exert ourselves!--Oh ! [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston , [I]86-mr. weston could not have believed it of [you]207-mrs. elton ! ”[86-mr. weston]

“ Aye , [we]4735-us [men]3104-men are [sad fellows]4738-sad fellows . [You]207-mrs. elton must take care of [yourself]207-mrs. elton , [Mrs. Elton.--This]4739-mrs. elton.--this letter tells [us]4735-us -- it is a short letter -- written in a hurry , merely to give [us]4735-us notice -- it tells [us]4735-us that [they]3104-men are all coming up to [town]2760-town directly , on [Mrs. Churchill]98-mrs. churchill 's account -- [she]98-mrs. churchill has not been well the whole winter , and thinks [Enscombe]7-enscombe too cold for [her]98-mrs. churchill -- so [they]3104-men are all to move southward without loss of time . ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ Indeed!--from [Yorkshire]47-yorkshire , [I]86-mr. weston think . [Enscombe]7-enscombe is in [Yorkshire]47-yorkshire ? ”[86-mr. weston]

“ Yes , [they]3104-men are about one hundred and ninety miles from [London]1-london , a considerable journey . ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ Yes , upon [my]86-mr. weston word , very considerable . Sixty - five miles farther than from [Maple Grove]51-maple grove to [London]1-london . But what is distance , [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston , to [people of large fortune?--You]4741-people of large fortune?--you would be amazed to hear how [[my]86-mr. weston brother]2939-my brother , [Mr. Suckling]251-mr. suckling , sometimes flies about . [You]86-mr. weston will hardly believe [me]86-mr. weston -- but twice in one week [he]251-mr. suckling and [Mr. Bragge]279-mr. bragge went to [London]1-london and back again with four horses . ”[86-mr. weston]

“ The evil of the distance from [Enscombe]7-enscombe , ”[86-mr. weston] said [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston , “ is , that [Mrs. Churchill]98-mrs. churchill , _ as _ _ [we]4743-we _ _ understand _ , has not been able to leave the sofa for a week together . In [Frank]102-frank churchill 's last letter [she]98-mrs. churchill complained , [he]102-frank churchill said , of being too weak to get into [[her]98-mrs. churchill conservatory]4744-her conservatory without having both [his]102-frank churchill arm and [[his]102-frank churchill uncle]517-his uncle 's ! This , [you]86-mr. weston know , speaks a great degree of weakness -- but now [she]98-mrs. churchill is so impatient to be in [town]2760-town , that [she]98-mrs. churchill means to sleep only two nights on the road.--So [Frank]102-frank churchill writes word . Certainly , [delicate ladies]4747-delicate ladies have very extraordinary constitutions , [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton . [You]86-mr. weston must grant [me]86-mr. weston that . ”[86-mr. weston]

“ No , indeed , [I]207-mrs. elton shall grant [you]86-mr. weston nothing . [I]207-mrs. elton always take the part of [my]207-mrs. elton own sex . [I]207-mrs. elton do indeed . [I]207-mrs. elton give [you]86-mr. weston notice -- [You]86-mr. weston will find [me]207-mrs. elton a formidable antagonist on that point . [I]207-mrs. elton always stand up for [women]3259-women -- and [I]207-mrs. elton assure [you]86-mr. weston , if [you]86-mr. weston knew how [Selina]252-selina feels with respect to sleeping at [an inn]4299-an inn , [you]86-mr. weston would not wonder at [Mrs. Churchill]98-mrs. churchill 's making incredible exertions to avoid it . [Selina]252-selina says it is quite horror to [her]252-selina -- and [I]207-mrs. elton believe [I]207-mrs. elton have caught a little of [her]252-selina nicety . [She]252-selina always travels with [her]252-selina own sheets ; an excellent precaution . Does [Mrs. Churchill]98-mrs. churchill do the same ? ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ Depend upon it , [Mrs. Churchill]98-mrs. churchill does every thing that [any other fine lady]4750-any other fine lady ever did . [Mrs. Churchill]98-mrs. churchill will not be second to [any lady in [the land]4752-the land]4751-any lady in the land for”--[86-mr. weston]

[Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton eagerly interposed with ,

“ Is not [she]252-selina ? Then [she]252-selina is no rule for [Mrs. Churchill]98-mrs. churchill , who is as thorough [a fine lady as any body]4754-a fine lady as any body ever beheld . ”[86-mr. weston]

[Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton began to think [she]207-mrs. elton had been wrong in disclaiming so warmly . “ [Mrs. Churchill]98-mrs. churchill is not much in [my]86-mr. weston good graces , as [you]86-mr. weston may suspect -- but this is quite between [ourselves]4755-ourselves . [She]98-mrs. churchill is very fond of [Frank]102-frank churchill , and therefore [I]86-mr. weston would not speak ill of [her]98-mrs. churchill . Besides , [she]98-mrs. churchill is out of health now ; but _ that _ indeed , by [her]98-mrs. churchill own account , [she]98-mrs. churchill has always been . “ If [she]98-mrs. churchill is really ill , why not go to [Bath]30-bath , [Mr. Weston?--To Bath]280-mr. weston?--to bath , or to [Clifton]56-clifton ? ”[207-mrs. elton] “ [She]98-mrs. churchill has taken it into [her]98-mrs. churchill head that [Enscombe]7-enscombe is too cold for [her]98-mrs. churchill . The fact is , [I]86-mr. weston suppose , that [she]98-mrs. churchill is tired of [Enscombe]7-enscombe . [She]98-mrs. churchill has now been a longer time stationary [there]448-there , than [she]98-mrs. churchill ever was before , and [she]98-mrs. churchill begins to want change . [It]7-enscombe is [a retired place]4757-a retired place . [A fine place]4758-a fine place , but very retired . ”[86-mr. weston]

“ Aye -- like [Maple Grove]51-maple grove , [I]207-mrs. elton dare say . Nothing can stand more retired from [the road]846-the road than [Maple Grove]51-maple grove . [Such an immense plantation all round [it]51-maple grove]4760-such an immense plantation all round it ! [You]4761-you seem shut out from every thing -- in the most complete retirement.--And [Mrs. Churchill]98-mrs. churchill probably has not health or spirits like [Selina]252-selina to enjoy that sort of seclusion . Or , perhaps [she]98-mrs. churchill may not have resources enough in [herself]98-mrs. churchill to be qualified for a country life . [I]207-mrs. elton always say [a woman]2864-a woman can not have too many resources -- and [I]207-mrs. elton feel very thankful that [I]207-mrs. elton have so many [myself]207-mrs. elton as to be quite independent of [society]4763-society . ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ [Frank]102-frank churchill was here in [February]57-february for a fortnight . ”[86-mr. weston]

“ So [I]207-mrs. elton remember to have heard . [He]102-frank churchill will find an _ addition _ to [the society of [Highbury]3-highbury]4764-the society of highbury when [he]102-frank churchill comes again ; that is , if [I]207-mrs. elton may presume to call [myself]207-mrs. elton [an addition]4765-an addition . This was too loud a call for a compliment to be passed by , and [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston , with a very good grace , immediately exclaimed ,

“ [[My]86-mr. weston dear madam]3345-my dear madam ! [[Nobody]2718-nobody but [yourself]3345-my dear madam]4769-nobody but yourself could imagine such a thing possible . Not heard of you!--I believe [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston 's letters lately have been full of very little else than [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton . ”[86-mr. weston]

[He]86-mr. weston had done [his]86-mr. weston duty and could return to [[his]86-mr. weston son]523-his son .

“ When [Frank]102-frank churchill left [us]4770-we , ”[86-mr. weston] continued [he]86-mr. weston , “ it was quite uncertain when [we]4770-we might see [him]102-frank churchill again , which makes this day 's news doubly welcome . It has been completely unexpected . That is , _ [I]86-mr. weston _ always had a strong persuasion [he]102-frank churchill would be [here]2707-here again soon , [I]86-mr. weston was sure something favourable would turn up -- but [nobody]2718-nobody believed [me]86-mr. weston . [He]102-frank churchill and [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston were both dreadfully desponding . ' How could [he]102-frank churchill contrive to come ? And how could it be supposed that [[his]102-frank churchill uncle]517-his uncle and [aunt]3628-aunt would spare [him]102-frank churchill again ? ' and so forth -- [I]86-mr. weston always felt that something would happen in [our]4770-we favour ; and so it has , [you]88-mrs. weston see . [I]86-mr. weston have observed , [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton , in the course of [my]86-mr. weston life , that if things are going untowardly one month , they are sure to mend the next . ”[86-mr. weston]

“ Very true , [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston , perfectly true . It is just what [I]1937-i used to say to [a certain gentleman in company]4775-a certain gentleman in company in the days of courtship , when , because things did not go quite right , did not proceed with all the rapidity which suited [his]102-frank churchill feelings , [he]102-frank churchill was apt to be in despair , and exclaim that [he]102-frank churchill was sure at this rate it would be _ May _ before [Hymen]281-hymen 's saffron robe would be put on for [us]4770-we . Oh ! the pains [I]1937-i have been at to dispel those gloomy ideas and give [him]102-frank churchill cheerfuller views ! [The carriage]2719-the carriage -- [we]4770-we had disappointments about the carriage;--one morning , [I]1937-i remember , [he]102-frank churchill came to [me]1937-i quite in despair . ”[1937-i]

[She]1937-i was stopped by a slight fit of coughing , and [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston instantly seized the opportunity of going on .

“ [You]86-mr. weston were mentioning May. May is the very month which [Mrs. Churchill]98-mrs. churchill is ordered , or has ordered [herself]98-mrs. churchill , to spend in [some warmer place than [Enscombe]7-enscombe]4777-some warmer place than enscombe -- in short , to spend in [London]1-london ; so that [we]4770-we have the agreeable prospect of frequent visits from [Frank]102-frank churchill the whole spring -- precisely the season of the year which [one]2775-one should have chosen for it : days almost at the longest ; weather genial and pleasant , always inviting [one]2775-one out , and never too hot for exercise . When [he]102-frank churchill was [here]2707-here before , [we]4770-we made the best of it ; but there was a good deal of wet , damp , cheerless weather ; there always is in February , [you]86-mr. weston know , and [we]4770-we could not do half that [we]4770-we intended . Now will be the time . This will be complete enjoyment ; and [I]1937-i do not know , [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton , whether the uncertainty of [our]4770-we meetings , the sort of constant expectation there will be of [his]102-frank churchill coming in to - day or to - morrow , and at any hour , may not be more friendly to happiness than having [him]102-frank churchill actually in [the house]435-the house . [I]1937-i think it is so . [I]1937-i think it is the state of mind which gives most spirit and delight . [I]1937-i hope [you]86-mr. weston will be pleased with [[my]1937-i son]3526-my son ; but [you]86-mr. weston must not expect [a prodigy]4783-a prodigy . [He]102-frank churchill is generally thought [a fine young man]4784-a fine young man , but do not expect [a prodigy]4783-a prodigy . [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston 's partiality for [him]102-frank churchill is very great , and , as [you]86-mr. weston may suppose , most gratifying to [me]1937-i . [She]88-mrs. weston thinks [nobody]2718-nobody equal to [him]102-frank churchill . ”[1937-i]

“ And [I]1937-i assure [you]86-mr. weston , [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston , [I]1937-i have very little doubt that [my]1937-i opinion will be decidedly in [his]102-frank churchill favour . [I]1937-i have heard so much in praise of [Mr. Frank Churchill.--At]282-mr. frank churchill.--at the same time it is fair to observe , that [I]1937-i am one of those who always judge for [themselves]4787-themselves , and are by no means implicitly guided by [others]2773-others . [I]1937-i give [you]86-mr. weston notice that as [I]1937-i find [[your]86-mr. weston son]3557-your son , so [I]1937-i shall judge of him.--I am [no flatterer]4790-no flatterer . ”[1937-i]

[Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston was musing .

“ [I]86-mr. weston hope , ”[86-mr. weston] said [he]86-mr. weston presently , “ [I]86-mr. weston have not been severe upon [poor Mrs. Churchill]98-mrs. churchill . If [she]98-mrs. churchill is ill [I]86-mr. weston should be sorry to do [her]98-mrs. churchill injustice ; but there are some traits in [her]98-mrs. churchill character which make it difficult for [me]86-mr. weston to speak of [her]98-mrs. churchill with the forbearance [I]86-mr. weston could wish . [You]86-mr. weston can not be ignorant , [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton , of [my]86-mr. weston connexion with [the family]433-the family , nor of the treatment [I]86-mr. weston have met with ; and , between [ourselves]4792-ourselves , the whole blame of it is to be laid to [her]98-mrs. churchill . [She]98-mrs. churchill was [the instigator]4793-the instigator . [[Frank]282-mr. frank churchill.--at 's mother]4794-frank 's mother would never have been slighted as [she]98-mrs. churchill was but for [her]98-mrs. churchill . [Mr. Churchill]102-frank churchill has pride ; but [his]102-frank churchill pride is nothing to [[his]102-frank churchill wife]2763-his wife 's : [his]102-frank churchill is a quiet , indolent , gentlemanlike sort of pride that would harm [nobody]2718-nobody , and only make [himself]102-frank churchill a little helpless and tiresome ; but [her]98-mrs. churchill pride is arrogance and insolence ! And what inclines [one]2775-one less to bear , [she]98-mrs. churchill has no fair pretence of [family]3450-family or blood . [She]98-mrs. churchill was [nobody]2718-nobody when [he]102-frank churchill married [her]98-mrs. churchill , barely [the daughter of [a gentleman]2822-a gentleman]4800-the daughter of a gentleman ; but ever since [her]98-mrs. churchill being turned into [a Churchill]4802-a churchill [she]98-mrs. churchill has out - Churchill'd [them]4803-them all in high and mighty claims : but in [herself]98-mrs. churchill , [I]86-mr. weston assure [you]4804-you , [she]98-mrs. churchill is [an upstart]4805-an upstart . ”[86-mr. weston]

“ Only think ! well , that must be infinitely provoking ! [I]1938-i have quite a horror of [upstarts]4806-upstarts . [Maple Grove]51-maple grove has given [me]1938-i a thorough disgust to [people of that sort]4807-people of that sort ; for there is [a family in [that neighbourhood]4809-that neighbourhood who are such an annoyance to [[my]1938-i brother]2939-my brother and [sister]3216-sister from the airs [they]4808-a family in that neighbourhood who are such an annoyance to my brother and sister from the airs they give themselves give [themselves]4808-a family in that neighbourhood who are such an annoyance to my brother and sister from the airs they give themselves]4808-a family in that neighbourhood who are such an annoyance to my brother and sister from the airs they give themselves ! [Your]4804-you description of [Mrs. Churchill]98-mrs. churchill made [me]1938-i think of [them]4808-a family in that neighbourhood who are such an annoyance to my brother and sister from the airs they give themselves directly . [People of the name of Tupman]4812-people of the name of tupman , very lately settled [there]448-there , and encumbered with many low connexions , but giving [themselves]4812-people of the name of tupman immense airs , and expecting to be on a footing with [the old established families]4814-the old established families . A year and a half is the very utmost that [they]4812-people of the name of tupman can have lived at [West Hall]59-west hall ; and how [they]4812-people of the name of tupman got [their]4812-people of the name of tupman fortune [nobody]2718-nobody knows . [They]4812-people of the name of tupman came from [Birmingham]60-birmingham , which is not a place to promise much , [you]4804-you know , [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston . One has not great hopes from [Birmingham]60-birmingham . [I]1938-i always say there is something direful in the sound : but nothing more is positively known of [the Tupmans]283-the tupmans , though a good many things [I]1938-i assure [you]4804-you are suspected ; and yet by [their]4812-people of the name of tupman manners [they]4812-people of the name of tupman evidently think [themselves]4812-people of the name of tupman equal even to [[my]1938-i brother]2939-my brother , [Mr. Suckling]251-mr. suckling , who happens to be [one of [[their]4812-people of the name of tupman nearest neighbours]4818-their nearest neighbours]4817-one of their nearest neighbours . It is infinitely too bad . [Mr. Suckling]251-mr. suckling , who has been eleven years [a resident at [Maple Grove]51-maple grove , and whose father]4819-a resident at maple grove , and whose father had it before [him]251-mr. suckling -- [I]1938-i believe , at least -- [I]1938-i am almost sure that [old Mr. Suckling]251-mr. suckling had completed the purchase before [his]251-mr. suckling death . ”[1938-i]

[They]1938-i were interrupted . [Tea]284-tea was carrying round , and [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston , having said all that [he]86-mr. weston wanted , soon took the opportunity of walking away .

After tea , [Mr.]1939-mr. and [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , and [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton sat down with [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse to cards . [The remaining five]1940-the remaining five were left to [their]1940-the remaining five own powers , and [Emma]123-emma doubted [their]1940-the remaining five getting on very well ; for [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley seemed little disposed for conversation ; [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton was wanting notice , which [nobody]2718-nobody had inclination to pay , and [she]207-mrs. elton was [herself]207-mrs. elton in a worry of spirits which would have made [her]207-mrs. elton prefer being silent .

[Mr. John Knightley]92-mr. knightley proved more talkative than [[his]92-mr. knightley brother]824-his brother . [He]92-mr. knightley was to leave [them]1940-the remaining five early the next day ; and [he]92-mr. knightley soon began with--

“ Well , [Emma]123-emma , [I]92-mr. knightley do not believe [I]92-mr. knightley have any thing more to say about [the boys]4820-the boys ; but [you]123-emma have [[your]123-emma sister]4821-your sister 's letter , and every thing is down at full length there [we]1940-the remaining five may be sure . [My]92-mr. knightley charge would be much more concise than [[her]4821-your sister 's]4822-her 's , and probably not much in the same spirit ; all that [I]92-mr. knightley have to recommend being comprised in , do not spoil them , and do not physic them . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ [I]123-emma rather hope to satisfy [you]1940-the remaining five both , ”[123-emma] said [Emma]123-emma , “ for [I]123-emma shall do all in [my]123-emma power to make [them]1940-the remaining five happy , which will be enough for [Isabella]87-isabella ; and happiness must preclude false indulgence and physic . ”[123-emma]

“ And if [you]123-emma find [them]1940-the remaining five troublesome , [you]123-emma must send [them]1940-the remaining five [home]562-home again . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ That is very likely . [You]123-emma think so , do not [you]123-emma ? ”[123-emma]

“ [I]92-mr. knightley hope [I]92-mr. knightley am aware that [they]1940-the remaining five may be too noisy for [[your]123-emma father]3597-your father -- or even may be some encumbrance to [you]123-emma , if [your]123-emma visiting engagements continue to increase as much as [they]1940-the remaining five have done lately . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ Increase ! ”[123-emma]

“ Certainly ; [you]123-emma must be sensible that the last half - year has made a great difference in [your]123-emma way of life . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ Difference ! No indeed [I]123-emma am not . ”[123-emma]

“ There can be no doubt of [your]123-emma being much more engaged with [company]1001-company than [you]123-emma used to be . Witness this very time . Here am [I]92-mr. knightley come down for only one day , and [you]123-emma are engaged with a dinner - party!--When did it happen before , or any thing like it ? [[Your]123-emma neighbourhood]4826-your neighbourhood is increasing , and [you]123-emma mix more with it . A little while ago , every letter to [Isabella]87-isabella brought an account of fresh gaieties ; dinners at [Mr. Cole]145-mr. cole 's , or balls at the Crown . The difference which [Randalls]101-randalls , [Randalls]101-randalls alone makes in [your]123-emma goings - on , is very great . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ Yes , ”[824-his brother] said [[his]1943-his brother]824-his brother quickly , “ it is [Randalls]101-randalls that does it all . ”[824-his brother]

“ Very well -- and as [Randalls]101-randalls , [I]92-mr. knightley suppose , is not likely to have less influence than heretofore , it strikes [me]92-mr. knightley as a possible thing , [Emma]123-emma , that [Henry]125-henry and [John]92-mr. knightley may be sometimes in the way . And if [they]4827-them are , [I]92-mr. knightley only beg [you]824-his brother to send [them]4827-them [home]562-home . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ No , ”[92-mr. knightley] cried [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley , “ that need not be the consequence . Let [them]4827-them be sent to [Donwell]24-donwell . [I]92-mr. knightley shall certainly be at leisure . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ Upon [my]123-emma word , ”[123-emma] exclaimed [Emma]123-emma , “ [you]824-his brother amuse [me]123-emma ! [I]123-emma should like to know how many of all [my]123-emma numerous engagements take place without [your]824-his brother being of the party ; and why [I]123-emma am to be supposed in danger of wanting leisure to attend to [the little boys]1881-the little boys . These amazing engagements of [mine]123-emma -- what have they been ? Dining once with [the Coles]184-the coles -- and having a ball talked of , which never took place . [I]123-emma can understand you--(nodding at [Mr. John Knightley)--your]285-mr. john knightley)--your good fortune in meeting with so many of [[your]824-his brother friends]3174-your friends at once here , delights [you]824-his brother too much to pass unnoticed . But [you]824-his brother , ( turning to [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley , ) who know how very , very seldom [I]123-emma am ever two hours from [Hartfield]2-hartfield , why [you]824-his brother should foresee such a series of dissipation for [me]123-emma , [I]123-emma can not imagine . And as to [[my]123-emma dear little boys]4831-my dear little boys , [I]123-emma must say , that if [Aunt Emma]123-emma has not time for [them]4831-my dear little boys , [I]123-emma do not think [they]4831-my dear little boys would fare much better with [Uncle Knightley]287-uncle knightley , who is absent from [home]562-home about five hours where [she]123-emma is absent one -- and who , when [he]287-uncle knightley is at [home]562-home , is either reading to [himself]287-uncle knightley or settling [his]287-uncle knightley accounts . ”[123-emma]

[Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley seemed to be trying not to smile ; and succeeded without difficulty , upon [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton 's beginning to talk to [him]92-mr. knightley .

VOLUME III

CHAPTER I

A very little quiet reflection was enough to satisfy [Emma]123-emma as to the nature of [her]123-emma agitation on hearing this news of [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill . [She]123-emma was soon convinced that it was not for [herself]123-emma [she]123-emma was feeling at all apprehensive or embarrassed ; it was for [him]102-frank churchill . [Her]123-emma own attachment had really subsided into a mere nothing ; it was not worth thinking of;--but if [he]102-frank churchill , who had undoubtedly been always so much the most in love of [the two]3078-the two , were to be returning with the same warmth of sentiment which [he]102-frank churchill had taken away , it would be very distressing . If a separation of two months should not have cooled [him]102-frank churchill , there were dangers and evils before her:--caution for [him]102-frank churchill and for [herself]123-emma would be necessary . [She]123-emma did not mean to have [her]123-emma own affections entangled again , and it would be incumbent on [her]123-emma to avoid any encouragement of [his]102-frank churchill .

[She]123-emma wished [she]123-emma might be able to keep [him]102-frank churchill from an absolute declaration . That would be so very painful a conclusion of [their]3078-the two present acquaintance ! and yet , [she]123-emma could not help rather anticipating something decisive . [She]123-emma felt as if the spring would not pass without bringing a crisis , an event , a something to alter [her]123-emma present composed and tranquil state .

It was not very long , though rather longer than [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston had foreseen , before [she]123-emma had the power of forming some opinion of [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill 's feelings . [The Enscombe family]1946-the enscombe family were not in [town]2760-town quite so soon as had been imagined , but [he]102-frank churchill was at [Highbury]3-highbury very soon afterwards . [He]102-frank churchill rode down for a couple of hours ; [he]102-frank churchill could not yet do more ; but as [he]102-frank churchill came from [Randalls]101-randalls immediately to [Hartfield]2-hartfield , [she]123-emma could then exercise all [her]123-emma quick observation , and speedily determine how [he]102-frank churchill was influenced , and how [she]123-emma must act . [They]3078-the two met with the utmost friendliness . There could be no doubt of [his]102-frank churchill great pleasure in seeing [her]123-emma . But [she]123-emma had an almost instant doubt of [his]102-frank churchill caring for [her]123-emma as [he]102-frank churchill had done , of [his]102-frank churchill feeling the same tenderness in the same degree . [She]123-emma watched [him]102-frank churchill well . It was a clear thing [he]102-frank churchill was less in love than [he]102-frank churchill had been . [Absence]288-absence , with the conviction probably of [her]123-emma indifference , had produced this very natural and very desirable effect .

[He]102-frank churchill was in high spirits ; as ready to talk and laugh as ever , and seemed delighted to speak of [his]102-frank churchill former visit , and recur to old stories : and [he]102-frank churchill was not without agitation . It was not in [his]102-frank churchill calmness that [she]123-emma read [his]102-frank churchill comparative difference . [He]102-frank churchill was not calm ; [his]102-frank churchill spirits were evidently fluttered ; there was restlessness about [him]102-frank churchill . Lively as [he]102-frank churchill was , it seemed a liveliness that did not satisfy [himself]102-frank churchill ; but what decided [her]123-emma belief on the subject , was [his]102-frank churchill staying only a quarter of an hour , and hurrying away to make other calls in [Highbury]3-highbury . “ [He]102-frank churchill had seen [a group of old acquaintance in [the street]1208-the street]4834-a group of old acquaintance in the street as [he]102-frank churchill passed -- [he]102-frank churchill had not stopped , [he]102-frank churchill would not stop for more than a word -- but [he]102-frank churchill had the vanity to think [they]4834-a group of old acquaintance in the street would be disappointed if [he]102-frank churchill did not call , and much as [he]102-frank churchill wished to stay longer at [Hartfield]2-hartfield , [he]102-frank churchill must hurry off . ”[123-emma] [She]123-emma had no doubt as to [his]102-frank churchill being less in love -- but neither [his]102-frank churchill agitated spirits , nor [his]102-frank churchill hurrying away , seemed like a perfect cure ; and [she]123-emma was rather inclined to think it implied a dread of [her]123-emma returning power , and a discreet resolution of not trusting [himself]102-frank churchill with [her]123-emma long .

This was the only visit from [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill in the course of ten days . [He]102-frank churchill was often hoping , intending to come -- but was always prevented . [[His]102-frank churchill aunt]3548-his aunt could not bear to have [him]102-frank churchill leave [her]3548-his aunt . Such was [his]102-frank churchill own account at [[Randall]289-randall 's]1949-randall 's . If [he]102-frank churchill were quite sincere , if [he]102-frank churchill really tried to come , it was to be inferred that [Mrs. Churchill]98-mrs. churchill 's removal to [London]1-london had been of no service to the wilful or nervous part of [her]98-mrs. churchill disorder . That [she]98-mrs. churchill was really ill was very certain ; [he]102-frank churchill had declared [himself]102-frank churchill convinced of it , at [Randalls]101-randalls . Though much might be fancy , [he]102-frank churchill could not doubt , when [he]102-frank churchill looked back , that [she]98-mrs. churchill was in a weaker state of health than [she]98-mrs. churchill had been half a year ago . [He]102-frank churchill did not believe it to proceed from any thing that care and medicine might not remove , or at least that [she]98-mrs. churchill might not have many years of existence before [her]98-mrs. churchill ; but [he]102-frank churchill could not be prevailed on , by all [[his]102-frank churchill father]518-his father 's doubts , to say that [her]98-mrs. churchill complaints were merely imaginary , or that [she]98-mrs. churchill was as strong as ever .

It soon appeared that [London]1-london was not the place for [her]98-mrs. churchill . [She]98-mrs. churchill could not endure [its]1-london noise . [Her]98-mrs. churchill nerves were under continual irritation and suffering ; and by the ten days ' end , [[her]98-mrs. churchill nephew]3651-her nephew 's letter to [Randalls]101-randalls communicated a change of plan . [They]1952-they were going to remove immediately to [Richmond]61-richmond . [Mrs. Churchill]98-mrs. churchill had been recommended to the medical skill of [an eminent person there]1953-an eminent person there , and had otherwise a fancy for [the place]450-the place . [A ready - furnished house in [a favourite spot]1956-a favourite spot]1955-a ready - furnished house in a favourite spot was engaged , and much benefit expected from the change .

[Emma]123-emma heard that [Frank]102-frank churchill wrote in the highest spirits of this arrangement , and seemed most fully to appreciate the blessing of having two months before [him]102-frank churchill of [such near neighbourhood]1957-such near neighbourhood to [many dear friends]1958-many dear friends -- for [the house]435-the house was taken for [May]290-may and [June]276-june . [She]123-emma was told that now [he]102-frank churchill wrote with the greatest confidence of being often with [them]1958-many dear friends , almost as often as [he]102-frank churchill could even wish .

[Emma]123-emma saw how [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston understood these joyous prospects . [He]86-mr. weston was considering [her]123-emma as the source of all the happiness [they]1958-many dear friends offered . [She]123-emma hoped it was not so . Two months must bring it to the proof .

[Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston 's own happiness was indisputable . [He]86-mr. weston was quite delighted . It was the very circumstance [he]86-mr. weston could have wished for . Now , it would be really having [Frank]102-frank churchill in [[their]1958-many dear friends neighbourhood]1960-their neighbourhood . What were nine miles to a young man?--An hour 's ride . [He]102-frank churchill would be always coming over . The difference in that respect of [Richmond]61-richmond and [London]1-london was enough to make the whole difference of seeing [him]102-frank churchill always and seeing [him]102-frank churchill never . Sixteen miles -- nay , eighteen -- it must be full eighteen to [Manchester - street]62-manchester - street -- was a serious obstacle . Were [he]102-frank churchill ever able to get away , the day would be spent in coming and returning . There was no comfort in having [him]102-frank churchill in [London]1-london ; [he]102-frank churchill might as well be at [Enscombe]7-enscombe ; but [Richmond]61-richmond was the very distance for easy intercourse . Better than nearer !

One good thing was immediately brought to a certainty by this removal,--the ball at the Crown . It had not been forgotten before , but it had been soon acknowledged vain to attempt to fix a day . Now , however , it was absolutely to be ; every preparation was resumed , and very soon after [the Churchills]100-the churchills had removed to [Richmond]61-richmond , a few lines from [Frank]102-frank churchill , to say that [[his]102-frank churchill aunt]3548-his aunt felt already much better for the change , and that [he]102-frank churchill had no doubt of being able to join [them]1958-many dear friends for twenty - four hours at any given time , induced [them]1958-many dear friends to name as early a day as possible .

[Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston 's ball was to be a real thing . [A very few to - morrows]1962-a very few to - morrows stood between [the young people of [Highbury]3-highbury and happiness]1963-the young people of highbury and happiness .

[Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse was resigned . The time of year lightened the evil to [him]85-mr. woodhouse . May was better for every thing than February . [Mrs. Bates]110-mrs. bates was engaged to spend the evening at [Hartfield]2-hartfield , [James]90-james had due notice , and [he]102-frank churchill sanguinely hoped that neither [dear little Henry]125-henry nor [dear little John]92-mr. knightley would have any thing the matter with [them]1958-many dear friends , while [dear Emma]123-emma were gone .

CHAPTER II

No misfortune occurred , again to prevent the ball . The day approached , the day arrived ; and after a morning of some anxious watching , [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill , in all the certainty of [his]102-frank churchill own self , reached [Randalls]101-randalls before dinner , and every thing was safe .

No second meeting had there yet been between [him]102-frank churchill and [Emma]123-emma . [The room at the Crown]4306-the room at the crown was to witness it;--but it would be better than a common meeting in [a crowd]4277-a crowd . [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston had been so very earnest in [his]86-mr. weston entreaties for [her]123-emma arriving [there]448-there as soon as possible after [themselves]1967-they , for the purpose of taking [her]123-emma opinion as to the propriety and comfort of [the rooms]4327-the rooms before [any other persons]1969-any other persons came , that [she]123-emma could not refuse [him]86-mr. weston , and must therefore spend some quiet interval in [[the young man]532-the young man 's company]1971-the young man 's company . [She]123-emma was to convey [Harriet]111-harriet , and [they]1967-they drove to [the Crown]43-the crown in good time , the Randalls party just sufficiently before [them]1967-they .

[Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill seemed to have been on the watch ; and though [he]102-frank churchill did not say much , [his]102-frank churchill eyes declared that [he]102-frank churchill meant to have a delightful evening . [They]1967-they all walked about together , to see that every thing was as it should be ; and within a few minutes were joined by the contents of [another carriage]1543-another carriage , which [Emma]123-emma could not hear the sound of at first , without great surprize . “ So unreasonably early ! ”[123-emma] [she]123-emma was going to exclaim ; but [she]123-emma presently found that it was [a family of old friends]1973-a family of old friends , who were coming , like [herself]123-emma , by particular desire , to help [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston 's judgment ; and [they]1973-a family of old friends were so very closely followed by another carriage of [cousins , who had been entreated to come early with the same distinguishing earnestness , on the same errand]1974-cousins , who had been entreated to come early with the same distinguishing earnestness , on the same errand , that it seemed as if half [the company]1975-the company might soon be collected together for the purpose of preparatory inspection .

[Emma]123-emma perceived that [her]123-emma taste was not the only taste on which [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston depended , and felt , that to be the favourite and intimate of [a man who had so many intimates and confidantes]1976-a man who had so many intimates and confidantes , was not the very first distinction in the scale of vanity . [She]123-emma liked [his]86-mr. weston open manners , but a little less of open - heartedness would have made [him]86-mr. weston a higher character.--General benevolence , but not general friendship , made [a man]2840-a man what [he]2840-a man ought to be.--She could fancy [such a man]2885-such a man . [The whole party]1152-the whole party walked about , and looked , and praised again ; and then , having nothing else to do , formed a sort of half - circle round the fire , to observe in [their]1152-the whole party various modes , till other subjects were started , that , though _ May _ , a fire in the evening was still very pleasant .

[Emma]123-emma found that it was not [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston 's fault that the number of [privy councillors]1980-privy councillors was not yet larger . [They]1152-the whole party had stopped at [Mrs. Bates]110-mrs. bates 's door to offer the use of [[their]1152-the whole party carriage]1981-their carriage , but [the aunt]520-the aunt and [niece]1561-niece were to be brought by [the Eltons]143-the eltons .

[Frank]102-frank churchill was standing by [her]110-mrs. bates , but not steadily ; there was a restlessness , which [shewed]1984-shewed a mind not at ease . [He]102-frank churchill was looking about , [he]102-frank churchill was going to the door , [he]102-frank churchill was watching for the sound of other carriages,--impatient to begin , or afraid of being always near [her]110-mrs. bates .

[Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton was spoken of . “ [I]102-frank churchill think [she]207-mrs. elton must be [here]2707-here soon , ”[102-frank churchill] said [he]102-frank churchill . “ [I]102-frank churchill have a great curiosity to see [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton , [I]102-frank churchill have heard so much of [her]207-mrs. elton . It can not be long , [I]102-frank churchill think , before [she]207-mrs. elton comes . ”[102-frank churchill]

[A carriage]540-a carriage was heard . [He]102-frank churchill was on the move immediately ; but coming back , said ,

“ [I]1986-mr. am forgetting that [I]1986-mr. am not acquainted with [her]207-mrs. elton . [I]1986-mr. have never seen either [Mr.]4837-mr. or [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton . [I]1986-mr. have no business to put [myself]1986-mr. forward . ”[1986-mr.]

[Mr.]1986-mr. and [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton appeared ; and all the smiles and the proprieties passed .

“ But [Miss Bates]105-miss bates and [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax ! ”[86-mr. weston] said [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston , looking about . “ [We]1988-them thought [you]1986-mr. were to bring [them]1988-them . ”[86-mr. weston]

The mistake had been slight . [The carriage]2719-the carriage was sent for [them]1988-them now . [Emma]123-emma longed to know what [Frank]102-frank churchill 's first opinion of [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton might be ; how [he]102-frank churchill was affected by the studied elegance of [her]207-mrs. elton dress , and [her]207-mrs. elton smiles of graciousness . [He]102-frank churchill was immediately qualifying [himself]102-frank churchill to form an opinion , by giving [her]207-mrs. elton very proper attention , after the introduction had passed .

In a few minutes the carriage returned.--Somebody talked of rain.--“I will see that there are umbrellas , [sir]2734-sir , ”[102-frank churchill] said [Frank]102-frank churchill to [[his]102-frank churchill father]518-his father : “ [Miss Bates]105-miss bates must not be forgotten : ”[102-frank churchill] and away [he]102-frank churchill went . [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston was following ; but [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton detained [him]86-mr. weston , to gratify [him]86-mr. weston by [her]207-mrs. elton opinion of [[his]86-mr. weston son]523-his son ; and so briskly did [she]207-mrs. elton begin , that [the young man]532-the young man [himself]532-the young man , though by no means moving slowly , could hardly be out of hearing .

“ [A very fine young man]524-a very fine young man indeed , [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston . [You]86-mr. weston know [I]207-mrs. elton candidly told [you]86-mr. weston [I]207-mrs. elton should form [my]207-mrs. elton own opinion ; and [I]207-mrs. elton am happy to say that [I]207-mrs. elton am extremely pleased with him.--You may believe [me]207-mrs. elton . [I]207-mrs. elton never compliment . [I]207-mrs. elton think [him]532-the young man [a very handsome young man]3140-a very handsome young man , and [his]532-the young man manners are precisely what [I]207-mrs. elton like and approve -- so truly [the gentleman]680-the gentleman , without the least conceit or puppyism . [You]86-mr. weston must know [I]207-mrs. elton have a vast dislike to puppies -- quite a horror of [them]4842-them . [They]4842-them were never tolerated at [Maple Grove]51-maple grove . [Neither Mr. Suckling]251-mr. suckling nor [me]207-mrs. elton had ever any patience with [them]4842-them ; and [we]4843-we used sometimes to say very cutting things ! [Selina]252-selina , who is mild almost to a fault , bore with [them]4842-them much better . ”[207-mrs. elton]

While [she]1992-she talked of [[his]1992-she son]523-his son , [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston 's attention was chained ; but when [she]1992-she got to [Maple Grove]51-maple grove , [he]86-mr. weston could recollect that there were [ladies just arriving to be attended to]1994-ladies just arriving to be attended to , and with happy smiles must hurry away .

[Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton turned to [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston . “ [I]207-mrs. elton have no doubt of [its]4844-its being [[our]4843-we carriage]4845-our carriage with [Miss Bates]105-miss bates and [Jane]105-miss bates . [[Our]4843-we coachman]4846-our coachman and horses are so extremely [expeditious!--I]4843-we believe [we]4843-we drive faster than any body.--What a pleasure it is to send [[one]2775-one 's carriage]4848-one 's carriage for a friend!--I understand [you]88-mrs. weston were so kind as to offer , but another time it will be quite unnecessary . [You]88-mrs. weston may be very sure [I]207-mrs. elton shall always take care of _ [them]1415-the two gentlemen _ . ”[207-mrs. elton]

[Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill returned to [[his]102-frank churchill station]1999-his station by [Emma]123-emma ; and as soon as [Miss Bates]105-miss bates was quiet , [she]105-miss bates found [herself]105-miss bates necessarily overhearing the discourse of [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton and [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax , who were standing a little way behind her.--He was thoughtful . Whether [he]102-frank churchill were overhearing too , [she]105-miss bates could not determine . After a good many compliments to [Jane]152-miss fairfax on [her]152-miss fairfax dress and look , compliments very quietly and properly taken , [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton was evidently wanting to be complimented [herself]207-mrs. elton -- and it was , “ How do [you]105-miss bates like [my]207-mrs. elton gown?--How do [you]105-miss bates like [my]207-mrs. elton trimming?--How has [Wright]266-wright done [my]207-mrs. elton hair?”--with[207-mrs. elton] many other relative questions , all answered with patient politeness . [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton then said , “ [Nobody]2718-nobody can think less of dress in general than [I]207-mrs. elton do -- but upon such an occasion as this , when every body 's eyes are so much upon [me]207-mrs. elton , and in compliment to [the Westons]108-the westons -- who [I]207-mrs. elton have no doubt are giving this ball chiefly to do [me]207-mrs. elton honour -- [I]207-mrs. elton would not wish to be inferior to [others]2773-others . And [I]207-mrs. elton see very few pearls in [the room]701-the room except mine.--So [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill is [a capital dancer]4872-a capital dancer , [I]207-mrs. elton understand.--We shall see if [our]4873-our styles suit.--A [fine young man]4874-fine young man certainly is [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill . [I]207-mrs. elton like [him]102-frank churchill very well . ”[207-mrs. elton]

At this moment [Frank]102-frank churchill began talking so vigorously , that [Emma]123-emma could not but imagine [he]102-frank churchill had overheard [his]102-frank churchill own praises , and did not want to hear more;--and the voices of [the ladies]627-the ladies were drowned for a while , till another suspension brought [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton 's tones again distinctly forward.--Mr . [Elton]207-mrs. elton had just joined [them]2001-them , and [[his]102-frank churchill wife]2763-his wife was exclaiming ,

“ Oh ! [you]207-mrs. elton have found [us]4873-our out at last , have [you]207-mrs. elton , in [our]4873-our seclusion?--I was this moment telling [Jane]152-miss fairfax , [I]207-mrs. elton thought [you]207-mrs. elton would begin to be impatient for tidings of [us]4873-our . ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ Jane!”--repeated[102-frank churchill] [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill , with a look of surprize and displeasure.--“That is easy -- but [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax does not disapprove it , [I]102-frank churchill suppose . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ How do [you]207-mrs. elton like [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton ? ”[123-emma] said [Emma]123-emma in a whisper .

“ Not at all . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ [You]207-mrs. elton are ungrateful . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ Ungrateful!--What do [you]207-mrs. elton mean ? ”[102-frank churchill] Then changing from a frown to a smile--“No , do not tell [me]102-frank churchill -- [I]102-frank churchill do not want to know what [you]207-mrs. elton mean.--Where is [my]102-frank churchill father?--When are [we]4875-we to begin dancing ? ”[102-frank churchill]

[Emma]123-emma could hardly understand [him]102-frank churchill ; [he]102-frank churchill seemed in an odd humour . [He]102-frank churchill walked off to find [[his]102-frank churchill father]518-his father , but was quickly back again with both [Mr.]2004-mr. and [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston . [He]102-frank churchill had met with [them]2005-them in a little perplexity , which must be laid before [Emma]123-emma . It had just occurred to [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston that [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton must be asked to begin the ball ; that [she]88-mrs. weston would expect it ; which interfered with all [their]2005-them wishes of giving [Emma]123-emma that distinction.--Emma heard the sad truth with fortitude .

“ And what are [we]2005-them to do for [a proper partner for [her]207-mrs. elton]4876-a proper partner for her ? ”[86-mr. weston] said [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston . “ [She]207-mrs. elton will think [Frank]102-frank churchill ought to ask [her]207-mrs. elton . ”[86-mr. weston]

[Frank]102-frank churchill turned instantly to [Emma]123-emma , to claim [her]123-emma former promise ; and boasted [himself]102-frank churchill [an engaged man]2006-an engaged man , which [[his]102-frank churchill father]518-his father looked [his]518-his father most perfect approbation of -- and it then appeared that [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston was wanting _ [him]102-frank churchill _ to dance with [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton [himself]102-frank churchill , and that [their]2008-their business was to help to persuade [him]102-frank churchill into it , which was done pretty soon.--Mr . [Weston]86-mr. weston and [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton led the way , [Mr. Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill and [Miss Woodhouse]295-miss woodhouse followed . [Emma]123-emma must submit to stand second to [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton , though [she]123-emma had always considered the ball as peculiarly for [her]123-emma . It was almost enough to make [her]123-emma think of marrying . [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton had undoubtedly the advantage , at this time , in vanity completely gratified ; for though [she]123-emma had intended to begin with [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill , [she]123-emma could not lose by the change . [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston might be [[his]86-mr. weston son]523-his son 's superior.--In spite of this little rub , however , [Emma]123-emma was smiling with enjoyment , delighted to see the respectable length of the set as it was forming , and to feel that [she]123-emma had so many hours of unusual festivity before her.--She was more disturbed by [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley 's not dancing than by any thing else.--There [he]102-frank churchill was , among [the standers - by]2010-the standers - by , where [he]102-frank churchill ought not to be ; [he]102-frank churchill ought to be dancing,--not classing [himself]102-frank churchill with [the husbands]2011-the husbands , and [fathers]2012-fathers , and [whist - players]2013-whist - players , who were pretending to feel an interest in the dance till [their]2013-whist - players rubbers were made up,--so young as [he]102-frank churchill looked!--He could not have appeared to greater advantage perhaps anywhere , than where [he]102-frank churchill had placed [himself]102-frank churchill . [His]102-frank churchill tall , firm , upright figure , among the bulky forms and stooping shoulders of [the elderly men]2014-the elderly men , was such as [Emma]123-emma felt must draw [every body]2749-every body 's eyes ; and , excepting [[her]123-emma own partner]2016-her own partner , there was [not one among [the whole row of young men who could be compared with him.--He moved a few steps nearer]2018-the whole row of young men who could be compared with him.--he moved a few steps nearer , and those few steps were enough to prove in how gentlemanlike a manner , with what natural grace , [he]102-frank churchill must have danced , would [he]102-frank churchill but take the trouble.--Whenever [she]123-emma caught [his]102-frank churchill eye , [she]123-emma forced [him]102-frank churchill to smile ; but in general [he]102-frank churchill was looking grave . [She]123-emma wished [he]102-frank churchill could love [a ballroom]2019-a ballroom better , and could like [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill better.--He seemed often observing [her]123-emma]2017-not one among the whole row of young men who could be compared with him.--he moved a few steps nearer , and those few steps were enough to prove in how gentlemanlike a manner , with what natural grace , he must have danced , would he but take the trouble.--whenever she caught his eye , she forced him to smile ; but in general he was looking grave . she wished he could love a ballroom better , and could like frank churchill better.--he seemed often observing her . [She]123-emma must not flatter [herself]123-emma that [he]102-frank churchill thought of [her]123-emma dancing , but if [he]102-frank churchill were criticising [her]123-emma behaviour , [she]123-emma did not feel afraid . There was nothing like flirtation between [her]123-emma and [[her]123-emma partner]1756-her partner . [They]2021-they seemed more like cheerful , [easy friends]2022-easy friends , than [lovers]2023-lovers . That [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill thought less of [her]123-emma than [he]102-frank churchill had done , was indubitable .

The ball proceeded pleasantly . The anxious cares , the incessant attentions of [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , were not thrown away . [Every body]2749-every body seemed happy ; and the praise of being a delightful ball , which is seldom bestowed till after a ball has ceased to be , was repeatedly given in the very beginning of the existence of this . Of very important , very recordable events , it was not more productive than such meetings usually are . There was one , however , which [Emma]123-emma thought something of.--The two last dances before supper were begun , and [Harriet]111-harriet had no [partner;--the only young lady sitting down;--and so equal had been hitherto the number of [dancers]2026-dancers]2025-partner;--the only young lady sitting down;--and so equal had been hitherto the number of dancers , that how there could be any one disengaged was the wonder!--But [Emma]123-emma 's wonder lessened soon afterwards , on seeing [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton sauntering about . [He]95-mr. elton would not ask [Harriet]111-harriet to dance if it were possible to be avoided : [she]123-emma was sure [he]95-mr. elton would not -- and [she]123-emma was expecting [him]95-mr. elton every moment to escape into [the card - room]2027-the card - room .

Escape , however , was not [his]95-mr. elton plan . [He]95-mr. elton came to the part of [the room]701-the room where [the sitters - by]2029-the sitters - by were collected , spoke to [some]4385-some , and walked about in front of [them]4385-some , as if to shew [his]95-mr. elton liberty , and [his]95-mr. elton resolution of maintaining it . [He]95-mr. elton did not omit being sometimes directly before [Miss Smith]111-harriet , or speaking to [those who were close to her.--Emma]2031-those who were close to her.--emma saw it . [She]111-harriet was not yet dancing ; [she]111-harriet was working [her]111-harriet way up from the bottom , and had therefore leisure to look around , and by only turning [her]111-harriet head a little [she]111-harriet saw it all . When [she]111-harriet was half - way up the set , [the whole group]2032-the whole group were exactly behind [her]111-harriet , and [she]111-harriet would no longer allow [her]111-harriet eyes to watch ; but [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton was so near , that [she]111-harriet heard every syllable of a dialogue which just then took place between [him]95-mr. elton and [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston ; and [she]111-harriet perceived that [[his]95-mr. elton wife]2763-his wife , who was standing immediately above [her]111-harriet , was not only listening also , but even encouraging [him]95-mr. elton by significant glances.--The kind - hearted , [gentle Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston had left [her]88-mrs. weston seat to join [him]95-mr. elton and say , “ Do not [you]95-mr. elton dance , [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton ? ”[88-mrs. weston] to which [his]95-mr. elton prompt reply was , “ Most readily , [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , if [you]88-mrs. weston will dance with [me]95-mr. elton . ”[95-mr. elton]

“ Me!--oh ! no -- [I]88-mrs. weston would get [you]88-mrs. weston a better partner than [myself]88-mrs. weston . [I]88-mrs. weston am [no dancer]4877-no dancer . ”[88-mrs. weston]

“ If [Mrs. Gilbert]114-mrs. martin wishes to dance , ”[95-mr. elton] said [he]95-mr. elton , “ [I]95-mr. elton shall have great pleasure , [I]95-mr. elton am sure -- for , though beginning to feel [myself]95-mr. elton rather [an old married man]4878-an old married man , and that [my]95-mr. elton dancing days are over , it would give [me]95-mr. elton very great pleasure at any time to stand up with [an old friend]4620-an old friend like [Mrs. Gilbert]114-mrs. martin . ”[95-mr. elton]

“ [Mrs. Gilbert]114-mrs. martin does not mean to dance , but there is [a young lady]2768-a young lady disengaged whom [I]88-mrs. weston should be very glad to see dancing -- [Miss Smith]111-harriet . ”[88-mrs. weston] “ [Miss Smith!--oh!--I]303-miss smith!--oh!--i had not observed.--You are extremely obliging -- and if [I]95-mr. elton were not [an old married man.--But]4881-an old married man.--but [my]95-mr. elton dancing days are over , [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston . [You]88-mrs. weston will excuse [me]95-mr. elton . Any thing else [I]95-mr. elton should be most happy to do , at [your]88-mrs. weston command -- but [my]95-mr. elton dancing days are over . ”[95-mr. elton]

[Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston said no more ; and [Emma]123-emma could imagine with what surprize and mortification [she]123-emma must be returning to [her]123-emma seat . This was [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton ! [the amiable , obliging , gentle Mr. Elton.--She]304-the amiable , obliging , gentle mr. elton.--she looked round for a moment ; [he]95-mr. elton had joined [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley at a little distance , and was arranging [himself]95-mr. elton for settled conversation , while smiles of high glee passed between [him]95-mr. elton and [[his]95-mr. elton wife]2763-his wife .

[She]2763-his wife would not look again . [Her]2763-his wife heart was in a glow , and [she]2763-his wife feared [her]2763-his wife face might be as hot .

In another moment a happier sight caught her;--Mr . [Knightley]92-mr. knightley leading [Harriet]111-harriet to the set!--Never had [she]2763-his wife been more surprized , seldom more delighted , than at that instant . [She]2763-his wife was all pleasure and gratitude , both for [Harriet]111-harriet and [herself]2763-his wife , and longed to be thanking [him]95-mr. elton ; and though too distant for speech , [her]2763-his wife countenance said much , as soon as [she]2763-his wife could catch [his]95-mr. elton eye again .

[His]95-mr. elton dancing proved to be just what [she]2763-his wife had believed it , extremely good ; and [Harriet]111-harriet would have seemed almost too lucky , if it had not been for the cruel state of things before , and for the very complete enjoyment and very high sense of the distinction which [her]2763-his wife happy features announced . It was not thrown away on [her]2763-his wife , [she]2763-his wife bounded higher than ever , flew farther down the middle , and was in a continual course of smiles .

[Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton had retreated into [the card - room]2027-the card - room , looking ( [Emma]123-emma trusted ) very foolish . [She]123-emma did not think [he]95-mr. elton was quite so hardened as [[his]95-mr. elton wife]2763-his wife , though growing very like [her;--_she]2763-his wife _ spoke some of [her]2763-his wife feelings , by observing audibly to [[her]2763-his wife partner]1756-her partner ,

“ [Knightley]92-mr. knightley has taken pity on poor little [Miss Smith!--Very]4882-miss smith!--very good - natured , [I]2763-his wife declare . ”[2763-his wife]

Supper was announced . The move began ; and [Miss Bates]105-miss bates might be heard from that moment , without interruption , till [her]105-miss bates being seated at table and taking up [her]105-miss bates spoon .

“ [Jane]105-miss bates , [Jane]105-miss bates , [[my]2763-his wife dear]2714-my dear [Jane]105-miss bates , where are you?--Here is [your]105-miss bates tippet . [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston begs [you]105-miss bates to put on [your]105-miss bates tippet . [She]88-mrs. weston says [she]88-mrs. weston is afraid there will be draughts in [the passage]3811-the passage , though every thing has been done -- One door nailed up -- Quantities of matting -- [[My]2763-his wife dear]2714-my dear [Jane]105-miss bates , indeed [you]105-miss bates must . [Mr. Churchill]102-frank churchill , oh ! [you]105-miss bates are too obliging ! How well [you]105-miss bates put it on!--so gratified ! Excellent dancing indeed!--Yes , [[my]2763-his wife dear]2714-my dear , [I]2763-his wife ran [home]562-home , as [I]2763-his wife said [I]2763-his wife should , to help [grandmama]3720-grandmama to bed , and got back again , and [nobody]2718-nobody missed me.--I set off without saying a word , just as [I]2763-his wife told [you]105-miss bates . [Grandmama]305-grandmama was quite well , had a charming evening with [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse , a vast deal of chat , and backgammon.--Tea was made [downstairs]1377-downstairs , biscuits and baked apples and wine before [she]3720-grandmama came away : amazing luck in some of [her]3720-grandmama throws : and [she]3720-grandmama inquired a great deal about [you]105-miss bates , how [you]105-miss bates were amused , and who were [[your]105-miss bates partners]4891-your partners . ' Oh ! ' said [I]2763-his wife , ' [I]2763-his wife shall not forestall [Jane]105-miss bates ; [I]2763-his wife left [her]105-miss bates dancing with [Mr. George Otway]126-george ; [she]105-miss bates will love to tell [you]105-miss bates all about it [herself]105-miss bates to - morrow : [[her]105-miss bates first partner]4892-her first partner was [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton , [I]2763-his wife do not know who will ask [her]105-miss bates next , perhaps [Mr. William Cox]216-mr. cox . ' [[My]2763-his wife dear sir]3019-my dear sir , [you]105-miss bates are too obliging.--Is there [nobody]2718-nobody [you]105-miss bates would not rather?--I am not helpless . [Sir]2734-sir , [you]105-miss bates are most kind . Upon [my]2763-his wife word , [Jane]105-miss bates on one arm , and [me]2763-his wife on the other!--Stop , stop , let [us]4896-we stand a little back , [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton is going ; [dear Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton , how elegant [she]105-miss bates looks!--Beautiful lace!--Now [we]4896-we all follow in [[her]105-miss bates train]4897-her train . Quite [the queen of the evening!--Well]4898-the queen of the evening!--well , here [we]4896-we are at [the passage]3811-the passage . Two steps , [Jane]105-miss bates , take care of the two steps . Oh ! no , there is but one . Well , [I]2763-his wife was persuaded there were two . How very odd ! [I]2763-his wife was convinced there were two , and there is but one . [I]2763-his wife never saw any thing equal to the comfort and style -- Candles everywhere.--I was telling [you]105-miss bates of [[your]105-miss bates grandmama]4900-your grandmama , [Jane,--There]306-jane,--there was a little disappointment.--The baked apples and biscuits , excellent in their way , [you]105-miss bates know ; but there was a delicate fricassee of sweetbread and some asparagus brought in at first , and [good Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse , not thinking the asparagus quite boiled enough , sent it all out again . [I]2763-his wife am all amazement ! could not have supposed any thing!--Such elegance and profusion!--I have seen nothing like it since -- Well , where shall [we]4896-we sit ? where shall [we]4896-we sit ? Anywhere , so that [Jane]105-miss bates is not in a draught . Where _ [I]2763-his wife _ sit is of no consequence .
