Soup too ! Bless [me]2763-his wife ! [I]2763-his wife should not be helped so soon , but it smells most excellent , and [I]2763-his wife can not help beginning . ”[2763-his wife]

[Emma]123-emma had no opportunity of speaking to [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley till after supper ; but , when [they]2038-they were all in [the ballroom]1716-the ballroom again , [her]123-emma eyes invited [him]92-mr. knightley irresistibly to come to [her]123-emma and be thanked . [He]92-mr. knightley was warm in [his]92-mr. knightley reprobation of [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton 's conduct ; it had been unpardonable rudeness ; and [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton 's looks also received the due share of censure .

“ [They]2038-they aimed at wounding more than [Harriet]111-harriet , ”[92-mr. knightley] said [he]92-mr. knightley . “ [Emma]123-emma , why is it that [they]2038-they are [[your]123-emma enemies]4904-your enemies ? ”[92-mr. knightley]

[He]92-mr. knightley looked with smiling penetration ; and , on receiving no answer , added , “ _ [She]111-harriet _ ought not to be angry with [you]123-emma , [I]92-mr. knightley suspect , whatever [he]92-mr. knightley may be.--To that surmise , [you]123-emma say nothing , of course ; but confess , [Emma]123-emma , that [you]123-emma did want [him]92-mr. knightley to marry [Harriet]111-harriet . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ [I]123-emma did , ”[123-emma] replied [Emma]123-emma , “ and [they]2038-they can not forgive [me]123-emma . ”[123-emma]

[He]92-mr. knightley shook [his]92-mr. knightley head ; but there was a smile of indulgence with it , and [he]92-mr. knightley only said ,

“ [I]92-mr. knightley shall not scold [you]123-emma . [I]92-mr. knightley leave [you]123-emma to [your]123-emma own reflections . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ Can [you]123-emma trust [me]92-mr. knightley with such flatterers?--Does [my]92-mr. knightley vain spirit ever tell [me]92-mr. knightley [I]92-mr. knightley am wrong ? ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ Not [your]123-emma vain spirit , but [your]123-emma serious spirit.--If one leads [you]123-emma wrong , [I]92-mr. knightley am sure the other tells [you]123-emma of it . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ [I]92-mr. knightley do own [myself]92-mr. knightley to have been completely mistaken in [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton . There is a littleness about [him]95-mr. elton which [you]123-emma discovered , and which [I]92-mr. knightley did not : and [I]92-mr. knightley was fully convinced of [his]95-mr. elton being in love with [Harriet]111-harriet . It was through a series of strange blunders ! ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ And , in return for [your]123-emma acknowledging so much , [I]92-mr. knightley will do [you]123-emma the justice to say , that [you]123-emma would have chosen for [him]95-mr. elton better than [he]95-mr. elton has chosen for himself.--Harriet [Smith]111-harriet has some first - rate qualities , which [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton is totally without . [An unpretending , single - minded , artless girl]4905-an unpretending , single - minded , artless girl -- infinitely to be preferred by [any man of sense and taste]4906-any man of sense and taste to [such a woman as [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton]4907-such a woman as mrs. elton . [I]92-mr. knightley found [Harriet]111-harriet more conversable than [I]92-mr. knightley expected . ”[92-mr. knightley]

[Emma]123-emma was extremely gratified.--They were interrupted by the bustle of [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston calling on [every body]2749-every body to begin dancing again .

“ Come [Miss Woodhouse]295-miss woodhouse , [Miss Otway]300-miss otway , [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax , what are [you]123-emma all doing?--Come [Emma]123-emma , set [[your]123-emma companions]4908-your companions the example . [Every body]2749-every body is lazy ! [Every body]2749-every body is asleep ! ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ [I]123-emma am ready , ”[123-emma] said [Emma]123-emma , “ whenever [I]123-emma am wanted . ”[123-emma]

“ Whom are [you]123-emma going to dance with ? ”[92-mr. knightley] asked [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley .

[She]123-emma hesitated a moment , and then replied , “ With [you]92-mr. knightley , if [you]92-mr. knightley will ask [me]123-emma . ”[123-emma]

“ [Brother]3042-brother and [sister]3216-sister ! no , indeed . ”[123-emma]

CHAPTER III

This little explanation with [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley gave [Emma]123-emma considerable pleasure . It was one of the agreeable recollections of the ball , which [she]123-emma walked about [the lawn]4430-the lawn the next morning to enjoy.--She was extremely glad that [they]2042-they had come to so good an understanding respecting [the Eltons]143-the eltons , and that [their]2042-they opinions of both [husband]1547-husband and [wife]1548-wife were so much alike ; and [his]92-mr. knightley praise of [Harriet]111-harriet , [his]92-mr. knightley concession in [her]111-harriet favour , was peculiarly gratifying . The impertinence of [the Eltons]143-the eltons , which for a few minutes had threatened to ruin the rest of [her]123-emma evening , had been the occasion of some of its highest satisfactions ; and [she]123-emma looked forward to another happy result -- the cure of [Harriet]111-harriet 's infatuation.--From [Harriet]111-harriet 's manner of speaking of the circumstance before [they]2042-they quitted [the ballroom]1716-the ballroom , [she]123-emma had strong hopes . It seemed as if [her]123-emma eyes were suddenly opened , and [she]123-emma were enabled to see that [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton was not [the superior creature [she]123-emma had believed [him]95-mr. elton]2046-the superior creature she had believed him . The fever was over , and [Emma]123-emma could harbour little fear of the pulse being quickened again by injurious courtesy . [She]123-emma depended on the evil feelings of [the Eltons]143-the eltons for supplying all the discipline of pointed neglect that could be farther requisite.--Harriet rational , [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill not too much in love , and [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley not wanting to quarrel with [her]123-emma , how very happy a summer must be before [her]123-emma !

[She]123-emma was not to see [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill this morning . [He]102-frank churchill had told [her]123-emma that [he]102-frank churchill could not allow [himself]102-frank churchill the pleasure of stopping at [Hartfield]2-hartfield , as [he]102-frank churchill was to be at [home]562-home by the middle of the day . [She]123-emma did not regret it .

Having arranged all these matters , looked [them]2048-them through , and put [them]2048-them all to rights , [she]123-emma was just turning to [the house]435-the house with spirits freshened up for the demands of [the two little boys]2050-the two little boys , as well as of [[their]2050-the two little boys grandpapa]1872-their grandpapa , when the great iron sweep - gate opened , and [two persons]1647-two persons entered whom [she]123-emma had never less expected to see together -- [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill , with [Harriet]111-harriet leaning on [his]102-frank churchill arm -- actually [Harriet!--A]307-harriet!--a moment sufficed to convince [her]123-emma that something extraordinary had happened . [Harriet]111-harriet looked white and frightened , and [he]102-frank churchill was trying to cheer her.--The iron gates and the front - door were not twenty yards asunder;--they were all three soon in [the hall]1379-the hall , and [Harriet]111-harriet immediately sinking into a chair fainted away .

[A young lady who faints ,]2054-a young lady who faints , must be recovered ; questions must be answered , and surprizes be explained . Such events are very interesting , but the suspense of them can not last long . A few minutes made [Emma]123-emma acquainted with the whole .

[Miss Smith]111-harriet , and [Miss Bickerton]308-miss bickerton , [another parlour boarder at [Mrs. Goddard]109-mrs. goddard 's , who had been also at the ball]2055-another parlour boarder at mrs. goddard 's , who had been also at the ball , had walked out together , and taken [a road]2056-a road , [the Richmond road]2057-the richmond road , which , though apparently public enough for safety , had led [them]2058-them into alarm.--About half a mile beyond [Highbury]3-highbury , making a sudden turn , and deeply shaded by elms on each side , [it]2059-it became for a considerable stretch very retired ; and when [the young ladies]834-the young ladies had advanced some way into [it]2059-it , [they]834-the young ladies had suddenly perceived at a small distance before [them]834-the young ladies , on [a broader patch of greensward by the side]2061-a broader patch of greensward by the side , [a party of [gipsies]2063-gipsies]2062-a party of gipsies . [A child on the watch]2064-a child on the watch , came towards [them]834-the young ladies to beg ; and [Miss Bickerton]308-miss bickerton , excessively frightened , gave a great scream , and calling on [Harriet]111-harriet to follow [her]308-miss bickerton , ran up [a steep bank]2065-a steep bank , cleared a slight hedge at the top , and made the best of [her]308-miss bickerton way by a short cut back to [Highbury]3-highbury . But poor [Harriet]111-harriet could not follow . [She]111-harriet had suffered very much from cramp after dancing , and [her]111-harriet first attempt to mount the bank brought on such a return of it as made [her]111-harriet absolutely powerless -- and in this state , and exceedingly terrified , [she]111-harriet had been obliged to remain .

How [the trampers]2066-the trampers might have behaved , had [the young ladies]834-the young ladies been more courageous , must be doubtful ; but such an invitation for attack could not be resisted ; and [Harriet]111-harriet was soon assailed by [half a dozen children]2068-half a dozen children , headed by [a stout woman]2069-a stout woman and [a great boy]2070-a great boy , all clamorous , and impertinent in look , though not absolutely in word.--More and more frightened , [she]111-harriet immediately promised [them]2068-half a dozen children money , and taking out [her]111-harriet purse , gave [them]2068-half a dozen children a shilling , and begged [them]2068-half a dozen children not to want more , or to use [her]111-harriet ill.--She was then able to walk , though but slowly , and was moving away -- but [her]111-harriet terror and [her]111-harriet purse were too tempting , and [she]111-harriet was followed , or rather surrounded , by [the whole gang]2071-the whole gang , demanding more .

In this state [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill had found [her]111-harriet , [she]111-harriet trembling and conditioning , [they]2072-they loud and insolent . By a most fortunate chance [his]102-frank churchill leaving [Highbury]3-highbury had been delayed so as to bring [him]102-frank churchill to [her]111-harriet assistance at this critical moment . The pleasantness of the morning had induced [him]102-frank churchill to walk forward , and leave [his]102-frank churchill horses to meet [him]102-frank churchill by [another road]2073-another road , a mile or two beyond [Highbury]3-highbury -- and happening to have borrowed a pair of scissors the night before of [Miss Bates]105-miss bates , and to have forgotten to restore them , [he]102-frank churchill had been obliged to stop at [her]111-harriet door , and go in for a few minutes : [he]102-frank churchill was therefore later than [he]102-frank churchill had intended ; and being on foot , was unseen by [the whole party]1152-the whole party till almost close to [them]1152-the whole party . The terror which [the woman]1799-the woman and [boy]3672-boy had been creating in [Harriet]111-harriet was then [their]1152-the whole party own portion . [He]102-frank churchill had left [them]1152-the whole party completely frightened ; and [Harriet]111-harriet eagerly clinging to [him]102-frank churchill , and hardly able to speak , had just strength enough to reach [Hartfield]93-miss woodhouse , before [her]111-harriet spirits were quite overcome . It was [his]102-frank churchill idea to bring [her]111-harriet to [Hartfield]2-hartfield : [he]102-frank churchill had thought of [no other place]2077-no other place .

This was the amount of the whole story,--of [his]102-frank churchill communication and of [Harriet]111-harriet 's as soon as [she]111-harriet had recovered [her]111-harriet senses and speech.--He dared not stay longer than to see [her]111-harriet well ; these several delays left [him]102-frank churchill not another minute to lose ; and [Emma]123-emma engaging to give assurance of [her]111-harriet safety to [Mrs. Goddard]109-mrs. goddard , and notice of there being such a set of people in [the neighbourhood]1432-the neighbourhood to [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley , [he]102-frank churchill set off , with all the grateful blessings that [she]123-emma could utter for [[her]123-emma friend]427-her friend and [herself]123-emma .

Such an adventure as [this,--a fine young man]2080-this,--a fine young man and [a lovely young woman]2081-a lovely young woman thrown together in such a way , could hardly fail of suggesting certain ideas to the coldest heart and the steadiest brain . So [Emma]123-emma thought , at least . Could [a linguist]2082-a linguist , could [a grammarian]2083-a grammarian , could even [a mathematician]2084-a mathematician have seen what [she]123-emma did , have witnessed [their]2085-their appearance together , and heard [their]2085-their history of it , without feeling that circumstances had been at work to make them peculiarly interesting to each other?--How much more must [an imaginist]2086-an imaginist , like [herself]123-emma , be on fire with speculation and foresight!--especially with such a groundwork of anticipation as [her]123-emma mind had already made .

It was a very extraordinary thing ! Nothing of the sort had ever occurred before to [any young ladies in [the place]450-the place]2087-any young ladies in the place , within [her]123-emma memory ; no rencontre , no alarm of the kind;--and now it had happened to [the very person]2089-the very person , and at the very hour , when [the other very person]2090-the other very person was chancing to pass by to rescue her!--It certainly was very extraordinary!--And knowing , as [she]123-emma did , the favourable state of mind of each at this period , it struck [her]123-emma the more . [He]2080-this,--a fine young man was wishing to get the better of [his]2080-this,--a fine young man attachment to [herself]123-emma , [she]123-emma just recovering from [her]123-emma mania for [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton . It seemed as if every thing united to promise the most interesting consequences . It was not possible that the occurrence should not be strongly recommending each to [the other]739-the other .

In the few minutes ' conversation which [she]123-emma had yet had with [him]2080-this,--a fine young man , while [Harriet]111-harriet had been partially insensible , [he]2080-this,--a fine young man had spoken of [her]111-harriet terror , [her]111-harriet naivete , [her]111-harriet fervour as [she]111-harriet seized and clung to [his]2080-this,--a fine young man arm , with a sensibility amused and delighted ; and just at last , after [Harriet]111-harriet 's own account had been given , [he]2080-this,--a fine young man had expressed [his]2080-this,--a fine young man indignation at the abominable folly of [Miss Bickerton]308-miss bickerton in the warmest terms . Every thing was to take its natural course , however , neither impelled nor assisted . [She]123-emma would not stir a step , nor drop a hint . No , [she]123-emma had had enough of interference . There could be no harm in a scheme , a mere passive scheme . It was no more than a wish . Beyond it [she]123-emma would on no account proceed .

[Emma]123-emma 's first resolution was to keep [[her]123-emma father]425-her father from the knowledge of what had passed,--aware of the anxiety and alarm it would occasion : but [she]123-emma soon felt that concealment must be impossible . Within half an hour it was known all over [Highbury]3-highbury . It was the very event to engage [those who talk most]2093-those who talk most , [the young and the low]2094-the young and the low ; and [all [the youth]2096-the youth and [servants]1339-servants in [the place]450-the place]2095-all the youth and servants in the place were soon in the happiness of frightful news . The last night 's ball seemed lost in the gipsies . [Poor Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse trembled as [he]85-mr. woodhouse sat , and , as [Emma]123-emma had foreseen , would scarcely be satisfied without [their]2099-their promising never to go beyond the shrubbery again . It was some comfort to [him]85-mr. woodhouse that many inquiries after [himself]85-mr. woodhouse and [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse ( for [[his]85-mr. woodhouse neighbours]541-his neighbours knew that [he]85-mr. woodhouse loved to be inquired after ) , as well as [Miss Smith]111-harriet , were coming in during the rest of the day ; and [he]85-mr. woodhouse had the pleasure of returning for answer , that [they]2099-their were all very indifferent -- which , though not exactly true , for [she]123-emma was perfectly well , and [Harriet]111-harriet not much otherwise , [Emma]123-emma would not interfere with . [She]123-emma had an unhappy state of health in general for [the child of such a man]2101-the child of such a man , for [she]123-emma hardly knew what indisposition was ; and if [he]85-mr. woodhouse did not invent illnesses for [her]123-emma , [she]123-emma could make no figure in a message .

[The gipsies]2102-the gipsies did not wait for the operations of justice ; [they]2102-the gipsies took [themselves]2102-the gipsies off in a hurry . [The young ladies of [Highbury]3-highbury]2103-the young ladies of highbury might have walked again in safety before [their]2103-the young ladies of highbury panic began , and the whole history dwindled soon into a matter of little importance but to [Emma]123-emma and [her]123-emma nephews:--in [her]123-emma imagination it maintained its ground , and [Henry]125-henry and [John]92-mr. knightley were still asking every day for the story of [Harriet]111-harriet and [the gipsies]2102-the gipsies , and still tenaciously setting [her]111-harriet right if [she]111-harriet varied in the slightest particular from the original recital .

CHAPTER IV

A very few days had passed after this adventure , when [Harriet]111-harriet came one morning to [Emma]123-emma with a small parcel in [her]111-harriet hand , and after sitting down and hesitating , thus began :

“ [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse -- if [you]123-emma are at leisure -- [I]111-harriet have something that [I]111-harriet should like to tell [you]123-emma -- a sort of confession to make -- and then , [you]123-emma know , it will be over . ”[111-harriet]

[Emma]123-emma was a good deal surprized ; but begged [her]111-harriet to speak . There was a seriousness in [Harriet]111-harriet 's manner which prepared [her]111-harriet , quite as much as [her]111-harriet words , for something more than ordinary .

“ It is [my]111-harriet duty , and [I]111-harriet am sure it is [my]111-harriet wish , ”[111-harriet] [she]111-harriet continued , “ to have no reserves with [you]123-emma on this subject . As [I]111-harriet am happily quite an altered creature in _ one _ _ respect _ , it is very fit that [you]123-emma should have the satisfaction of knowing it . [I]111-harriet do not want to say more than is necessary -- [I]111-harriet am too much ashamed of having given way as [I]111-harriet have done , and [I]111-harriet dare say [you]123-emma understand [me]111-harriet . ”[111-harriet]

“ Yes , ”[123-emma] said [Emma]123-emma , “ [I]123-emma hope [I]123-emma do . ”[123-emma]

“ How [I]111-harriet could so long a time be fancying [myself]111-harriet ! ... ”[111-harriet] cried [Harriet]111-harriet , warmly . “ It seems like madness ! [I]2105-i can see nothing at all extraordinary in [him]4914-him now.--I do not care whether [I]2105-i meet [him]4914-him or not -- except that of the two [I]2105-i had rather not see [him]4914-him -- and indeed [I]2105-i would go any distance round to avoid [him]4914-him -- but [I]2105-i do not envy [[his]4914-him wife]2763-his wife in the least ; [I]2105-i neither admire [her]2763-his wife nor envy [her]2763-his wife , as [I]2105-i have done : [she]2763-his wife is very charming , [I]2105-i dare say , and all that , but [I]2105-i think [her]2763-his wife very ill - tempered and disagreeable -- [I]2105-i shall never forget [her]2763-his wife look the other night!--However , [I]2105-i assure [you]4916-you , [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse , [I]2105-i wish [her]2763-his wife no evil.--No , let [them]4917-them be ever so happy together , it will not give [me]2105-i another moment 's pang : and to convince [you]4916-you that [I]2105-i have been speaking truth , [I]2105-i am now going to destroy -- what [I]2105-i ought to have destroyed long ago -- what [I]2105-i ought never to have kept -- [I]2105-i know that very well ( blushing as [she]2763-his wife spoke).--However , now [I]2105-i will destroy it all -- and it is [my]2105-i particular wish to do it in [your]4916-you presence , that [you]4916-you may see how rational [I]2105-i am grown . Can not [you]4916-you guess what this parcel holds ? ”[2105-i] said [she]2105-i , with a conscious look .

“ Not the least in the world.--Did [he]4918-he ever give [you]4916-you any thing ? ”[111-harriet]

“ No -- [I]2105-i can not call [them]4919-them gifts ; but they are things that [I]2105-i have valued very much . ”[2105-i]

[She]2105-i held the parcel towards [her]2105-i , and [Emma]123-emma read the words _ Most _ _ precious _ _ treasures _ on the top . [Her]123-emma curiosity was greatly excited . [Harriet]111-harriet unfolded the parcel , and [she]111-harriet looked on with impatience . Within abundance of silver paper was a pretty little [Tunbridge]63-tunbridge - ware box , which [Harriet]111-harriet opened : it was well lined with the softest cotton ; but , excepting the cotton , [Emma]123-emma saw only a small piece of court - plaister .

“ Now , ”[111-harriet] said [Harriet]111-harriet , “ [you]111-harriet _ must _ recollect . ”[111-harriet]

“ No , indeed [I]111-harriet do not . ”[111-harriet]

“ Dear [me]111-harriet ! [I]111-harriet should not have thought it possible [you]111-harriet could forget what passed in [this very room]4920-this very room about [court]4921-court [- plaister]309-- plaister , one of the very last times [we]4922-we ever met in it!--It was but a very few days before [I]111-harriet had [my]111-harriet sore throat -- just before [Mr.]4923-mr. and [Mrs. John Knightley]122-mrs. john knightley came -- [I]111-harriet think the very evening.--Do not [you]111-harriet remember [his]4923-mr. cutting [his]4923-mr. finger with [your]111-harriet new penknife , and [your]111-harriet recommending court - plaister?--But , as [you]111-harriet had none about [you]111-harriet , and knew [I]111-harriet had , [you]111-harriet desired [me]111-harriet to supply [him]4923-mr. ; and so [I]111-harriet took [mine]111-harriet out and cut [him]4923-mr. a piece ; but it was a great deal too large , and [he]4923-mr. cut it smaller , and kept playing some time with what was left , before [he]4923-mr. gave it back to [me]111-harriet . And so then , in [my]111-harriet nonsense , [I]111-harriet could not help making a treasure of it -- so [I]111-harriet put it by never to be used , and looked at it now and then as a great treat . ”[111-harriet]

“ [My]123-emma dearest [Harriet]111-harriet ! ”[123-emma] cried [Emma]123-emma , putting [her]123-emma hand before [her]123-emma face , and jumping up , “ [you]111-harriet make [me]123-emma more ashamed of [myself]123-emma than [I]123-emma can bear . Remember it ? Aye , [I]123-emma remember it all now ; all , except [your]111-harriet saving this relic -- [I]123-emma knew nothing of that till this moment -- but the cutting the finger , and [my]123-emma recommending court - plaister , and saying [I]123-emma had none about me!--Oh ! [my]123-emma sins , [my]123-emma sins!--And [I]123-emma had plenty all the while in [my]123-emma pocket!--One of [my]123-emma senseless tricks!--I deserve to be under a continual blush all the rest of [my]123-emma life.--Well--(sitting down again)--go on -- what else ? ”[123-emma]

“ And had [you]111-harriet really some at hand [yourself]111-harriet ? [I]111-harriet am sure [I]111-harriet never suspected it , [you]111-harriet did it so naturally . ”[111-harriet]

“ And so [you]111-harriet actually put this piece of court - plaister by for [his]4924-his sake ! ”[123-emma] said [Emma]123-emma , recovering from [her]123-emma state of shame and feeling divided between wonder and amusement . And secretly [she]123-emma added to [herself]123-emma , “ Lord bless [me]123-emma ! when should [I]123-emma ever have thought of putting by in cotton a piece of court - plaister that [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill had been pulling about ! [I]123-emma never was equal to this . ”[123-emma]

“ Here , ”[111-harriet] resumed [Harriet]111-harriet , turning to [her]111-harriet box again , “ here is something still more valuable , [I]111-harriet mean that _ has _ _ been _ more valuable , because this is what did really once belong to [him]4924-his , which [the court - plaister]4925-the court - plaister never did . ”[111-harriet]

[Emma]123-emma was quite eager to see this superior treasure . It was the end of an old pencil,--the part without any lead .

“ This was really [his]4924-his , ”[123-emma] said [Harriet.--“Do]310-harriet.--“do not [you]111-harriet remember one [morning?--no]311-morning?--no , [I]123-emma dare say [you]111-harriet do not . But one morning -- [I]123-emma forget exactly the day -- but perhaps it was the Tuesday or Wednesday before _ that _ _ evening _ , [he]4924-his wanted to make a memorandum in [his]4924-his pocket - book ; it was about spruce - beer . [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley had been telling [him]4924-his something about brewing spruce - beer , and [he]4924-his wanted to put it down ; but when [he]4924-his took out [his]4924-his pencil , there was so little lead that [he]4924-his soon cut it all away , and it would not do , so [you]111-harriet lent [him]4924-his another , and this was left upon the table as good for nothing . But [I]123-emma kept [my]123-emma eye on it ; and , as soon as [I]123-emma dared , caught it up , and never parted with it again from that moment . ”[123-emma]

“ [I]123-emma do remember it , ”[123-emma] cried [Emma]123-emma ; “ [I]123-emma perfectly remember it.--Talking about spruce - beer.--Oh ! yes -- [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley and [I]123-emma both saying [we]4926-we liked it , and [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton 's seeming resolved to learn to like it too . [I]123-emma perfectly remember it.--Stop ; [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley was standing just here , was not [he]95-mr. elton ? [I]123-emma have an idea [he]95-mr. elton was standing just here . ”[123-emma]

“ Ah ! [I]123-emma do not know . [I]123-emma can not recollect.--It is very odd , but [I]123-emma can not recollect.--Mr . [Elton]95-mr. elton was sitting here , [I]123-emma remember , much about where [I]123-emma am now . ”--[123-emma]

“ Well , go on . ”[123-emma]

“ Oh ! that 's all . [I]123-emma have nothing more to shew [you]123-emma , or to say -- except that [I]123-emma am now going to throw [them]4927-them both behind the fire , and [I]123-emma wish [you]123-emma to see [me]123-emma do it . ”[123-emma]

“ [[My]123-emma poor dear [Harriet]111-harriet]4928-my poor dear harriet ! and have [you]111-harriet actually found happiness in treasuring up these things ? ”[123-emma]

“ Yes , [simpleton]4929-simpleton as [I]123-emma was!--but [I]123-emma am quite ashamed of it now , and wish [I]123-emma could forget as easily as [I]123-emma can burn them . It was very wrong of [me]123-emma , [you]123-emma know , to keep any remembrances , after [he]4929-simpleton was married . [I]123-emma knew it was -- but had not resolution enough to part with [them]4927-them . ”[123-emma]

“ But , [Harriet]111-harriet , is it necessary to burn [the court]4930-the court - plaister?--I have not a word to say for the bit of old pencil , but [the court - plaister]4925-the court - plaister might be useful . ”[123-emma]

“ [I]111-harriet shall be happier to burn it , ”[111-harriet] replied [Harriet]111-harriet . “ [It]4925-the court - plaister has a disagreeable look to [me]111-harriet . [I]111-harriet must get rid of every thing.--There it goes , and there is an end , thank Heaven ! of [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton . ”[111-harriet]

“ And when , ”[123-emma] thought [Emma]123-emma , “ will there be a beginning of [Mr. Churchill]102-frank churchill ? ”[123-emma]

[She]123-emma had soon afterwards reason to believe that the beginning was already made , and could not but hope that [the gipsy]2106-the gipsy , though [she]2106-the gipsy had _ told _ no fortune , might be proved to have made [Harriet's.--About]312-harriet's.--about a fortnight after the alarm , [they]2107-they came to a sufficient explanation , and quite undesignedly . [Emma]123-emma was not thinking of it at the moment , which made the information [she]123-emma received more valuable . [She]123-emma merely said , in the course of some trivial chat , “ Well , [Harriet]111-harriet , whenever [you]111-harriet marry [I]123-emma would advise [you]111-harriet to do so and so”--and[123-emma] thought no more of it , till after a minute 's silence [she]123-emma heard [Harriet]111-harriet say in a very serious tone , “ [I]111-harriet shall never marry . ”[111-harriet]

[Emma]123-emma then looked up , and immediately saw how it was ; and after a moment 's debate , as to whether it should pass unnoticed or not , replied ,

“ Never marry!--This is a new resolution . ”[123-emma]

“ It is one that [I]123-emma shall never change , however . ”[123-emma]

After another short hesitation , “ [I]123-emma hope it does not proceed from -- [I]123-emma hope it is not in compliment to [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton ? ”[123-emma]

“ [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton indeed ! ”[111-harriet] cried [Harriet]111-harriet indignantly.--“Oh ! [no”--and[123-emma] Emma]123-emma could just catch the words , “ so superior to [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton ! ”[123-emma]

[She]123-emma then took a longer time for consideration . Should [she]111-harriet proceed no farther?--should [she]111-harriet let it pass , and seem to suspect nothing?--Perhaps [Harriet]111-harriet might think [her]111-harriet cold or angry if [she]111-harriet did ; or perhaps if [she]111-harriet were totally silent , it might only drive [Harriet]111-harriet into asking [her]111-harriet to hear too much ; and against any thing like such an unreserve as had been , such an open and frequent discussion of hopes and chances , [she]111-harriet was perfectly resolved.--She believed it would be wiser for [her]111-harriet to say and know at once , all that [she]111-harriet meant to say and know . Plain dealing was always best . [She]111-harriet had previously determined how far [she]111-harriet would proceed , on any application of the sort ; and it would be safer for both , to have the judicious law of [her]111-harriet own brain laid down with speed.--She was decided , and thus spoke--

“ [Harriet]111-harriet , [I]2109-i will not affect to be in doubt of [your]111-harriet meaning . [Your]111-harriet resolution , or rather [your]111-harriet expectation of never marrying , results from an idea that [the person whom [you]111-harriet might prefer]4932-the person whom you might prefer , would be too greatly [your]111-harriet superior in situation to think of [you]111-harriet . Is not it so ? ”[2109-i]

“ Oh ! [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse , believe [me]2109-i [I]2109-i have not the presumption to suppose-- Indeed [I]2109-i am not so mad.--But it is a pleasure to [me]2109-i to admire [him]2109-i at a distance -- and to think of [his]2109-i infinite superiority to all the rest of [the world]403-the world , with the gratitude , wonder , and veneration , which are so proper , in [me]2109-i especially . ”[2109-i]

“ [I]2109-i am not at all surprized at [you]111-harriet , [Harriet]111-harriet . The service [he]2109-i rendered [you]111-harriet was enough to warm [your]111-harriet heart . ”[2109-i]

“ Service ! oh ! it was such an inexpressible obligation!--The very recollection of it , and all that [I]2109-i felt at the time -- when [I]2109-i saw [him]2109-i coming -- [his]2109-i noble look -- and [my]2109-i wretchedness before . Such a change ! In one moment such a change ! From perfect misery to perfect happiness ! ”[2109-i]

“ It is very natural . It is natural , and it is honourable.--Yes , honourable , [I]2109-i think , to chuse so well and so gratefully.--But that it will be a fortunate preference is more than [I]2109-i can promise . [I]2109-i do not advise [you]111-harriet to give way to it , [Harriet]111-harriet . [I]2109-i do not by any means engage for [its]4934-its being returned . Consider what [you]111-harriet are about . Perhaps it will be wisest in [you]111-harriet to check [your]111-harriet feelings while [you]111-harriet can : at any rate do not let [them]4934-its carry [you]111-harriet far , unless [you]111-harriet are persuaded of [his]2109-i liking [you]111-harriet . Be observant of [him]2109-i . Let [his]2109-i behaviour be the guide of [your]111-harriet sensations . [I]2109-i give [you]111-harriet this caution now , because [I]2109-i shall never speak to [you]111-harriet again on the subject . [I]2109-i am determined against all interference . Henceforward [I]2109-i know nothing of the matter . Let no name ever pass [our]4935-we lips . [We]4935-we were very wrong before ; [we]4935-we will be cautious now.--He is [[your]111-harriet superior]4936-your superior , no doubt , and there do seem objections and obstacles of a very serious nature ; but yet , [Harriet]111-harriet , more wonderful things have taken place , there have been matches of greater disparity . But take care of [yourself]111-harriet . [I]2109-i would not have [you]111-harriet too sanguine ; though , however it may end , be assured [your]111-harriet raising [your]111-harriet thoughts to _ [him]427-her friend _ , is a mark of good taste which [I]2109-i shall always know how to value . ”[2109-i]

[Harriet]111-harriet kissed [her]111-harriet hand in silent and submissive gratitude . [Emma]123-emma was very decided in thinking such an attachment no bad thing for [[her]123-emma friend]427-her friend . [Its]2109-i tendency would be to raise and refine [her]123-emma mind -- and it must be saving [her]123-emma from the danger of degradation .

CHAPTER V

In this state of schemes , and hopes , and connivance , [June]276-june opened upon [Hartfield]93-miss woodhouse . To [Highbury]3-highbury in general it brought no material change . [The Eltons]143-the eltons were still talking of a visit from [the Sucklings]313-the sucklings , and of the use to be made of [[their]313-the sucklings barouche - landau]4444-their barouche - landau ; and [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax was still at [[her]152-miss fairfax grandmother]3294-her grandmother 's ; and as the return of [the Campbells]190-the campbells from [Ireland]32-ireland was again delayed , and [August]314-august , instead of Midsummer , fixed for it , [she]152-miss fairfax was likely to remain there full two months longer , provided at least [she]152-miss fairfax were able to defeat [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton 's activity in [her]152-miss fairfax service , and save [herself]152-miss fairfax from being hurried into a delightful situation against [her]152-miss fairfax will .

[Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley , who , for some reason best known to [himself]92-mr. knightley , had certainly taken an early dislike to [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill , was only growing to dislike [him]92-mr. knightley more . [He]92-mr. knightley began to suspect [him]92-mr. knightley of some double dealing in [his]92-mr. knightley pursuit of [Emma]123-emma . That [Emma]123-emma was [his]92-mr. knightley object appeared indisputable . Every thing declared it ; [his]92-mr. knightley own attentions , [[his]92-mr. knightley father]518-his father 's hints , [[his]92-mr. knightley mother - in - law]1397-his mother - in - law 's guarded silence ; it was all in unison ; words , conduct , discretion , and indiscretion , told the same story . But while so many were devoting [him]92-mr. knightley to [Emma]123-emma , and [Emma]123-emma [herself]123-emma making [him]92-mr. knightley over to [Harriet]111-harriet , [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley began to suspect [him]92-mr. knightley of some inclination to trifle with [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax . [He]92-mr. knightley could not understand it ; but there were symptoms of intelligence between [them]2114-them -- [he]92-mr. knightley thought so at least -- symptoms of admiration on [his]92-mr. knightley side , which , having once observed , [he]92-mr. knightley could not persuade [himself]92-mr. knightley to think entirely void of meaning , however [he]92-mr. knightley might wish to escape any of [Emma]123-emma 's errors of imagination . _ [She]152-miss fairfax _ was not present when the suspicion first arose . [He]92-mr. knightley was dining with [[the Randalls]101-randalls family]2115-the randalls family , and [Jane]152-miss fairfax , at [the Eltons ']2116-the eltons ' ; and [he]92-mr. knightley had seen a look , more than a single look , at [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax , which , from [the admirer of [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse]2117-the admirer of miss woodhouse , seemed somewhat out of place . When [he]92-mr. knightley was again in [their]2114-them company , [he]92-mr. knightley could not help remembering what [he]92-mr. knightley had seen ; nor could [he]92-mr. knightley avoid observations which , unless it were like [Cowper]315-cowper and [his]315-cowper fire at twilight ,

“ [Myself]315-cowper creating what [I]315-cowper saw , ”[315-cowper]

brought [him]92-mr. knightley yet stronger suspicion of there being a something of private liking , of private understanding even , between [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill and [Jane]152-miss fairfax .

[He]92-mr. knightley had walked up one day after dinner , as [he]92-mr. knightley very often did , to spend [his]92-mr. knightley evening at [Hartfield]2-hartfield . [Emma]123-emma and [Harriet]111-harriet were going to walk ; [he]92-mr. knightley joined [them]2114-them ; and , on returning , [they]2114-them fell in with [a larger party , who , like [themselves]2114-them]2118-a larger party , who , like themselves , judged it wisest to take [their]2114-them exercise early , as the weather threatened rain ; [Mr.]2119-mr. and [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston and [[their]2114-them son]2120-their son , [Miss Bates]105-miss bates and [[her]105-miss bates niece]1204-her niece , who had accidentally met . [They]2114-them all united ; and , on reaching [Hartfield]2-hartfield gates , [[Emma]123-emma , who knew it was exactly the sort of visiting that would be welcome to [[her]123-emma father]425-her father]2122-emma , who knew it was exactly the sort of visiting that would be welcome to her father , pressed [them]2114-them all to go in and drink tea with [him]92-mr. knightley . [The Randalls party]2124-the randalls party agreed to it immediately ; and after a pretty long speech from [Miss Bates]105-miss bates , which [few persons listened to]2125-few persons listened to , [she]105-miss bates also found it possible to accept dear [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse 's most obliging invitation .

As [they]2114-them were turning into [the grounds]4429-the grounds , [Mr. Perry]106-mr. perry passed by on horseback . [The gentlemen]1438-the gentlemen spoke of [his]106-mr. perry horse .

“ By the bye , ”[102-frank churchill] said [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill to [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston presently , “ what became of [Mr. Perry]106-mr. perry 's plan of setting up [his]106-mr. perry carriage ? ”[88-mrs. weston]

[Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston looked surprized , and said , “ [I]88-mrs. weston did not know that [he]106-mr. perry ever had any such plan . ”[88-mrs. weston]

“ Nay , [I]102-frank churchill had it from [you]88-mrs. weston . [You]88-mrs. weston wrote [me]102-frank churchill word of it three months ago . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ [Me]88-mrs. weston ! impossible ! ”[88-mrs. weston]

“ Indeed [you]88-mrs. weston did . [I]102-frank churchill remember it perfectly . [You]88-mrs. weston mentioned it as what was certainly to be very soon . [Mrs. Perry]104-mrs. perry had told [somebody]604-somebody , and was extremely happy about it . It was owing to _ [her]104-mrs. perry _ persuasion , as [she]104-mrs. perry thought [his]106-mr. perry being out in bad weather did [him]106-mr. perry a great deal of harm . [You]88-mrs. weston must remember it now ? ”[102-frank churchill]

“ Upon [my]88-mrs. weston word [I]88-mrs. weston never heard of it till this moment . ”[88-mrs. weston]

“ Never ! really , never!--Bless [me]102-frank churchill ! how could it be?--Then [I]102-frank churchill must have dreamt it -- but [I]102-frank churchill was completely persuaded -- [Miss Smith]111-harriet , [you]111-harriet walk as if [you]111-harriet were tired . [You]111-harriet will not be sorry to find [yourself]111-harriet at [home]562-home . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ What is this?--What is this ? ”[86-mr. weston] cried [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston , “ about [Perry]106-mr. perry and [a carriage]540-a carriage ? Is [Perry]106-mr. perry going to set up [[his]106-mr. perry carriage]1005-his carriage , [Frank]102-frank churchill ? [I]86-mr. weston am glad [he]106-mr. perry can afford it . [You]102-frank churchill had it from [himself]106-mr. perry , had [you]102-frank churchill ? ”[86-mr. weston]

“ No , [sir]2734-sir , ”[523-his son] replied [[his]86-mr. weston son]523-his son , laughing , “ [I]523-his son seem to have had it from nobody.--Very odd!--I really was persuaded of [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston 's having mentioned it in one of [her]88-mrs. weston letters to [Enscombe]7-enscombe , many weeks ago , with all these particulars -- but as [she]88-mrs. weston declares [she]88-mrs. weston never heard a syllable of it before , of course it must have been a dream . [I]523-his son am [a great dreamer]4942-a great dreamer . [I]523-his son dream of every body at [Highbury]3-highbury when [I]523-his son am away -- and when [I]523-his son have gone through [[my]523-his son particular friends]4943-my particular friends , then [I]523-his son begin dreaming of [Mr.]4944-mr. and [Mrs. Perry]104-mrs. perry . ”[523-his son]

“ It is odd though , ”[518-his father] observed [[his]523-his son father]518-his father , “ that [you]523-his son should have had such a regular connected dream about people whom it was not very likely [you]523-his son should be thinking of at [Enscombe]7-enscombe . [Perry]104-mrs. perry 's setting up [[his]518-his father carriage]1005-his carriage ! and [[his]518-his father wife]2763-his wife 's persuading [him]518-his father to it , out of care for [his]518-his father health -- just what will happen , [I]518-his father have no doubt , some time or other ; only a little premature . What an air of probability sometimes runs through a dream ! And at others , what a heap of absurdities it is ! Well , [Frank]102-frank churchill , [your]102-frank churchill dream certainly shews that [Highbury]3-highbury is in [your]102-frank churchill thoughts when [you]102-frank churchill are absent . [Emma]123-emma , [you]123-emma are [a great dreamer]4942-a great dreamer , [I]518-his father think ? ”[518-his father]

[Emma]123-emma was out of hearing . [She]123-emma had hurried on before [[her]123-emma guests]2130-her guests to prepare [[her]123-emma father]425-her father for [their]2130-her guests appearance , and was beyond the reach of [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston 's hint .

“ Why , to own the truth , ”[105-miss bates] cried [Miss Bates]105-miss bates , who had been trying in vain to be heard the last two minutes , “ if [I]105-miss bates must speak on this subject , there is no denying that [Mr. Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill might have -- [I]105-miss bates do not mean to say that [he]102-frank churchill did not dream it -- [I]105-miss bates am sure [I]105-miss bates have sometimes the oddest dreams in [the world]403-the world -- but if [I]105-miss bates am questioned about it , [I]105-miss bates must acknowledge that there was such an idea last spring ; for [Mrs. Perry]104-mrs. perry [herself]104-mrs. perry mentioned it to [[my]105-miss bates mother]3715-my mother , and [the Coles]184-the coles knew of it as well as [ourselves]4950-us -- but it was quite a secret , known to [nobody else]3698-nobody else , and only thought of about three days . [Mrs. Perry]104-mrs. perry was very anxious that [he]102-frank churchill should have [a carriage]540-a carriage , and came to [[my]105-miss bates mother]3715-my mother in great spirits one morning because [she]3715-my mother thought [she]3715-my mother had prevailed . [Jane]105-miss bates , do n't [you]105-miss bates remember [grandmama]3720-grandmama 's telling [us]4950-us of it when [we]4950-us got [home]562-home ? [I]105-miss bates forget where [we]4950-us had been walking to -- very likely to [Randalls]101-randalls ; yes , [I]105-miss bates think it was to [Randalls]101-randalls . [Mrs. Perry]104-mrs. perry was always particularly fond of [[my]105-miss bates mother]3715-my mother -- indeed [I]105-miss bates do not know who is not -- and [she]104-mrs. perry had mentioned it to [her]104-mrs. perry in confidence ; [she]104-mrs. perry had no objection to [her]104-mrs. perry telling [us]4950-us , of course , but it was not to go beyond : and , from that day to this , [I]105-miss bates never mentioned it to [a soul that [I]105-miss bates know of]4957-a soul that i know of . At the same time , [I]105-miss bates will not positively answer for [my]105-miss bates having never dropt a hint , because [I]105-miss bates know [I]105-miss bates do sometimes pop out a thing before [I]105-miss bates am aware . [I]105-miss bates am [a talker]4958-a talker , [you]4959-you know ; [I]105-miss bates am rather [a talker]4958-a talker ; and now and then [I]105-miss bates have let a thing escape [me]105-miss bates which [I]105-miss bates should not . [I]105-miss bates am not like [Jane]105-miss bates ; [I]105-miss bates wish [I]105-miss bates were . [I]105-miss bates will answer for it _ [she]105-miss bates _ never betrayed the least thing in [the world]403-the world . Where is she?--Oh ! just behind . Perfectly remember [Mrs. Perry]104-mrs. perry 's coming.--Extraordinary dream , indeed ! ”[105-miss bates]

[They]2132-they were entering [the hall]1379-the hall . [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley 's eyes had preceded [Miss Bates]105-miss bates 's in a glance at [Jane]105-miss bates . From [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill 's face , where [he]102-frank churchill thought [he]102-frank churchill saw confusion suppressed or laughed away , [he]102-frank churchill had involuntarily turned to [hers]105-miss bates ; but [she]105-miss bates was indeed behind , and too busy with [her]105-miss bates shawl . [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston had walked in . [The two other gentlemen]2134-the two other gentlemen waited at the door to let [her]105-miss bates pass . [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley suspected in [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill the determination of catching [her]105-miss bates eye -- [he]102-frank churchill seemed watching [her]105-miss bates intently -- in vain , however , if it were so -- [Jane]105-miss bates passed between [them]2134-the two other gentlemen into [the hall]1379-the hall , and looked at neither .

There was no time for farther remark or explanation . The dream must be borne with , and [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley must take [his]92-mr. knightley seat with the rest round the large modern circular table which [Emma]123-emma had introduced at [Hartfield]2-hartfield , and which none but [Emma]123-emma could have had power to place there and persuade [[her]123-emma father]425-her father to use , instead of the small - sized Pembroke , on which two of [his]92-mr. knightley daily meals had , for forty years been crowded . [Tea]284-tea passed pleasantly , and [nobody]2718-nobody seemed in a hurry to move .

“ [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse , ”[102-frank churchill] said [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill , after examining a table behind [him]102-frank churchill , which [he]102-frank churchill could reach as [he]102-frank churchill sat , “ have [[your]93-miss woodhouse nephews]4962-your nephews taken away [their]4962-your nephews alphabets -- [their]4962-your nephews box of letters ? It used to stand [here]2707-here . Where is it ? This is a sort of dull - looking evening , that ought to be treated rather as winter than summer . [We]4964-we had great amusement with those letters one morning . [I]102-frank churchill want to puzzle [you]93-miss woodhouse again . ”[102-frank churchill]

[Emma]123-emma was pleased with the thought ; and producing the box , the table was quickly scattered over with alphabets , which [no one]3090-no one seemed so much disposed to employ as [[their]2139-them two selves]2140-their two selves . [They]2139-them were rapidly forming words for [each other]430-each other , or for [any body else who would be puzzled]2142-any body else who would be puzzled . The quietness of the game made it particularly eligible for [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse , who had often been distressed by the more animated sort , which [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston had occasionally introduced , and who now sat happily occupied in lamenting , with tender melancholy , over the departure of [the “ poor little boys]4965-the “ poor little boys , ”[102-frank churchill] or in fondly pointing out , as [he]102-frank churchill took up any stray letter near [him]102-frank churchill , how beautifully [Emma]123-emma had written it .

[Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill placed a word before [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax . [She]123-emma gave a slight glance round the table , and applied [herself]123-emma to it . [Frank]102-frank churchill was next to [Emma]123-emma , [Jane]152-miss fairfax opposite to [them]2139-them -- and [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley so placed as to see [them]2139-them all ; and it was [his]92-mr. knightley object to see as much as [he]92-mr. knightley could , with as little apparent observation . The word was discovered , and with a faint smile pushed away . If meant to be immediately mixed with the others , and buried from sight , [she]123-emma should have looked on the table instead of looking just across , for it was not mixed ; and [Harriet]111-harriet , eager after every fresh word , and finding out none , directly took it up , and fell to work . [She]111-harriet was sitting by [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley , and turned to [him]92-mr. knightley for help . The word was _ blunder _ ; and as [Harriet]111-harriet exultingly proclaimed it , there was a blush on [Jane]152-miss fairfax 's cheek which gave it a meaning not otherwise ostensible . [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley connected it with the dream ; but how it could all be , was beyond [his]92-mr. knightley comprehension . How the delicacy , the discretion of [his]92-mr. knightley favourite could have been so lain asleep ! [He]92-mr. knightley feared there must be some decided involvement . Disingenuousness and double dealing seemed to meet [him]92-mr. knightley at every turn . These letters were but the vehicle for gallantry and trick . It was [a child]497-a child 's play , chosen to conceal a deeper game on [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill 's part .

With great indignation did [he]92-mr. knightley continue to observe [him]102-frank churchill ; with great alarm and distrust , to observe also [[his]92-mr. knightley two blinded companions]2144-his two blinded companions . [He]92-mr. knightley saw a short word prepared for [Emma]123-emma , and given to [her]123-emma with a look sly and demure . [He]92-mr. knightley saw that [Emma]123-emma had soon made it out , and found it highly entertaining , though it was something which [she]123-emma judged it proper to appear to censure ; for [she]123-emma said , “ Nonsense ! for shame ! ”[123-emma] [He]92-mr. knightley heard [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill next say , with a glance towards [Jane]152-miss fairfax , “ [I]102-frank churchill will give it to [her]123-emma -- shall [I?”--and]4966-i?”--and[102-frank churchill] as clearly heard [Emma]123-emma opposing it with eager laughing warmth . “ No , no , [you]152-miss fairfax must not ; [you]152-miss fairfax shall not , indeed . ”[123-emma]

It was done however . [This gallant young man]2145-this gallant young man , who seemed to love without feeling , and to recommend [himself]2145-this gallant young man without complaisance , directly handed over the word to [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax , and with a particular degree of sedate civility entreated [her]152-miss fairfax to study it . [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley 's excessive curiosity to know what this word might be , made [him]92-mr. knightley seize every possible moment for darting [his]92-mr. knightley eye towards it , and it was not long before [he]92-mr. knightley saw it to be _ [Dixon]192-mr. dixon _ . [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax 's perception seemed to accompany [his]92-mr. knightley ; [her]152-miss fairfax comprehension was certainly more equal to the covert meaning , the superior intelligence , of those five letters so arranged . [She]152-miss fairfax was evidently displeased ; looked up , and seeing [herself]152-miss fairfax watched , blushed more deeply than [he]92-mr. knightley had ever perceived [her]152-miss fairfax , and saying only , “ [I]92-mr. knightley did not know that proper names were allowed , ”[92-mr. knightley] pushed away the letters with even an angry spirit , and looked resolved to be engaged by no other word that could be offered . [Her]152-miss fairfax face was averted from [those who had made the attack]2146-those who had made the attack , and turned towards [[her]152-miss fairfax aunt]3293-her aunt .

“ Aye , very true , [[my]1655-the latter dear]2714-my dear , ”[1655-the latter] cried [the latter]1655-the latter , though [Jane]152-miss fairfax had not spoken a word--“I was just going to say the same thing . It is time for [us]4968-us to be going indeed . The evening is closing in , and [grandmama]3720-grandmama will be looking for [us]4968-us . [[My]1655-the latter dear sir]3019-my dear sir , [you]3019-my dear sir are too obliging . [We]4968-us really must wish [you]3019-my dear sir good night . ”[1655-the latter]

[Jane]152-miss fairfax 's alertness in moving , proved [her]152-miss fairfax as ready as [[her]152-miss fairfax aunt]3293-her aunt had preconceived . [She]152-miss fairfax was immediately up , and wanting to quit the table ; but so many were also moving , that [she]152-miss fairfax could not get away ; and [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley thought [he]92-mr. knightley saw another collection of letters anxiously pushed towards [her]152-miss fairfax , and resolutely swept away by [her]152-miss fairfax unexamined . [She]152-miss fairfax was afterwards looking for [her]152-miss fairfax shawl -- [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill was looking also -- it was growing dusk , and [the room]701-the room was in confusion ; and how [they]2151-they parted , [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley could not tell .

[He]92-mr. knightley remained at [Hartfield]2-hartfield after all the rest , [his]92-mr. knightley thoughts full of what [he]92-mr. knightley had seen ; so full , that when the candles came to assist [his]92-mr. knightley observations , [he]92-mr. knightley must -- yes , [he]92-mr. knightley certainly must , as [a friend]416-a friend -- [an anxious friend]2153-an anxious friend -- give [Emma]123-emma some hint , ask [her]123-emma some question . [He]92-mr. knightley could not see [her]123-emma in a situation of such danger , without trying to preserve [her]123-emma . It was [his]92-mr. knightley duty .

“ Pray , [Emma]123-emma , ”[92-mr. knightley] said [he]92-mr. knightley , “ may [I]92-mr. knightley ask in what lay the great amusement , the poignant sting of the last word given to [you]123-emma and [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax ? [I]92-mr. knightley saw the word , and am curious to know how it could be so very entertaining to [the one]4971-the one , and so very distressing to [the other]739-the other . ”[92-mr. knightley]

[Emma]123-emma was extremely confused . [She]123-emma could not endure to give [him]92-mr. knightley the true explanation ; for though [her]123-emma suspicions were by no means removed , [she]123-emma was really ashamed of having ever imparted [them]2154-them .

“ Oh ! ”[123-emma] [she]123-emma cried in evident embarrassment , “ it all meant nothing ; a mere joke among [ourselves]4973-ourselves . ”[123-emma]

“ The joke , ”[92-mr. knightley] [he]92-mr. knightley replied gravely , “ seemed confined to [you]123-emma and [Mr. Churchill]102-frank churchill . ”[92-mr. knightley]

[He]92-mr. knightley had hoped [she]123-emma would speak again , but [she]123-emma did not . [She]123-emma would rather busy [herself]123-emma about any thing than speak . [He]92-mr. knightley sat a little while in doubt . A variety of evils crossed [his]92-mr. knightley mind . Interference -- fruitless interference . [Emma]123-emma 's confusion , and the acknowledged intimacy , seemed to declare [her]123-emma affection engaged . Yet [he]92-mr. knightley would speak . [He]92-mr. knightley owed it to [her]123-emma , to risk any thing that might be involved in an unwelcome interference , rather than [her]123-emma welfare ; to encounter any thing , rather than the remembrance of neglect in such a cause .

“ [[My]92-mr. knightley dear]2714-my dear [Emma]123-emma , ”[92-mr. knightley] said [he]92-mr. knightley at last , with earnest kindness , “ do [you]123-emma think [you]123-emma perfectly understand the degree of acquaintance between [the gentleman]680-the gentleman and [lady]4976-lady [we]4977-we have been speaking of ? ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ Between [Mr. Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill and [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax ? Oh ! yes , perfectly.--Why do [you]92-mr. knightley make a doubt of it ? ”[2155-her]

“ Have [you]92-mr. knightley never at any time had reason to think that [he]92-mr. knightley admired [her]123-emma , or that [she]123-emma admired [him]92-mr. knightley ? ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ Never , never ! ”[123-emma] [she]123-emma cried with a most open eagerness--“Never , for the twentieth part of a moment , did such an idea occur to [me]123-emma . And how could it possibly come into [your]92-mr. knightley head ? ”[123-emma]

“ [I]92-mr. knightley have lately imagined that [I]92-mr. knightley saw symptoms of attachment between [them]4978-them -- certain expressive looks , which [I]92-mr. knightley did not believe meant to be public . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ Oh ! [you]123-emma amuse [me]123-emma excessively . [I]123-emma am delighted to find that [you]123-emma can vouchsafe to let [your]123-emma imagination wander -- but it will not do -- very sorry to check [you]123-emma in [your]123-emma first essay -- but indeed it will not do . There is no admiration between [them]4978-them , [I]123-emma do assure [you]123-emma ; and the appearances which have caught [you]123-emma , have arisen from some peculiar circumstances -- feelings rather of a totally different nature -- it is impossible exactly to explain:--there is a good deal of nonsense in it -- but the part which is capable of being communicated , which is sense , is , that [they]4978-them are as far from any attachment or admiration for [one another]2744-one another , as any two beings in [the world]403-the world can be . That is , [I]123-emma _ presume _ it to be so on [her]2155-her side , and [I]123-emma can _ answer _ for its being so on [his]92-mr. knightley . [I]123-emma will answer for [the gentleman]680-the gentleman 's indifference . ”[123-emma]

[She]2155-her spoke with a confidence which staggered , with a satisfaction which silenced , [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley . [She]2155-her was in gay spirits , and would have prolonged the conversation , wanting to hear the particulars of [his]92-mr. knightley suspicions , every look described , and all the where s and how s of a circumstance which highly entertained [her]2155-her : but [his]92-mr. knightley gaiety did not meet [hers]2155-her . [He]92-mr. knightley found [he]92-mr. knightley could not be useful , and [his]92-mr. knightley feelings were too much irritated for talking . That [he]92-mr. knightley might not be irritated into an absolute fever , by the fire which [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse 's tender habits required almost every evening throughout the year , [he]92-mr. knightley soon afterwards took a hasty leave , and walked [home]562-home to the coolness and solitude of [Donwell Abbey]8-donwell abbey .

CHAPTER VI

After being long fed with hopes of a speedy visit from [Mr.]2157-mr. and [Mrs. Suckling]316-mrs. suckling , [the Highbury world]2158-the highbury world were obliged to endure the mortification of hearing that [they]2158-the highbury world could not possibly come till the autumn . No such importation of novelties could enrich [their]2158-the highbury world intellectual stores at present . In the daily interchange of news , [they]2158-the highbury world must be again restricted to the other topics with which for a while [the Sucklings]2159-the sucklings ' coming had been united , such as the last accounts of [Mrs. Churchill]98-mrs. churchill , whose health seemed every day to supply a different report , and the situation of [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , whose happiness it was to be hoped might eventually be as much increased by the arrival of [a child]497-a child , as that of all [[her]2155-her neighbours]2161-her neighbours was by the approach of it .

[Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton was very much disappointed . It was the delay of a great deal of pleasure and parade . [Her]207-mrs. elton introductions and recommendations must all wait , and [every projected party]2162-every projected party be still only talked of . So [she]207-mrs. elton thought at first;--but a little consideration convinced [her]207-mrs. elton that every thing need not be put off . Why should not [they]2158-the highbury world explore to [Box Hill]64-box hill though [the Sucklings]313-the sucklings did not come ? [They]2158-the highbury world could go there again with [them]313-the sucklings in the autumn . It was settled that [they]2158-the highbury world should go to [Box Hill]64-box hill . That there was to be [such a party]2163-such a party had been long generally known : it had even given the idea of another . [Emma]123-emma had never been to [Box Hill]64-box hill ; [she]123-emma wished to see what every body found so well worth seeing , and [she]123-emma and [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston had agreed to chuse some fine morning and drive thither . [Two or three more of the chosen only]2164-two or three more of the chosen only were to be admitted to join [them]2158-the highbury world , and it was to be done in a quiet , unpretending , elegant way , infinitely superior to the bustle and preparation , the regular eating and drinking , and picnic parade of [the Eltons]143-the eltons and [the Sucklings]2159-the sucklings .

This was so very well understood between [them]2158-the highbury world , that [Emma]123-emma could not but feel some surprise , and a little displeasure , on hearing from [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston that [he]86-mr. weston had been proposing to [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton , as [[her]123-emma brother]482-her brother and sister had failed [her]123-emma , that [the two parties]2167-the two parties should unite , and go together ; and that as [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton had very readily acceded to it , so it was to be , if [she]207-mrs. elton had no objection . Now , as [her]207-mrs. elton objection was nothing but [her]207-mrs. elton very great dislike of [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton , of which [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston must already be perfectly aware , it was not worth bringing forward again:--it could not be done without a reproof to [him]86-mr. weston , which would be giving pain to [[his]86-mr. weston wife]2763-his wife ; and [she]207-mrs. elton found [herself]207-mrs. elton therefore obliged to consent to an arrangement which [she]207-mrs. elton would have done a great deal to avoid ; an arrangement which would probably expose [her]207-mrs. elton even to the degradation of being said to be of [[Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton 's party]2169-mrs. elton 's party ! Every feeling was offended ; and the forbearance of [her]207-mrs. elton outward submission left a heavy arrear due of secret severity in [her]207-mrs. elton reflections on the unmanageable goodwill of [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston 's temper .

“ [I]86-mr. weston am glad [you]207-mrs. elton approve of what [I]86-mr. weston have done , ”[86-mr. weston] said [he]86-mr. weston very comfortably . “ But [I]86-mr. weston thought [you]207-mrs. elton would . Such schemes as these are nothing without numbers . [One]2775-one can not have too large a party . [A large party]4983-a large party secures [its]4983-a large party own amusement . And [she]207-mrs. elton is [a good - natured woman]4984-a good - natured woman after all . [One]2775-one could not leave [her]207-mrs. elton out . ”[86-mr. weston]

[Emma]123-emma denied none of it aloud , and agreed to none of it in private .

It was now the middle of June , and the weather fine ; and [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton was growing impatient to name the day , and settle with [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston as to pigeon - pies and cold lamb , when a lame carriage - horse threw every thing into sad uncertainty . It might be weeks , it might be only a few days , before the horse were useable ; but no preparations could be ventured on , and it was all melancholy stagnation . [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton 's resources were inadequate to such an attack .

“ Is not this most vexatious , [Knightley]92-mr. knightley ? ”[207-mrs. elton] [she]207-mrs. elton cried.--“And such weather for exploring!--These delays and disappointments are quite odious . What are [we]4986-we to do?--The year will wear away at this rate , and nothing done . Before this time last year [I]207-mrs. elton assure [you]207-mrs. elton [we]4986-we had had a delightful exploring party from [Maple Grove]51-maple grove to [Kings Weston]65-kings weston . ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ [You]207-mrs. elton had better explore to [Donwell]24-donwell , ”[92-mr. knightley] replied [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley . “ That may be done without horses . Come , and eat [my]92-mr. knightley strawberries . They are ripening fast . ”[92-mr. knightley]

If [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley did not begin seriously , [he]92-mr. knightley was obliged to proceed so , for [his]92-mr. knightley proposal was caught at with delight ; and the “ Oh ! [I]207-mrs. elton should like it of all things , ”[207-mrs. elton] was not plainer in words than manner . [Donwell]24-donwell was famous for [its]24-donwell strawberry - beds , which seemed a plea for the invitation : but no plea was necessary ; cabbage - beds would have been enough to tempt [the lady]3048-the lady , who only wanted to be going somewhere . [She]207-mrs. elton promised [him]92-mr. knightley again and again to come -- much oftener than [he]92-mr. knightley doubted -- and was extremely gratified by such a proof of intimacy , such a distinguishing compliment as [she]207-mrs. elton chose to consider it .

“ [You]92-mr. knightley may depend upon [me]207-mrs. elton , ”[207-mrs. elton] said [she]207-mrs. elton . “ [I]207-mrs. elton certainly will come . Name [your]92-mr. knightley day , and [I]207-mrs. elton will come . [You]92-mr. knightley will allow [me]207-mrs. elton to bring [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax ? ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ [I]92-mr. knightley can not name a day , ”[92-mr. knightley] said [he]92-mr. knightley , “ till [I]92-mr. knightley have spoken to [some others whom [I]92-mr. knightley would wish to meet [you]207-mrs. elton]4987-some others whom i would wish to meet you . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ Oh ! leave all that to [me]207-mrs. elton . Only give [me]207-mrs. elton a carte - blanche.--I am [Lady Patroness]4988-lady patroness , [you]92-mr. knightley know . It is [my]207-mrs. elton party . [I]207-mrs. elton will bring [friends]579-friends with [me]207-mrs. elton . ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ [I]92-mr. knightley hope [you]207-mrs. elton will bring [Elton]207-mrs. elton , ”[92-mr. knightley] said [he]92-mr. knightley : “ but [I]92-mr. knightley will not trouble [you]207-mrs. elton to give any other invitations . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ Oh ! now [you]92-mr. knightley are looking very sly . But consider -- [you]92-mr. knightley need not be afraid of delegating power to _ [me]207-mrs. elton _ . [I]207-mrs. elton am [no young lady]4990-no young lady on [her]4988-lady patroness preferment . [Married women]4490-married women , [you]92-mr. knightley know , may be safely authorised . It is [my]207-mrs. elton party . Leave it all to [me]207-mrs. elton . [I]207-mrs. elton will invite [[your]92-mr. knightley guests]4992-your guests . ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ [No,”--he]317-no,”--he[92-mr. knightley] calmly replied,--“there is but [one married woman in [the world]403-the world whom [I]207-mrs. elton can ever allow to invite what [guests]3791-guests [she]4993-one married woman in the world whom i can ever allow to invite what guests she pleases to donwell pleases to [Donwell]24-donwell]4993-one married woman in the world whom i can ever allow to invite what guests she pleases to donwell , and [that one]4996-that one is-- ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ --Mrs . [Weston]86-mr. weston , [I]207-mrs. elton suppose , ”[207-mrs. elton] interrupted [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton , rather mortified .

“ No -- [Mrs. Knightley;--and]318-mrs. knightley;--and till [she]4993-one married woman in the world whom i can ever allow to invite what guests she pleases to donwell is in being , [I]207-mrs. elton will manage such matters [myself]207-mrs. elton . ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ Ah ! [you]207-mrs. elton are [an odd creature]4997-an odd creature ! ”[207-mrs. elton] [she]207-mrs. elton cried , satisfied to have [no one]3090-no one preferred to herself.--“You are [a humourist]4998-a humourist , and may say what [you]207-mrs. elton like . Quite [a humourist]4998-a humourist . Well , [I]207-mrs. elton shall bring [Jane]152-miss fairfax with [me]207-mrs. elton -- [Jane]152-miss fairfax and [her]152-miss fairfax aunt.--The rest [I]207-mrs. elton leave to [you]207-mrs. elton . [I]207-mrs. elton have no objections at all to meeting [the Hartfield family]5000-the hartfield family . Do n't scruple . [I]207-mrs. elton know [you]207-mrs. elton are attached to [them]5000-the hartfield family . ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ [You]207-mrs. elton certainly will meet [them]5000-the hartfield family if [I]207-mrs. elton can prevail ; and [I]207-mrs. elton shall call on [Miss Bates]105-miss bates in [my]207-mrs. elton way [home]562-home . ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ That 's quite unnecessary ; [I]207-mrs. elton see [Jane]105-miss bates every day:--but as [you]207-mrs. elton like . It is to be a morning scheme , [you]207-mrs. elton know , [Knightley]92-mr. knightley ; quite a simple thing . [I]207-mrs. elton shall wear a large bonnet , and bring one of [my]207-mrs. elton little baskets hanging on [my]207-mrs. elton arm . Here,--probably this basket with pink ribbon . Nothing can be more simple , [you]207-mrs. elton see . And [Jane]105-miss bates will have such another . There is to be no form or parade -- a sort of gipsy party . [We]5002-we are to walk about [[your]207-mrs. elton gardens]5003-your gardens , and gather the strawberries [ourselves]5002-we , and sit under trees;--and whatever else [you]207-mrs. elton may like to provide , it is to be all out of doors -- a table spread in the shade , [you]207-mrs. elton know . Every thing as natural and simple as possible . Is not that [your]207-mrs. elton idea ? ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ Not quite . [My]207-mrs. elton idea of the simple and the natural will be to have the table spread in [the dining - room]1589-the dining - room . The nature and the simplicity of [gentlemen]675-gentlemen and [ladies]3480-ladies , with [[their]675-gentlemen servants]5007-their servants and furniture , [I]207-mrs. elton think is best observed by meals within doors . When [you]207-mrs. elton are tired of eating strawberries in [the garden]5008-the garden , there shall be cold meat in [the house]435-the house . ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ Well -- as [you]207-mrs. elton please ; only do n't have a great set out . And , by the bye , can [I]207-mrs. elton or [[my]207-mrs. elton housekeeper]4494-my housekeeper be of any use to [you]207-mrs. elton with [our]5002-we opinion?--Pray be sincere , [Knightley]92-mr. knightley . If [you]207-mrs. elton wish [me]207-mrs. elton to talk to [Mrs. Hodges]235-mrs. hodges , or to inspect anything-- ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ [I]207-mrs. elton have not the least wish for it , [I]207-mrs. elton thank [you]207-mrs. elton . ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ Well -- but if any difficulties should arise , [[my]207-mrs. elton housekeeper]4494-my housekeeper is extremely clever . ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ [I]207-mrs. elton will answer for it , that [mine]207-mrs. elton thinks [herself]4494-my housekeeper full as clever , and would spurn [any body]665-any body 's assistance . ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ [I]207-mrs. elton wish [we]5002-we had a donkey . The thing would be for [us]5002-we all to come on [donkeys]5013-donkeys , [Jane]105-miss bates , [Miss Bates]105-miss bates , and [me]207-mrs. elton -- and [my]207-mrs. elton caro sposo walking by . [I]207-mrs. elton really must talk to [him]5014-him about purchasing [a donkey]5015-a donkey . In [a country]5016-a country life [I]207-mrs. elton conceive it to be a sort of necessary ; for , let [a woman]2864-a woman have ever so many resources , it is not possible for [her]2864-a woman to be always shut up at home;--and very long walks , [you]207-mrs. elton know -- in summer there is dust , and in winter there is dirt . ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ [You]207-mrs. elton will not find either , between [Donwell]24-donwell and [Highbury]3-highbury . [Donwell Lane]66-donwell lane is never dusty , and now it is perfectly dry . Come on a donkey , however , if [you]207-mrs. elton prefer it . [You]207-mrs. elton can borrow [Mrs. Cole]185-mrs. cole 's . [I]207-mrs. elton would wish every thing to be as much to [your]207-mrs. elton taste as possible . ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ That [I]207-mrs. elton am sure [you]207-mrs. elton would . Indeed [I]207-mrs. elton do [you]207-mrs. elton justice , [[my]207-mrs. elton good friend]3942-my good friend . Under that peculiar sort of dry , blunt manner , [I]207-mrs. elton know [you]207-mrs. elton have the warmest heart . As [I]207-mrs. elton tell [Mr. E.]255-mr. e. , [you]207-mrs. elton are [a thorough humourist.--Yes]5019-a thorough humourist.--yes , believe [me]207-mrs. elton , [Knightley]92-mr. knightley , [I]207-mrs. elton am fully sensible of [your]207-mrs. elton attention to [me]207-mrs. elton in the whole of this scheme . [You]207-mrs. elton have hit upon the very thing to please [me]207-mrs. elton . ”[207-mrs. elton]

[Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley had another reason for avoiding a table in the shade . [He]92-mr. knightley wished to persuade [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse , as well as [Emma]123-emma , to join the party ; and [he]92-mr. knightley knew that to have any of [them]2172-them sitting down out of doors to eat would inevitably make [him]92-mr. knightley ill . [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse must not , under the specious pretence of a morning drive , and an hour or two spent at [Donwell]24-donwell , be tempted away to [his]85-mr. woodhouse misery .

[He]85-mr. woodhouse was invited on good faith . No lurking horrors were to upbraid [him]85-mr. woodhouse for [his]85-mr. woodhouse easy credulity . [He]85-mr. woodhouse did consent . [He]85-mr. woodhouse had not been at [Donwell]24-donwell for two years . “ Some very fine morning , [he]85-mr. woodhouse , and [Emma]123-emma , and [Harriet]111-harriet , could go very well ; and [he]85-mr. woodhouse could sit still with [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , while [the dear girls]5020-the dear girls walked about [the gardens]5021-the gardens . [He]85-mr. woodhouse did not suppose [they]5021-the gardens could be damp now , in the middle of the day . [He]85-mr. woodhouse should like to see [the old house]5022-the old house again exceedingly , and should be very happy to meet [Mr.]5023-mr. and [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton , and [any other of [his]85-mr. woodhouse neighbours.--He]5024-any other of his neighbours.--he could not see any objection at all to [his]5023-mr. , and [Emma]123-emma 's , and [Harriet]111-harriet 's going [there]448-there some very fine morning . [He]85-mr. woodhouse thought it very well done of [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley to invite [them]2174-them -- very kind and sensible -- much cleverer than dining out.--He was not fond of dining out . ”[85-mr. woodhouse]

[Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley was fortunate in [every body]2749-every body 's most ready concurrence . The invitation was everywhere so well received , that it seemed as if , like [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton , [they]2174-them were all taking the scheme as a particular compliment to themselves.--Emma and [Harriet]111-harriet professed very high expectations of pleasure from it ; and [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston , unasked , promised to get [Frank]102-frank churchill over to join [them]2174-them , if possible ; a proof of approbation and gratitude which could have been dispensed with.--Mr . [Knightley]92-mr. knightley was then obliged to say that [he]92-mr. knightley should be glad to see [him]102-frank churchill ; and [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston engaged to lose no time in writing , and spare no arguments to induce [him]102-frank churchill to come .

In the meanwhile the lame horse recovered so fast , that the party to [Box Hill]64-box hill was again under happy consideration ; and at last [Donwell]24-donwell was settled for one day , and [Box Hill]64-box hill for the next,--the weather appearing exactly right .

Under a bright mid - day sun , at almost Midsummer , [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse was safely conveyed in [[his]85-mr. woodhouse carriage]1005-his carriage , with one window down , to partake of this al - fresco party ; and in [one of the most comfortable rooms in [the Abbey]2802-the abbey]2176-one of the most comfortable rooms in the abbey , especially prepared for [him]85-mr. woodhouse by a fire all the morning , [he]85-mr. woodhouse was happily placed , quite at [his]85-mr. woodhouse ease , ready to talk with pleasure of what had been achieved , and advise every body to come and sit down , and not to heat themselves.--Mrs . [Weston]86-mr. weston , who seemed to have walked [there]448-there on purpose to be tired , and sit all the time with [him]102-frank churchill , remained , when [all the others]2179-all the others were invited or persuaded out , [[his]102-frank churchill patient listener and [sympathiser]2181-sympathiser]2180-his patient listener and sympathiser .
