It was so long since [Emma]123-emma had been at [the Abbey]2802-the abbey , that as soon as [she]123-emma was satisfied of [[her]123-emma father]425-her father 's comfort , [she]123-emma was glad to leave [him]425-her father , and look around [her]123-emma ; eager to refresh and correct [her]123-emma memory with more particular observation , more exact understanding of [a house]2184-a house and grounds which must ever be so interesting to [her]123-emma and [all [her]123-emma family]2185-all her family .

[She]123-emma felt all the honest pride and complacency which [her]123-emma alliance with [the present and future proprietor]2186-the present and future proprietor could fairly warrant , as [she]123-emma viewed the respectable size and style of [the building]2187-the building , [its]2187-the building suitable , becoming , characteristic situation , low and sheltered -- [[its]2187-the building ample gardens]2188-its ample gardens stretching down to meadows washed by [a stream]2189-a stream , of which [the Abbey]2802-the abbey , with all the old neglect of prospect , had scarcely a sight -- and [its]2187-the building abundance of timber in rows and [avenues]2191-avenues , which neither fashion nor extravagance had rooted [up.--The house]2192-up.--the house was larger than [Hartfield]2-hartfield , and totally unlike [it]2192-up.--the house , covering a good deal of ground , rambling and irregular , with many comfortable , and one or two handsome rooms.--It was just what [it]2192-up.--the house ought to be , and [it]2192-up.--the house looked what [it]2192-up.--the house was -- and [Emma]123-emma felt an increasing respect for [it]2192-up.--the house , as [the residence of [a family of such true gentility]2194-a family of such true gentility , untainted in blood and understanding.--Some faults of temper [John Knightley]92-mr. knightley had]2193-the residence of a family of such true gentility , untainted in blood and understanding.--some faults of temper john knightley had ; but [Isabella]87-isabella had connected [herself]87-isabella unexceptionably . [She]87-isabella had given [them]2194-a family of such true gentility neither [men]3104-men , nor names , nor places , that could raise a blush . These were pleasant feelings , and [she]87-isabella walked about and indulged them till it was necessary to do as [the others]870-the others did , and collect round the strawberry - beds.--The [whole party]2197-whole party were assembled , excepting [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill , who was expected every moment from [Richmond]61-richmond ; and [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton , in all [her]207-mrs. elton apparatus of happiness , [her]207-mrs. elton large bonnet and [her]207-mrs. elton basket , was very ready to lead the way in gathering , accepting , or talking -- strawberries , and only strawberries , could now be thought or spoken of.--“The best fruit in [England]36-england -- [every body]2749-every body 's favourite -- always wholesome.--These the finest beds and finest sorts.--Delightful to gather for one 's self -- the only way of really enjoying them.--Morning decidedly the best time -- never tired -- every sort good -- hautboy infinitely superior -- no comparison -- [the others]870-the others hardly eatable -- [hautboys]5028-hautboys very scarce -- Chili preferred -- white wood finest flavour of all -- price of strawberries in [London]1-london -- abundance about [Bristol]40-bristol -- [Maple Grove]51-maple grove -- cultivation -- beds when to be renewed -- [gardeners]5029-gardeners thinking exactly different -- no general rule -- [gardeners]5029-gardeners never to be put out of [their]5029-gardeners way -- delicious fruit -- only too rich to be eaten much of -- inferior to cherries -- currants more refreshing -- only objection to gathering strawberries the stooping -- glaring sun -- tired to death -- could bear it no longer -- must go and sit in the shade . ”[207-mrs. elton]

Such , for half an hour , was the conversation -- interrupted only once by [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston , who came out , in [her]207-mrs. elton solicitude after [[her]207-mrs. elton son - in - law]1648-her son - in - law , to inquire if [he]1648-her son - in - law were come -- and [she]207-mrs. elton was a little uneasy.--She had some fears of [his]1648-her son - in - law horse .

Seats tolerably in the shade were found ; and now [Emma]123-emma was obliged to overhear what [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton and [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax were talking of.--A situation , a most desirable situation , was in question . [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton had received notice of it that morning , and was in raptures . It was not with [Mrs. Suckling]316-mrs. suckling , it was not with [Mrs. Bragge]277-mrs. bragge , but in felicity and splendour it fell short only of [them]2199-them : it was with [a cousin of [Mrs. Bragge]277-mrs. bragge]2200-a cousin of mrs. bragge , [an acquaintance of [Mrs. Suckling]316-mrs. suckling]2201-an acquaintance of mrs. suckling , [a lady known at [Maple Grove]51-maple grove]2202-a lady known at maple grove . Delightful , charming , superior , first circles , spheres , lines , ranks , every thing -- and [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton was wild to have the offer closed with immediately.--On [her]207-mrs. elton side , all was warmth , energy , and triumph -- and [she]207-mrs. elton positively refused to take [[her]207-mrs. elton friend]427-her friend 's negative , though [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax continued to assure [her]207-mrs. elton that [she]207-mrs. elton would not at present engage in any thing , repeating the same motives which [she]207-mrs. elton had been heard to urge before.--Still [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton insisted on being authorised to write an acquiescence by the morrow 's post.--How [Jane]152-miss fairfax could bear it at all , was astonishing to [Emma.--She]319-emma.--she did look vexed , [she]319-emma.--she did speak pointedly -- and at last , with a decision of action unusual to [her]319-emma.--she , proposed a removal.--“Should not [they]2206-they walk ? Would not [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley shew [them]2206-they [the gardens]5021-the gardens -- [all the gardens?--She]5032-all the gardens?--she wished to see the whole extent . ”--The[319-emma.--she] pertinacity of [[her]207-mrs. elton friend]427-her friend seemed more than [she]207-mrs. elton could bear .

It was hot ; and after walking some time over [the gardens]5021-the gardens in a scattered , dispersed way , scarcely any three together , [they]2206-they insensibly followed [one another]2744-one another to the delicious shade of a broad short avenue of limes , which stretching beyond [the garden]5008-the garden at an equal distance from [the river]2209-the river , seemed the finish of the pleasure grounds.--It led to nothing ; nothing but a view at the end over a low stone wall with high pillars , which seemed intended , in [their]2206-they erection , to give the appearance of an approach to [the house]435-the house , which never had been [there]448-there . Disputable , however , as might be the taste of such a termination , it was in itself a charming walk , and the view which closed [it]5008-the garden extremely pretty.--The considerable slope , at nearly the foot of which [the Abbey]2802-the abbey stood , gradually acquired a steeper form beyond [its]2802-the abbey grounds ; and at half a mile distant was a bank of considerable abruptness and grandeur , well clothed with wood;--and at the bottom of this bank , favourably placed and sheltered , rose [the Abbey Mill Farm]2213-the abbey mill farm , with [meadows in front]2214-meadows in front , and [the river]2209-the river making a close and handsome curve around [it]2213-the abbey mill farm .

[It]2216-it was a sweet view -- sweet to the eye and the mind . English verdure , English culture , English comfort , seen under a sun bright , without being oppressive .

In this walk [Emma]123-emma and [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston found [all the others assembled]2217-all the others assembled ; and towards this view [she]123-emma immediately perceived [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley and [Harriet]111-harriet distinct from [the rest]1921-the rest , quietly leading the way . [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley and [Harriet!--It]320-harriet!--it was an odd tete - a - tete ; but [she]123-emma was glad to see it.--There had been a time when [he]92-mr. knightley would have scorned [her]111-harriet as [a companion]2862-a companion , and turned from [her]111-harriet with little ceremony . Now [they]2220-they seemed in pleasant conversation . There had been a time also when [Emma]123-emma would have been sorry to see [Harriet]111-harriet in [a spot so favourable for [the Abbey Mill Farm]2213-the abbey mill farm]2221-a spot so favourable for the abbey mill farm ; but now [she]123-emma feared it not . [It]2213-the abbey mill farm might be safely viewed with all [its]2213-the abbey mill farm appendages of prosperity and beauty , [its]2213-the abbey mill farm rich pastures , spreading flocks , orchard in blossom , and light column of smoke ascending.--She joined [them]2220-they at the wall , and found [them]2220-they more engaged in talking than in looking around . [He]92-mr. knightley was giving [Harriet]111-harriet information as to modes of agriculture , etc . and [Emma]123-emma received a smile which seemed to say , “ These are [my]92-mr. knightley own concerns . [I]92-mr. knightley have a right to talk on such subjects , without being suspected of introducing [Robert Martin]114-mrs. martin . ”--She[92-mr. knightley] did not suspect [him]92-mr. knightley . It was too old a story.--Robert [Martin]114-mrs. martin had probably ceased to think of [Harriet.--They]321-harriet.--they took a few turns together along the walk.--The shade was most refreshing , and [Emma]123-emma found it the pleasantest part of the day .

The next remove was to [the house]435-the house ; [they]2220-they must all go in and eat;--and [they]2220-they were all seated and busy , and still [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill did not come . [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston looked , and looked in vain . [[His]102-frank churchill father]518-his father would not own [himself]518-his father uneasy , and laughed at [her]88-mrs. weston fears ; but [she]88-mrs. weston could not be cured of wishing that [he]518-his father would part with [his]518-his father black mare . [He]518-his father had expressed [himself]518-his father as to coming , with more than common certainty . “ [[His]102-frank churchill aunt]3548-his aunt was so much better , that [he]518-his father had not a doubt of getting over to [them]3548-his aunt . ”--Mrs[518-his father] . [Churchill]102-frank churchill 's state , however , as many were ready to remind [her]88-mrs. weston , was liable to such sudden variation as might disappoint [[her]88-mrs. weston nephew]3651-her nephew in the most reasonable dependence -- and [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston was at last persuaded to believe , or to say , that it must be by some attack of [Mrs. Churchill]98-mrs. churchill that [he]518-his father was prevented coming.--Emma looked at [Harriet]111-harriet while the point was under consideration ; [she]111-harriet behaved very well , and betrayed no emotion .

The cold repast was over , and [the party]2949-the party were to go out once more to see what had not yet been seen , [the old Abbey fish - ponds]2227-the old abbey fish - ponds ; perhaps get as far as the clover , which was to be begun cutting on the morrow , or , at any rate , have the pleasure of being hot , and growing cool again.--Mr . [Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse , who had already taken [his]85-mr. woodhouse little round in the highest part of [the gardens]5021-the gardens , where no damps from [the river]2209-the river were imagined even by [him]85-mr. woodhouse , stirred no more ; and [[his]85-mr. woodhouse daughter]2723-his daughter resolved to remain with [him]85-mr. woodhouse , that [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston might be persuaded away by [[her]88-mrs. weston husband]441-her husband to the exercise and variety which [her]88-mrs. weston spirits seemed to need .

[Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley had done all in [his]92-mr. knightley power for [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse 's entertainment . Books of engravings , drawers of medals , cameos , corals , shells , and every other family collection within [his]85-mr. woodhouse cabinets , had been prepared for [[his]85-mr. woodhouse old friend]2232-his old friend , to while away the morning ; and the kindness had perfectly answered . [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse had been exceedingly well amused . [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston had been shewing them all to [him]85-mr. woodhouse , and now [he]85-mr. woodhouse would shew them all to [Emma;--fortunate]322-emma;--fortunate in having no other resemblance to [a child]497-a child , than in a total want of taste for what [he]85-mr. woodhouse saw , for [he]85-mr. woodhouse was slow , constant , and methodical.--Before this second looking over was begun , however , [Emma]123-emma walked into [the hall]1379-the hall for the sake of a few moments ' free observation of the entrance and ground - plot of [the house]435-the house -- and was hardly there , when [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax appeared , coming quickly in from [the garden]5008-the garden , and with a look of escape.--Little expecting to meet [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse so soon , there was a start at first ; but [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse was [the very person [she]123-emma was in quest of]2237-the very person she was in quest of .

“ Will [you]85-mr. woodhouse be so kind , ”[123-emma] said [she]123-emma , “ when [I]123-emma am missed , as to say that [I]123-emma am gone [home?--I]123-emma am going this moment.--My [aunt]3628-aunt is not aware how late it is , nor how long [we]5035-we have been absent -- but [I]123-emma am sure [we]5035-we shall be wanted , and [I]123-emma am determined to go [directly.--I]123-emma have said nothing about it to [any body]665-any body . It would only be giving trouble and distress . [Some]4385-some are gone to [the ponds]5038-the ponds , and [some]4385-some to [the lime walk]5040-the lime walk . Till [they]5041-they all come in [I]123-emma shall not be missed ; and when [they]5041-they do , will [you]85-mr. woodhouse have the goodness to say that [I]123-emma am gone ? ”[123-emma]

“ Certainly , if [you]85-mr. woodhouse wish it;--but [you]85-mr. woodhouse are not going to walk to [Highbury]3-highbury alone ? ”[2238-my]

“ Yes -- what should hurt me?--I walk fast . [I]123-emma shall be at [home]562-home in twenty minutes . ”[123-emma]

“ But it is too far , indeed it is , to be walking quite alone . Let [[my]2238-my father 's servant]5043-my father 's servant go with you.--Let [me]2238-my order [the carriage]2719-the carriage . It can be round in five minutes . ”[2238-my]

“ Thank [you]85-mr. woodhouse , thank [you]85-mr. woodhouse -- but on no account.--I would rather walk.--And for _ [me]123-emma _ to be afraid of walking alone!--I , who may so soon have to guard [others]2773-others ! ”[123-emma]

[She]2238-my spoke with great agitation ; and [Emma]123-emma very feelingly replied , “ That can be no reason for [your]85-mr. woodhouse being exposed to danger now . [I]123-emma must order [the carriage]2719-the carriage . The heat even would be danger.--You are fatigued already . ”[123-emma]

“ [I]123-emma am,”--she[123-emma] [answered--“I]123-emma am fatigued ; but it is not the sort of fatigue -- quick walking will refresh [me.--Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse , [we]5047-we all know at times what it is to be wearied in spirits . [Mine]123-emma , [I]123-emma confess , are exhausted . The greatest kindness [you]85-mr. woodhouse can shew [me]123-emma , will be to let [me]123-emma have [my]123-emma own way , and only say that [I]123-emma am gone when it is necessary . ”[123-emma]

[Emma]123-emma had not another word to oppose . [She]123-emma saw it all ; and entering into [her]123-emma feelings , promoted [her]123-emma quitting [the house]435-the house immediately , and watched [her]123-emma safely off with the zeal of [a friend]416-a friend . [Her]123-emma parting look was grateful -- and [her]123-emma parting words , “ Oh ! [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse , the comfort of being sometimes alone!”--seemed[123-emma] to burst from an overcharged heart , and to describe somewhat of the continual endurance to be practised by [her]123-emma , even towards [some of those who loved [her]123-emma best]2241-some of those who loved her best .

“ Such [a home]4409-a home , indeed ! such [an aunt]5049-an aunt ! ”[123-emma] said [Emma]123-emma , as [she]123-emma turned back into [the hall]1379-the hall again . “ [I]123-emma do pity [you]93-miss woodhouse . And the more sensibility [you]93-miss woodhouse betray of [their]5050-their just horrors , the more [I]123-emma shall like [you]93-miss woodhouse . ”[123-emma]

[Jane]152-miss fairfax had not been gone a quarter of an hour , and [they]2243-they had only accomplished some views of [[St. Mark]323-st. mark 's Place]68-st. mark 's place , [Venice]69-venice , when [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill entered [the room]701-the room . [Emma]123-emma had not been thinking of [him]102-frank churchill , [she]123-emma had forgotten to think of [him]102-frank churchill -- but [she]123-emma was very glad to see [him]102-frank churchill . [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston would be at ease . [The black mare]2245-the black mare was blameless ; _ [they]2246-they _ were right who had named [Mrs. Churchill]98-mrs. churchill as the cause . [He]102-frank churchill had been detained by a temporary increase of illness in [her]98-mrs. churchill ; a nervous seizure , which had lasted some hours -- and [he]102-frank churchill had quite given up every thought of coming , till very late;--and had [he]102-frank churchill known how hot a ride [he]102-frank churchill should have , and how late , with all [his]102-frank churchill hurry , [he]102-frank churchill must be , [he]102-frank churchill believed [he]102-frank churchill should not have come at all . The heat was excessive ; [he]102-frank churchill had never suffered any thing like it -- almost wished [he]102-frank churchill had staid at [home]562-home -- nothing killed [him]102-frank churchill like heat -- [he]102-frank churchill could bear any degree of cold , etc . , but heat was intolerable -- and [he]102-frank churchill sat down , at the greatest possible distance from the slight remains of [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse 's fire , looking very deplorable .

“ [You]102-frank churchill will soon be cooler , if [you]102-frank churchill sit still , ”[123-emma] said [Emma]123-emma .

“ As soon as [I]102-frank churchill am cooler [I]102-frank churchill shall go back again . [I]102-frank churchill could very ill be spared -- but such a point had been made of [my]102-frank churchill coming ! [You]102-frank churchill will all be going soon [I]102-frank churchill suppose ; the whole party breaking up . [I]102-frank churchill met _ one _ as [I]102-frank churchill came -- Madness in such weather!--absolute madness ! ”[102-frank churchill]

[Emma]123-emma listened , and looked , and soon perceived that [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill 's state might be best defined by the expressive phrase of being out of humour . [Some people]2762-some people were always cross when [they]2762-some people were hot . Such might be [his]102-frank churchill constitution ; and as [she]123-emma knew that eating and drinking were often the cure of such incidental complaints , [she]123-emma recommended [his]102-frank churchill taking some refreshment ; [he]102-frank churchill would find abundance of every thing in [the dining - room]1589-the dining - room -- and [she]123-emma humanely pointed out the door .

“ No -- [he]102-frank churchill should not eat . [He]102-frank churchill was not hungry ; it would only make [him]102-frank churchill hotter . ”[123-emma] In two minutes , however , [he]102-frank churchill relented in [his]102-frank churchill own favour ; and muttering something about spruce - beer , walked off . [Emma]123-emma returned all [her]123-emma attention to [[her]123-emma father]425-her father , saying in secret--

“ [I]123-emma am glad [I]123-emma have done being in love with [him]102-frank churchill . [I]123-emma should not like [a man who is so soon discomposed by a hot morning]5051-a man who is so soon discomposed by a hot morning . [Harriet]111-harriet 's sweet easy temper will not mind it . ”[123-emma]

[He]102-frank churchill was gone long enough to have had a very comfortable meal , and came back all the better -- grown quite cool -- and , with good manners , like [himself]102-frank churchill -- able to draw a chair close to [them]2251-them , take an interest in [their]2251-them employment ; and regret , in a reasonable way , that [he]102-frank churchill should be so late . [He]102-frank churchill was not in [his]102-frank churchill best spirits , but seemed trying to improve [them]2251-them ; and , at last , made [himself]102-frank churchill talk nonsense very agreeably . [They]2252-they were looking over views in [Swisserland]70-swisserland .

“ As soon as [[my]102-frank churchill aunt]4162-my aunt gets well , [I]102-frank churchill shall go abroad , ”[102-frank churchill] said [he]102-frank churchill . “ [I]102-frank churchill shall never be easy till [I]102-frank churchill have seen [some of [these places]5054-these places]5053-some of these places . [You]5055-you will have [my]102-frank churchill sketches , some time or other , to look at -- or [my]102-frank churchill tour to read -- or [my]102-frank churchill poem . [I]102-frank churchill shall do something to expose [myself]102-frank churchill . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ That may be -- but not by sketches in [Swisserland]70-swisserland . [You]5055-you will never go to [Swisserland]70-swisserland . [[Your]5055-you uncle]5056-your uncle and [aunt]3628-aunt will never allow [you]102-frank churchill to leave [England]36-england . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ [They]5055-you may be induced to go too . A warm climate may be prescribed for [her]3628-aunt . [I]102-frank churchill have more than half an expectation of [our]5058-our all going abroad . [I]102-frank churchill assure [you]5055-you [I]102-frank churchill have . [I]102-frank churchill feel a strong persuasion , this morning , that [I]102-frank churchill shall soon be abroad . [I]102-frank churchill ought to travel . [I]102-frank churchill am tired of doing nothing . [I]102-frank churchill want a change . [I]102-frank churchill am serious , [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse , whatever [your]5055-you penetrating eyes may fancy -- [I]102-frank churchill am sick of [England]36-england -- and would leave it to - morrow , if [I]102-frank churchill could . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ [You]102-frank churchill are sick of prosperity and indulgence . Can not [you]102-frank churchill invent a few hardships for [yourself]102-frank churchill , and be contented to stay ? ”[102-frank churchill]

“ _ [I]102-frank churchill _ sick of prosperity and indulgence ! [You]5055-you are quite mistaken . [I]102-frank churchill do not look upon [myself]102-frank churchill as either prosperous or indulged . [I]102-frank churchill am thwarted in every thing material . [I]102-frank churchill do not consider [myself]102-frank churchill at all [a fortunate person]5059-a fortunate person . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ [You]102-frank churchill are not quite so miserable , though , as when [you]102-frank churchill first came . Go and eat and drink a little more , and [you]102-frank churchill will do very well . Another slice of cold meat , another draught of Madeira and water , will make [you]102-frank churchill nearly on a par with [the rest of [us]5061-us]5060-the rest of us . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ No -- [I]102-frank churchill shall not stir . [I]102-frank churchill shall sit by [you]102-frank churchill . [You]102-frank churchill are [my]102-frank churchill best cure . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ [We]5061-us are going to [Box Hill]64-box hill to - morrow;--you will join [us]5061-us . It is not [Swisserland]70-swisserland , but it will be something for [a young man so much in want of a change]5062-a young man so much in want of a change . [You]102-frank churchill will stay , and go with [us]5061-us ? ”[102-frank churchill]

“ No , certainly not ; [I]102-frank churchill shall go [home]562-home in the cool of the evening . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ But [you]102-frank churchill may come again in the cool of to - morrow morning . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ No -- It will not be worth while . If [I]102-frank churchill come , [I]102-frank churchill shall be cross . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ Then pray stay at [Richmond]61-richmond . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ But if [I]102-frank churchill do , [I]102-frank churchill shall be crosser still . [I]102-frank churchill can never bear to think of [you]5064-you all there without [me]102-frank churchill . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ These are difficulties which [you]102-frank churchill must settle for [yourself]102-frank churchill . Chuse [your]102-frank churchill own degree of crossness . [I]102-frank churchill shall press [you]123-emma no more . ”[102-frank churchill]

[The rest of the party]2253-the rest of the party were now returning , and all were soon collected . With some there was great joy at the sight of [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill ; [others]2773-others took it very composedly ; but there was a very general distress and disturbance on [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax 's disappearance being explained . That it was time for [every body]2749-every body to go , concluded the subject ; and with a short final arrangement for the next day 's scheme , [they]2256-they parted . [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill 's little inclination to exclude [himself]102-frank churchill increased so much , that [his]102-frank churchill last words to [Emma]123-emma were ,

“ Well;--if _ [you]123-emma _ wish [me]102-frank churchill to stay and join [the party]2949-the party , [I]102-frank churchill will . ”[102-frank churchill]

[She]123-emma smiled [her]123-emma acceptance ; and nothing less than a summons from [Richmond]61-richmond was to take [him]102-frank churchill back before the following evening .

[CHAPTER VII]324-chapter vii

[They]2256-they had a very fine day for [Box Hill]64-box hill ; and all the other outward circumstances of arrangement , accommodation , and punctuality , were in favour of a pleasant party . [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston directed the whole , officiating safely between [Hartfield]2-hartfield and [the Vicarage]844-the vicarage , and [every body]2749-every body was in good time . [Emma]123-emma and [Harriet]111-harriet went together ; [Miss Bates]105-miss bates and [[her]105-miss bates niece]1204-her niece , with [the Eltons]143-the eltons ; [the gentlemen on horseback]2260-the gentlemen on horseback . [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston remained with [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse . Nothing was wanting but to be happy when [they]2256-they got [there]448-there . Seven miles were travelled in expectation of enjoyment , and [every body]2749-every body had a burst of admiration on first arriving ; but in the general amount of the day there was deficiency . There was a languor , a want of spirits , a want of union , which could not be got over . [They]2256-they separated too much into parties . [The Eltons]143-the eltons walked together ; [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley took charge of [Miss Bates]105-miss bates and [Jane]105-miss bates ; and [Emma]123-emma and [Harriet]111-harriet belonged to [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill . And [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston tried , in vain , to make [them]2256-they harmonise better . It seemed at first an accidental division , but it never materially varied . [Mr.]2263-mr. and [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton , indeed , [shewed]2264-shewed no unwillingness to mix , and be as agreeable as [they]2256-they could ; but during the two whole hours that were spent on [the hill]2265-the hill , there seemed a principle of separation , between [the other parties]2266-the other parties , too strong for any fine prospects , or any cold collation , or any cheerful [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston , to remove .

At first it was downright dulness to [Emma]123-emma . [She]123-emma had never seen [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill so silent and stupid . [He]102-frank churchill said nothing worth hearing -- looked without seeing -- admired without intelligence -- listened without knowing what [she]123-emma said . While [he]102-frank churchill was so dull , it was no wonder that [Harriet]111-harriet should be dull likewise ; and [they]2256-they were both insufferable .

When [they]2256-they all sat down it was better ; to [her]123-emma taste a great deal better , for [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill grew talkative and gay , making [her]123-emma [his]102-frank churchill first object . Every distinguishing attention that could be paid , was paid to [her]123-emma . To amuse [her]123-emma , and be agreeable in [her]123-emma eyes , seemed all that [he]102-frank churchill cared for -- and [Emma]123-emma , glad to be enlivened , not sorry to be flattered , was gay and easy too , and gave [him]102-frank churchill all the friendly encouragement , the admission to be gallant , which [she]123-emma had ever given in the first and most animating period of [their]2256-they acquaintance ; but which now , in [her]123-emma own estimation , meant nothing , though in the judgment of [most people looking on it]2267-most people looking on it must have had such an appearance as no English word but flirtation could very well describe . “ [Mr. Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill and [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse flirted together excessively . ”[2256-they] [They]2256-they were laying [themselves]2256-they open to that very phrase -- and to having it sent off in a letter to [Maple Grove]51-maple grove by [one lady]2268-one lady , to [Ireland]32-ireland by another . Not that [Emma]123-emma was gay and thoughtless from any real felicity ; it was rather because [she]123-emma felt less happy than [she]123-emma had expected . [She]123-emma laughed because [she]123-emma was disappointed ; and though [she]123-emma liked [him]102-frank churchill for [his]102-frank churchill attentions , and thought [them]2269-them all , whether in friendship , admiration , or playfulness , extremely judicious , [they]2269-them were not winning back [her]123-emma heart . [She]123-emma still intended [him]102-frank churchill for [[her]123-emma friend]427-her friend .

“ How much [I]102-frank churchill am obliged to [you]123-emma , ”[102-frank churchill] said [he]102-frank churchill , “ for telling [me]102-frank churchill to come to - day!--If it had not been for [you]123-emma , [I]102-frank churchill should certainly have lost all the happiness of [this party]5066-this party . [I]102-frank churchill had quite determined to go away again . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ Yes , [you]123-emma were very cross ; and [I]123-emma do not know what about , except that [you]123-emma were too late for the best strawberries . [I]123-emma was [a kinder friend]5067-a kinder friend than [you]123-emma deserved . But [you]123-emma were humble . [You]123-emma begged hard to be commanded to come . ”[123-emma]

“ Do n't say [I]102-frank churchill was cross . [I]102-frank churchill was fatigued . The heat overcame [me]102-frank churchill . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ It is hotter to - day . ”[123-emma]

“ Not to [my]102-frank churchill feelings . [I]102-frank churchill am perfectly comfortable to - day . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ [You]102-frank churchill are comfortable because [you]102-frank churchill are under command . ”[123-emma]

“ [Your]102-frank churchill command?--Yes . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ Perhaps [I]123-emma intended [you]123-emma to say so , but [I]123-emma meant self - command . [You]123-emma had , somehow or other , broken bounds yesterday , and run away from [[your]123-emma own management]5068-your own management ; but to - day [you]123-emma are got back again -- and as [I]123-emma can not be always with [you]123-emma , it is best to believe [your]123-emma temper under [your]123-emma own command rather than [mine]123-emma . ”[123-emma]

“ It comes to the same thing . [I]102-frank churchill can have no self - command without a motive . [You]123-emma order [me]102-frank churchill , whether [you]123-emma speak or not . And [you]123-emma can be always with [me]102-frank churchill . [You]123-emma are always with [me]102-frank churchill . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ Dating from three o'clock yesterday . [My]123-emma perpetual influence could not begin earlier , or [you]123-emma would not have been so much out of humour before . ”[123-emma]

“ Three o'clock yesterday ! That is [your]123-emma date . [I]102-frank churchill thought [I]102-frank churchill had seen [you]123-emma first in February . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ [Your]123-emma gallantry is really unanswerable . But ( lowering [her]5069-her voice)--nobody speaks except [ourselves]5070-we , and it is rather too much to be talking nonsense for the entertainment of [seven silent people]5071-seven silent people . ”[123-emma]

“ [I]2271-i say nothing of which [I]2271-i am ashamed , ”[2271-i] replied [he]2271-i , with lively impudence . “ [I]2271-i saw [you]123-emma first in [February]57-february . Let every body on [the Hill]72-the hill hear [me]2271-i if [they]5072-they can . Let [my]2271-i accents swell to [Mickleham]73-mickleham on one side , and [Dorking]74-dorking on the other . [I]2271-i saw [you]123-emma first in [February]57-february . ”[2271-i] And then [whispering--“Our companions]5073-whispering--“our companions are excessively stupid . What shall [we]5070-we do to rouse [them]5073-whispering--“our companions ? Any nonsense will serve . [They]5073-whispering--“our companions _ shall _ talk . [Ladies]3480-ladies and [gentlemen]675-gentlemen , [I]2271-i am ordered by [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse ( who , wherever [she]93-miss woodhouse is , presides ) to say , that [she]93-miss woodhouse desires to know what [you]123-emma are all thinking of ? ”[2271-i]

[Some]325-some laughed , and answered good - humouredly . [Miss Bates]105-miss bates said a great deal ; [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton swelled at the idea of [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse 's presiding ; [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley 's answer was the most distinct .

“ Is [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse sure that [she]93-miss woodhouse would like to hear what [we]5070-we are all thinking of ? ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ Oh ! no , no”--cried[123-emma] [Emma]123-emma , laughing as carelessly as [she]123-emma could--“Upon no account in [the world]403-the world . It is the very last thing [I]207-mrs. elton would stand the brunt of just now . Let [me]207-mrs. elton hear any thing rather than what [you]123-emma are all thinking of . [I]207-mrs. elton will not say quite all . There are one or two , perhaps , ( glancing at [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston and [Harriet]111-harriet , ) whose thoughts [I]207-mrs. elton might not be afraid of knowing . ”[207-mrs. elton]

“ It is a sort of thing , ”[207-mrs. elton] cried [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton emphatically , “ which _ [I]207-mrs. elton _ should not have thought [myself]207-mrs. elton privileged to inquire into . Though , perhaps , as [the _ Chaperon _ of the party--_I _]5077-the _ chaperon _ of the party--_i _ never was in any circle -- exploring parties -- [young ladies]4621-young ladies -- married women-- ”[207-mrs. elton]

[Her]207-mrs. elton mutterings were chiefly to [[her]207-mrs. elton husband]441-her husband ; and [he]441-her husband murmured , in reply ,

“ Very true , [my]441-her husband love , very true . Exactly so , indeed -- quite unheard of -- but [some ladies]5079-some ladies say any thing . Better pass it off as a joke . [Every body]2749-every body knows what is due to _ [you]123-emma _ . ”[441-her husband]

“ [It]5081-it will not do , ”[102-frank churchill] whispered [Frank]102-frank churchill to [Emma]123-emma ; “ [they]5082-them are most of [them]5082-them affronted . [I]102-frank churchill will attack [them]5082-them with more address . [Ladies]3480-ladies and [gentlemen]675-gentlemen -- [I]102-frank churchill am ordered by [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse to say , that [she]93-miss woodhouse waives [her]93-miss woodhouse right of knowing exactly what [you]123-emma may all be thinking of , and only requires something very entertaining from each of [you]123-emma , in a general way . Here are seven of [you]123-emma , besides [myself]102-frank churchill , ( who , [she]93-miss woodhouse is pleased to say , am very entertaining already , ) and [she]93-miss woodhouse only demands from each of [you]123-emma either one thing very clever , be it prose or verse , original or repeated -- or two things moderately clever -- or three things very dull indeed , and [she]93-miss woodhouse engages to laugh heartily at them all . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ Oh ! very well , ”[105-miss bates] exclaimed [Miss Bates]105-miss bates , “ then [I]105-miss bates need not be uneasy . ' Three things very dull indeed . ' That will just do for [me]105-miss bates , [you]123-emma know . [I]105-miss bates shall be sure to say three dull things as soon as ever [I]105-miss bates open [my]105-miss bates mouth , sha n't [I]105-miss bates ? ( looking round with the most good - humoured dependence on every body 's assent)--Do not [you]123-emma all think [I]105-miss bates shall ? ”[105-miss bates]

[Emma]123-emma could not resist .

“ Ah ! [ma'am]4171-ma'am , but there may be a difficulty . Pardon [me]102-frank churchill -- but [you]4171-ma'am will be limited as to number -- only three at once . ”[102-frank churchill]

[Miss Bates]105-miss bates , deceived by the mock ceremony of [her]123-emma manner , did not immediately catch [her]123-emma meaning ; but , when it burst on [her]123-emma , it could not anger , though a slight blush shewed that it could pain [her]123-emma .

“ [Ah!--well]326-ah!--well -- to be sure . Yes , [I]102-frank churchill see what [she]123-emma means , ( turning to [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley , ) and [I]102-frank churchill will try to hold [my]102-frank churchill tongue . [I]102-frank churchill must make [myself]102-frank churchill very disagreeable , or [she]123-emma would not have said such a thing to [an old friend]4620-an old friend . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ [I]86-mr. weston like [your]86-mr. weston plan , ”[86-mr. weston] cried [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston . “ Agreed , agreed . [I]86-mr. weston will do [my]86-mr. weston best . [I]86-mr. weston am making a conundrum . How will a conundrum reckon ? ”[86-mr. weston]

“ [Low]327-low , [I]86-mr. weston am afraid , [sir]2734-sir , very low , ”[86-mr. weston] answered [his]86-mr. weston son;--“but [we]5088-we shall be indulgent -- especially to any one who leads the way . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ No , no , ”[123-emma] said [Emma]123-emma , “ it will not reckon low . A conundrum of [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston 's shall clear [him]86-mr. weston and [[his]86-mr. weston next neighbour]5089-his next neighbour . Come , [sir]2734-sir , pray let [me]123-emma hear it . ”[123-emma]

“ [I]86-mr. weston doubt its being very clever [myself]86-mr. weston , ”[86-mr. weston] said [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston . “ It is too much a matter of fact , but here it is.--What two letters of the alphabet are there , that express perfection ? ”[86-mr. weston]

“ What two letters!--express perfection ! [I]123-emma am sure [I]123-emma do not know . ”[123-emma]

“ Ah ! [you]123-emma will never guess . [You]123-emma , ( to [Emma]123-emma ) , [I]86-mr. weston am certain , will never [guess.--I]5091-guess.--i will tell you.--M. and A.--Em - ma.--Do [you]123-emma understand ? ”[86-mr. weston]

Understanding and gratification came together . It might be a very indifferent piece of wit , but [Emma]123-emma found a great deal to laugh at and enjoy in it -- and so did [Frank]102-frank churchill and [Harriet.--It]328-harriet.--it did not seem to touch the rest of [the party]2949-the party equally ; [some]4385-some looked very stupid about it , and [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley gravely said ,

“ This explains the sort of clever thing that is wanted , and [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston has done very well for [himself]86-mr. weston ; but [he]86-mr. weston must have knocked up every body else . _ Perfection _ should not have come quite so soon . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ Oh ! for [myself]207-mrs. elton , [I]207-mrs. elton protest [I]207-mrs. elton must be excused , ”[207-mrs. elton] said [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton ; “ _ [I]207-mrs. elton _ really can not attempt -- [I]207-mrs. elton am not at all fond of the sort of thing . [I]207-mrs. elton had an acrostic once sent to [me]207-mrs. elton upon [my]207-mrs. elton own name , which [I]207-mrs. elton was not at all pleased with . [I]207-mrs. elton knew who it came from . An abominable puppy!--You know who [I]207-mrs. elton mean ( nodding to [[her]207-mrs. elton husband]441-her husband ) . These kind of things are very well at Christmas , when one is sitting round the fire ; but quite out of place , in [my]207-mrs. elton opinion , when one is exploring about [the country]611-the country in summer . [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse must excuse [me]207-mrs. elton . [I]207-mrs. elton am not [one of those who have witty things at every body]5094-one of those who have witty things at every body 's service . [I]207-mrs. elton do not pretend to be a wit . [I]207-mrs. elton have a great deal of vivacity in [my]207-mrs. elton own way , but [I]207-mrs. elton really must be allowed to judge when to speak and when to hold [my]207-mrs. elton tongue . Pass [us]5095-us , if [you]5096-you please , [Mr. Churchill]102-frank churchill . Pass [Mr. E.]255-mr. e. , [Knightley]92-mr. knightley , [Jane]105-miss bates , and [myself]207-mrs. elton . [We]5095-us have nothing clever to say -- [not one of [us]5095-us]5097-not one of us .[207-mrs. elton]

“ Yes , yes , pray pass _ [me]441-her husband _ , ”[441-her husband] added [[her]2275-her husband]441-her husband , with a sort of sneering consciousness ; “ _ [I]441-her husband _ have nothing to say that can entertain [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse , or [any other young lady]5098-any other young lady . [An old married man]4878-an old married man -- quite good for nothing . Shall [we]5095-us walk , [Augusta]204-augusta ? ”[441-her husband]

“ With all [my]105-miss bates heart . [I]105-miss bates am really tired of exploring so long on one spot . Come , [Jane]105-miss bates , take [my]105-miss bates other arm . ”[105-miss bates]

[Jane]105-miss bates declined it , however , and [the husband]3572-the husband and [wife]1548-wife walked off . “ [Happy couple]5100-happy couple ! ”[102-frank churchill] said [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill , as soon as [they]2279-they were out of hearing:--“How well [they]2279-they suit one another!--Very lucky -- marrying as [they]2279-they did , upon [an acquaintance formed only in a public]5101-an acquaintance formed only in a public place!--They only knew [each other]430-each other , [I]105-miss bates think , a few weeks in [Bath]30-bath ! Peculiarly lucky!--for as to any real knowledge of [a person]2845-a person 's disposition that [Bath]5104-bath , or [any public place]5105-any public place , can give -- it is all nothing ; there can be no knowledge . It is only by seeing women in [[their]1548-wife own homes]5106-their own homes , among [their]1548-wife own set , just as [they]1548-wife always are , that [you]5107-you can form any just judgment . Short of that , it is all guess and luck -- and will generally be ill - luck . How many [a man]2840-a man has committed [himself]2840-a man on a short acquaintance , and rued it all the rest of [his]2840-a man life ! ”[105-miss bates]

[[Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax , who had seldom spoken before , except among [[her]152-miss fairfax own confederates]2281-her own confederates]2280-miss fairfax , who had seldom spoken before , except among her own confederates , spoke now .

“ Such things do occur , undoubtedly . ”--She[152-miss fairfax] was stopped by a cough . [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill turned towards [her]152-miss fairfax to listen .

“ [You]152-miss fairfax were speaking , ”[102-frank churchill] said [he]102-frank churchill , gravely . [She]152-miss fairfax recovered [her]152-miss fairfax voice .

“ [I]152-miss fairfax was only going to observe , that though such unfortunate circumstances do sometimes occur both to [men]3104-men and [women]3259-women , [I]152-miss fairfax can not imagine [them]5111-them to be very frequent . A hasty and imprudent attachment may arise -- but there is generally time to recover from it afterwards . [I]152-miss fairfax would be understood to mean , that it can be only [weak , irresolute characters , ( whose happiness must be always at the mercy of chance , ) who will suffer an unfortunate acquaintance]5112-weak , irresolute characters , ( whose happiness must be always at the mercy of chance , ) who will suffer an unfortunate acquaintance to be an inconvenience , an oppression for ever . ”[152-miss fairfax]

[He]102-frank churchill made no answer ; merely looked , and bowed in submission ; and soon afterwards said , in a lively tone ,

“ Well , [I]102-frank churchill have so little confidence in [my]102-frank churchill own judgment , that whenever [I]102-frank churchill marry , [I]102-frank churchill hope [some body]5113-some body will chuse [[my]102-frank churchill wife]5114-my wife for [me]102-frank churchill . Will [you]152-miss fairfax ? ( turning to [Emma]123-emma . ) Will [you]152-miss fairfax chuse [a wife]2759-a wife for [me?--I]152-miss fairfax am sure [I]102-frank churchill should like any body fixed on by [you]152-miss fairfax . [You]152-miss fairfax provide for [the family]433-the family , [you]152-miss fairfax know , ( with a smile at [[his]102-frank churchill father]518-his father ) . Find some body for [me]102-frank churchill . [I]102-frank churchill am in no hurry . Adopt [her]5114-my wife , educate [her]5114-my wife . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ And make [her]5114-my wife like [myself]102-frank churchill . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ By all means , if [you]152-miss fairfax can . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ Very well . [I]102-frank churchill undertake the commission . [You]152-miss fairfax shall have [a charming wife]5118-a charming wife . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ [She]5114-my wife must be very lively , and have hazle eyes . [I]102-frank churchill care for nothing else . [I]102-frank churchill shall go abroad for a couple of years -- and when [I]102-frank churchill return , [I]102-frank churchill shall come to [you]152-miss fairfax for [[my]102-frank churchill wife]5114-my wife . Remember . ”[102-frank churchill]

[Emma]123-emma was in no danger of forgetting . It was a commission to touch every favourite feeling . Would not [Harriet]111-harriet be the very creature described ? [Hazle]329-hazle eyes excepted , two years more might make [her]111-harriet all that [he]2282-he wished . [He]2282-he might even have [Harriet]111-harriet in [his]2282-he thoughts at the moment ; who could say ? Referring the education to [her]111-harriet seemed to imply it .

“ Now , [ma'am]4171-ma'am , ”[152-miss fairfax] said [Jane]152-miss fairfax to [[her]152-miss fairfax aunt]3293-her aunt , “ shall [we]5121-we join [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton ? ”[152-miss fairfax]

“ If [you]4171-ma'am please , [[my]2284-i dear]2714-my dear . With all [my]2284-i heart . [I]2284-i am quite ready . [I]2284-i was ready to have gone with [her]111-harriet , but this will do just as well . [We]5121-we shall soon overtake [her]111-harriet . There [she]111-harriet is -- no , that 's [somebody else]1627-somebody else . That 's [one of [the ladies in the Irish car party]5125-the ladies in the irish car party]5124-one of the ladies in the irish car party , not at all like her.--Well , [I]2284-i declare-- ”[2284-i]

[They]2284-i walked off , followed in half a minute by [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley . [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston , [[his]86-mr. weston son]523-his son , [Emma]123-emma , and [Harriet]111-harriet , only remained ; and [the young man]532-the young man 's spirits now rose to a pitch almost unpleasant . Even [Emma]123-emma grew tired at last of flattery and merriment , and wished [herself]123-emma rather walking quietly about with any of [the others]870-the others , or sitting almost alone , and quite unattended to , in tranquil observation of the beautiful views beneath [her]123-emma . The appearance of [the servants]1923-the servants looking out for [them]1923-the servants to give notice of [the carriages]989-the carriages was a joyful sight ; and even the bustle of collecting and preparing to depart , and the solicitude of [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton to have _ [[her]207-mrs. elton _ carriage]2290-her _ carriage first , were gladly endured , in the prospect of the quiet drive [home]562-home which was to close the very questionable enjoyments of this day of pleasure . Such another scheme , composed of [so many ill - assorted people]2292-so many ill - assorted people , [she]123-emma hoped never to be betrayed into again .

While waiting for [the carriage]2719-the carriage , [she]123-emma found [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley by [her]123-emma side . [He]92-mr. knightley looked around , as if to see that [no one]3090-no one were near , and then said ,

“ [Emma]123-emma , [I]92-mr. knightley must once more speak to [you]123-emma as [I]92-mr. knightley have been used to do : a privilege rather endured than allowed , perhaps , but [I]92-mr. knightley must still use it . [I]92-mr. knightley can not see [you]123-emma acting wrong , without a remonstrance . How could [you]123-emma be so unfeeling to [Miss Bates]105-miss bates ? How could [you]123-emma be so insolent in [your]123-emma wit to [a woman of [her]105-miss bates character]5126-a woman of her character , age , and situation?--Emma , [I]92-mr. knightley had not thought it possible . ”[92-mr. knightley]

[Emma]123-emma recollected , blushed , was sorry , but tried to laugh it off .

“ Nay , how could [I]92-mr. knightley help saying what [I]92-mr. knightley did?--Nobody could have helped it . It was not so very bad . [I]92-mr. knightley dare say [she]105-miss bates did not understand [me]92-mr. knightley . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ [I]92-mr. knightley assure [you]123-emma [she]105-miss bates did . [She]105-miss bates felt [your]123-emma full meaning . [She]105-miss bates has talked of it since . [I]92-mr. knightley wish [you]123-emma could have heard how [she]105-miss bates talked of it -- with what candour and generosity . [I]92-mr. knightley wish [you]123-emma could have heard [her]105-miss bates honouring [your]123-emma forbearance , in being able to pay [her]105-miss bates such attentions , as [she]105-miss bates was for ever receiving from [yourself]123-emma and [[your]123-emma father]3597-your father , when [her]105-miss bates society must be so irksome . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ Oh ! ”[123-emma] cried [Emma]123-emma , “ [I]123-emma know there is not a better creature in [the world]403-the world : but [you]123-emma must allow , that what is good and what is ridiculous are most unfortunately blended in [her]105-miss bates . ”[123-emma]

“ [They]5129-they are blended , ”[2295-i] said [he]2295-i , “ [I]2295-i acknowledge ; and , were [she]105-miss bates prosperous , [I]2295-i could allow much for the occasional prevalence of the ridiculous over the good . Were [she]105-miss bates [a woman of fortune]5130-a woman of fortune , [I]2295-i would leave every harmless absurdity to take its chance , [I]2295-i would not quarrel with [you]123-emma for any liberties of manner . Were [she]105-miss bates [your]123-emma equal in situation -- but , [Emma]123-emma , consider how far this is from being the case . [She]105-miss bates is poor ; [she]105-miss bates has sunk from the comforts [she]105-miss bates was born to ; and , if [she]105-miss bates live to old age , must probably sink more . [Her]105-miss bates situation should secure [your]123-emma compassion . It was badly done , indeed ! [You]123-emma , whom [she]105-miss bates had known from [an infant]5131-an infant , whom [she]105-miss bates had seen grow up from a period when [her]105-miss bates notice was an honour , to have [you]123-emma now , in thoughtless spirits , and the pride of the moment , laugh at [her]105-miss bates , humble [her]105-miss bates -- and before [[her]105-miss bates niece]1204-her niece , too -- and before others , many of whom ( certainly _ some _ , ) would be entirely guided by _ [your]123-emma _ treatment of her.--This is not pleasant to [you]123-emma , [Emma]123-emma -- and it is very far from pleasant to [me]2295-i ; but [I]2295-i must , [I]2295-i will,--I will tell [you]123-emma truths while [I]2295-i can ; satisfied with proving [myself]2295-i [[your]123-emma friend]2922-your friend by very faithful counsel , and trusting that [you]123-emma will some time or other do [me]2295-i greater justice than [you]123-emma can do now . ”[2295-i]

While [they]2296-they talked , [they]2296-they were advancing towards [the carriage]2719-the carriage ; it was ready ; and , before [she]2298-she could speak again , [he]2299-he had handed [her]2298-she in . [He]2299-he had misinterpreted the feelings which had kept [her]2298-she face averted , and [her]2298-she tongue motionless . They were combined only of anger against [herself]2298-she , mortification , and deep concern . [She]2298-she had not been able to speak ; and , on entering [the carriage]2719-the carriage , sunk back for a moment overcome -- then reproaching [herself]2298-she for having taken no leave , making no acknowledgment , parting in apparent sullenness , [she]2298-she looked out with voice and hand eager to shew a difference ; but it was just too late . [He]2299-he had turned away , and the horses were in motion . [She]2298-she continued to look back , but in vain ; and soon , with what appeared unusual speed , [they]2296-they were half way down [the hill]2265-the hill , and every thing left far behind . [She]2298-she was vexed beyond what could have been expressed -- almost beyond what [she]2298-she could conceal . Never had [she]2298-she felt so agitated , mortified , grieved , at any circumstance in [her]2298-she life . [She]2298-she was most forcibly struck . The truth of this representation there was no denying . [She]2298-she felt it at [her]2298-she heart . How could [she]2298-she have been so brutal , so cruel to [Miss Bates]105-miss bates ! How could [she]2298-she have exposed [herself]2298-she to such ill opinion in any one [she]2298-she valued ! And how suffer [him]2299-he to leave [her]2298-she without saying one word of gratitude , of concurrence , of common kindness !

Time did not compose [her]2298-she . As [she]2298-she reflected more , [she]2298-she seemed but to feel it more . [She]2298-she never had been so depressed . Happily it was not necessary to speak . There was only [Harriet]111-harriet , who seemed not in spirits [herself]111-harriet , fagged , and very willing to be silent ; and [Emma]123-emma felt the tears running down [her]123-emma cheeks almost all the way [home]562-home , without being at any trouble to check them , extraordinary as they were .

CHAPTER VIII

The wretchedness of a scheme to [Box Hill]64-box hill was in [Emma]123-emma 's thoughts all the evening . How it might be considered by [the rest of the party]2253-the rest of the party , [she]123-emma could not tell . [They]2253-the rest of the party , in [[their]2253-the rest of the party different homes]2304-their different homes , and [their]2253-the rest of the party different ways , might be looking back on it with pleasure ; but in [her]123-emma view it was a morning more completely misspent , more totally bare of rational satisfaction at the time , and more to be abhorred in recollection , than any [she]123-emma had ever passed . A whole evening of back - gammon with [[her]123-emma father]425-her father , was felicity to it . _ There _ , indeed , lay real pleasure , for there [she]123-emma was giving up the sweetest hours of the twenty - four to [his]425-her father comfort ; and feeling that , unmerited as might be the degree of [his]425-her father fond affection and confiding esteem , [she]123-emma could not , in [her]123-emma general conduct , be open to any severe reproach . As [a daughter]2306-a daughter , [she]123-emma hoped [she]123-emma was not without a heart . [She]123-emma hoped [no one]3090-no one could have said to [her]123-emma , “ How could [you]123-emma be so unfeeling to [your]123-emma father?--I must , [I]3090-no one will tell [you]123-emma truths while [I]3090-no one can . ”[3090-no one] [Miss Bates]105-miss bates should never again -- no , never ! If attention , in future , could do away the past , [she]123-emma might hope to be forgiven . [She]123-emma had been often remiss , [her]123-emma conscience told [her]123-emma so ; remiss , perhaps , more in thought than fact ; scornful , ungracious . But it should be so no more . In the warmth of true contrition , [she]123-emma would call upon [her]123-emma the very next morning , and it should be the beginning , on [her]123-emma side , of a regular , equal , kindly intercourse .

[She]123-emma was just as determined when the morrow came , and went early , that nothing might prevent [her]123-emma . It was not unlikely , [she]123-emma thought , that [she]123-emma might see [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley in [her]123-emma way ; or , perhaps , [he]92-mr. knightley might come in while [she]123-emma were paying [her]123-emma visit . [She]123-emma had no objection . [She]123-emma would not be ashamed of the appearance of [the penitence]2308-the penitence , so justly and truly [hers]123-emma . [Her]123-emma eyes were towards [Donwell]24-donwell as [she]123-emma walked , but [she]123-emma saw [him]92-mr. knightley not .

“ [The ladies]627-the ladies were all at [home]562-home . ”[123-emma] [She]123-emma had never rejoiced at the sound before , nor ever before entered [the passage]3811-the passage , nor walked up [the stairs]2310-the stairs , with any wish of giving pleasure , but in conferring obligation , or of deriving it , except in subsequent ridicule .

There was a bustle on [her]123-emma approach ; a good deal of moving and talking . [She]123-emma heard [Miss Bates]105-miss bates 's voice , something was to be done in a hurry ; [the maid]1113-the maid looked frightened and awkward ; hoped [she]1113-the maid would be pleased to wait a moment , and then ushered [her]1113-the maid in too soon . [The aunt]520-the aunt and [niece]1561-niece seemed both escaping into [the adjoining room]885-the adjoining room . [Jane]105-miss bates [she]123-emma had a distinct glimpse of , looking extremely ill ; and , before the door had shut [them]2315-them out , [she]123-emma heard [Miss Bates]105-miss bates saying , “ Well , [[my]105-miss bates dear]2714-my dear , [I]105-miss bates shall _ say _ [you]2714-my dear are laid down upon the bed , and [I]105-miss bates am sure [you]2714-my dear are ill enough . ”[105-miss bates]

[Poor old Mrs. Bates]110-mrs. bates , civil and humble as usual , looked as if [she]110-mrs. bates did not quite understand what was going on .

“ [I]110-mrs. bates am afraid [Jane]105-miss bates is not very well , ”[110-mrs. bates] said [she]110-mrs. bates , “ but [I]110-mrs. bates do not know ; [they]2315-them _ tell _ [me]110-mrs. bates [she]105-miss bates is well . [I]110-mrs. bates dare say [[my]110-mrs. bates daughter]3021-my daughter will be [here]2707-here presently , [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse . [I]110-mrs. bates hope [you]2714-my dear find a chair . [I]110-mrs. bates wish [Hetty]186-hetty had not gone . [I]110-mrs. bates am very little able -- Have [you]2714-my dear a chair , [ma'am]4171-ma'am ? Do [you]2714-my dear sit where [you]2714-my dear like ? [I]110-mrs. bates am sure [she]186-hetty will be [here]2707-here presently . ”[110-mrs. bates]

[Emma]123-emma seriously hoped [she]123-emma would . [She]123-emma had a moment 's fear of [Miss Bates]105-miss bates keeping away from [her]123-emma . But [Miss Bates]105-miss bates soon came--“Very happy and obliged”--but[123-emma] [Emma]123-emma 's conscience told [her]123-emma that there was not the same cheerful volubility as before -- less ease of look and manner . A very friendly inquiry after [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax , [she]123-emma hoped , might lead the way to a return of old feelings . The touch seemed immediate .

“ Ah ! [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse , how kind [you]93-miss woodhouse are!--I suppose [you]93-miss woodhouse have heard -- and are come to give [us]5141-us joy . This does not seem much like joy , indeed , in me--(twinkling away a tear or two)--but it will be very trying for [us]5141-us to part with [her]186-hetty , after having had [her]186-hetty so long , and [she]186-hetty has a dreadful headache just now , writing all the morning:--such long letters , [you]93-miss woodhouse know , to be written to [Colonel Campbell]164-colonel campbell , and [Mrs. Dixon]191-mrs. dixon . ' [[My]123-emma dear]2714-my dear , ' said [I]123-emma , ' [you]93-miss woodhouse will blind [yourself'--for]5143-yourself'--for tears were in [her]186-hetty eyes perpetually . [One]2775-one can not wonder , [one]2775-one can not wonder . It is a great change ; and though [she]186-hetty is amazingly fortunate -- such a situation , [I]123-emma suppose , as [no young woman]5146-no young woman before ever met with on first going out -- do not think [us]5141-us ungrateful , [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse , for such surprising good fortune--(again dispersing [her]186-hetty tears)--but , [poor dear soul]5147-poor dear soul ! if [you]93-miss woodhouse were to see what a headache [she]186-hetty has . When [one]2775-one is in great pain , [you]93-miss woodhouse know [one]2775-one can not feel any blessing quite as it may deserve . [She]186-hetty is as low as possible . To look at [her]186-hetty , [nobody]2718-nobody would think how delighted and happy [she]186-hetty is to have secured such a situation . [You]93-miss woodhouse will excuse [her]186-hetty not coming to [you]93-miss woodhouse -- [she]186-hetty is not able -- [she]186-hetty is gone into [[her]186-hetty own room]3195-her own room -- [I]123-emma want [her]186-hetty to lie down upon the bed . ' [[My]123-emma dear]2714-my dear , ' said [I]123-emma , ' [I]123-emma shall say [you]2714-my dear are laid down upon the bed : ' but , however , [she]186-hetty is not ; [she]186-hetty is walking about [the room]701-the room . But , now that [she]186-hetty has written [her]186-hetty letters , [she]186-hetty says [she]186-hetty shall soon be well . [She]186-hetty will be extremely sorry to miss seeing [you]2714-my dear , [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse , but [your]2714-my dear kindness will excuse [her]186-hetty . [You]2714-my dear were kept waiting at the door -- [I]123-emma was quite ashamed -- but somehow there was a little bustle -- for it so happened that [we]5154-we had not heard the knock , and till [you]2714-my dear were on the stairs , [we]5154-we did not know any body was coming . ' It is only [Mrs. Cole]185-mrs. cole , ' said [I]123-emma , ' depend upon it . [Nobody else]3698-nobody else would come so early . ' ' Well , ' said [she]186-hetty , ' it must be borne some time or other , and it may as well be now . ' But then [Patty]196-patty came in , and said it was [you]2714-my dear . ' Oh ! ' said [I]123-emma , ' it is [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse : [I]123-emma am sure [you]2714-my dear will like to see [her]186-hetty . ['--'I]2714-my dear can see [nobody]2718-nobody , ' said [she]186-hetty ; and up [she]186-hetty got , and would go away ; and that was what made [us]5154-we keep [you]2714-my dear waiting -- and extremely sorry and ashamed [we]5154-we were . ' If [you]2714-my dear must go , [[my]123-emma dear]2714-my dear , ' said [I]123-emma , ' [you]2714-my dear must , and [I]123-emma will say [you]2714-my dear are laid down upon the bed . ' ”[123-emma]

[Emma]123-emma was most sincerely interested . [Her]123-emma heart had been long growing kinder towards [Jane]152-miss fairfax ; and this picture of [her]152-miss fairfax present sufferings acted as a cure of every former ungenerous suspicion , and left [her]123-emma nothing but pity ; and the remembrance of the less just and less gentle sensations of the past , obliged [her]123-emma to admit that [Jane]152-miss fairfax might very naturally resolve on seeing [Mrs. Cole]185-mrs. cole or [any other steady friend]2316-any other steady friend , when [she]152-miss fairfax might not bear to see [herself]152-miss fairfax . [She]123-emma spoke as [she]123-emma felt , with earnest regret and solicitude -- sincerely wishing that the circumstances which [she]123-emma collected from [Miss Bates]105-miss bates to be now actually determined on , might be as much for [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax 's advantage and comfort as possible . “ It must be a severe trial to [them]5158-them all . [She]123-emma had understood it was to be delayed till [Colonel Campbell]164-colonel campbell 's return . ”[123-emma]

“ So very kind ! ”[105-miss bates] replied [Miss Bates]105-miss bates . “ But [you]123-emma are always kind . ”[105-miss bates]

There was no bearing such an “ always ; ”[123-emma] and to break through [her]123-emma dreadful gratitude , [Emma]123-emma made the direct inquiry of--

“ Where -- may [I]123-emma ask?--is [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax going ? ”[123-emma]

“ To [a [Mrs. Smallridge]330-mrs. smallridge -- charming woman -- most superior -- to have the charge of [[her]330-mrs. smallridge three little girls]5160-her three little girls]5159-a mrs. smallridge -- charming woman -- most superior -- to have the charge of her three little girls -- [delightful children]5161-delightful children . “ [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton , [I]123-emma suppose , has been [the person to whom [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax]5164-the person to whom miss fairfax owes-- ”[123-emma]

“ Yes , [our]5162-we good [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton . [The most indefatigable , true friend]5165-the most indefatigable , true friend . [She]207-mrs. elton would not take a denial . [She]207-mrs. elton would not let [Jane]152-miss fairfax say , ' No ; ' for when [Jane]152-miss fairfax first heard of it , ( it was the day before yesterday , the very morning [we]5162-we were at [Donwell]24-donwell , ) when [Jane]152-miss fairfax first heard of it , [she]152-miss fairfax was quite decided against accepting the offer , and for the reasons [you]5166-you mention ; exactly as [you]5166-you say , [she]152-miss fairfax had made up [her]152-miss fairfax mind to close with nothing till [Colonel Campbell]164-colonel campbell 's return , and nothing should induce [her]152-miss fairfax to enter into any engagement at present -- and so [she]152-miss fairfax told [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton over and over again -- and [I]123-emma am sure [I]123-emma had no more idea that [she]152-miss fairfax would change [her]152-miss fairfax mind!--but that good [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton , whose judgment never fails [her]152-miss fairfax , saw farther than [I]123-emma did . It is not every body that would have stood out in such a kind way as [she]152-miss fairfax did , and refuse to take [Jane]152-miss fairfax 's answer ; but [she]152-miss fairfax positively declared [she]152-miss fairfax would _ not _ write any such denial yesterday , as [Jane]152-miss fairfax wished [her]152-miss fairfax ; [she]152-miss fairfax would wait -- and , sure enough , yesterday evening it was all settled that [Jane]152-miss fairfax should go . Quite a surprize to [me]123-emma ! [I]123-emma had not the least idea!--Jane took [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton aside , and told [her]207-mrs. elton at once , that upon thinking over the advantages of [Mrs. Smallridge]330-mrs. smallridge 's situation , [she]152-miss fairfax had come to the resolution of accepting it.--I did not know a word of it till it was all settled . ”[123-emma]

“ Ah ! “ [You]93-miss woodhouse are so noble in [your]93-miss woodhouse ideas ! ”[123-emma]

“ Very soon , very soon , indeed ; that 's the worst of it . Within a fortnight . [Mrs. Smallridge]330-mrs. smallridge is in a great hurry . “ Yes ; [Jane]152-miss fairfax says [she]152-miss fairfax is sure [they]3093-her friends will ; but yet , this is such a situation as [she]152-miss fairfax can not feel [herself]152-miss fairfax justified in declining . [Miss Bates]105-miss bates would hardly give [Emma]123-emma time to say how perfectly new this circumstance was to [her]123-emma ; but as without supposing it possible that [she]123-emma could be ignorant of any of the particulars of [Mr. Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill 's going , [she]123-emma proceeded to give [them]2317-them all , it was of no consequence .

What [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton had learned from [the ostler]2318-the ostler on the subject , being the accumulation of [the ostler]2318-the ostler 's own knowledge , and the knowledge of [the servants at [Randalls]101-randalls]2320-the servants at randalls , was , that [a messenger]2321-a messenger had come over from [Richmond]61-richmond soon after the return of [the party]2949-the party from [Box Hill]64-box hill -- which [messenger]2323-messenger , however , had been no more than was expected ; and that [Mr. Churchill]102-frank churchill had sent [[his]102-frank churchill nephew]1750-his nephew a few lines , containing , upon the whole , a tolerable account of [Mrs. Churchill]98-mrs. churchill , and only wishing [him]1750-his nephew not to delay coming back beyond the next morning early ; but that [Mr. Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill having resolved to go [home]562-home directly , without waiting at all , and [his]102-frank churchill horse seeming to have got a cold , [Tom]333-tom had been sent off immediately for the Crown chaise , and [the ostler]2318-the ostler had stood out and seen it pass by , [the boy]499-the boy going a good pace , and driving very steady .

There was nothing in all this either to astonish or interest , and it caught [Emma]123-emma 's attention only as it united with the subject which already engaged [her]123-emma mind . The contrast between [Mrs. Churchill]98-mrs. churchill 's importance in [the world]403-the world , and [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax 's , struck [her]123-emma ; one was every thing , the other nothing -- and [she]123-emma sat musing on the difference of [woman]749-woman 's destiny , and quite unconscious on what [her]123-emma eyes were fixed , till roused by [Miss Bates]105-miss bates 's saying ,

“ Aye , [I]105-miss bates see what [you]123-emma are thinking of , the pianoforte . What is to become of that?--Very true . [Poor dear [Jane]105-miss bates]5198-poor dear jane was talking of it just now.--'You must go , ' said [she]105-miss bates . ' [You]123-emma and [I]105-miss bates must part . Now [Emma]123-emma was obliged to think of the pianoforte ; and the remembrance of all [her]123-emma former fanciful and unfair conjectures was so little pleasing , that [she]123-emma soon allowed [herself]123-emma to believe [her]123-emma visit had been long enough ; and , with a repetition of every thing that [she]123-emma could venture to say of the good wishes which [she]123-emma really felt , took leave .

[CHAPTER IX

Emma]123-emma 's pensive meditations , as [she]123-emma walked [home]562-home , were not interrupted ; but on entering [the parlour]659-the parlour , [she]123-emma found those who must rouse [her]123-emma . [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley and [Harriet]111-harriet had arrived during [her]123-emma absence , and were sitting with [her]123-emma father.--Mr . [Knightley]92-mr. knightley immediately got up , and in a manner decidedly graver than usual , said ,

“ [I]92-mr. knightley would not go away without seeing [you]123-emma , but [I]92-mr. knightley have no time to spare , and therefore must now be gone directly . [I]92-mr. knightley am going to [London]1-london , to spend a few days with [John]92-mr. knightley and [Isabella]87-isabella . Have [you]123-emma any thing to send or say , besides the ' love , ' which [nobody carries]5201-nobody carries ? ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ Nothing at all . But is not this a sudden scheme ? ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ Yes -- rather -- [I]92-mr. knightley have been thinking of it some little time . ”[92-mr. knightley]

[Emma]123-emma was sure [he]92-mr. knightley had not forgiven [her]123-emma ; [he]92-mr. knightley looked unlike [himself]92-mr. knightley . Time , however , [she]123-emma thought , would tell [him]92-mr. knightley that [they]2332-they ought to be [friends]579-friends again . While [he]92-mr. knightley stood , as if meaning to go , but not going -- [[her]123-emma father]425-her father began [his]425-her father inquiries .

“ Well , [[my]425-her father dear]2714-my dear , and did [you]123-emma get [there]448-there safely?--And how did [you]123-emma find [[my]425-her father worthy old friend]5204-my worthy old friend and [her]5204-my worthy old friend daughter?--I dare say [they]2332-they must have been very much obliged to [you]123-emma for coming . [She]123-emma is always so attentive to [them]2332-they ! ”[425-her father]

[Emma]123-emma 's colour was heightened by this unjust praise ; and with a smile , and shake of the head , which spoke much , [she]123-emma looked at [Mr. Knightley.--It]334-mr. knightley.--it seemed as if there were an instantaneous impression in [her]123-emma favour , as if [his]334-mr. knightley.--it eyes received the truth from [hers]123-emma , and all that had passed of good in [her]123-emma feelings were at once caught and honoured.-- [He]334-mr. knightley.--it looked at [her]123-emma with a glow of regard . [She]123-emma was warmly gratified -- and in another moment still more so , by a little movement of more than common friendliness on [his]334-mr. knightley.--it part.--He took [her]123-emma hand;--whether [she]123-emma had not [herself]123-emma made the first motion , [she]123-emma could not say -- [she]123-emma might , perhaps , have rather offered it -- but [he]334-mr. knightley.--it took [her]123-emma hand , pressed it , and certainly was on the point of carrying it to [his]334-mr. knightley.--it lips -- when , from some fancy or other , [he]334-mr. knightley.--it suddenly let it go.--Why [he]334-mr. knightley.--it should feel such a scruple , why [he]334-mr. knightley.--it should change [his]334-mr. knightley.--it mind when it was all but done , [she]123-emma could not perceive.--He would have judged better , [she]123-emma thought , if [he]334-mr. knightley.--it had not stopped.--The intention , however , was indubitable ; and whether it was that [his]334-mr. knightley.--it manners had in general so little gallantry , or however else it happened , but [she]123-emma thought nothing became [him]334-mr. knightley.--it more.--It was with [him]334-mr. knightley.--it , of so simple , yet so dignified a nature.--She could not but recall the attempt with great satisfaction . [It]2335-it spoke such perfect amity.--He left [them]2336-them immediately afterwards -- gone in a moment . [He]334-mr. knightley.--it always moved with the alertness of a mind which could neither be undecided nor dilatory , but now [he]334-mr. knightley.--it seemed more sudden than usual in [his]334-mr. knightley.--it disappearance .

[Emma]123-emma could not regret [her]123-emma having gone to [Miss Bates]105-miss bates , but [she]123-emma wished [she]123-emma had left [her]123-emma ten minutes earlier;--it would have been a great pleasure to talk over [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax 's situation with [Mr. Knightley.--Neither]335-mr. knightley.--neither would [she]123-emma regret that [he]334-mr. knightley.--it should be going to [Brunswick Square]5-brunswick square , for [she]123-emma knew how much [his]334-mr. knightley.--it visit would be enjoyed -- but it might have happened at a better time -- and to have had longer notice of it , would have been pleasanter.--They parted [thorough friends]2337-thorough friends , however ; [she]123-emma could not be deceived as to the meaning of [his]334-mr. knightley.--it countenance , and [his]334-mr. knightley.--it unfinished gallantry;--it was all done to assure [her]123-emma that [she]123-emma had fully recovered [his]334-mr. knightley.--it good opinion.--He had been sitting with [them]2338-them half an hour , [she]123-emma found . It was a pity that [she]123-emma had not come back earlier !

In the hope of diverting [[her]123-emma father]425-her father 's thoughts from the disagreeableness of [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley 's going to [London]1-london ; and going so suddenly ; and going on horseback , which [she]123-emma knew would be all very bad ; [Emma]123-emma communicated [her]123-emma news of [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax , and [her]123-emma dependence on the effect was justified ; it supplied a very useful check,--interested , without disturbing [him]334-mr. knightley.--it . [He]334-mr. knightley.--it had long made up [his]334-mr. knightley.--it mind to [Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax 's going out as [governess]412-governess , and could talk of it cheerfully , but [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley 's going to [London]1-london had been an unexpected blow .

“ [I]61-richmond am very glad , indeed , [[my]61-richmond dear]2714-my dear , to hear [she]152-miss fairfax is to be so comfortably settled . [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton is very good - natured and agreeable , and [I]61-richmond dare say [her]152-miss fairfax acquaintance are just what [they]5207-they ought to be . [I]61-richmond hope it is a dry situation , and that [her]152-miss fairfax health will be taken good care of . It ought to be a first object , as [I]61-richmond am sure [poor Miss Taylor]84-miss woodhouse 's always was with [me]61-richmond . And [I]61-richmond hope [she]152-miss fairfax will be better off in one respect , and not be induced to go away after it has been [her]152-miss fairfax home so long . ”[61-richmond]

The following day brought news from [Richmond]61-richmond to throw every thing else into the background . An express arrived at [Randalls]101-randalls to announce the death of [Mrs. Churchill]98-mrs. churchill ! Though [[her]98-mrs. churchill nephew]3651-her nephew had had no particular reason to hasten back on [her]98-mrs. churchill account , [she]98-mrs. churchill had not lived above six - and - thirty hours after [his]3651-her nephew return . A sudden seizure of a different nature from any thing foreboded by [her]98-mrs. churchill general state , had carried [her]98-mrs. churchill off after a short struggle . [The great Mrs. Churchill]98-mrs. churchill was no more .

It was felt as such things must be felt . [Every body]2749-every body had a degree of gravity and sorrow ; tenderness towards [the departed]2343-the departed , solicitude for [the surviving friends]2344-the surviving friends ; and , in a reasonable time , curiosity to know where [she]98-mrs. churchill would be buried . [Goldsmith]337-goldsmith tells [us]2345-us , that when [lovely woman]783-lovely woman stoops to folly , [she]783-lovely woman has nothing to do but to die ; and when [she]783-lovely woman stoops to be disagreeable , it is equally to be recommended as a clearer of ill - fame . [Mrs. Churchill]98-mrs. churchill , after being disliked at least twenty - five years , was now spoken of with compassionate allowances . In one point [she]98-mrs. churchill was fully justified .
