Then , [he]116-mr. martin said , [he]116-mr. martin would endeavour to see [her]109-mrs. goddard in the course of this day . ”[92-mr. knightley]

“ [I]123-emma am perfectly satisfied , ”[123-emma] replied [Emma]123-emma , with the brightest smiles , “ and most sincerely wish [them]5570-them happy . ”[123-emma]

“ [You]92-mr. knightley are materially changed since [we]5571-we talked on this subject before . ”[123-emma]

“ [I]123-emma hope so -- for at that time [I]123-emma was [a fool]5572-a fool . ”[123-emma]

“ And [I]123-emma am changed also ; for [I]123-emma am now very willing to grant [you]92-mr. knightley all [Harriet]111-harriet 's good qualities . [I]123-emma have taken some pains for [your]92-mr. knightley sake , and for [Robert Martin]116-mr. martin 's sake , ( whom [I]123-emma have always had reason to believe as much in love with [her]109-mrs. goddard as ever , ) to get acquainted with [her]109-mrs. goddard . [I]123-emma have often talked to [her]109-mrs. goddard a good deal . [You]92-mr. knightley must have seen that [I]123-emma did . Sometimes , indeed , [I]123-emma have thought [you]92-mr. knightley were half suspecting [me]123-emma of pleading poor [Martin]116-mr. martin 's cause , which was never the case ; but , from all [my]123-emma observations , [I]123-emma am convinced of [her]109-mrs. goddard being [an artless , amiable girl]5573-an artless , amiable girl , with very good notions , very seriously good principles , and placing [her]109-mrs. goddard happiness in the affections and utility of domestic life.--Much of this , [I]123-emma have no doubt , [she]109-mrs. goddard may thank [you]92-mr. knightley for . ”[123-emma]

“ [Me]123-emma ! ”[123-emma] cried [Emma]123-emma , shaking [her]123-emma head.--“Ah ! poor [Harriet]111-harriet ! ”[123-emma]

[She]123-emma checked [herself]123-emma , however , and submitted quietly to a little more praise than [she]123-emma deserved .

[Their]2649-their conversation was soon afterwards closed by the entrance of [[her]123-emma father]425-her father . [She]123-emma was not sorry . [She]123-emma wanted to be alone . [Her]123-emma mind was in a state of flutter and wonder , which made it impossible for [her]123-emma to be collected . [She]123-emma was in dancing , singing , exclaiming spirits ; and till [she]123-emma had moved about , and talked to [herself]123-emma , and laughed and reflected , [she]123-emma could be fit for nothing rational .

[[Her]123-emma father]425-her father 's business was to announce [James]90-james 's being gone out to put the horses to , preparatory to [their]2649-their now daily drive to [Randalls]101-randalls ; and [she]123-emma had , therefore , an immediate excuse for disappearing .

The joy , the gratitude , the exquisite delight of [her]123-emma sensations may be imagined . The sole grievance and alloy thus removed in the prospect of [Harriet]111-harriet 's welfare , [she]123-emma was really in danger of becoming too happy for security.--What had [she]123-emma to wish for ? Nothing , but to grow more worthy of [him]425-her father , whose intentions and judgment had been ever so superior to [her]123-emma own . Nothing , but that the lessons of [her]123-emma past folly might teach [her]123-emma humility and circumspection in future .

Serious [she]123-emma was , very serious in [her]123-emma thankfulness , and in [her]123-emma resolutions ; and yet there was no preventing a laugh , sometimes in the very midst of them . [She]123-emma must laugh at such a close ! Such an end of the doleful disappointment of five weeks back ! Such a heart -- [such a Harriet]2652-such a harriet !

Now there would be pleasure in [her]123-emma returning -- Every thing would be a pleasure . It would be a great pleasure to know [Robert Martin]116-mr. martin .

High in the rank of [her]123-emma most serious and heartfelt felicities , was the reflection that all necessity of concealment from [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley would soon be over . The disguise , equivocation , mystery , so hateful to [her]123-emma to practise , might soon be over . [She]123-emma could now look forward to giving [him]425-her father that full and perfect confidence which [her]123-emma disposition was most ready to welcome as a duty .

In the gayest and happiest spirits [she]123-emma set forward with [[her]123-emma father]425-her father ; not always listening , but always agreeing to what [he]425-her father said ; and , whether in speech or silence , conniving at the comfortable persuasion of [his]425-her father being obliged to go to [Randalls]101-randalls every day , or poor [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston would be disappointed .

[They]2654-they arrived.--Mrs . [Weston]88-mrs. weston was alone in the drawing - room:--but hardly had [they]2654-they been told of [the baby]946-the baby , and [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse received the thanks for coming , which [he]85-mr. woodhouse asked for , when a glimpse was caught through the blind , of [two figures passing near the window]2656-two figures passing near the window .

“ It is [Frank]102-frank churchill and [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax , ”[88-mrs. weston] said [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston . “ [I]88-mrs. weston was just going to tell [you]123-emma of [our]2654-they agreeable surprize in seeing [him]946-the baby arrive this morning . [He]946-the baby stays till to - morrow , and [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax has been persuaded to spend the day with us.--They are coming in , [I]88-mrs. weston hope . ”[88-mrs. weston]

In half a minute [they]2654-they were in [the room]701-the room . [Emma]123-emma was extremely glad to see [him]946-the baby -- but there was a degree of confusion -- a number of embarrassing recollections on each side . [They]2654-they met readily and smiling , but with a consciousness which at first allowed little to be said ; and having all sat down again , there was for some time such a blank in the circle , that [Emma]123-emma began to doubt whether the wish now indulged , which [she]123-emma had long felt , of seeing [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill once more , and of seeing [him]102-frank churchill with [Jane]152-miss fairfax , would yield its proportion of pleasure . When [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston joined [the party]2949-the party , however , and when [the baby]946-the baby was fetched , there was no longer a want of subject or animation -- or of courage and opportunity for [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill to draw near [her]123-emma and say ,

“ [I]102-frank churchill have to thank [you]123-emma , [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse , for a very kind forgiving message in one of [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston 's letters . [I]102-frank churchill hope time has not made [you]123-emma less willing to pardon . [I]102-frank churchill hope [you]123-emma do not retract what [you]123-emma then said . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ No , indeed , ”[123-emma] cried [Emma]123-emma , most happy to begin , “ not in the least . [I]123-emma am particularly glad to see and shake hands with [you]102-frank churchill -- and to give [you]102-frank churchill joy in person . ”[123-emma]

[He]102-frank churchill thanked [her]123-emma with all [his]102-frank churchill heart , and continued some time to speak with serious feeling of [his]102-frank churchill gratitude and happiness .

“ Is not [she]152-miss fairfax looking well ? ”[102-frank churchill] said [he]102-frank churchill , turning [his]102-frank churchill eyes towards [Jane]152-miss fairfax . “ Better than [she]152-miss fairfax ever used to do?--You see how [[my]102-frank churchill father]2740-my father and [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston doat upon [her]152-miss fairfax . ”[102-frank churchill]

But [his]102-frank churchill spirits were soon rising again , and with laughing eyes , after mentioning the expected return of [the Campbells]190-the campbells , [he]102-frank churchill named the name of [Dixon.--Emma]398-dixon.--emma blushed , and forbade its being pronounced in [her]152-miss fairfax hearing .

“ [I]152-miss fairfax can never think of it , ”[152-miss fairfax] [she]152-miss fairfax cried , “ without extreme shame . ”[152-miss fairfax]

“ The shame , ”[102-frank churchill] [he]102-frank churchill answered , “ is all mine , or ought to be . But is it possible that [you]152-miss fairfax had no suspicion?--I mean of late . Early , [I]102-frank churchill know , [you]152-miss fairfax had none . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ [I]102-frank churchill never had the smallest , [I]102-frank churchill assure [you]102-frank churchill . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ That appears quite wonderful . [I]102-frank churchill was once very near -- and [I]102-frank churchill wish [I]102-frank churchill had -- it would have been better . But though [I]102-frank churchill was always doing wrong things , they were very bad wrong things , and such as did [me]102-frank churchill no service.--It would have been a much better transgression had [I]102-frank churchill broken the bond of secrecy and told [you]102-frank churchill every thing . ”[102-frank churchill]

“ It is not now worth a regret , ”[123-emma] said [Emma]123-emma .

“ [I]102-frank churchill have some hope , ”[102-frank churchill] resumed [he]102-frank churchill , “ of [[my]102-frank churchill uncle]4367-my uncle 's being persuaded to pay a visit at [Randalls]101-randalls ; [he]4367-my uncle wants to be introduced to [her]152-miss fairfax . When [the Campbells]190-the campbells are returned , [we]5576-we shall meet [them]190-the campbells in [London]1-london , and continue there , [I]102-frank churchill trust , till [we]5576-we may carry [her]152-miss fairfax northward.--But now , [I]102-frank churchill am at such a distance from [her]152-miss fairfax -- is not it hard , [Miss Woodhouse?--Till]399-miss woodhouse?--till this morning , [we]5576-we have not once met since the day of reconciliation . Do not [you]2660-you pity [me]102-frank churchill ? ”[102-frank churchill]

[Emma]123-emma spoke [her]123-emma pity so very kindly , that with a sudden accession of gay thought , [he]2660-you cried ,

“ Ah ! by the bye , ”[2660-you] then sinking [his]2660-you voice , and looking demure for the moment--“I hope [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley is well ? ”[2660-you] [He]2660-you paused.--She coloured and laughed.--“I know [you]2660-you saw [my]2660-you letter , and think [you]2660-you may remember [my]2660-you wish in [your]2660-you favour . Let [me]2660-you return [your]2660-you congratulations.--I assure [you]2660-you that [I]2660-you have heard the news with the warmest interest and satisfaction.--He is [a man whom [I]2660-you can not presume to praise]5577-a man whom i can not presume to praise . ”[2660-you]

[Emma]123-emma was delighted , and only wanted [him]2660-you to go on in the same style ; but [his]2660-you mind was the next moment in [his]2660-you own concerns and with [his]2660-you own [Jane]152-miss fairfax , and [his]2660-you next words were ,

“ Did [you]2660-you ever see such a skin?--such smoothness ! such delicacy!--and yet without being actually fair.--One can not call [her]152-miss fairfax fair . It is a most uncommon complexion , with [her]152-miss fairfax dark eye - lashes and hair -- a most distinguishing complexion ! So peculiarly [the lady in it.--Just colour enough for beauty]5578-the lady in it.--just colour enough for beauty . ”[2660-you]

“ [I]123-emma have always admired [her]152-miss fairfax complexion , ”[123-emma] replied [Emma]123-emma , archly ; “ but do not [I]123-emma remember the time when [you]2660-you found fault with [her]152-miss fairfax for being so pale?--When [we]5579-us first began to talk of her.--Have [you]2660-you quite forgotten ? ”[123-emma]

“ Oh ! no -- what [an impudent dog]5580-an impudent dog [I]2660-you was!--How could [I]2660-you dare-- ”[2660-you]

But [he]2660-you laughed so heartily at the recollection , that [Emma]123-emma could not help saying ,

“ [I]123-emma do suspect that in the midst of [your]2660-you perplexities at that time , [you]2660-you had very great amusement in tricking [us]5579-us all.--I am sure [you]2660-you had.--I am sure it was a consolation to [you]2660-you . ”[123-emma]

“ Oh ! no , no , no -- how can [you]2660-you suspect [me]123-emma of such a thing ? [I]123-emma was [the most miserable wretch]5581-the most miserable wretch ! ”[123-emma]

“ Not quite so miserable as to be insensible to mirth . [I]123-emma am sure it was a source of high entertainment to [you]2660-you , to feel that [you]2660-you were taking [us]5579-us all in.--Perhaps [I]123-emma am [the readier]5582-the readier to suspect , because , to tell [you]2660-you the truth , [I]123-emma think it might have been some amusement to [myself]123-emma in the same situation . [I]123-emma think there is a little likeness between [us]5579-us . ”[123-emma]

[He]2661-my bowed .

“ If not in [our]5579-us dispositions , ”[2662-she] [she]2662-she presently added , with a look of true sensibility , “ there is a likeness in [our]5579-us destiny ; the destiny which bids fair to connect [us]5579-us with [two characters so much superior to [our]5579-us own]5583-two characters so much superior to our own . ”[2662-she]

“ True , true , ”[2661-my] [he]2661-my answered , warmly . “ No , not true on [your]2660-you side . [You]2660-you can have [no superior]5584-no superior , but most true on mine.--She is [a complete angel]5585-a complete angel . Look at [her]5585-a complete angel . Is not [she]5585-a complete angel [an angel]2904-an angel in every gesture ? Observe the turn of [her]5585-a complete angel throat . Observe [her]5585-a complete angel eyes , as [she]5585-a complete angel is looking up at [[my]2661-my father.--You]5587-my father.--you will be glad to hear ( inclining [his]2663-his head , and whispering seriously ) that [[my]2661-my uncle]4367-my uncle means to give [her]5585-a complete angel all [[my]2661-my aunt]4162-my aunt 's jewels . They are to be new set . [I]2661-my am resolved to have some in an ornament for the head . Will not it be beautiful in [her]5585-a complete angel dark hair ? ”[2661-my]

“ Very beautiful , indeed , ”[123-emma] replied [Emma]123-emma ; and [she]123-emma spoke so kindly , that [he]2663-his gratefully burst out ,

“ How delighted [I]123-emma am to see [you]123-emma again ! and to see [you]123-emma in such excellent looks!--I would not have missed this meeting for [the world]403-the world . [I]123-emma should certainly have called at [Hartfield]2-hartfield , had [you]2663-his failed to come . ”[123-emma]

[The others]870-the others had been talking of [the child]498-the child , [Mrs. Weston]88-mrs. weston giving an account of a little alarm [she]88-mrs. weston had been under , the evening before , from [the infant]2666-the infant 's appearing not quite well . [She]123-emma believed [she]123-emma had been foolish , but it had alarmed [her]123-emma , and [she]123-emma had been within half a minute of sending for [Mr. Perry]106-mr. perry . Perhaps [she]123-emma ought to be ashamed , but [Mr. Weston]86-mr. weston had been almost as uneasy as herself.--In ten minutes , however , [the child]498-the child had been perfectly well again . This was [her]123-emma history ; and particularly interesting it was to [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse , who commended [her]123-emma very much for thinking of sending for [Perry]106-mr. perry , and only regretted that [she]123-emma had not done it . “ [She]123-emma should always send for [Perry]106-mr. perry , if [the child]498-the child appeared in the slightest degree disordered , were it only for a moment . [She]123-emma could not be too soon alarmed , nor send for [Perry]106-mr. perry too often . It was a pity , perhaps , that [he]106-mr. perry had not come last night ; for , though [the child]498-the child seemed well now , very well considering , it would probably have been better if [Perry]106-mr. perry had seen it . ”[85-mr. woodhouse]

[Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill caught the name .

“ [Perry]106-mr. perry ! ”[102-frank churchill] said [he]102-frank churchill to [Emma]123-emma , and trying , as [he]102-frank churchill spoke , to catch [Miss Fairfax]152-miss fairfax 's eye . “ [[My]102-frank churchill friend]3149-my friend [Mr. Perry]106-mr. perry ! What are [they]5594-they saying about [Mr.]5595-mr. Perry?--Has [he]106-mr. perry been [here]2707-here this morning?--And how does [he]106-mr. perry travel now?--Has [he]106-mr. perry set up [[his]106-mr. perry carriage]1005-his carriage ? ”[102-frank churchill]

[Emma]123-emma soon recollected , and understood [him]102-frank churchill ; and while [she]123-emma joined in the laugh , it was evident from [Jane]152-miss fairfax 's countenance that [she]123-emma too was really hearing [him]102-frank churchill , though trying to seem deaf .

“ Such an extraordinary dream of [mine]102-frank churchill ! ”[102-frank churchill] [he]102-frank churchill cried . “ [I]102-frank churchill can never think of it without laughing.--She hears [us]5598-us , [she]123-emma hears [us]5598-us , [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse . [I]102-frank churchill see it in [her]123-emma cheek , [her]123-emma smile , [her]123-emma vain attempt to frown . Look at [her]123-emma . Do not [you]93-miss woodhouse see that , at this instant , the very passage of [her]123-emma own letter , which sent [me]102-frank churchill the report , is passing under [her]123-emma eye -- that the whole blunder is spread before [her]123-emma -- that [she]123-emma can attend to nothing else , though pretending to listen to [the others]870-the others ? ”[102-frank churchill]

[Jane]152-miss fairfax was forced to smile completely , for a moment ; and the smile partly remained as [she]152-miss fairfax turned towards [him]102-frank churchill , and said in a conscious , low , yet steady voice ,

“ How [you]102-frank churchill can bear such recollections , is astonishing to me!--They _ will _ sometimes obtrude -- but how [you]102-frank churchill can court [them]5600-them ! ”[152-miss fairfax]

[He]102-frank churchill had a great deal to say in return , and very entertainingly ; but [Emma]123-emma 's feelings were chiefly with [Jane]152-miss fairfax , in the argument ; and on leaving [Randalls]101-randalls , and falling naturally into a comparison of [the two men]2668-the two men , [she]123-emma felt , that pleased as [she]123-emma had been to see [Frank Churchill]102-frank churchill , and really regarding [him]102-frank churchill as [she]123-emma did with friendship , [she]123-emma had never been more sensible of [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley 's high superiority of character . The happiness of this most happy day , received its completion , in the animated contemplation of [his]102-frank churchill worth which this comparison produced .

CHAPTER XIX

If [Emma]123-emma had still , at intervals , an anxious feeling for [Harriet]111-harriet , a momentary doubt of its being possible for [her]123-emma to be really cured of [her]123-emma attachment to [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley , and really able to accept [another man]3500-another man from unbiased inclination , it was not long that [she]123-emma had to suffer from the recurrence of any such uncertainty . A very few days brought the party from [London]1-london , and [she]123-emma had no sooner an opportunity of being one hour alone with [Harriet]111-harriet , than [she]123-emma became perfectly satisfied -- unaccountable as it was!--that [Robert Martin]116-mr. martin had thoroughly supplanted [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley , and was now forming all [her]123-emma views of happiness .

[Harriet]111-harriet was a little distressed -- did look a little foolish at first : but having once owned that [she]111-harriet had been presumptuous and silly , and self - deceived , before , [her]111-harriet pain and confusion seemed to die away with the words , and leave [her]111-harriet without a care for the past , and with the fullest exultation in the present and future ; for , as to [[her]123-emma friend]427-her friend 's approbation , [Emma]123-emma had instantly removed every fear of that nature , by meeting [her]111-harriet with the most unqualified congratulations.--Harriet was most happy to give every particular of the evening at [Astley 's]396-astley , and the dinner the next day ; [she]123-emma could dwell on it all with the utmost delight . But what did such particulars explain?--The fact was , as [Emma]123-emma could now acknowledge , that [Harriet]111-harriet had always liked [Robert Martin]116-mr. martin ; and that [his]116-mr. martin continuing to love [her]111-harriet had been irresistible.--Beyond this , it must ever be unintelligible to [Emma]123-emma .

The event , however , was most joyful ; and every day was giving [her]123-emma fresh reason for thinking so.--Harriet 's parentage became known . [She]111-harriet proved to be [the daughter of [a tradesman]2672-a tradesman]2671-the daughter of a tradesman , rich enough to afford [her]111-harriet the comfortable maintenance which had ever been [hers]111-harriet , and [decent enough to have always wished for concealment.--Such]2673-decent enough to have always wished for concealment.--such was the blood of gentility which [Emma]123-emma had formerly been so ready to vouch for!--It was likely to be as untainted , perhaps , as the blood of [many a gentleman]2674-many a gentleman : but what a connexion had [she]123-emma been preparing for [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley -- or for [the Churchills]100-the churchills -- or even for [Mr. Elton!--The]400-mr. elton!--the stain of illegitimacy , unbleached by nobility or wealth , would have been a stain indeed .

No objection was raised on [the father]1329-the father 's side ; [the young man]532-the young man was treated liberally ; it was all as it should be : and as [Emma]123-emma became acquainted with [Robert Martin]116-mr. martin , who was now introduced at [Hartfield]2-hartfield , [she]123-emma fully acknowledged in [him]116-mr. martin all the appearance of sense and worth which could bid fairest for [[her]123-emma little friend]761-her little friend . [She]123-emma had no doubt of [Harriet]111-harriet 's happiness with [any good - tempered man]2678-any good - tempered man ; but with [him]116-mr. martin , and in [the home]2679-the home [he]116-mr. martin offered , there would be the hope of more , of security , stability , and improvement . [She]123-emma would be placed in the midst of [those who loved [her]123-emma , and who had better sense than [herself]123-emma]2680-those who loved her , and who had better sense than herself ; [retired enough for safety , and occupied enough for cheerfulness]2681-retired enough for safety , and occupied enough for cheerfulness . [She]123-emma would be never led into temptation , nor left for it to find [her]123-emma out . [She]123-emma would be respectable and happy ; and [Emma]123-emma admitted [her]123-emma to be the luckiest creature in [the world]403-the world , to have created so steady and persevering an affection in [such a man;--or , if not quite the luckiest]2683-such a man;--or , if not quite the luckiest , to yield only to [herself]123-emma .

[Harriet]111-harriet , necessarily drawn away by [her]111-harriet engagements with [the Martins]113-the martins , was less and less at [Hartfield]2-hartfield ; which was not to be regretted.--The intimacy between [her]111-harriet and [Emma]123-emma must sink ; [their]2684-their friendship must change into a calmer sort of goodwill ; and , fortunately , what ought to be , and must be , seemed already beginning , and in the most gradual , natural manner .

Before the end of September , [Emma]123-emma attended [Harriet]111-harriet to [church]593-church , and saw [her]123-emma hand bestowed on [Robert Martin]116-mr. martin with so complete a satisfaction , as no remembrances , even connected with [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton as [he]95-mr. elton stood before [them]2684-their , could impair.--Perhaps , indeed , at that time [she]123-emma scarcely saw [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton , but as [the clergyman whose blessing at the altar might next fall on]2686-the clergyman whose blessing at the altar might next fall on [herself.--Robert Martin]116-mr. martin and [Harriet Smith]111-harriet , [the latest couple engaged of [the three]2688-the three]2687-the latest couple engaged of the three , were the first to be married .

[Jane Fairfax]152-miss fairfax had already quitted [Highbury]3-highbury , and was restored to the comforts of [[her]152-miss fairfax beloved home]2689-her beloved home with [the Campbells.--The Mr. Churchills]100-the churchills were also in [town]2760-town ; and [they]2691-they were only waiting for November .

The intermediate month was the one fixed on , as far as [they]2684-their dared , by [Emma]123-emma and [Mr. Knightley.--They]401-mr. knightley.--they had determined that [their]2684-their marriage ought to be concluded while [John]92-mr. knightley and [Isabella]87-isabella were still at [Hartfield]2-hartfield , to allow [them]2684-their the fortnight 's absence in a tour to [the seaside]2692-the seaside , which was the plan.--John and [Isabella]87-isabella , and [every other friend]2693-every other friend , were agreed in approving it . But [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse -- how was [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse to be induced to consent?--he , who had never yet alluded to [their]2684-their marriage but as a distant event .

When first sounded on the subject , [he]85-mr. woodhouse was so miserable , that [they]2684-their were almost hopeless.--A second allusion , indeed , gave less pain.--He began to think it was to be , and that [he]85-mr. woodhouse could not prevent it -- a very promising step of the mind on its way to resignation . Still , however , [he]85-mr. woodhouse was not happy . Nay , [he]85-mr. woodhouse appeared so much otherwise , that [[his]85-mr. woodhouse daughter]2723-his daughter 's courage failed . [She]2723-his daughter could not bear to see [him]85-mr. woodhouse suffering , to know [him]85-mr. woodhouse fancying [himself]85-mr. woodhouse neglected ; and though [her]2723-his daughter understanding almost acquiesced in the assurance of both [the Mr. Knightleys]151-the mr. knightleys , that when once the event were over , [his]85-mr. woodhouse distress would be soon over too , [she]2723-his daughter hesitated -- [she]2723-his daughter could not proceed .

In this state of suspense [they]2684-their were befriended , not by any sudden illumination of [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse 's mind , or any wonderful change of [his]85-mr. woodhouse nervous system , but by the operation of the same system in another way.--Mrs . [[Weston]86-mr. weston 's poultry - house]2695-weston 's poultry - house was robbed one night of all [her]2723-his daughter turkeys -- evidently by the ingenuity of [man]774-man . [Other poultry - yards in [the neighbourhood]1432-the neighbourhood]2697-other poultry - yards in the neighbourhood also suffered.--Pilfering was _ housebreaking _ to [Mr. Woodhouse]85-mr. woodhouse 's fears.--He was very uneasy ; and but for the sense of [[his]85-mr. woodhouse son]523-his son - in - law 's protection , would have been under wretched alarm every night of [his]85-mr. woodhouse life . The strength , resolution , and presence of mind of [the Mr. Knightleys]151-the mr. knightleys , commanded [his]85-mr. woodhouse fullest dependence . While [either of [them]2684-their]2700-either of them protected [him]85-mr. woodhouse and [his]85-mr. woodhouse , [Hartfield]93-miss woodhouse was safe.--But [Mr. John Knightley]92-mr. knightley must be in [London]1-london again by the end of the first week in November .

The result of this distress was , that , with a much more voluntary , cheerful consent than [[his]85-mr. woodhouse daughter]2723-his daughter had ever presumed to hope for at the moment , [she]2723-his daughter was able to fix [her]2723-his daughter wedding - day -- and [Mr. Elton]95-mr. elton was called on , within a month from the marriage of [Mr.]2702-mr. and [Mrs. Robert Martin]114-mrs. martin , to join the hands of [Mr. Knightley]92-mr. knightley and [Miss Woodhouse]93-miss woodhouse .

The wedding was very much like other weddings , where [the parties]1320-the parties have no taste for finery or parade ; and [Mrs. Elton]207-mrs. elton , from the particulars detailed by [[her]207-mrs. elton husband]441-her husband , thought it all extremely shabby , and very inferior to [her]207-mrs. elton own.--“Very little white satin , very few lace veils ; [a most pitiful business!--Selina]5601-a most pitiful business!--selina would stare when [she]207-mrs. elton heard of it . ”--But[207-mrs. elton] , in spite of these deficiencies , the wishes , the hopes , the confidence , the predictions of [the small band of [true friends who witnessed the ceremony]2706-true friends who witnessed the ceremony]2705-the small band of true friends who witnessed the ceremony , were fully answered in the perfect happiness of the union .

[FINIS]402-finis
